Last weeks "Swing at the Abbey" was a blast! We have more of the same this Monday!

If you're at a loose end after work, join us (from about 5:30pm) for a bite to eat at our "Swing Time Supper Club" and take advantage of the happy hour from 5pm - 8pm!

We still bring you two totally awesome swing dance classes. Balboa with Paul Crook & Natasha Hall and Lindy Hop with Sean Hall & Lucy Toseland.

If you are NEW to Swing dancing, or maybe an experienced dancer, come on down, all levels are welcome, you'll be sure to pick up some fantastic moves and some great authentic styling.

Balboa & Lindy Hop classes run simultaneously.

Beginners Lindy Hop & Balboa - 7:30pm - 8:10pm

10 min break - Get the drinks in! It's HAPPY HOUR!

Intermediate Lindy Hop & Balboa - 8:20pm - 9pm

--
POLITE NOTICE:

PLEASE DON'T TURN UP BEFORE 9PM AND TRY TO PAY £4 FOR THE SOCIAL DANCE!

IF CLASSES ARE RUNNING THAT MEANS OUR TEACHERS ARE WORKING AND SHARING THEIR EXPERT KNOWLEDGE, SO ENTRY IS £8.00!

THE BAR IS NICE UPSTAIRS, RELAX AND GET A DRINK, THEN SEE US AFTER 9PM.

SORRY, THERE IS NO FREE ENTRY FOR SPECTATORS!
--

From 9pm - 11pm it's social dance time. DJ Tim Hellzapoppin will be playing a good mix of Swing & R&B tunes to get the dance floor jumpin', so you'll be able to practice your moves from the classes.


Doors open at 7pm

Admission:

£8.00 - for both classes & club (before 9pm)

£4.00 - club (after 9pm)

Hope to see you! ; )

1374358439491429.description:
Welcome to Property Investor Africa - the No.1 On-line Marketplace for Property Investments in Africa (PiA). 

With a huge housing deficit and  lack of financial investment in Africa's real estate industry, PiA aims to bring financial and institutional investors, property developers, governments, banks, fund managers and businesses in the supply chain together, on one single platform.

Property Investor Africa Summit 2014, to be held on 19th September 2014 at Grange Tower Bridge Hotel, guarantees leading information from across the African real estate sector as well as local market intelligence from industry experts. 

The full-day conference, themed Investing in Africa, features distinguished leaders and policy-makers from the EU, Africa, Asia and the Middle East, who will analyse the prospects of the African emerging economy. A key focus area is the recent proven discovery of oil and gas, as well as Africa's formalising banking sector.

Invited Keynote speakers include Elisabeth Troni - Executive Director at UBS; Tutu Agyare - Non-Executive Director of Tullow Oil plc and Managing Partner at Nubuke Investments; TidjaneThiam - CEO of Prudential Plc; Bob Diamond - former CEO of Barclays; Lord Sheikh - House of Lords; Lord Boateng - House of Lords; Samuel Esson Jonah - CEO of Jonah Capital, and many other global business leaders. 

Main topics explored include Energy Efficiency in Africa's Property Industry, How the Oil Boom will Change Africa's Property Market, and Opportunities in Africa's Banking Sector Real Estate.

The conference rooms, VIP round table discussion groups and exhibition area are in close proximity, giving the exhibitors excellent opportunity to meet the participants. VIP Coffee will be served in the exhibition area. 

It is with pleasure that we invite your company and organizations to take an active part in the PiA Summit as Corporate Partners, VIP B2B host, Seminar Presenter or Exhibitor, to promote your brand equity through this prestigious international platform. Your involvement in the conference is of utmost importance to us. We will work hard to increase your visibility and return on investment before, during and after the conference.

Together, let us make this conference a memorable and successful one.

Register TODAY at    https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/property-investor-africa-summit-2014-tickets-10646607289?ref=estw

Ads: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WH5lIGpboOM&feature=youtu.be

1000 Available Spaces

1376159252666548.description:
W środę 23 kwietnia prosto z Londynu wpada do Psa Cultural Other i razem z krakowskimi szarpidrutami z Straight Jack Cat i Venus Fly Trap gotują soniczne burrito! 

BILETY: 10zł/szt.

Kim są wykonawcy:

Straight Jack Cat - Kraków

Grają niehigienicznego rock’n’rolla. Robią hałas. Są konserwatywni światopoglądowo. Kompulsywnie kolekcjonują analogowy muzyczny sprzęt z XX w. i wciąż nie wiedzą jak się go poprawnie używa. Ich koncerty pozostają na długo w pamięci. Najczęściej w postaci szumów usznych nazajutrz. Istnieją, bo wciąż wierzą, że muzyka to sposób na to, by się uwolnić... Co za banda naiwniaków!

Do posłuchania:
EP: http://straightjackcat.bandcamp.com/

Do pooglądania:
Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-_ZIvD0VGdk
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mKWJPGnDcsA

Cultural Other - Londyn

Cultural Other jest kolektywem na muzycznej misji z prostym celem: dostarczeniem mocnej i lakonicznej muzyki rockowej która będzie uznawana w studiu i przez pełnejatmosfery koncertów. Formacja zespołu wiele zawdzięcza nieoczekiwanym doświadczeniom kiedy to we wrześniu 2011 roku, przez przypadek basista James Campbell i perkusista Kuba Mleczko poznali się na stacji kolejowej w Guildford, pod Londynem. Spotkanie to zaowocowało muzyczne dyskusje oraz wiele prób tworząc początki Cultural Other. Znalezieniem ostatniej układanki nastąpiło parę miesięcy później kiedy to Mleczko wcześniej poznanego włoskiego gitarzystę Andrea Venerus, zaprosił na próbę, po której już było wiadomo, że trzy odrębne tożsamości zaczęły tworzyć niesamowitą chemię muzyczną którą nazywają experymentalną alternatywą. 

Cechą która odróżnia ten zespół od innych jest ich kulturowa mieszanka. Perkusisty Kuby Mleczki polsko-amerykańskie korzenie, gitarzysty Andrea Venerusa środziemnomorska natura oraz basisty Jamesa Campbella huczny Argentyński temperament akcentują nietypowy dźwięk i ideologie muzyczne zespołu, z tekstami piosenek które odkrywają labirynt którym jest natura ludzkich emocji oraz poglądy polityczne zespołu. Choć jeszcze na początku swej kariery, Cultural Other są zdeterminowani by stworzyć niebywałą reputację i że ich ostra muzyczna wirtuozeria oraz innowacyjne brzmienie upieczętuje się w historii współczesnego rocka. Zostaliście ostrzeżeni!

FB: https://www.facebook.com/CulturalOther
Bandcamp: http://culturalother.bandcamp.com/

137912873045567.description:
You Press & Caritas Anchor House Presents…‘One Story – Our Voice’ Poetry Event!

Homeless people are some of the most vulnerable and socially excluded people in our society. Almost 1 in 10 people say they have been homeless at some point, with a fifth of these people saying it happened in the last five years. Last year 113,260 people in England approached their council as homeless, an 11% increase over 2 years. Independent research carried out for Crisis and the Joseph Rowntree Foundation shows that homelessness is likely to increase further. People become and stay homeless for a whole range of complex and overlapping reasons and solving homelessness is about much more than putting a roof over people's heads.

With our new poetry project (One Story – Our Voice), we have identified a great response to poetry from our community and as a result we plan to address some of these complex reasons (as to why people become and stay homeless) through narrative poetry and music that engages and raises awareness. We are working with a group of talented young poets and musicians, who have interviewed 10 homeless people and have narrated their stories into powerful poetry and music that will be performed at our event on 25th April 2014.

The aim of our poetry project is to shed light to the challenges and roots of homelessness through poetry, spoken word and music. To also create a voice for these voiceless stories and to raise awareness on this overlooked community, but mostly importantly to tackle the stigma attached to homeless people.

We are very excited to invite you to take an extraordinary journey in experiencing the world of 10 homeless people through poetry, spoken word and music. 10 phenomenal life stories of 10 homeless people will be performed by a group of extraordinary artists.

‘One Story - Our Voice’ is a show stopping event that cannot be missed. Come and support a cause that is deeply profound!

Performing Artists:

Asabi Hawah
Asha Lul Mohammoud
Carmina Masoliver
Bennett
E.S.T

Room 1: 
Cassius (Ed Banger)
Real Nice vs E.T.A All Stars
Jolyon (Red Sky)
Croz (Real Nice Recordings)

Room 2: 
Joe Maglia (Bordel Music)
Popeyee (Bordel Music)
Macking (Lafternoon records)
Sacha Schwarz (Housewife/Bloop)
Ted Alexander (Stem records)

Summer is fast approaching, the call of festivals, al fresco parties and beach dancing at sunrise is ringing in all of our ears.

L'Afternoon and Real Nice are answering that call with their biggest and most spectacular event to date. In association with Mixmag, expect a production reminiscent to an Ibizan super club combined with the sharper flavour of the Parisian underground to mark the occasion.

Headlining the show, are iconic French house pioneers Cassius (@edbanger) making their first London appearance in 3 years. This is all the more exciting as they are currently in the process of completing a long anticipated album – which will no doubt be exclusively performed on the night.

138828062954096.description:
Break down the Wall
Conference on the fight back to save education
To be held at the Cowley Club: 12 London Road, Lewes Rd., Brighton BN1 4JA Saturday 24th May. 12.00 to 4.00.
Sponsored by Brighton branch unite 0140 and Labour movement history publications
There will be a bar and food available.
And time allocated for discussion
.

Chair: John Johnson,
Speakers

The significance of the Plebs Strike at Ruskin College (1909) for independent working class education today. Colin Waugh

Why the attacks on adult education with a special emphasis on special needs. Terry McCarthy

The Brighton Free University Bunchie Fox

Women and the struggle for an independent working class education Louise Raw.

Robert Tressell: an advocate of IWCE.

The Big issue, education and the homeless.

John Johnson, is a lay officer of the Brighton Trades Council/UnitetheUnion
Terry McCarthy has worked for decades teaching adult education with a special emphasis on special needs.
He is also the former director of the national Museum of Labour history.
Louise Raw is the author of the ground breaking book "Striking a Light: the real history of the match women's strike". Louise is also a regular contributor to the left press and broadcaster. Colin Waugh's Plebs has reminded us of the struggle for IWCE. Bunchie Fox is the founder and organiser of the Brighton Free University.
138828062954096.location: Cowley Club: 12 London Road, Lewes Rd., Brighton BN1 4JA
138828062954096.name: Break Down the Wall

Half Time activities


We're not asking a lot, not in monetary terms, but we are asking you to come and enjoy a day out, with football between your favourite, and least favourite teams, & for a life, the life of Stacey. 

The money we raise can't buy the life Stacey could live, but it most certainly will help to give her a chance at having one.

Without this treatment, her Dad will no longer see that beautiful smile when she realise's Santa has been. Her Mum will no longer be able hug her daughter simply to say, "I Love You", Her brother Jake won't be able to poke his sister in the eye with a stick when they're out of sight, or steal her tights to keep his legs warm whilst playing football.

Stacey only dreams of a tomorrow, be it bright or not, just any tomorrow will do, and you have the power to give her that dream.

Come on you lot, dig deep, make this little girls dreams come true. Come and enjoy our day out

1395032234101492.description:
Random Magic pres. Cajmere Vs Green Velvet (Cajual X Relief) UK EXCLUSIVE + Boddika / Luke Solomon b2b Neville Watson (Classic Music Company)
Farr Festival X Random Magic. South London Ordnance / October / Otto & Farr Residents

TICKETS
RSN: http://bit.ly/1oIybpy
Fire : http://bit.ly/randommagicFIRE
Resident Advisor :  http://bit.ly/1ctFBwE
  
Saturday 3rd May 2014 | 10pm - 7am 
FIRE, South Lambeth Rd, London SW8 1RT  
_____________________
 
RANDOM MAGIC steps out of the shadows and into the Spring-time for the second night in their series of music, magic and dancing taking place over the May Bank Holiday at FIRE.
  
This time they bring something rather special as they conjure up a UK exclusive with house don CAJMERE performing back to back with his own alias GREEN VELVET. Change has been a constant theme throughout the successful career of Curtis Alan Jones, but as he's crossed genres, explored themes from the comedic to the serious and changed monikers, the common thread running through the music he has made for nearly two decades and both his Cajual and Relief labels is its roots in and dedication to the Chicago House sound. For this very special appearance Curtis will be donning both of his hats and performing two special sets. Think lots of smoke and green lights and some rather stunning music.
 
Also in FIRE's main room will be Nonplus label head BODDIKA. With incredible collaborations between himself and Joy Orbsion, one half of the highly respected Instra:mental, one third of Autonomic and solo as Boddika, these past few years have marked Al Green out as one of the UK club music's most restless innovators.
 
The Classic Recording Company's leader LUKE SOLOMON and the amazing musical mind that is NEVILLE WATSON play back to back, warming this room to perfection. Luke returns to Random Magic after a spell-binding performance at Halloween to play an extended set with Neville Watson, the master of revivalist house.  

Taking over the second room of FIRE will be FARR FESTIVAL. Just 5 years young Farr has grown into one of the most well-respected boutique festivals in the country. With this year's festival stepping up a gear this will be the London launch for the festival. For the celebrations they'll be bringing with them Hot Flush's SOUTH LONDON ORDNANCE who has made musical waves with his Swamp 81-esque percussive house and techno sounds and OCTOBER from Stockholm's SKUDGE Records. In support will be OTTO & FARR RESIDENTS.
  
Random Magic's last event back in October saw the likes of Omar S, Maxxi Soundsystem, Horse Meat Disco, Luke Solomon, Honey Dijon (Live) put the Funktion 1 Sound System to the test.  Taking the spring solstice, morris dancers and maypoles as inspiration for this party, Random Magic is back to wow with more sporadic gatherings and late night happenings.
1395032234101492.name: Cajmere vs Green Velvet + Boddika, South London Ordnance, Luke Solomon + more

1397372373860367.description:
When the Equinox lands this Thursday the 20th of March, you have the opportunity to make a real difference to the lives of innocent animals by protesting the capture and slaughter of dolphins that is an atrocious annual tradition in Japan’s Taiji Cove. 

The little cove’s dirty great secret was uncovered in 2003, when marine conservation society Sea Shepherd released images of the now infamous ‘bloody cove’ – revealing the epicentre of the annual murder of 20 000 dolphins, porpoises and small whales which occurs in Japan every year between September and March. Since 2010 Sea Shepherd has maintained an ongoing presence of volunteers standing watch on the Cove site, known as The Cove Guardians. 

Australian Cove Guardian Emillie describes the scene she witnessed at Taiji Cove…

“A pod of 250 bottlenose dolphins spent days netted in the cove while their family unit was torturously torn apart. Dolphins deemed worthy for a life of captivity were stolen away. The remainder waited - disoriented, frightened and hungry until the eventual slaughter. On an almost daily basis I continued to witness intelligent, wild and free dolphin pods systematically driven into the cove only to depart as a commodity, either as a petrified prisoner or lifeless meat for human consumption. Every day, six months of the year, this is the reality of Taiji. And it is a visibly decaying town, symbolic of its archaic practices.”

The Japanese government maintain that Taiji is part of a cultural tradition, and yet the evidence is clear that this is a commercially driven endeavour, with the animals ending up in captivity, on the food market, or simply left injured in the oceans to die. Unlike whales, dolphins do not have an international organisation to offer them protection, so it really is down to us - the people of the international community to care enough to take action for these animals which scientists are increasingly discovering to be highly intelligent, emotional and social beings. 

Momentum is building rapidly for the opposition of dolphin and whale slaughter and capture in the form of global protests, a viral storm of Internet activity and media coverage including high profile documentaries. In 2009 the Academy Award winning documentary The Cove was released, featuring Richard O’Barry, a former dolphin capturer and trainer for the TV Series Flipper, who later dedicated his life to preventing the very same practice. The impact of this film now looks set to be matched by the recent release of the documentary Blackfish, which chillingly reveals the immorality and tragic consequences of keeping orca whales in captivity. 

Continued pressure is crucial. This Equinox Protest will act as a follow up to the extremely successful protest event of February 20th, during which over 1000 people arrived outside the Japanese embassy to show their derision at the Japanese government’s continued support of the annual slaughter. 

The world is waking up to the horrific reality of Taiji cove, but nothing will change unless we turn our awareness into action. Please join us at the protest on March 20th, to show Japan and the world that we no longer accept this and bring about a change desperately overdue.
1397372373860367.name: London Protest against Taiji Annual Dolphin Hunt & Captivity -  20th MARCH 2014

1397828940438345.description:
We believe that World Youth Day 2022 should take place in Britain, with the main events and closing Mass in London. And we'll be there! Visit and LIKE the WYD London 2022 page here to support the cause:
https://www.facebook.com/WYDLondon2022?hc_location=stream

We could put on the best WYD there has ever been. Why? Because of the faith and energy of young Catholics here, the sense of renewal and hope within the Catholic Church in this country, the pull of the English language, and the attraction of Britain as a destination for visitors. WYD 2016 will be in Krakow; WYD 2019 will probably be outside Europe; and so by 2022 it will be time to come to Britain! It seems like a long way off, but time passes quickly, and it will take a lot of planning ahead.

WYD London would revitalise the Church and be an incredible witness to the people of this country. It would be a truly national event, bringing together every Catholic diocese, parish, group and movement. It wouldn't distract from other important pastoral priorities - instead it would provide a focus and stimulus for them. The period of planning and preparation would galvanise the Church at national and local levels. The ‘Days in the Dioceses', in the week before WYD itself, would be a celebration of faith throughout the regions, with hundreds of thousands of international young pilgrims welcomed into parishes and families across Britain. And there could be an important ecumenical dimension too, with Catholics and other Christian communities cooperating in hospitality, witness and celebration.

London would be the focus for the main WYD events and closing Mass. Why? Not because of some unthinking ‘London-centric’ prejudice in favour of the capital, but simply because of the practical advantages. London has the venues, the infrastructure, the transport, the public spaces - the sheer size; and it will have the experience of dealing with the Olympics. In the three dioceses that converge there (Westminster, Southwark and Brentwood), it has the greatest number of Catholic parishes and movements, the richest concentration of Catholic life, and an incomparable diversity of people and communities. And it has a unique pull in the international imagination. It would be ‘London uniting the country and opening out to the world’, rather than ‘London excluding the regions’.

Yes, there would be significant costs. But unlike Pope Benedict's visit to the UK in 2010, WYD would pay for itself. If just half a million pilgrims register (a conservative estimate), and the fee is just £50, that's £25m to start with, even before the serious fundraising has begun. And despite the misgivings of some, no-one seriously doubts that this kind of event brings massive economic benefits to the host country. The Papal visit, for example, brought an £8.5m boost to Glasgow alone; and a £12.5m boost to Birmingham. According to an independent report from PricewaterhouseCoopers, WYD Madrid brought 354m Euros to Spain, and there are similar predictions for Rio [see links below]. This is one reason why the British Government and Mayor of London will surely be interested in it. But there would be deeper reasons are well: the opportunity of hosting what is perhaps the largest youth event in the world, of opening our doors to people from every corner of the earth, and of putting young people at the centre of the national agenda.

At the moment, this is an off-the-cuff, un-thought-out, testing-the-water kind of proposition. It began in the parks and cafes of Madrid at WYD 2011, when thousands of young people from the UK began to think ‘We could do this!’ It continued in a World Youth Day London 2016 Facebook Event, before Krakow was announced, which had 2,900 potential attendees - it's now been closed! And it continues now through this new WYD London 2022 Event.

So if you want to see it move forward, INVITE YOUR FRIENDS - TODAY!! 

What do you think? Post your own comments, suggestions, criticisms, links, etc. in the box below.

You can see the Krakow page here:
https://www.facebook.com/pages/World-Youth-Day-Krakow-2016/1398183080399598

1400544033543172.description:
Introduction to Sociocracy (a.k.a Dynamic governance) London, UK
21st & 22nd June 2014 ~ with recommended 3rd day of practice to embodying learning ~ 23rd June

Discover Sociocracy ~ the elegant and effective way to dynamically manage organisation ~ with James Priest, supported by Rakesh "Rootsman Rak"

This 2-day workshop, with an optional 3rd day for guided experiential practice, will give you an overview of the main elements of Sociocracy. You’ll understand why Sociocracy is so effective in helping organisations become more sustainable and dynamic, and you'll develop transferable skills you can apply within your groups, organisations and relationships!

About the facilitators:

James Priest combines 18 years experience of project management with over a decade supporting intentional communities, organisations and individuals to thrive.  An advocate of transformational tools and methods facilitating self-fulfillment, more conscious relationships and collaborative organisation, his current synthesis of approach includes well known tools such as Sociocracy, Non Violent Communication, Way of Council, Inner Voice Dialogue and the Psychology of Selves.

In addition to his services as a holistic organisational development consultant, James provides facilitation and training for community groups and organisations, sharing his passion for exploring and understanding the subtle energetic dimensions of relationship and organisational systems. Working as a skilled Voice Dialogue facilitator, he also has a private practice for individuals and couples.

Website: www.thriveincommunity.co.uk

Rakesh Rootsman Rak
Rakesh is an  experienced low impact living designer and teacher from the UK, specialising in community resilience, permaculture, creating food forests and low maintenance food growing systems. He has worked as an advisor to several community projects in London and throughout Europe and has taught in many countries around the world. Rakesh has turned his dyslexia to his advantage by developing a talent for observation and hands on learning and teaching methods. At a young age he established a successful computer consultancy and, after achieving financial independence, acquired skills as a homeopath and yoga teacher which he put to use in Ananda Marga humanitarian relief projects in Africa, Asia and Eastern Europe. Along with Permaculture Rakesh focuses on the human skills of communication and planning so necessary for successful communities.

Website: www.ecologicaldesigns.co.uk

Dates
Introduction Sat 21st and Sun 22nd June 2014, from 9:30am to 5:30pm
Optional deepening the process day Mon 23rd June 2014

Venue
The 2 day introduction will take place at an alternative school in East London (5 mins walk from a tube station). Full details will be given on application.
The one day deepening session will take place in Ilford (we have a choice of venues depending on the number of attendees). All venues are within 5 to 10 mins walk from a British Rail station, which is 15 minutes from Liverpool street or Stratford station.

Cost
£150 advanced discount (if paid before 1st May)
£200 full cost
£300 if you are funded
£390 for a group discount of 3 people if paid before 1st May
£500 for a group discount of 4 people if paid before 1st May

Food
Tea and snacks will be provided for the breaks. To show the abundance of community action, we kindly request people to bring food and drinks to share for lunch. Please bring something vegetarian that is easy to split and share with the group. It could be your favourite home made dish or something store bought. If everyone brings enough to feed 2 people, we will show the power of community in action by sharing the load and creating abundance for all. Ideally the food you bring will tell a story, and become part of the learning experience.

Contact
Rakesh rakeshaji@gmail.com

Sign up
To register for this course please fill in this very short and very simple form
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1iq22aG-WDhm4QY--uDVYmjYc8jS0D4Kw1TVvrqWCfpE/viewform


Feedback from previous courses

The Sociocratic method offers a whole system governance solution to draw on the collective intelligence of any organisation or group. It facilitates collaborative innovation, fosters transparency and guarantees the potential for equivalence in decision making.  "The practical nature of Sociocracy, as experienced in the workshop filled me with inspiration. I've often felt powerless and before the workshop I had the strong feeling “there has to be a better way”.  After the workshop I felt, “yes, I am starting to get my groove back”. 
Eileen, Independent Translator and Copywriter

"This was not an easy workshop, with  the steep learning curve of Sociocratic process and a two year old conflict waiting to be resolved, battling for supremacy… The facilitators art was such we learned the processes while in process! We never lost a member to boredom, ( much) or from the room, (for long) in the two long days of  the workshop." 
Roz - Co-housing resident - UK

Although I had read the book “We the people” twice and already had done some practical work with Sociocracy the course gave me a much deeper understanding of  how Sociocracy integrates human wisdom, natural organizational design and how this is realised by the Sociocracy principles and practices. Understanding the purpose and intent behind the principles will make me able to adapt practices and handle challenging situations. Now I am really exited to facilitate and implement Sociocracy on a new level." 
Michael Gothe - Agile Coach, Stockholm

"I didn’t know anything about Sociocracy before hand. The course presented a good overview and it was easy to grasp the effectiveness of the method. I’m active in Transition Gothenburg and I will support every initiative to introduce Sociokrati in our network." 
Susanne - Transition Gothenburg

"Thank you for a great weekend. You presented outstanding material in a personal, present and powerful way. I came back with many tools to get started implementing Sociocracy."
Matteas - RAW & Green Earth, Stockholm

"This workshop gave me a deeper appreciation for the sociocratic principles and values. I felt fully engaged, had lot of fun, learned a lot, and received much value from the interactions with the instructor and the other participants. I particularly appreciated the focus on experiential learning. I highly recommend this workshop for anyone who wants to improve their understanding of sociocracy!"
Jan  - Global Process Improvement Manager, ABB, Sweden

1404256469816299.description:
In 2012 The London Community Gospel Choir went to Barcelona to team up with that city’s Latin Big Band, and musical director/arranger Ramon Escalé, for a dynamic makeover of some of their repertoire into a brassy, Latin format. The power and technique of the choir linked with the syncopation of salsa to create an uplifting live show.

Tonight in a special La Linea event the Choir perform with a big band, led by Cuban virtuoso violinist Omar Puente, to inject some Havana heat into their tunes and to bring their vocal power to some Cuban repertoire.

Energetic, professional, inspiring and spirit filled, whatever word you choose to describe London Community Gospel Choir there ‘ain’t no stopping them now’.

From the Choir’s humble beginnings in 1982 as Britain’s first concert gospel choir to performing at Wembley for the FA Cup final, The London Community Gospel Choir have grown to be world-wide phenomenon.

Renowned for their funky gospel flair, swing-beat, RnB traditional and soulful arrangements, invigorating choreography and vocal gymnastics, this dynamic group have performed at Live 8, Glastonbury and on the soundtrack for the Disney Smash the Lion King.

Tickets £20 plus booking fee

1405467259731672.description:
Order tickets via Eventbrite:
http://colmhw2.eventbrite.com/?aff=efbevent

 


Join us on Bank Holiday Monday for the Muslim History Walk of City of London. The prefect opportunity for a fun day out with your children and to meet other people!

Did you know that Saladhuddin has connections with the City of London? Find out what they are whilst we show you some of the earliest Muslim Statues in UK, hidden gems, Architecture, Crime, Crusades/ Jihad, the place where humans were experimented on when medicine was brought over, Drink, The Great Fire of London, legends and much more!



Testimonies:

 

"Thoroughly enjoyed both walks - well researched, relaxed, insightful and a great eye opener to London's hidden Muslim history. The guide was impeccably professional (even in rain!) and knowledgeable and I would highly recommend both walks."

Lawyer, City of London.

 

"I thought it was an excellent and extremely interesting discussion- I learned so much!  I even asked me husband about St. George...  I think there should be more efforts to have these interesting pieces of history taught to more and more school children.  Young Muslim children should feel pride in their legacy in the UK, and other non-Muslims need to acknowledge the important contributions Muslims have been making to this country for centuries. for our entire existence, and we are better for it.  Thank you for such a great afternoon and thank you for making me feel welcome" 
 J. Martin, US Embassy, Cultural Attache`

 

"It was excellent mashallah, hihghly recommend to all. The evening was very informative. Provided a great insight in a practical fun 'walk n talk', which was sociable, giving a chance to meet new people and scope for photography along the way!"

Rooful Ali -Review of EMERALD
1405467259731672.location: Temple London Underground Station, City of London, London, GB
1405467259731672.name: City of London Muslim History Walking Tour

1405475179704070.description:
STUDIO 54 Night – Dj Ronny Birthday party v Duplexu Praha 12.4.2014 + star DJ LEE DAGGER (London)

Studio 54 vás zve na narozenivou party Dj RONNYho na sobotu 12.4.2014 s hvězdným hostem z Londýna DJ LEE DAGGER! 
Support Djs: Tommy Rogers a Enrico. 

Oslavenec Dj Ronny hraje od roku 1995 a to znamená, že brázdí okolo djského pultu již 19 let :). Roman Fojtík aka dj Ronny je dlouletý rezident Studia 54 a je oblíbený jak u nás, tak jeho djské úspěchy sahají až za hranice našich země.   
Mezi jeho největší úspěchy patří rok 2011 když ho oslovil holandský booking a jeho djský kalendář se začal plnit místy jako je Amsterdam, Hamburk nebo Paříž. Mezi nejprestižnější akce, na kterých si DJ Ronny zahrál patří i česká zastávka turné Home Of La Troya, která je považována za jednu z nejlepší nocí na Ibize, dále jeho dnes již legendární vystoupení jako předskokan skupiny Scooter před 8.000 lidmi, dále hraní v rakouských klubech sítě Nachtschicht ve Vídni, Linzi nebo Grazu a u nás doma si zahrál na velkých festivalech jako je Mácháč, Cosmic Trip nebo Pleasure Island. A tak bychom mohli pokračovat dál a dál (více info na www.djronny.cz).
Dj Ronny hraje house a progressive house a svůj narozeninový set předvede v sobotu 12.4.2014 v Duplexu. 

Hlavním dárkem od Studia 54 je londýnský star dj LEE DAGGER. Tento celosvětově oblíbený dj a remixér, byl 4 x za sebou nominovaný v kategorii “Nejlepší remixér” na nejprestižnější hudební konferenci světa WinterMusicConferenc v Miami. Byl v nominaci se super star djema jako jsou Avicii, Afrojack, Calvin Harris, Hardwell, Tommy Trash, R3hab a Kaskade. Tyhle všechny jména Lee Daggera řadí mezi star dje a není o tom pochyb! Letos již po 3 tí Lee vystoupil v Sydney v Austrálii na "Mardi Gras Party" pro 17.000 party people a to společně s Carl Coxe, David Guetta, George Michael, Kylie Minogue nebo Kelly Rowland. Není tajemstvím, že Lee Dagger má momentálně před vydáním nového alba “Bimbo Jones“ a tak se můžeme těšit na new music!  
(více info na www.leedagger.com)

Dalším gratulantem a rezidentem Studia 54 je Dj Tommy Rogers, který si mezi hraním v Miami USA, Švýcarsku nebo Francii “odskočí“ do domácího Duplexu a svým setem popřeje Ronnymu a oslaví tak jeho narozeniny. 
(více info na www.djtommyrogers.com)

A čtvrtým gratulantem a nejdéle hrajícím rezidentem Studia 54 je Dj Enrico.
Jeho hraní v nekolikrát oficiálně zvoleném nejlepším klubu světa Amnesia Ibiza mluví za vše a u nás v ČR není větší akce na které by nehrál. Na oslavu narozenin Dj Ronnyho si nachystal speciální  "Naked" narozeninový mix, tak se máte na co těšit! 
(více info na www.djenrico.cz)  

Sečteno podtrženo. DJs Lee Dagger, Ronny, Tommy Rogers a Enrico vystoupí na narozenivové oslavě Dj Ronny v sobotu 12.4.2014 v pražském klubu DUPLEX.


Oficiální afterparty bude ve Studiu 54. 


www.studio54.cz


More info is coming soon.
1405475179704070.name: DJ RONNY Birthday party s DJs: LEE DAGGER (London), Tommy Rogers a Enrico v Duplex Praha 12.4.2014

1405963452992454.description:
OXIDE & NEUTRINO - FAT SANDWICH - PAPA B & ZICO
THE SNEAK EAZIES      -      PLAYHEAD      -     MUTTLEY
ARIES        -        FLASH HARRY        -       AMBASSADOR

!BIG BRIGHT AND BAGGY FANCY DRESS! (Prize for best outfit)

From the creators of Bambi Legs ( Bristol ) & TruSoundTribe ( London ) comes a brand new musical extravaganza. 
Dedicated to providing feel good, pout worthy, party music to the masses. In a totally immersible, Old Skool DIY fashion & stylee.
Thumper strives to break the divide between electronic & live acts. Showcasing some of the freshest underground talents alongside long time veterans of the industry. 
From knees up horn driven Ska, Dub & Roots to cheeky tail feather shaking garage, Breaks & Jungle!
As long as it feels great then we are game. 
Come reminisce to some old fatties while being introduced to a new generation of talent.


****ELECTRONIC****


OXIDE & NEUTRINO

are a DJ and MC duo from London.
 They both started out at the age of 16 on a pirate radio station called SUPREME FM, It was there they joined So Solid Crew and then formed DELIGHT FM.
 After two years of hype on the underground scene and selling more than 20,000 white labels they finally released their single
"Bound 4 Da Reload" which went to number 1 in the UK singles charts in May 2000 selling more than 200,000 copies. "Bound 4 Da Reload" was famously known for sampling the theme song to the BBC's hospital drama series, Casualty.
 They then went on to cover the prodigy's start the dance.
"No Good 4 Me" which featured Mega Man, Romeo and Lisa Maffia was released in December 2000 it reached number 6 in the Christmas singles charts and also sold over 200,000 copies.
https://soundcloud.com/djoxide/sets/oxide-neutrino/

PAPA B & ZICO

Zico is best known as a member of London's heavyweight reggae band onlyjoe. 
https://soundcloud.com/nuffruffriddims/setting-the-vibe-snippet

Papa B is a man of many talents.
Saxophonist, selecta, label manager & producer. Pappa B
represents for Maggie Scratchers, Hundred Years, Unit 137 & Onlyjoe
https://soundcloud.com/recreouk/papa-b-minimix

ARIES

One of jungle / drum and bass's rising stars, dj and producer Aries has been making big waves in the scene ever since his first release's in 2005. Closely associated with the Co-Lab Recordings camp (run by Benny Co-Lab and Heist), Chopstick Dubplate and Reggae Crew Friendly Fire, Aries looks set to fly the flag for the future sound of dubwise dnb. Touring and receiving huge support wordldwide and with a new project (LionFire) soon to drop on Dread Recordings, Aries is definitely one to keep your eye on.
https://soundcloud.com/aries-uk

MUTTLEY

With his debut release on 'Imperial Audio' reaching the top ten in Juno's Dubstep charts and a track on Jman's album (Greasy Vinyl), 2014 is set to be another busy year. Some of the DJ's supporting his sound include DJ Chef (Rinse Fm), Ruckspin, Skream (BBC), Diplo (Mad Decent), Plastician (Rinse Fm) and RSD (Smith and Mighty) to name a few. This year he has played at some of Bristols most popular nights such as 5127 and Shapes as well as his first headline shows in Europe; appearing on lineups alongside MJ Cole, Yasmin, N-Type, NYTA, Kode9, DJ Q, Fantastic Mr. Fox and more. Last year he also started the collective / label “Vivid Sounds”,  you can hear him playing live on Dusk.fm (first Monday of each month 4-6pm) and on Rood.fm (second and fourth Monday of each month 4-6pm).
https://soundcloud.com/muttleyuk

FLASH HARRY

Resident DJ for Sika Studios and T.F.I.F.
Flash Harry is a mash up DJ from the Midlands(UK).

From hip-hop beginnings, Flash only 24 has evolved in the past ten years, using his DJ skills and unique mashup style that consists of Reggae, Hip Hop, Funk, Breaks, House, Dubstep, Jungle DnB + many other genres to make sure he hits any dance hard. playing up and down the country, 2x comp winner has performed alongside acts such as Shy Fx, Krafty Kuts and The Freestylers while supporting top UK Hip Hop acts such as Chester P, Mystro n Foreign Beggars, With festival sets including Nass, Boardmasters n R.T.T.S. Flash also hosts a weekly radio show with sika studios on UKFM most sunday evenings bringin you the best in UNDERGROUND SOUND.
https://soundcloud.com/flash-harry-sika-fam


****LIVE****


FAT SANDWICH

"Funky GypHopSka salad & Roots with a dash of Jungle sauce, packed nicely into a big warm sub... 

Fat Sandwich are a Bristol(UK) based band playing a fine selection of musical ingredients, flavors and fillings. The unique 11 piece outfit combine elements of Reggae, Gypsy, Swing, Ska, Funk & Blues with a dash of Hip-Hop and a Junglist twist. Always an energetic, raucous knees up, fuelled by music that people just can't resist dancing too!
https://soundcloud.com/fatsandwich
https://www.facebook.com/fatsandwichmusic

THE SNEAK EAZIES

'Skank tastic bouncy fun time Ska'
Welcome to the sneakin' world of the Sneak Eazies. A Bristol based bunch of lovelies playing rocking skanking beats. Lots of bouncy tunes with heavy bass lines and blasting horns.
 7 friends playing ska with various bits of this and that thrown in for good measure. 
https://soundcloud.com/sneakeazies
https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Sneak-Eazies/163656753725375

PLAYHEAD

Playhead are a new and exciting 4 piece electronic band from Bristol, UK playing live dance music, merging club with live music cultures.
Combining the creative forces of two eminent producers - Jon Savage (real world) & Bruce Turner (DSR), and have worked and produced with some of the industry's finest: 
(Roni Size, Pendulum, TC, Jakes, Distorted Minds, Sub Focus, Fabio & Grooverider, Banco De Gaia, Squarepusher); the group have refined a wealth of conceptual and technical delivery with an ambitious, fiery and original live show. 
So far this year Album release, remixes for Squarepusher and Banco De Gaia and live video, studio recording.
https://soundcloud.com/playhead-2/diabolus-in-musica-bbc/s-OlXer
https://www.facebook.com/playheadhq


AMBASSADOR with FEDZILLA 

Heavyweight DubSelector from London. With a case full of nothing other than fatties and back up from the Beautiful Fedzilla. Ambassador is set to kick the party off in a true roots style & fashion.
http://www.mixcloud.com/Ambassador_DaVinciSound/


HOSTS- FEDZILLA & KEV THE POET
https://soundcloud.com/kevthepoet
https://soundcloud.com/fedzilla-1

1408830839335235.description:
Buy your vintage by weight – the smartest way to shop vintage.

The brainchild of Europe’s largest vintage wholesaler and Britain’s biggest vintage fair, The Vintage Kilo Sale returns this season, bringing the mother of all vintage events to London’s east end. 

Location: York Hall, 5 Old Ford Road, Bethnal Green, E2 9PJ

Date: Sunday 4th May 2014

PRIVATE TRADE ENTRY: 9:45am
EARLY BIRD GENERAL PUBLIC: 10:15am £3.00
PUBLIC ENTRY: 11:00am £1.00
SALE CLOSES AT 16:00

Founded in 2009, the formula for the Kilo is a simple one; offering a window into wholesale life, the event lets shoppers play trader for a day, scouring over 3 tonnes of vintage and simply paying per weight. Priced at £15 per kilo you can shop menswear, womenswear and childrenswear. Dresses, denim, jumpers to tees, with many combinations taking change from a twenty. 

Championed by Stylist, Timeout and the London Evening Standard as a revolutionary new way to shop, it’s vintage without the worry-lines.

Unlike other events, The Kilo Sale is much more than its rails and rummage tubs. Alongside ladies, children’s and gents outfits, the event offers reworked vintage, accessories and a much-needed  dose of vintage on a shoestring, with wholesale vintage jewellery priced from 50p. In a time of financial crisis, The Vintage Kilo team understand that buying bulk may not be everyone’s cup of tea; offering all items  individually, prices still remain affordable, with dresses, shirts, jumpers and tees all generating change from a tenner. 

A popular choice with thrifters, designers and London’s east-end crowd, The Vintage Kilo Sale regularly sees over 1,000 shoppers over the 5 hour opening period. 

Offering an economical yet exciting way to shop the big A/W trends such as heritage, dark romance and of course the 1990s, founder Judy Berger calls it ‘taking retro to its roots.’ Acknowledged by the likes of Elle, Asos and Stylist, shoppers can expect the same high standard from ‘Vintage’ festival curator, bringing vintage that’s affordable, eclectic and always ‘worth the weight.’
1408830839335235.name: London Vintage Kilo Sale

1410646315873496.description:
It’s not Food. It’s Violence. (http://directactioneverywhere.com/daysofaction)

Read coverage of our campaign at Salon here: http://goo.gl/kqK0q7

Video from our February day of action: http://goo.gl/AFaENQ

---

There is only the vaguest trace of her left. You might find an eerie bone in the otherwise innocent-looking burrito. You’ll see a hint of red -- could it be blood? -- in the brownish flakes that have been processed into a form that makes the original body all but unrecognizable. Perhaps you will even watch one of Chipotle’s beautiful ads featuring happy images of her as a baby (http://goo.gl/ttA0Am) and wonder... what eventually happened to that little pig with a bright, beautiful face?

Chipotle and the food industry want you to believe that you have paid her a kindness by buying their premium priced "meat." But we know better. We know that she died a terrifying and violent death.

And while she is gone. But we will not allow her, or her brutal end, to be forgotten.

The “It’s not Food, It’s Violence” campaign has grown from a single demonstration in San Francisco to a few dozen cities all over the world – most recently, Paris and Lisbon – since it started at the end of October. We have received media coverage in multiple cities and inspired new activists and activism all over the world. But we need your help to keep up the momentum.
1410646315873496.name: It's not Food, It's Violence--Gone, but not Forgotten (LONDON)

1410822475848561.description:
May 1st to May 15th!!!!

Internationally renowned fetish Photographer, Lucas Konrad Messerer, aka Soul Focus Studio, will be staying at Dungeon Manor for the first two weeks of May and is offering photo shoots to Mistresses and kinksters during his stay. He will be mostly photographing at the Manor but will also be available to to shoots anywhere in London for an extra travel fee.

This is an opportunity not to be missed for Mistresses wishing to get professional photos of an international standard, as well as being a perfect gift for someone you care about.

If you have not heard of Soul Focus, here is the blurb. He is a world renowned fetish and Mistress photographer and has been published in all the big fetish and BDSM magazines, often making the covers.

He has photographed many world famous Mistresses and is most famous for his latex pictures.

Normally based in Australia, he occasionally visits Europe and will be staying at Dungeon Manor and offering 2 exclusive low price days during his stay.
Lucas will also be available for his regular fee on other days.

In order to book a shoot with Lucas, you can contact him through his website.

Lucas will be available for shoots between the 1st and 15th of May at Dungeon Manor and on location in London (travel fees apply).
The rate for a 2 hour photo shoot is £250.

On Monday the 5th and Thursday the 8th of May, Soul Focus Studio will be doing a special offer of £150 per 2 hour shoot with 10 edited images given to the model, based from the Manor.
Places for those days are limited so it is best to book early.

A £50 deposit will apply for reservations.

Dungeon Manor is located in Orpington, which is just a 15 minute train ride from London Bridge, and also accessible by direct train from Kent, Sussex, London Victoria, London Charing Cross, and London Cannon Street. There is also ample parking for those who wish to drive.

You can contact Lucas on FB https://www.facebook.com/soulfocusstudio for a direct response or his website:
http://soulfocusstudio.net

1411514952437145.description:
Hello! 
Vi, i 2.c på Himmelev Gymnasium, drager mod London d. 6/4-2014. I denne anledning vil vi invitere jer til at opleve det vi skal på vores studietur. 

Kunne du tænke dig at shoppe second-hand på  Oxford street? Snuppe en øl på den lokale pub med dertilhørende peanuts? Tage til et ægte engelsk teaparty hvor du kan nyde et stykke kage? Eller er du mere til en tur i biografen til en alternativ musical, hvor du kan sidde og gnaske popcorn i mørket? 
Alt dette kan vi tilbyde dig på kun én dag i Londons undergrund. 

I vores London vil du i løbet af dagen have mulighed for at deltage i konkurrencer, som bordfodbold, dart og evt. Fifa. Du kan også købe lodder til vores lotteri, hvor lækre præmier udloddes til de heldige vindere. 
Lodderne koster: 
➢	1 for 5 kr. 
➢	3 for 10 kr. 
➢	7 for 20 kr. 

Og PRÆMIERNE som er på spil er: 

2 gaver poser fra frisørsalonen STENDER til en værdi af 250 kr. 

2 gaver fra Rud og vester

9 gaver fra Telenor 

3 gaver fra Matas 

2 gaveposer fra frisørsalonen Hair by Nature 

1 gave fra Smartyphone

2 gaver fra Apoteket 

2 gaver fra Wagner 

3 gaver fra First Lady 

1 gave fra helsebutikken Helsam 

1 gave The Body Shop 

1 kurv med brød og delikatesser fra Caseus ost og delikatesser 

10 gavekort til Optik Nicolai's til en værdi op til 1000 kr. 

Alle er velkomne, så tag venner og familie under armen og følg lyset ned til kælderen og du vil befinde dig i Londons centrum! 

Vi glæder os til at se jer og give jer muligheden for at opleve London! Vi håber i glæder jer ligeså meget som vi gør. 

Mange hilsner 2.c
1411514952437145.name: Vi tager til London - kom og støt 2.C! STARK

1413230788910965.description:
20 PROFESSIONAL DANCERS GUESTS DIRECT FROM BRAZIL
+ 10 FROM AROUND THE WORLD

 LAMBAZOUK SAMBA LONDON DANCE CONGRESS 
July 2014

The Congress:

We are very pleased to be inviting all of you to participate at Brazilian Dance Congress in London. 
London is one of the most cosmopolitan cities in the world and it is also the only one to offer 4 lambadazouk nights per week in addition to other rhythms and dances such as Samba, Tango or Salsa. With all this diversity we decided to host this Congress in order to continue uniting people passionate about dance from all over the world, thereby further increasing the popularity of Lambada. 
We hope that you will join us at this event which will offer more than 3 days of workshops and shows constituting the 'official part', as well as 3 further dance party nights outside the congress dates, making the entire event a 4 day celebration. 
We are currently have place for the event next to Central London to facilitate the transfers between the hotels, restaurants and the event. London itself has a vast number of tourist attractions to visit during the day. In addition to that, the city is famous for its exciting nightlife offer ranging from musicals in the West End (the English Broadway) to charming cafes, nightclubs and many other exciting events catering for all preferences and tastes.

1415338338718867.description:
Direct from Buenos Aires, Melingo’s deep grouchy voice and his vividly sparse music well up from the world of tango in its early days. Sad, funny, intense, bizarre, fascinating, welcome to Melingo’s wry bohemian universe – a fabulous, boozy, theatrical milieu where Tolstoy, Kafka, Piaf, Brecht, Waits and Cohen might find solace and unsettled lodging.

Tonight Melingo launches  his new album Linyera, offbeat love songs, sparkling with glints of the blues and tangos of old, vagrants’ tales sprinkled with snatches of bossa nova and candombe, atmospheric melodies summoning up musical spirits, now of Duke, now of Zappa, all plunging us into Melingo’s surreal universe.  In the company of his band of itinerant musician-poets, he is a free-spirited, definition-defying artist at the very zenith of his powers.  Part rocker, part flamboyant crooner, with a touch of the comedian, as well as a multi-instrumentalist and composer, he bewitches us with intoxicating dreams.

“The man who makes Tango seriously cool!” The Independent

“A mesmerising stage presence.” The Times

“Imagine a proud hybrid of Paolo Conte and Ian Dury, with the facial mannerisms of a silent-film heavy.” The Guardian

Daniel Melingo: vocals, clarinet
Muhammad Habbibi el Rodra Guerra: electric guitar, saw
Pedro  Onetto:  piano,
“Marques” Gustavo  Paglia: bandoneón
Patricio  Cotella: double bass

Tickets £15 plus booking fee

BUY TICKETS ONLINE
Via venue:  https://tickets.southbankcentre.co.uk/booking/production/syos/82323?performance=

Ticketmaster: http://www.ticketmaster.co.uk/Melingo-tickets/artist/1967323?dcc=

See Tickets: http://www.seetickets.com/event/melingo-la-linea/queen-elizabeth-hall/769372

1415603872040493.description:
No pop, no commercial dance. Just cutting-edge house music.

*Please note that WRONG! is a mixed gay/straight party. Be nice or you won't get in. We're being strict on this*

Following the huge success of Jason Chance's return to WRONG! last week, we're back with 5 of our residents in charge!

WRONG! has built its reputation as Vauxhall's biggest, busiest, best Saturday morning afterhours party on the firm foundations of our friendly welcoming crowd and cutting-edge tech house. Always the friendliest welcome in Vauxhall (it's more like a family!), our established team of hosts are always on hand to welcome you on arrival: Robbie, Andy and Luis!

We open 2:30am Saturday morning and close around 1pm - often later!

£7 with a flyer, MOTD, ROAR. Get there early to avoid the queue.

The WRONG! residents this week:

Steven Sharp
Jamie de Rooy
Thomas Wonderland
Eduardo Herrera
& introducing NPM

About our DJs:

STEVEN SHARP
With literally hundreds of productions and remixes under his belt as part of the Sharp Boys, and a good couple of decades tearing up the dancefloors, Steven Sharp has been at the forefront of the house music scene for a long time. He's promoted some of London's biggest parties, and played some of the world's biggest. Steven joined us as our new resident in January 2013 to play a great underground tech house set.
http://www.mixcloud.com/WRONG_Club/steven-sharp-at-wrong-17-august-2013/

JAMIE DE ROOY
Jamie de Rooy has for the past few years been bringing the London sound to Spain through his twice-weekly peak-hour mix show through Barcelona's premier dance music radio station, Styl FM. Jamie's supercharged tech house sets rock WRONG's parties, and will bring you up and then keep you on a peak til you can't dance anymore.
http://www.mixcloud.com/jamiederooy/

THOMAS WONDERLAND
Thomas is Wrong's Corsican import, and he's been partying since he was 13. Ibiza, Spain, London, France, Thailand, Goa - his travels have informed his music. WRONG! was one of the first club nights Thomas played, and we're delighted to have secured him as one of our forward-thinking residents.
https://soundcloud.com/thomas-wonderland

EDUARDO HERRERA
Eduardo fell in love with dance music way back in 1979 and since then he's never looked back. Originating from southern Brazil's capital Porto Alegre, Eduardo is a genius behind the decks. If you caught his set last time he played at WRONG! then you know you're in for a great experience - tough but alwyas uplifting, deep but never boring, he'll keep your feet firmly on the dancefloor!
https://soundcloud.com/theboxcollective/the-box-radio-show-ep-11-with

NPM
We’re very excited about the new DJ talent we’ve discovered! With his debut at this week’s WRONG, Nick Martin aka NPM has always been immersed in music from an early age. With an extensive background in music starting at 6 years old learning the piano, he has since covered many instruments and genres including playing the violin and flute in orchestras, performing at many festivals on the drums with a college reggae band, and producing trip hop and dance tracks throughout university. He is currently working at Universal Music in Marketing and Production, and has a life-long passion for house and techno. We can’t wait to hear his set!
https://soundcloud.com/nikoli/sets/npm-tech-this-out
1415603872040493.name: WRONG! London's biggest, busiest and best Saturday morning afterhours!

Laid Blak Live // General Roots Live // Reggae Roast with Parly B // Ambassador // Alive // Dub Fiesta 

Tickets - http://bit.ly/1ep03do

Subjam
Saturday 26th April
Plan B, Brixton
Reggae / Dub / Roots 

A live melting pot of Reggae, Dub and Roots performers and musicians.

★ Laid Blak Live
http://youtu.be/A1PqFuzuEec 
Urban Reggae Heavyweights Laid Blak originate from Bristol, England and are taking the UK Live music venues and underground club scene by storm.along with supporting ed sheeran they have supported artist like the wailers, lee scratch perry, desmond decker, john legend, d marley, horace andy, and soo many more great acts, 

★ Reggae Roast
Since forming in 2007, Reggae Roast have forged a reputation as the leading light in the resurgence of the UK Dub / Reggae scene. Combining the label, events and sound system they are spreading the conscious message in the music far and wide, whilst gaining a reputation as one of the key players in the new wave of British Reggae.

★ Parly B
Parly B has collaborated with a variety of producers in the music scene such as Lionfire, Riddim Tuffa sound, Ed West, Ghost Town, 7FT, Digital Dubstar, Tradesman & Danny T, Mungo’s Hi Fi, Adam Prescott, Oris Jay, Raggattack, Part2style, Reggae Toybox. He has performed live pa gigs with The Skints and supported Gym Class Heroes at the Cockpit at Leeds, Sound Control in Manchester & Koko in Camden, London and has performed with The skints at Leeds Festival and Reading Festival 2012 and Boomtown Festival. Also played in his hometown of Doncaster at The leopard and Doncaster Live 2012.

★ Genéral Røots Live
General Roots are a six piece reggae band created in 2008. Growing up in the same area of North London with a shared love of dub, dancehall and roots reggae, they were eager to reignite the power and flavor of the reggae movement through the latter part of the 20th century. The Generals are on a mission to bring a new sound to people’s ears whilst capturing the classic sound and feel that was coming out of Jamaica during the 1970′s and 80′s. General Roots live shows come with high energy vibes and feel good sound, Guaranteed!

★ Dub Fiesta

Sat June 21 - The South London Soul Train marks the 5th anniversary of the passing of the unequalled genius that is / was Michael Jackson. [June 25 2009] Your Host Jazzheadchronic taking you through a celebratory retrospective of classic Michael Jackson.

JHC mining the complete back catalogue of Michael Jackson and dropping live bombs o' soul from his iconic Motown Years to epic works of the 70’s, 80's and 90's - Jackson 5 Classics 'I want You Back' and 'Rockin' Robin' to The Jacksons All time Disco Anthems like "Can You Feel It' and 'Enjoy Yourself'. As well as classic solo works from mind blowing Albums 'Off The Wall', 'Thriller', 'Bad' + More. 'Don't Stop Til You Get Enough', 'PYT', 'Beat It' + More. Original Takes to Remixes and Rare gems from the Motown vaults dropped hard, large and loud all night long - alongside more than a few equally heavyweight non MJ joints to keep the vibe absolutely righteous.

Then on level 2 Legendary Djs Snowboy & Dean Rudland unleash the Soul, Funk and Groove on 45 direct to the whole ah you soul. Storming! The South London Soul Train Michael Jackson Special finished off in room 3 by SLST residents the simply outstanding Nik Weston & Walking Encyclopedia of Black Music Si Cheeba.

All floors taking all passengers on a Non-Stop Magical Mystery Tour through all things Too Damn Funky. P-Funk to Jazz Funk, Soul Jazz to Rare Groove N’ Stax, Motown to Club Classics and Anthems. 

As always, Passengers are requested to check their Souls at the Station as this ones for good time party people only! No Bass Wobbles Here, Only Love, Funk and Souuuuuuuul.

£5 Adv from RA or £7 OTD / Takes place on the 1st Sat of each month w/ mid month 2 + 3 floor specials on an on-going basis.

NOTE: 500 TICKETS ALWAYS AVAILABLE ON THE DOOR. However pls get there early as is always a roadblock, but once in it's well worth it :D

See you on the dancefloors fo sho!

NEXT EVENT: Sat July 05 - w/The Riot Jazz Brass Band Live http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?598413

+ SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT: Tickets on sale now for Sat Aug 30th's - 16hr, 3 Room South London Soul Train Summer Festival and CD Launch at the 3000 capacity Studio 338. With all day and night open air dance floor for 1500 people. Gonna be tooooooo hot! http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?582998

1422069764689028.description:
This is the event page for the London Empty the Tanks event taking place on Saturday 24 May 2014.  It is the day for everyone around the world to stand up against marine mammal captivity.

It's been suggested that we all wear something blue - it's not a 'must do' but it might make the photos look good and give us a bit of an identity as we're hitting the streets.  We're up for it...

Shortened event link for twitter: http://on.fb.me/1dbD5uS and don't forget #emptythetanks.

Please only hit 'join' if you think you can actually come so we have a good idea of numbers on the day; to support the event and be kept up to date, click 'maybe'. 

The event will be one of hundreds around the world happening on the same day, sending a clear message to the people and companies that profit from the captive whale and dolphin trade. 

Worldwide Empty the Tanks event page https://www.facebook.com/events/589482841111412/?fref=ts)

Edinburgh Event Page (same day): https://www.facebook.com/events/351890421613016/?fref=ts

The only way to close their doors for good and to stop the increasing trade in wild caught cetaceans for the marine park market is to get the general public to stop buying tickets. We need your voice and your dedication to see an end to the captivity industry.

We will have a number of flyers, posters, stickers and other props for people to use on the day but do get creative and make your own, then share them on here.

Event location: The UK has not had any captive whales or dolphins since 1993 (although it would not be illegal to open a facility here).  http://www.marineanimalwelfare.com/Dolphinaria/UK%20Dolphinaria.htm 

So instead of protesting outside a marine park or dolphinarium as others will be doing, we plan to hit high traffic areas in central London (exact locations tbc), talking to local people and tourists alike, encouraging them to pledge never to buy a ticket to a whale or dolphin show, or to pay to swim with captive cetaceans.

We’ll keep this page updated with news and what we hope will be interesting links to more information and resources, but please do add your own and keeping sharing this page with everyone you can think of.  Everyone is welcome.

The only reason for whales or dolphins to be in captivity is for rescue, rehabilitation and release.  

Approximate total number of cetaceans in captivity as at November 2013 (data from www.ceta-base.com)
 	51 orcas (including 7 recently captured in the Sea of Okhotsk in Russia)
 	224 belugas (including 18 held in Russia awaiting an appeal decision on import permit into US brought by Georgia Aquarium consortium)
 	2,164 dolphins (including 95 captured so far this year in Taiji, Japan)

Available records show that approximately 5,500 cetaceans have died in captivity, including many newborns and others that have died during transport to and from marine parks.

What you can do
- Please join us on Saturday 24 May 2014 – the more people we have, the louder and stronger our message will be.

- Never pay to go to an aquarium, marine park or any other facility that holds captive cetaceans or other marine mammals.  DON'T BUY A TICKET. 

- Watch Blackfish (being shown on BBC 4, Thursday 21 November 2013 at 9pm), 'The Cove' and 'Keiko - the untold story', read David Kirby's 'Death at SeaWorld'

- If you know of people who plan to visit one and cannot be dissuaded, ask them to take a camera and get good head and fin shot of each cetacean they see.  They should note the species, the number of animals, the date and location. This is best way to provide an actual identification of the animals, especially since names are often changed and animals moved and traded between marine parks. They should then send the information to Ceta-base, email: phinventory@gmail.com.

For further information or to discuss the London event, contact:  lucyearthrace@hotmail.co.uk or bev@earthraceconservation.org

Empty the Tanks Worldwide
Contact: rachel@emptythetanksworldwide.com
https://www.facebook.com/EmptyTheTanksWorldwide
World-wide event page with listing of all events to date: https://www.facebook.com/events/589482841111412/?fref=ts
http://www.emptythetanksworldwide.com

For more insight into captive cetaceans or UK specific cetacean information, visit these pages:
Marine Connection http://www.marineconnection.org
Earthrace Conservation http://www.earthraceconservation.org/captivity http://www.earthraceconservation.org/black-days-white-whales-1 and link to July 2013 London Empty the Tanks protest album https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.688098957873971.1073741827.209732702377268&type=3
Whale and Dolphin Conservation UK http://uk.whales.org/issues/captivity and http://uk.whales.org/campaigns/leave-beluga-whales-in-wild
Cetacean Research and Rescue Unit http://www.crru.org.uk
British Divers Marine Life Rescue http://www.bdmlr.org.uk/ 
Orcaweb http://www.orcaweb.org.uk
http://www.earthraceconservation.org/death-sticks

1422345864686046.description:
Since September 2013, the UK’s first full-time poetry Spoken Word Educators have been embedded in 6 London secondary schools.

On Wednesday 9th April students from Cardinal Pole Secondary will perform their work. Coached by Hackney poet, Raymond Antrobus 

The Spoken Word Education Programme offers a highly effective approach to raising children’s confidence, self-expression, team-building and leadership skills, whilst also developing oral communication and literacy skills. 

The Spoken Word Educators comprise award winning poets Peter Bearder, Dean Atta, Indigo Williams, Raymond Antrobus, Cat Brogan and Keith Jarrett.  They work with young people who may not otherwise get access to arts opportunities, with a range of complex issues that affect their lives and engagement in learning.  Spoken Word Poetry is a cathartic outlet for them, allowing them to be more focused and productive learners. 
rafeef

The key to this innovative model’s success is embedding poets in the culture of each school and enabling them to build relationships with the students, both in school and during their after school spoken word clubs.

The programme has already benefitted more than 2000 students in some of the most deprived areas of London.   The participating young people have wowed audiences across London including performances at Portcullis House for Parliament Week and the launch of Words Over Waltham Forest.  Joshua Izundu, a year 11 student at Cardinal Pole Catholic School in Hackney said, “I have a new appreciation for spoken word.  I have learnt how to turn a picture into words.”

http://spokenwordeducators.org

*** VENUE CHANGE *** NEW VENUE ***

This is a meeting space to learn, experiment, collaborate and be entertained... 

Tuesday 29 April
FREE ENTRY (donations appreciated towards our costs)
Doors at 6.30pm, Workshops at 7pm
Performances and jam session from 8pm – 11.00pm
Bar/cafe open throughout

near Old St tube, Shoreditch High St overground
buses: 48, 55, 26, 242, 149, 67, 35, 45, 8 etc.

WWW.CRUX-EVENTS.ORG

P R E S E N T A T I O N S

ZIPPOROBOTICS with DIVA
Meet Diva the robot performer. An interactive and experimental human-sized robot able to play sounds and even generate algorithmic music that will also become a DJ soon.
www.facebook.com/zipporoboticss

SUBSTANCE B
Substance B details his recent addiction to his MIDI Fighter arcade-style MIDI controller and his high-velocity finger drumming routines.

RONIN
Ableton Live tutor Ronin breaks down the step sequencer part of his improvised liveset project which, with the help of a touch-screen Lemur interface, enables him to rapidly programme drum patterns on-the-fly during a performance.


J A M S E S S I O N (confirmed so far)

DIVA
You are welcome to come and interact with Diva to generate sounds as part of the jam session.
www.facebook.com/zipporoboticss

AMOUSEMENT
Amousement starts making beats with his computer in 1996, alternating this with live shows as a drummer in his punk band. In 2009 he receives the Ableton Trainer Certification. He mixes acid basslines and breakbeats with soft ambient pads, going from dub beats to fast broken jungle. Has released with Altosync, Sociopath Recording, Sostanze rec, Till2012, Pandead Recordings.
soundcloud.com/amousement

FREDDY FROGS
Freddy Frogs has been rocking dance floors with his long-standing Frogs Records white labels. His techno-driven sample madness has been noticed and supported by electronic music mogul Amon Tobin, among others. In 2009 the single 'Excuse My French' was acclaimed by Paris’s Radio Neo.
soundcloud.com/freddyfrogs
frogsrecords.co.uk

SUBSTANCE B
French-born and now 202% London-based, Substance B blends a wide range of influences from Hip-Hop to Breakcore to produce his very own soup.
soundcloud.com/substance-b

RONIN
Ronin is a London-based audio/visual artist, underground media magnate, catalyst for hire and general trouble-maker who has a slightly schizo take on modern electronic dance music. 
soundcloud.com/r0nin
roninaudio.net
mixcloud.com/roninaudio

BIGGINS
Representing one half of the Jenerapartical folkcore liveset, Biggins uses Ableton to fuse live bass-guitar with uptempo beats and sample


L I V E S E T S

Storrmfield runs Combat Recordings and is one half of Fausten. For this event he will be doing an audio-visual set of dark sounds and twisted visuals. There will also be a sneak preview of new Fausten video 'Evisceration'

Moocha will be attempting to do his first live set on an MPC and a Moog as well as some homemade electronics courtesy of Swarm Audio

1424918404429816.description:
New World Artists, Sabretusk & Deathproof PR Presents,

Closure In Moscow (CIM) are pleased to announce the release date for their sophomore full length 'Pink Lemonade’ and the Pink Lemonade album tour. The album will be released independently through MGM on May 9th. It's been a while between drinks, so those boffins at CIM HQ ran focus groups day and night to hone in on exactly what would satiate the hungry masses, baying for more sexy tunes from the Melbourne quintet... The results are conclusive! Turns out it's all about quantity over quality, so this thing clocks in at over 60 minutes! That's longer than an episode of The Block, and since that's about to leave a gaping cultural void the guys figured it would be the perfect time to step up and slide up into that void like a warm kitten. 

‘Pink Lemonade’ was produced by Tom Larkin and CIM in various dens of aural inequity around Melbourne, mixed by one of Melbourne's brightest, rising stars in the audio world, Andrei Eremin and mastered by Howie Weinberg. CIM funded the entire effort by offering some spiffy fan pre-order packs. You could snag everything from a lizard costume, soaked in singer Christopher's sensual sweat, to a Cadillac, ah yep... A goddamn CADILLAC. Some of the remaining items are still available here: http://closureinmoscow.bigcartel.com 

Pink Lemonade was designed to be a voyage that is greater than the sum of it's parts. It is the tale of a hapless fool's descent down the rabbit hole and through the Chapel Perilous... Smashing through the 4th wall with a novelty hulk fist, it is a fable laced with subversive sludge that will seep into your minds eye and stir your soul like a rich pumpkin soup. 

The recorded component of Pink Lemonade is only half the fun... Don’t miss your opportunity to catch up close, the tentacled mass that is the Closure In Moscow live show, where you get to be the innocent hentai babe, and it's a one way ticket on the bullet train to pleasure town... New tunes will be played, faces will be melted, engagement rings will be smelted out of all the used guitar strings and the guys will be betrothed to all that attend. United forever by the power of music, praise be!
1424918404429816.name: CLOSURE IN MOSCOW // Atlantis Awaits // The London Town Fire // The Alternative // ANU BAR 18+

★ ENZO SIRAGUSA

★ ALEXKID

★ SEB ZITO

★ RICH NxT

★ ITTETSU

★ DAN LIVELY

★ ANTONY DIFRANCESCO 

Since the very first FUSE party over half a decade ago, our roster of residents have been playing their own distinct sound – also known as ‘Fusic’. The FUSE London label launched a couple of years later as a platform for our residents and friends to release their tracks, which had been tried and tested on the FUSE faithful. 

On Sunday 23rd March, we’d like to invite you all to come and party with us at Village Underground from 3pm until midnight because we’re throwing one hell of a party to celebrate three massive years of FUSE London. 

With sets from seven great Djs, the label’s third birthday will definitely be one to remember. Playing some of the most-loved material from the past, present and future, our DJs will take you through an aural journey of the very best in Fusic. From Enzo Siragusa’s debut Sagamore EP to Enzo and Alexkid’s Kilimijaro project, Seb Zito's Seven Dials EP, Rich NxT's forthcoming Wasteline EP and the hugely popular Fuse Volume series.This is going to be one serious party.
 
Now encompassing sub-label INFUSE, the productions just keep on coming and with huge support from both established and up and coming Djs alike, there are no signs of slowing down. 

The label releases have seen our sound spread far and wide, culminating in global gigs for our residents everywhere from South Africa to Switzerland. With our residents and friends constantly making music in the studio, this next year will see even more releases and even more parties around the world. But as we return to our London home, we want to celebrate with the people who have partied with us since the very beginning.

See you on the dance floor. 


Follow FUSE on Twitter: @FUSE_London

Please add the Fuse Fan Page:
http://www.facebook.com/pages/FUSELondon
▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

★ TO GET ON THE LIST VISIT OUR WEBSITE WWW.FUSELONDON.NET
★ GUEST LIST REQUESTS MUST BE RECEIVED BY 12PM

Please be aware that being on the guest list does not 100% guarantee entrance. The management still reserve the right to refuse admission to anyone they feel is not right for the party.It is very important to us to preserve the special vibe at Fuse and we will not jeopardise that for anyone. We know the right people will understand

TRIBAL SOUND HEALING PRESENTS:

"Sacred Sound Gatherings"

Hello Wonderful People!

Sacred Sound Gatherings arrive to London! also different Sound and Ceremony Events during 2014, after a long successful tour in the UK and Colombia.

These Sacred Sound Gatherings will be right in the Heart of London, in Angel, lead by Anthar Kharana from Colombia.


Limited to 13 participants only! Don't miss out!

£15 

£13 Advanced Booking Discount until 27th April

Pre-booking Essential via Website:
www.tribalsoundhealing.com/soundgatherings.html

7:00pm

Saturday 3rd May 


Bookings on: 
http://www.tribalsoundhealing.com/soundgatherings.html
anthar@tribalsoundhealing.com
07916 300 990 (Anthar)


The use of Sound is becoming more and more well known in different fields. Sound is been used as a powerful tool to connect us with our inner realities and empowering people to discover their own vision and path to walk, as well as to have a relaxing experience yet deep. 

This is been the way that our Elders have always taught us with much kindness. The practice of respect for all what we are and everything that surround us. 

You are very welcome to join us in this Sound Ceremonies held right in the Heart of London where we will spread the big wave of vibrational intensions reaching many others who will received it in one way or another.

The gatherings will be limited to 13 participants, who will embody the different aspects of the wheel of an ancient calendar from our brothers of Central America, we will be talking about this in more detail during the gatherings.

Pre-booking your place is essential, do not miss out!

Instruments from different ancestral traditions including, flutes, singing bowls, gongs, voice and different rattles and healing tools used in rituals of purification around America, will be played following the purpose of the day.
This practice enhances the experience or inner quest and it will be presided by an opening ceremony to welcome and honour the four corners of the Medicine Wheel. We will also talk about the Nahual or Animal guide of the day which helps to lead the purpose. 

With much gratitude and respect for all the relations, 

Anthar Kharana 

May our Hearts sing with joy with the blessings of the Sacred Unions! communion! 


for private 1:1 sessions and couple sessions please visit: http://www.tribalsoundhealing.com/
1434414646798740.location: London - Angel, Islington, Please Call for directions
1434414646798740.name: SACRED SOUND GATHERINGS in London with Anthar Kharana

1443535042524889.description:
ACE CAFE LONDON & SLAMMEDUK PRESENT THE 4th ANNUAL INCARNATION - BRIGHTON OFFICIAL EVENT PAGE

Calling all car clubs, groups and individuals, don't miss this unique free to attend event! 
 
If you are a member of a car forum or blog, please repost or share the below press release with friends.
 
Forms for Car Clubs wishing to take part are obtained via the contact details below, along with Terms & Conditions. Please complete both documents and return to the cafe.
 
If you are an individual and want to show off your motor, just drive in and park up!

ACE CAFE LONDON PRESENTS THE 4th ANNUAL INCARNATION - BRIGHTON

Calling all Petrolheads!  On Saturday 26th April 2014, from 10am - 6pm, Brighton's famous seafront road, Madeira Drive will again host the UK's finest on four wheels.

Conceived in 2011 following the popularity of the cafe's regular monthly InCarNation Night, held at the Ace on the last Wednesday of every month, with racers, tuners, car clubs and motor fans from across the country enjoying their "wheels" and vying for space, InCarNation Brighton 2014 is a free to attend drive-in and display of vehicles.

Focusing on the individuals who drive and their passions, and open to all motor fans and enthusiasts, from classic cars, hot rods, street-tuned racers, through to hot exotic supercars, prizes and awards will be up for grabs on the day, to include for "Best Club Car" and "Best Club Display", as well as individual spot prizes for "Best Motors". Along with SlammedUK on the spot trophies!

With stands, displays and entertainment on the Ace stage, if the roar of an Italian V10 engine is music to your ears, or a tyre shredding drifter gets your adrenalin pumping, make sure you don't miss this unique, free to attend, seaside event - InCarNation Brighton 2014.

Drive In, Park Up, Chill Out & Party!

Car Clubs are required to pre-book

For further information: Contact: 
Darren Williams
darren@acecafeevents.com



www.facebook.com/SlammedUK
www.ignitionshows.com
www.slammeduk.co.uk
1443535042524889.name: ACE CAFE LONDON & SLAMMEDUK PRESENT The 4th Annual IN CAR NATION 2014

Mixing the past and the present to create the future... I will take you on a musical journey through the decades...

@  Ace Hotel London Shoreditch  : Downstairs bar 

Want to get involved? Want a chance to showcase your talent? Please call me 07466794529
Its not to late to get involved, place still available for next month. 

Taking you through a musical journey through the decades, past & present....

The legendary Mr. Newton Dunbar arrived in the UK from Jamaica in the 1960`s and Directed THE 4 ACES. Which was home to some of the most influential black music and musicians of our time.

Dalstons 4 ACES CLUB showcased new music genres such as Reggae, Ska, Lovers rock, Jazz and Soul. Was a Platform/venue for Channel 1 sound system, Abi Shanti, Desmond Decker, Jimmy Cliff (is just but a few to mention) to perform & express their musical talents.
