1445096469053799.description:
For our first London Kumasi party of 2014 we've lined up something rather special for you. An exclusive 250 person intimate all-night rave in a true gem of a studio space which has never previously been used before for music events. Spread over 3 interlinking chambers and a main 2-tiered mezzanine studio space, we invite you to run and rave amok to the sounds of our choice Kumasi Music guests in this spine-tingling setting.

Headind the bill is Kumasi Music favourite, Rayko. Spanish producer extraordinaire Rayko has been a leading light in the nu-disco edits scene for the past 5 years. Deeply rooted in '70s and '80s disco, funk, boogie and rock, Rayko's influences are masterfully interpreted and transformed into modern day dancefloor bombs. His mind-blowing edit of Candi Staton's 'Broadway' was Juno's #1 disco record of 2011, and his exquisite remix of Barbara Keith's 'All Along The Watchtower' has racked up a whopping 136,000 Soundcloud plays - a platform which he has amassed over 22,000 followers. Rayko's DJ sets are stuff of legend, as such we're delighted to secure his services for our first all-night session of 2014.

Matt Fear continues his Kumasi Music residency and will purvey his bass-heavy interpretation of the slower nu-disco/house sound that has found such popularity across world dancefloors of recent times. Never one to dissapoint, his latest remix for Kumasi (out February) takes us on a typically emotionally charged bass led journey to the basement, warehouse, and back again with a sublime cut of jacking tech-house artistry. Playfully tossing us one way then the next, Fear's rework of Matteo Floris's 'Dance!' makes you do exactly what it says on the tin, and is all set to destroy dancefloors across the globe.

Italy-born Barcelona based Kumasi new signing Matteo Floris has provided us with our first EP of 2014. Both 'Dance!' and 'Let Me Tell Ya' are beautifully crafted tracks in their own right, and we can't wait to hear them loud and proud on March 22nd. London duo Tainted Souls round off the bill, armed to the teeth with the kind of big-hitting releases which have seen them be signed to such labels as Amine Edge & DANCE's 'CUFF', Kolombo's 'LouLou' and Rob Made's 'Sleazy Deep' imprints.

Expect the usual high level Kumasi production and visuals throughout the space. Earlybird tickets are on sale now at the bargain January Sale price of only £5! 

See you in the S-S-Studios!

Kumasi x

The London Easter Carnival @ Shaka- Zulu - 4am Finish  

Celebrate this Easter weekend in style!

Love London PR have pulled out all the stops to bring you an unforgettable night this coming Easter Sunday 20th April 2014.  Join us for "The London Easter Carnival" at London's breathtaking Shaka- Zulu, Camden!  A night with 900 party goers across 2 level's of the finest in House, RnB & Club Classics

This year we bring you a night in Rio De Janeiro. Recreating the atmosphere, style, entertainment of that of an authentic original Brazilian street party, we offer you a never seen before experience this Easter Sunday!

Love London PR presents "The London Easter Carnival". With Live Bongo & Steel Pan acoustics to accompany our resident DJ's and entertainers of the night Love London PR has spared no expense and takes great care in delivering you the ultimate Easter satisfactory experience. 

Expect Brazlian & Flamingo Street dancers, Carnival themed Hostesses & Waiters, Carnival Masquerade, and much more all in the hustle and bustle of the Camden's famous Camden Market.  

All guests before midnight will be issued a complimentary Carnival Mask (Masqurade style) or optional face-painter for the theme. Get you ticket NOW and be a part of "The London Carnival" this East Sunday! An EPIC experience not to be missed!

• Shaka- Zulu - The Venue

Shaka Zulu is absolutely stunning and without doubt the most beautiful venue in London right now. With 60ft giant statues, meat flavored cocktails and a giant escalator taking you between floors it provides a totally unique clubbing experience. Prepare to be amazed as you move through the venue and marvel at the intricate detail captured on each carved wall and ceiling panel.

The design has earned Shaka Zulu numerous accolades including the prestigious prize of ‘best interior design’ at the London Club and Bar Awards 2012.  Located in Stables Market in Camden and based over two floors, Shaka Zulu is the perfect place to let loose this Easter. Resident DJ's play the best of House, Funkyhouse Commercial Rnb and Club Classic This will prove to be the perfect solution for those of you seeking a slightly more unique, innovative experience outside the westend!

IAMDV8 is a creative festival celebrating the talents of Dv8 Training’s most exciting young musicians, singers, MCs, fashion designers, event managers, graphic artists and filmmakers. 
 
Now in its third year, this collaborative project brings the creativity of the various courses under one roof. Dv8 Training’s Events Management & Promotions (EMP) students will work with students, local artists and partner organisations to showcase the best that Dv8 has to offer. 
 
IAMDV8 will provide a unique platform to network as hundreds of likeminded young people and professionals from across the creative industries come together for one evening of entertainment. With the launch of Dv8 Academy in September 2014 there couldn’t be a better time to see what we’re about. 
 
Background
Over the years, Dv8 Training has built a reputation for nurturing some of the brightest new talent in the creative sector. Developed by event manager Fusion in 2011, IAMDV8 has gone on to showcase emerging singers, MCs and musicians, fashion shows, open mic battles, documentary screenings, master classes, market stalls and has been headlined by the likes of Wretch 32, Angel, Devlin, Ghetts, Shola Ama, Giggs and Kele Le Roc. Building on the success of past Eastside Stories showcases and Music Potential Wembley Arena, in January 2013, IAMDV8 is set to take over Stratford Circus once again. 

www.Iamdv8.com

1449924518571037.description:
Wednesday March 19th, 2014
Konkrete Jungle Minneapolis Presents: 



MAMPI SWIFT - Charge Recordings - London, UK

www.facebook.com/mampiswiftrecordings

The very definition of a legend, Mampi Swift has been involved in the drum & bass scene since the early 90’s. It was in 1990 that Swift started DJing and found himself behind the counter of Lucky Spin records. With access to the studio next door and an in-house engineer, Swift jumped at the valuable opportunity to start learning how to produce. Releases soon started filtering out with labels like Suburban Base, True Playaz, Trouble On Vinyl & Frontline all taking tracks.

1997 saw the launch of Charge Recordings, and a slur of releases that saw him rise meteorically to the top of the DnB tree. With the release of ‘The One’, Swift became a household name and he showed no signs of slowing up, following that up with the likes of ‘Hi Tek’, ‘Touch Of J’, ‘Jaws’ and ‘Trippin’. The label went from strength to strength and has since seen releases from Fresh, Friction, Blame, Sigma, Gridlok and more.

In the DJ booth, Mampi is a force to be reckoned with and it’s arguably where he feels most at home. A pioneer of the double drop style of DJing alongside Andy C, his unmistakeable presence behind the decks has formed the back bone of many a line up from the UK to the States and everywhere in between. A true originator he has influenced and shaped the scene like few others.

After a couple of years out, Mampi Swift & Charge Recordings are back in the biggest way. The long awaited ‘History LP’ has been heavily supported by the likes of Andy C, MistaJam, Friction, Hype, Crissy Criss & Bailey. Tracks such as 'Gangster', 'Soldiers' & 'The Silence' have been destroying dance floors worldwide! Fast forward to Autumn 2013 and surely a career highlight for Swift as his monstrous remix of Dizzee Rascal's 'I Dont Need A Reason' took his profile to another level. The track was featured heavily on both mainstream & underground radio, and was critically acclaimed to be "The most most disgusting slice of D&B in the last 5 years!" - Zane Lowe.

Expect big things in 2014 - There is so much more to come!


With Konkrete Jungle Residents:

Easyrider | MBC | Greensky

TICKETS ON SALE WEDNESDAY FEBRUARY 26TH @ 10AM www.ariesmusicfestival.com

ABOUT:
Welcome to the Aries Music Festival page! 2014 is the first year of an annual event that will be taking place in London, Ontario. This year's two day concert will be taking place at the newly renovated London Music Hall. 
It will be our goal every year to procure some the world's best musical acts. Over the course of two days, April 5th and 6th, we are excited to share in the experience with you the live performances of some of the most renowned EDM artists. Our lineup also includes up and coming international and local talent.

1450815401818760.description:
DJ PARTY 乱痴気 LANCHEEKY LONDON vol.2 !! 
※日本語紹介文は下にあります

We're having another LANCHEEKY party!!

After the success of the first party we had in January we just couldn't wait to put on another! We received so much positive feedback from the first event and we're determined to make this one even better. We've got a bigger/more centrally located venue with a better sound system, more DJs playing all kinds of music and a few other ideas up our sleeves to make sure everyone has a great time :)

DJs will be playing a huge range of music including J-POP, UK ROCK, PUNK ROCK,EMO,SKA,INDIE, DANCE, R&B and so much more.

UK based art artists will be having shop space as well! 
They'll sell their Jewellery, accessory and illustration goods...etc

Just like the first event there'll be lots of different kinds of people - guys and girls of different ages from all over the world... Everyone is welcome :)

Also there will be delicious Japanese food available on the night from our friends Peko Peko!

It'll be a great chance to eat, drink, dance and make new friends... please join us！

◆Date
Saturday 12 Apr 2014
Start 19:00
Until late

◆Entrance fee

(£4 with a flyer （one flyer for each person）)

-------------------------------

DJ PARTY 乱痴気 LANCHEEKY LONDON vol.2 !!

1月に約250人以上を集めたvol.1に引き続きvol.2開催決定！！

大好評だったvol.1で皆さんに頂いた意見をもとに、
今回のvol.2では会場を変更し、ZONE1でアクセスも良く、会場も大きくなり、サウンドシステムも更に充実した、規模を拡大しての開催になります！

会場には日本食キッチンの「PEKO PEKO」も併設されており、唐揚げや焼きそば、カツカレーなどの日本食もお楽しみ頂けます。

また、今回は音楽だけではなく、イギリス在住の芸大生・アーティストの方々とコラボして作品販売も行います。

当日はJ-POP、J-ROCKからUK ROCK、PUNK ROCK、SKA、エモ、インディロック、R&B、ダンスミュージックまで、幅広い音楽を流し続けます！！

日本人、英国人を問わず幅広い国籍の方、
そして社会人から、留学生、ワーホリの方など幅広い年齢層が参加予定です！

飲みに、踊りに、友達作りに…気軽にご参加下さい！

1451218318440888.description:
NOEMI  in "MADE IN LONDON TOUR" all'AUDITORIUM SANTA CHIARA Di TRENTO Giovedi 8 MAGGIO.

08/05/2014
Trento - Teatro Auditorium Santa Chiara
ore 21.00

PREVENDITE:
Circuito Primi alla Prima (Casse rurali del Trentino convenzionate, Centro Santa Chiara, Promoevent, Musica 3000) e Ticketone

http://www.ticketone.it/biglietti-noemi-made-in-london-tour-trento.html?affiliate=ITT&doc=artistPages%2Ftickets&fun=artist&action=tickets&key=1141526%243741644&jumpIn=yTix&kuid=466080&from=erdetaila

Uscirà il  20 febbraio “Made in London”, il nuovo album di Noemi contenente i due brani presentati al 64° Festival di Sanremo “Bagnati dal sole” e “Un uomo è un albero”.
Noemi torna con una nuova maturità artistica e personale sviluppata grazie ad esperienze professionali e non che le hanno aperto orizzonti diversi. 
Questo album, come annunciato dal titolo, nasce e si è sviluppa a Londra e vede un grandissimo impegno personale dell’artista sia dal punto di vista autorale che produttivo, infatti la produzione artistica è curata della stessa Noemi. “Made in London” vanta inoltre grandissime collaborazioni con autori come Paul Statham,  Poul O’ duffy e Shelly Poole e con produttori inglesi tra cui Steve Brown – appena nominato per i Britt Award come miglior album di quest’anno di Laura Mvula – e gli Electric .

Queste le date in calendario del “MADE IN LONDON TOUR” di Noemi, una produzione Massimo Levantini per Live Nation:

17 APRILE – MILANO, TEATRO DEGLI ARCIMBOLDI
29 APRILE – FIRENZE, OBIHALL
5 MAGGIO – BRESCIA, PALABRESCIA
8 MAGGIO – TRENTO, AUDITORIUM SANTA CHIARA
9 MAGGIO – MANTOVA, GRAN TEATRO
10 MAGGIO – PARMA, TEATRO REGIO
12 MAGGIO – VERONA, TEATRO FILARMONICO
17 MAGGIO  – NAPOLI, TEATRO AUGUSTEO
23 MAGGIO – ROMA, AUDITORIUM CONCILIAZIONE
26 MAGGIO – TORINO, TEATRO COLOSSEO

Radio Italia è la radio ufficiale del “MADE IN LONDON TOUR”.

1452075378343951.description:
Visit www.starpowertraining.com for full details

We are proud to host Ring of Honor’s Michael Elgin, as he leads seminars throughout August 2014.

Elgin is known the world over as a hard hitting wrestler who has had some of the toughest and grittiest matches in recent independent wrestling history. His strong work ethic and take-no-prisoners style in the ring has turned a lot of heads and this approach bleeds into his training regimen.

This course will be as tough and rewarding as any Star Power have hosted but if take this course head on then at the end you too will be able to call yourself "Unbreakable".

His wealth of knowledge and experience make Elgin a perfect fit for Star Power Training and unmissable opportunity for anyone looking to start or further their wrestling training.

Seminars will include 
•	5 days training Monday to Friday
•	Minimum of 30 hours training
•	Limited numbers of 16 each week in order to maximise the benefit for each individual
•	The best training available in the UK

Visit www.starpowertraining.com for full details

1453786701523745.description:
King Size Recordings Presents: Sam Russo 

First of all thank you to everyone who came down to our last event at Distrikt. Again it was a great bunch of people who were all dancing until the end. A special thank you to U.D.A and Jordan Plant who provided the sounds along with our residents!

We’re straight back into it again this time bringing you a special Bank Holiday Sunday party at Beat Bar on April 20th. For those who haven’t been before it’s a great little space with a meaty Funktion One sound system that we can’t wait to get our wax on.

April’s Bank Holiday party is headlined by Sam Russo, an artist who’s releases on labels like Leftroom, Fear of Flying and Air London as well as his collaborations with the likes of Craig Richards, Huxley and Matt Tolfrey have gained him worldwide acclaim as someone who knows how to get a dance floor moving.  Influenced by the sounds of Berlin and US house, Russo has accumulated a heap of DJ’ing experience having played at most of the UK’s best and iconic clubs like Fabric, The Rainbow and The Shipping Forecast to name just a few. As well as in Britain he has performed at Studio 80 in Amsterdam, BeCool in Barcelona and not to mention the Leftroom Records party at the WMC in Miami. We are very excited to welcome Sam to Leeds for his appearance at King Size, and we hope it excites you too!

https://soundcloud.com/russomusic 

Line Up

SAM RUSSO [Air London / Leftroom]

+ King Size Residents

Aden Konrad
Greg Slater
Jake Wheatley
Josh Plews

1455449724667321.description:
Un Trio Internazionale, una location suggestiva nel cuore di Roma, e tanto Jazz...

Roma, Giovedì 17 Aprile Studio Orizzonte apre le porte ad un trio di artisti internazionali per un interessante concerto jazz, protagonisti sul palco saranno "Joe Pisto Trio" e "Tre Toni Sotto"

Joe Pisto si presenta accompagnato da due importanti musicisti internazionali: Alex Boneham (Australia) al double bass e Adam Pache (Australia) alla Batteria, con i quali presenta un repertorio carico di swing e groove alternando arrangiamenti di standards a composizioni originali tratte dal suo album di debutto come contante "London Vibes" - Emarcy/Universal Music.

Joe Pisto Trio "London Vibes" - Jazz Concert live in Rome - Giovedì 17 aprile

Eventi all'Orizzonte e Patrizia Messina (Elettrotangobar.com) regalano ai loro ospiti una piacevole serata per ascoltare musica jazz di qualità gustando il buffet e bevendo gli ottimi drink offerti dalla location. Il concerto inizia alle 21.00 e dopo le esibizione delle band partirà la Jam Session.

Info
Ass. Cult. Eventi all'Orizzonte, Via Barberini 60 - 064825333 metro Barberini - no ztl - parcheggi blu fino alle 23 (i festivi non si paga)

Per prenotazioni:
Patrizia Messina (Elttrotangobar.com) 3355913434 / 064825333

Inizio Concerto ore 21.00
Concerto + Drink: 10 Euro (tessera inclusa)
Concerto + Buffet + 2 Drink: 15 Euro (tessera inclusa)

Note Biografiche
Per ragioni di spazio non ineriremo la biografia integrale degli artsti che però potrete visionare al seguente link: http://www.elettrotangobar.com/joe-pisto-trio-london-vibes-jazz/

Joe Pisto - Cantante, chitarrista e compositore www.joepisto.com
Iniziamo la presentazione citando due delle sue innumerevoli recensioni:
“Joe Pisto sounds wonderful, very soulful and so musical!” - Sheila Jordan
“Joe sounds great! I’m sure he has a bright future in front of him.” - Kurt Elling

Joe Pisto è un jazzista di fama internazionale che ha suonato in manifestazioni come International Festival “Jazz Over Villach” (Austria), “Montecarlo Jazz Festival”, “Umbria Jazz Festival” e ha vinto il Primo Premio al “Concorso Internazionale per Solisti Jazz” di Monaco (Francia). Ha suonato e collaborato con grandi artisti italiani e stranieri come Paolo Fresu, Fabrizio Bosso, Andrea Bocelli, Brandon Allen, Quentin Collins, Jeff Berlin e molti altri. Ma più di ogni cosa, parla per lui la musica e la sua sua infinita passione per il jazz che lo ha reso l'artista apprezzato di oggi (www.youtube.com/joepisto)

Alex Boneham
Bassista australiano premiato come “Young Jazz Artist of the Year” ai Bell Awards nel 2012, è gia uno dei bassisti piu ricercati del suo paese. Ha girato il mondo con il suo strumento e continua a collaborare con molti importanti musicisti come Mike Nock, Dale Barlow, James Morrison e James Muller.

Adam Pache
Adam Pache è uno dei migliori batteristi australiani e negli ultimi anni si è conquistato un ruolo di rilievo anche nella scena Europea, suonando e incidendo con grandi musicisti quali Steve Grossman, Clark Terry, Junior Mance, Christian McBride, Carla Bley, Steve Swallow, Roberta Gambarini, Diane Schuur, Paul Jeffrey, Duško Gojković, per per citarne alcuni.

Tre Toni Sotto
Tre Toni Sotto è una formazione romana di genere "Jazz-Latin-Ambient” creata con l'intento di promuovere evoluzioni e rivisitazioni di standard Jazz, di musica d'autore, progressive e non solo. Il loro progetto si può riassumere con la frase “tutta la musica... così come la viviamo noi", ogni concerto infatti rappresenta un vero e proprio laboratorio di composizione, dove da una traccia scritta, tutto è lasciato all'estro degli artisti in scena, in una mescolanza di suoni e ritmi che rendono ogni evento “un momento unico“, donando al pubblico ogni volta emozioni diverse.
1455449724667321.name: Joe Pisto Trio "London Vibes" - Jazz Concert live in Rome

1460061780874159.description:
Tickets: http://www.ticketweb.com/fb/4066084/scenic

Zion80:

"A truly soulful experience" - NY Times
Zion80 explores Jewish music (Carlebach, Zorn and more) through the lens of the Afrobeat funk master Fela Anikulapo Kuti. Led by Jon Madof (Rashanim, Matisyahu), the 13-piece band arranges Jewish melodies using the polyrhythmic intensity of Afrobeat, blended with the madness of the Downtown scene. Madof’s most ambitious project to date, Zion80 is blazing hot and tight as a drum. Spiritual, grooving and endlessly exciting, this is essential Jewish music for the 21st century.
The band will debut material off their upcoming sophomore album, music from John Zorn's Masada Book 2, The Book of Angels, alongside selections from their debut on Tzadik Records.
 
Sharabi featuring Frank London, Deep Singh, and Manu Narayan
 
Gaida Electrique is Matt Darriau's new power band, expanding on his interest in Balkan music and love of the Bulgarian bagpipe (gaida).  Power chords meet Bulgarian folk dance. The gaida with its intense rhythmic and metric tradition is super charged by a group of high energy young players from the eclectic and electric New York music scene.  With Yoshie Fruchter (Pitom), Chris Stromquist (Slavic Souls Party), Jessica Lurie (The Tiptons) Seido Salifoski (Paradox Trio).

1462901100595104.description:
Nikita's London Calling (Chapter 3) Feat. D'Julz, Bill Patrick, Ben Annand, Patrick Gil, Max Gardner, Brian Knarfield, Bob Five, Bells & Whistles, + a Special Guest that just happens to be in town... ;)

Sunday, March 23rd, 2014
12:PM - 12:AM

Line-up /
D'JULZ (Bass Culture-Paris)
BILL PATRICK (ROBOTS, Supplement Facts | Berlin/NYC)
BEN ANNAND (Tropical-LA) 
PATRICK GIL (Direct to Earth/DeepLabs, Gynoid Audio)
MAX GARDNER (Direct to Earth)
BRIAN KNARFIELD (Direct to Earth)
BOB FIVE (Direct to Earth)
BELLS & WHISTLES (Four Sweaters / AYLI -SF) 
+ A Special Guest That Just Happens To Be In Town

///

D'JULZ (Bass Culture Records | Paris)
www.djulz.com/
www.lola-ed.com/artists/djulz
www.facebook.com/djulz
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/djulz

Whether it’s through his productions, radio shows, compilations, parties or club sets, D'Julz has been at the forefront of electronic music since his career first began back in 1992. A firm DJ and fan favourite alike, his ability to transcend genres and trends has seen him hold one of the most consistent levels of success of any modern-­‐day DJ/Producer. A run of form that is at its strongest, today.
D'Julz's early career saw him make an instant impact in his home city of Paris, spinning at many of the city's early raves and legendary clubs. A hugely successful move to New York in 1993 quickly furthered his reputation, and upon his return to Europe he found himself to be in high demand, playing key clubs in Belgium, Holland, the UK and Ibiza.

1997 saw the birth of his now legendary 'Bass Culture' night at Rex Club, Paris. The monthly party has become the longest running event in the club’s history, and in 2009 gave its name to D'Julz's highly successful record label. His impact on the club was further celebrated in 2010 when he was asked to mix the debut Rexperience compilation of the series, coinciding with the 15th year of the Bass Culture parties.

Producing since the mid 90's, his music has featured on some of the world’s finest labels –20:20 Vision, Dessous, Pokerflat, Safari, Get Physical, Mobilee, Rekids, Systematic, 100% Pure – tracks and remixes that have become essential weapons in the record boxes of the world's elite. 2008's ‘Just so You Know’ on Ovum and 'Fleurette' on Circus Company became instant classics, as did his debut EP on Bass Culture ‘Fofoca’. His remixes of Slam's 'Positive Education' on Soma, Barem’s ‘Is’ on M_nus and Franck Roger’s ‘After All’ on Real Tone, have all ruled the DJ and download charts alike.

D'Julz continues to travel the world playing the likes of fabric London, Panorama Bar Berlin, Amnesia Ibiza, not to mention regular appearances at the infamous Circoloco, DC10 . The future has never been more exciting for the Frenchman as Bass Culture label grows from strength to strength, and as a producer he continues to raise the bar with recent releases like ‘Special Day’ on Circus Company. Recently becoming the newest addition to Lola ED agency, 2013 see D’Julz join the like-­‐minded Parisian crew of some of the most in-­‐demand underground house and techno artists.

///

BILL PATRICK (Robots, Supplement Facts | Berlin/NYC)
www.soundcloud.com/billpatrick
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/billpatrick
www.facebook.com/billpatrick.ny

In America, specifically NYC, Bill Patrick is a man of many accolades... Since his days as a DJ in legendary clubs such as The Limelight, Vinyl & Arc, he has charmed our hearts and moved our bodies. Not to mention being co-founder of the famed Robots parties and amusing us weekly as Robot Radio's alluring and witty host. Within the world of electronic music everyone has a tale about our friend Bill Patrick. Some funny, some sad, some tragic, most shady, but at the end of each story or any encounter with this demi god you're left wanting more.

In 2008, this mythical creature, who by chance was reborn a man, relocated to Berlin. Why? Few know. Some say it was in search of gold, some suggest it was out of self loathing, those in his inner circle say it was to be closer to them. He says it was to challenge the European state of mind and how sexually active they, as a people, can become. In any event all legend and lore were left behind. So where has that left this man, this nu-romantic? I'll tell you, striving to be more. It doesn't matter that the only place he now plays are mega festivals like Sunwaves in Romania, or super clubs like DC10, Fabric, and Rex in Paris. Currently holding the A&R title for Guy Gerber's Supplement Facts label and hosting his wildly popular radio show, Private Stock on Pulse Radio, Bill still finds time to update his Facebook fan page and send out extremely well written tweets. But he wants to step out of his box and come to you, to educate the minds of the world with his deep, psychedelic take on contemporary dance music. With the help of his unwavering comrades; Seth Troxler, Guy Gerber, Ryan Crosson and Shaun Reeves, he is destined to thrive!

- Words by Seth Troxler

///

BEN ANNAND (Moontribe, Tropical House, LA)
www.soundcloud.com/ben-annand
www.facebook.com/benannandmusic
www.residentadvisor.net/profile/benannand

Ben Annand has been djing and producing events based from his home in Los Angeles since 1996.  In his zone on vinyl, CDJs, or both, he pairs impeccably smooth mixing skills with a dynamic mixing style that keeps the music moving.  His music is dreamy, atmospheric and deep, crossing the genres of house, tech-house and techno and defying categorization strictly in one.  

Buying his first records at 23rd Precinct in Edinburgh Scotland in the summer of 96, Ben returned to the States determined to learn how to mix records and was already thinking about the future, declaring his next trip to Europe would be when he was paid to dj there.  He was a quick study and started playing out at parties in late 1997, had his first international gig in Quito, Ecuador in January 1999 and followed that with a summer 1999 Moontribe Tour in Canada.  In 2000 he made 5 trips to Mexico City’s Club Rimel, 1 to Guadalajara, and closed out the Jazz stage of the Aca World Sound Festival in Acapulco.   Within 5 years of first trying to match 2 beats together, Ben accomplished his Europe goal with pizazz in May 2001 with a 6-gig, 4-country tour that ranged from a small club in a 13th century building in Portugal, to the 20,000 person Festimad in Madrid, a 10-year running underground warehouse party in the UK, and finally ending at the now world-famous Propaganda Club in Moscow.

From 2001-2010 Ben became rather famous in Russia as one of the top-booked dis at Propaganda with 13 visits in those years, appearing on a one-hour show Russian National Television which aired to over 2 million people, and djing outside of Moscow in 9 other Russian cities spread across its 9 time zones - St.Petersburg, Murmansk, Ekaterinburg, Chelyabinsk, Magnitigorsk, Sakhalin, Krasnoyarsk, Saratov and Orenburg (where he was the first American dj ever).

In that time he also made several trips to Spain, playing in Madrid, La Coruna, Santiago de Campostela, Vigo, and Lloret de Mar.  In 2007 he notched one of the world’s top honors for a tech-house dj, playing for in London for Nathan Coles at Wiggle at Fabric.  His success was not confined to Europe; in both 2007 and 2008 he played the Labyrinth Festival in Japan, which many top djs consider the best house/techno festival in the world.  

The past three years have seen a shift in focus for Ben from international touring to becoming rooted closer to home, establishing himself on the West Coast USA Festival circuit with peak-time appearances at Photosynthesis (WA), Esthetic Evolution (ID), and Desert Hearts (CA) among many others, while continuing his 16-year running residency with Moontribe, one of Southern California’s original outdoor events and one which has influenced most other outdoor parties on the West Coast.  He also continues organizing his own nonprofit event, Tropical, which stands out amongst Socal parties for having given its participants extras like free smoothies and massage and in the early days, mixtapes, while over the years while also making a positive impact on the outside community with over $13,000 in charitable donations to date.

The number and caliber of gigs Ben played all over the world in the first 15 years of his career is a testament to his being one of the more skilled and unique djs out there.  Having not produced any tracks over this span, he has always been hired for his skill and has truly succeeded on an underground level, fully focused on his mixing and providing memorable nights of music to partygoers.  Yet as his vision matured Ben became more and more interested on the idea of making his own music and finally released his first track on Laus Recordings in June 2012.  Wanting to improve on the result, Ben began taking voice and piano lessons shortly thereafter to better understand music theory and take some of the music making off the computer.  In 2014 he continues with voice and piano lessons and has begun integrating his knowledge (and voice) into projects using Maschine, Ableton Live, and Logic Pro.  Look for his next release in the near future.

/// 

NIKITA (listed, London Calling | SF)
www.facebook.com/TheOfficialDJNikita
www.soundcloud.com/djnikita
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/nikita

On the same day Dolly Parton, Janis Joplin, Edgar Allen Poe, his mother and grandmother were born, so too did San Francisco DJ NIKITA begin his enchanted existence. As a young boy in Denver, Colorado, NIKITA's childhood was similar to that of other creative youth, days filled with singing, playing the piano, and dancing to his mother's R&B albums. From an early age, NIKITA always knew he wanted to be an entertainer. Then, in 1993, a chance encounter with house music at an underground warehouse party would prove to be a pivotal moment in his life, ultimately guiding NIKITA towards the charmed life he lives today.

It wasn't until the turn of the millennium though that NIKITA would leave his home in Colorado to search the clubs and warehouses of San Francisco for his destiny. At the very least, he would get a degree in music business from San Francisco State University. But with a resounding perseverance and an inimitable personality, NIKITA quickly earned his place among the upper echelon of DJs in San Francisco's world-renowned club scene. In 2005, NIKITA was chosen to host his own radio show, The Massive Mix, on Northern California's only electronic dance music radio station, Energy 92.7 FM. Indeed, it was NIKITA's penchant for blending raw grooves with sophisticated sounds that garnered him a residency at San Francisco's legendary nightclub, The EndUp.

NIKITA is a DJ's DJ, a rare soul who truly understands his role in the DJ booth. Performing anywhere from two to twelve hour sets, NIKITA weaves music into fantastic journeys of rhythm and sound. NIKITA's ability to contrast the harder elements of techno with the soulful sensuality of deep house has garnered him accolades from some of the world's best DJs and allowed him the rare opportunity to tag team alongside the likes of Lee Burridge, Cassy and Derek Plaslaiko. Indeed, NIKITA has played with a Who's Who of international talent, including Danny Howells, Loco Dice, Steve Lawler, Craig Richards, Steve Bug, Joel Mull, Adam Beyer, Damian Lazurus, M.A.N.D.Y. and many, many more. With additional inspiration coming from friends such as Ms. Honey Dijon, Tedd Patterson and Danny Tenaglia, it comes as no wonder why NIKITA's story is one of a dream come true.

written by Jack O'Shaughnessy

///

PATRICK GIL (DeepLabs, Direct to Earth, Gynoid Audio)
Soundcloud.com/patrickgil
Facebook.com/Patrickgilmusic
Residentadvisor.net/DJ/patrickgil
http://www.directtoearth.com

Patrick has lived in California all his life, and it shapes his interpretation of electronic music. Raised in the 90's and 00's on psychedelic rock, jazz, electronica, indie, singer songwriter - and later on - techno and house music, he finds strains of inspiration through the music he was exposed to and has been creating since age 15. He works as a live sound and video production engineer, as well as an event producer in San Francisco; and has successfully found a way to merge his career and passion into a happy medium, that translates into his body of work. 

His production technique is shaped by analog synthesizers, guitar pedals, software tricks, far-out samples, and dub techniques. His productions have appeared at the likes of Berghain/Panorama Bar, Space Club Ibiza, Fabric London, Movement Festival Detroit, Slam Radio, and other various radio shows and podcasts all over the world. He believes in simple and spacious sounds that translate into an open canvas for every DJ to interpret his own story through. 

As a DJ himself, he prefers long, smooth and spacious mixing and storytelling through the slow build. He seeks the same qualities in the music he plays as the produces. Lush but dissonant, slow grooving but jacking; he tries always to find the 'in-between' sounds that stretch out the minds of listeners and dancers. He prefers to play without a computer, and keeps the mixes smooth and tight, with bits of surprises along the way.  2014 is looking positive with many gigs,  the launch of his own vinyl imprint called 'Pressed Friends', as well as forthcoming pieces of wax on CMYK and Space.

///

BRIAN KNARFIELD (Direct to Earth)
www.beatport.com/artist/brian-knarfield/103921
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/brianknarfield/
www.facebook.com/Brianknarfield
www.soundcloud.com/brian-knarfield
http://www.directtoearth.com/

It was the  summer of 2000 when Brian ditched space camp to learned to spin. The intensity of school and the threatening thoughts of staying a Mobile DJ forever began to poke and jab as the years went on. Brian began producing and  playing Techno-inspired beats under the Knarfield ("gnar-field") moniker in 2008 . in 2011 Brian Co-founded the Direct to Earth Party crew and continues to express himself musically at DTE events, while also captivating strangers at other affairs. 

///

MAX GARDER (Direct to Earth)
www.facebook.com/maxgardner.dte
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/maxgardner
www.soundcloud.com/max-gardner
www.dj.beatport.com/maxgardner

Max's style is all over the spectrum of electronic music: ranging from playful minimal and house, to deep techno and experimental productions.  As a student in Arizona, he was raising the bar for underground music. The originality of his DJ sets had him quickly recognized throughout the state and he became a regular performer at large-scale events featuring big name guests. He was playing music that was completely new to his region, regardless of when it was actually released. With a heady, yet distinguished taste, Max set himself apart from his peers. Eventually, his love for deeper and more experimental sounds led him back to his natural habitat of the San Francisco bay area.

After settling down Max refocused his direction towards jam sessions in the studio. He strived to find his own sound by working hard on mastering his gear and developing his own production technique. As a result of being surrounded by a wide range of electronic sounds, Max decided to team up with music aficionado, Brian Knarfield and founded the event series Direct To Earth (DTE), originally based out of Oakland, CA. DTE continues to provide a home for techno and the underground dance music community throughout the bay area.

Since the move, Max has performed at shows featuring artists such as Dustin Zahn, Luke Hess, Troy Pierce, Raiz, Max Cooper, Heiko Laux, Pig & Dan, Tim Xavier, Timo Maas, Marco Bailey, [a]pendics.shuffle, Jay Tripwire, Evil Eddie Richards, Barem, Noah Pred, Nico Stojan, Echospace, Sante, Hollen, Harvey Mckay and Octave among many others. He's also released his first EP with Seeder and saw it reach #11 on the Beatport minimal charts. Max feels out the dancefloor. He can sense what they want. Sometimes he plays raw, gritty, heavy and experimental; other times it's more inviting, friendly, and groovy. While pushing the limits and trying new things, he commonly sneaks original productions into his DJ sets.  

Max always has fun behind the decks, and it truly shows. With an exquisite taste in sound, seemless mixing and an intelligent track selection, he's a master at setting the vibe just how he wants it.  He is a frequent performer at the bay area’s most celebrated nightclubs and undergrounds, and has also made appearances in Las Vegas, Colorado, Black Rock City, and throughout Arizona.

///

BOB FIVE (Direct to Earth, Star Kommand)
www.facebook.com/i.m.bob.five
www.soundcloud.com/bobfive
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/bobfive
http://www.directtoearth.com

bob five roots run deeps in san francisco underground house/techno world. A constant presence in the scene since the mid 90s, bob's performed both near and far, from Black Rock City to the depths of the Santa Cruz forests. His sound can range from heady dreamy deep house to the darker edges of techno. from rare grooves to the latest heat his style of mixing takes you on a voyage blending genres into one seamless soundscape. listen closely to the story he tells and maybe you can also find the deeper meaning he hides within.

TICKETS:
http://thenestcollective.co.uk/shows/events/19-jun-14-will-varley--bush-hall--bush-hall/
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Nest Collective & Smugglers Records present Will Varley @ The Bush Hall. 

To celebrate the end of his upcoming walking tour, on June 19th Varley will headline the prestigious Bush Hall, Shepherds Bush, London. There will be a limited number of free CD's featuring new material and folk covers recorded while on tour that will ONLY be available to attendees of this gig.

The Last 12 months have been an incredible step forward for folk singer Will Varley following the release of his second album 'As The Crow Flies'. The 27 year old has toured the length and breadth of the UK, and has been invited to open for the likes of The Vaccines & Frank Turner. The album reached number 20 in the Amazon Folk charts and received glowing reviews from national music magazines including Q and fRoots. Tracks from the record have been playlisted on BBC Radio 3 & 6 as well as numerous local radio stations. The response to Varley's self made music videos has also been phenomenal, with the latest receiving over 30,000 views in it's first month and resulting in further national press and a television interview in the US.

This Spring, Varley is set to step things up another gear with a 500 mile walking tour of the south coast (from Lands End, Cornwall to Deal, Kent) planned for May. Appearances booked at over a dozen major UK festivals including Cambridge Folk Festival and The BBC Introducing Stage at Secret Garden Party.

Support slots will be announced at a later date.

Tickets:
http://thenestcollective.co.uk/shows/events/19-jun-14-will-varley--bush-hall--bush-hall/

1465870350315793.description:
Dust & Grooves joins forces with Ninja Tune Official, Wah Wah 45s, Mixcloud, and Classic Album Sundays for an opening reception, photo exhibit and book launch party for Dust & Grooves: Adventures in Record Collecting, the debut book by photographer Eilon Paz about the world’s finest record collectors.
This free public event celebrates vinyl culture and photography with a photo exhibition featuring the likes of Gilles Peterson, Mr Scruff, Ollie Teeba, DJ Food, Keb Darge and many more. There will also be a book signing and all-vinyl sets from DJs who are featured in the book.  The book will be on available to purchase.

The official Record Store Day book for 2014, Dust & Grooves is a 416-page coffee-table book that profiles over 130 vinyl collectors and their collections in the most intimate of environments—their record rooms. With a foreword by the RZA, compelling photographic essays are paired with in-depth interviews to illustrate what motivates record collectors to keep digging for more records. Readers get an up close and personal look at a variety of well-known vinyl champions as well as a glimpse into the collections of known and unknown DJs, producers, record dealers, and everyday enthusiasts.		

12:00 - Doors open. Photo exhibition open to the public. 

18:00 - The party kicks off with rotating sets from DJs who are featured in the book. Scheduled DJs include Jonny Trunk, DJ Food (Ninja Tune), Ollie Teeba (The Herbaliser), Colleen “Cosmo” Murphy, Kid Dyno (The Daily Diggers), Dom Servini (Wah Wah 45s), Sheila B. (Cha Cha Charming).

20:00 - Book signing by author Eilon Paz.

21:00 - Raffle of sponsors’ premiums.  The book will be on available to purchase.
1465870350315793.name: Dust & Grooves: Adventures in Record Collecting. LONDON book launch

1466765390201793.description:
Sobota , 12 kwietnia 2014

THE FLASHBACK PROJECT

klimat: RAVE + OLD SCHOOL + BREAKBEAT + CLUB ANTHEMS

Djs: 

The Flashback Project (Propaganda Music, London, UK)
Mikro (dwaPiętra/ShamanaGurus/ukbassradio.com)
Corban (dwaPiętra/ShamanaGurus)
Hosh (Sen-C Rollers)
Diabeł (Hardcore Devotion)

Start: 21:00/bilety: 10 pln

Legenda brytyjskiej sceny rave/hardcore - DJ FLASHBACK -  zabierze nas w muzyczną podróż w czasie - prosto do ery imprez RAVE! :D

THE FLASHBACK PROJECT.

DJ FLASHBACK znany także jako The Flashback Project  - jest jednym z liderów londyńskiej sceny Old Skool , Hardcore Breaks, jak również jednym z członków grupy The Breakz Alliance. Swoją karierę jako DJ rozpoczął już w 1990 roku podczas studiów na Uniwersytecie, grając na wszystkich imprezach studenckich, prowadząc audycje muzyczne w Radiu i rozpowszechniając tym samym pozytywne i energetyczne odmiany muzyczne. Od tamtego czasu grał na wielu imprezach w całej Europie m.in. Niemczech, Szwajcarii, Holandi, Hiszpani, jak również na wielu znaczących Imprezach w Anglii takich jak: Dance Energy, Helter Skelter czy Back To The Oldschool. Jest to obecnie jeden z najbardziej znanych i cenionych Producentów i Djów na scenie muzyki HardcoreBreakz - NuRave. Jego produkcje, to połączenie wokali i klasycznego pianina z energetycznym bitem i bassem. W 2006 roku zdobył nagrodę 'Best New Era DJ' na prestiżowej imprezie w Londynie Old Skool Awards! Był nominowany jako ‘Najlepszy DJ’ na The Yolk Music Awards oraz ‘Najlepszy DJ OldSkool' na The Hardcore Till I Die Peoples Choice Awards. Od 11 lat jest rezydentem takich klubów jak Raindance, Epidemik, Hardcore Revival, Resonance czy Sunday Skool. Grał także w wielu historycznych miejscach Rave takich jak The Ministry Of Sound , The Rocket czy The Sanctuary. Utwory, które DJ Flashback wyprodukował przez ostatnie 10 lat obecnie wydawane są na pojedynczych ekskluzywnych winylach - dub-plate’ach. Natomiast ostatnie jego produkcje wydawane są w wytwórniach takich jak Rave Breakz, Ministry Of Sound, Mert Wax, Firewall Records, Tornado Records czy 2FX. Jego przebojowe energetyczne Remixy grywane są przez wielu znaczących Djs w całej Europie i Świecie.


http://www.djflashback.co.uk/
http://www.theflashbackproject.co.uk/
http://www.soundcloud.com/the-flashback-project/

Riot Jazz is an infamous, live music club night, known as the most raucous nights in Manchester. Now it's coming to London, and the big smoke isn't going to know whats hit it...
 
• • RIOT JAZZ comes to LONDON! • •

TICKETS
£8 BADDABINGO EARLY BIRD FLAMINGO 
£12 SOLD OUT
£15
Skiddle: http://bit.ly/1fQ6hmw
 
Room 1
• RIOT JAZZ BRASS BAND
• HONEYFEET
• TOO MUCH LOVE
 
Room 2
• WALK
• TANTZ
• DAKOTA JIM BAND - WHISKEY MOON FACE
 
DJs
• ALEXANDER NUT
• RICH REASON
• COOPS
 
As the man said: “Start a movement – eat a prune!”
 
And so, with bellies full of plumb cultivars and lips dripping with trumpet juice, the Riot Jazz-mobile yanks and banks and rolls south from Manchester…
 
…on FRIDAY 28th March, the sun shall rise from the North West!


At Riot Jazz, anything is possible: a place of dreams and liquid wondermint. A one-night-only-festival where the air is thick with pumping jazz and sweat beads cling to the walls like a colony of bats having nocturnal emissions.
 
Chase the feeling! Join the undulating mass of flesh and dance into the night and get your kicks, before the morning comes and you retrace your steps, hopping on your good feet, back along on the road paved with bold intentions…
 
…the road to Riot Jazz.
 
 
• ¡ RIOT JAZZ BRASS BAND ! • 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6xM12g8MD-g
 
These guys put their jazz pants on one leg at a time, just like the next man. The only difference is, when these guys get them jazz pants on, they make sweet and sweaty, export-strength, brass-packed euphoria!
 
Body-surfing national TV and radio waves and bouncing across country and continent - with appearances at Glastonbury, Fusion, Bestival, V Fest, Soundwave Croatia and many more - the original peace-loving aggro-jazz guerrilla have started a movement of their own!
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
"Riot Jazz's brass-heavy jazz combo pack a hefty punch" / The Guardian
 
“…my personal highlight, Riot Jazz, whose unique blend of funk, jazz and hip-hop absolutely smashed it… …if you’ve yet to witness a crowd whipped into a frenzy by a sousaphone solo then I suggest you rectify that at the earliest opportunity and catch one of their upcoming shows.” / Festivalcorner.co.uk
 
∆ Think!
A New Orleans first line lost in the Balkan mountains, with only Chunky to lead them home!
 
Stare into the eyes of the most handsome jazzmen north of Watford Junction. Then get ready for more!
 

• ¡ HONEYFEET ! •
http://www.honeyfeet.org/
A wonderband of royalty from Manchester’s live music scene - If Tom Waits was a happier woman he wouldn’t sound half as good as this!
 
Riognach Connolly, the songbird of a generation, and her merry gentlemen are
musical wizards with a cauldron full of hand-clappin’, bum-wrigglin’ concotions!  
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
 “seldom has conspicuous talent been more accessable” / CityLife
 
∆ Think!
Three hours into a lock-in at an irish blues bar in antebellum East Berlin.
 

• ¡ WALK ! •
http://vimeo.com/walkmusic
 
This new Manchester two-piece has created “sequencer blues” – a high-proof blend of hard-oak blues of the same universe as Valerie June and The Black Keys, but set on a different planet by the drummer’s ambidextrous, multi-tasking, electro-flavouring sequencer-play. These guys have grabbed us by the proverbials like few others – it’s time for the groins of London to feel that tug!  
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
“Absolutely love it!” / BBC Radio 6 Mark Riley
 
“The kick with WALK is the evolution to sequencer blues; leaving electric blues in the past by warping their sonic creations with 21st Century electronic gadgetry.” / Now Then
 
∆ Think!
Giorgio Moroder and Nina Simone served an umbrella cocktail by Robert Johnson
 

• ¡ TANTZ ! •
www.facebook.com/tantzleeds
Steamy-fresh from the Brit Awards After Party, Tantz Take their name from the age-old Yiddish adage “Freilich! Tantz yer pants off!” And when these meshugeners’ mix of power-klezmer with dub, hiphop and Balkan beats hits ludicrous-speed, you best be wearing both belt and braces!
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
'Tantz are a remarkable collective of talented equals making the most of traditional material in a truly modern way… by the end of their set they’d earned a serious dance response from a happy and sweaty canteen crowd.' / Tony Benjamin, Venue Magazine
 
'4 tracks of klezmer crossover with eastern influences and a nod to the dance floor…this is fantastically played and written stuff!!!'/ Jumbo Records review of Tantz’s newest EP: ‘Etrog Pomander’
 
∆ Think!
Itzhak Perlman at the Star Wars cantina on the first night that droids are allowed in!
 

• ¡ THE DAKOTA JIM BAND - WHISKEY MOON FACE ! •
http://www.whiskeymoonface.co.uk/
 
Toe-rag and broken-bone old time jazz, brimming with hopeful revelry! 

Vaudeville blues and North Indian classical music crash together above a Francophone Mississippi delta in a phantasmagoria of Louisa Jones’ velveteen rasp, the clarion-call clarinet of Ewan Bleach and the tub-thumping, legs akimbo-banging legendary double bass and accordion-play of North Dakota’s finest and most travelled gentleman, Dakota Jim.  
 
If you’ve ever been found wandering in the early hours of the final night of a summer festival – this is what you were hoping to find!
 
∆ Believe the Ballyhoo!
“Louisa Jones is the girl with a suitcase full of songs. Well known & loved in the homemade, handmade realm of the Hackney backstreets; a sheer delight brimming with vitality” / Upstairs at The Ritzy
 
∆ Think!
Amélie Poulain reshot as an American folk-tale in Super 8 on an inter-continental train travelling back in time.
 

• ¡ TOO MUCH LOVE ! •
www.soundcloud.com/tmlmusic/sets/2013-1
www.facebook.com/TMLmusic
 
Brothers and sisters are as close as hands and feet but siblings Vicky and Simi Freund have a beating telepathic musical connection that is almost palpable as they steer their clam-tight horn and rhythm sections into the funky lands and get brothers sliding, sisters bouncing, hands jumping and feet clapping.
 
Live, pumping cosmic soul disco and afro-cuban rhythms, straight from the top shelf!

Our weekly social at Zebrano's is getting more and more popular as each week goes by with over 200 people attending every week, guaranteed to be a great night out. It's the best opportunity to meet new people from all over the world and make new friends.

If you have never been before don't worry you won't be the only newbie - you will be greeted by one of our lovely host and introduced to some people to make you feel comfortable.

BIG thanks jury & voters for your support: Leah Rosier & the Tworoots Band (NL) made it to the Northern Europe live finals of the Rototom European Reggae Contest!! 

This will take place on April 3rd 2014 at Hootananny Brixton in London, UK. 

The other two finalists are ONE ROOT (BE) and Atomic Spliff Soundsystem And The Rebell Dubz (BE).

Afterparty: Jahrevelationmuzik Sound System

Doors open 9PM - 2AM / ENTRY £ 3

Get ready irie outtanational reggae massive!! 

www.reggaecontest.com

--------------------------------------------

Leah Rosier from Amsterdam has always been passionate about Reggae music and combines this with her love for singing and writing songs. She teamed up with TwoRoots in the summer of 2011. The name TwoRoots stands for the origin of the members; they have their roots in both the Netherlands and in Suriname. The TwoRoots Band has been playing together since 2004, old-school roots-reggae just as easy as modern dancehall. Recently Leah Rosier and the TwoRoots band linked up with the sisters Samirah & Miryel who now nice up the live shows with beautiful backing vocals.

1475232596038012.description:
ABB April 2014 Live Edition 

Man of Booom w.
Figub Brazlevič, Teknical Development & 
JuJu Rogers (Sichtexot / London/Berlin)
Ecke Prenz w. V.Raeter und Breaque (Spoken View)

Donnerstag 17.04.2014 / Hot Jazz Club
Doors 20Uhr / Start 21:00Uhr 
VVK 10 / AK 13 

ab 23Uhr 6€ ABB w. Ecke Prenz / Subotage / Dj Q

Am Gründonnerstag vor Ostern haben wir Euch 2Acts der Berlin Boombap Beatszene eingeladen.
Mastermind Figub Brazlevič  ist der Produzent & Kopf des dreiköpfigen Boombap-Monsters  Man of Booom. Er balanciert auf der stilistischen Reflexkette der Golden Era ohne sich das kreative Klischee-Korsett überzustülpen oder allzu sehr seine offensichtlichen Vorbilder zu imitieren.  Alles fließt, rumpelt und drumbreakt an den Stellen, die sonst nur alte Pete Rock- oder Showbiz-Platten erreichen. Es booomt.

Dazu kommen nach dem Konzert die  Macher unserer Lieblingsradioshow  Ecke Prenz aus Berlin. 
Ecke Prenz  das sind  Breaque und V.Raeter. Ecke Prenz ist eine Mischung aus Malzbier, Mutterwitz und gutem Essen, aus HipHopSoulDubLounge und Futurebeats. So klingt Berlin Prenzlauer Berg heute.

sichtexot.com/21102013-man-of-booom-back-to-the-booom/
facebook.com/EckePrenz
mixcloud.com/eckeprenz

LONRA-ISTANBUL COCUKLARIMIZ EL ELE

23 Nisan Ulusal Egemenlik ve Cocuk BAYRAMINI Cocuklarimizla beraber degisik aktivitelerle ve SOYAC Cocuklarinin Cektigi "BENIM ISTANBULUM FOTOGRAF SERGISINI" konuk ederek kutluyoruz.

Sergide satilacak fotograflarin geliri SOYAC Kordinatoru Ozden Hanima sergi sonunda hep birlikte teslim edilecek ve SOYAC`in sokaklarda yasam alani aramak zorunda kalan cocuklarimiza yonelik yaptiklari projelere destek olarak gidecek. 

Londra`da bu projeyi bireysel/kurumsal olarak da desteklemek isteyen duyarli isyerlerimiz ve toplumumuzda duyarli kisiler varsa lutfen 07584122810 numaraya mesaj birakarak sizinle irtibata gecmemizi saglayiniz. SOYAC Maltepe Universitesi Proje Grubu olarak size odemeniz karsiliginda makbuz verilecektir. 

Lutfen SOYAC hakkinda bilgi almak icin tiklayiniz. http://soyacnew.maltepe.edu.tr/

23 Nisan Cocuk Bayrami Etkinlikleri ve "Benim Istabulum Fotograf Sergisine" hepinizi bekliyoruz.

1478610325686244.description:
MERCREDI 30 AVRIL// VEILLE DE JOUR FERIE // 20H30 // 8€ - 6€ - 3€ (Cursus) (Concert)
[Rockabilly – Country – Folk]
CELEBRATION DAYS ACT VII
JAKE CALYPSO & HIS RED HOT (Lille / France) + HANAMI (London / UK) +  THE SWINGING DICE (Beauvais / France)

PREVENTES
Digitick - 7€
http://www.digitick.com/celebration-days-vii-jake-calypso-la-grange-a-musique-creil-30-avril-2014-css4-digitick-pg101-ri2370300.html
Fnac / Ticketnet - 7,80€
http://www.fnacspectacles.com/place-spectacle/manifestation/Pop-rock-Folk-CELEBRATION-DAYS---JAKE-CALYPSO-49781.htm

SUR PLACE
Tarif Plein : 8€ / Tarif Réduit & Pass GAM : 6€ / Carte Cursus : 3€

Plein de ressources les Celebration Days reviennent avec une soirée cette fois dédiée au rock des 50’s (rockabilly, country, blues). Banane et veste en cuir de rigueur ? Pas seulement !

Jake Calypso déménage les préjugés, bouscule les instruments, le mobilier et démolit les cloisons. Avec une longue carrière derrière lui (il sort son premier 45 tours en 1983 avec son groupe The Corals), Jake crée le trio actuel en 1999, affectionnant toujours le rock’n’roll des années 55 au début des sixties, ainsi que le blues, le boogie, et la country, le tout influencé par Buddy Holly, Gene Vincent ou Little Richard. Le rock’n’roll à la sauce Jake, un divertissement pour tous avec option courbatures pour certains.

Nous recevons de nouveaux représentants du label Smugglers Records (souvenez-vous de l’acte V des aventures de Celebration Days à la GAM avec Cocos Lovers). Le duo Hanami est animés par une profonde âme gitane. Leur folk psychédélique célèbre la musique de rue en signe de protestation contre une société jamais satisfaite de ce qu’elle possède déjà. Ces 5 dernières années les deux vagabonds ont traversé toutes l’Europe, partageant la scène avec The GrandMothers of Invention (avec des membres du groupe original de Frank Zappa) ou The Patti Smith Band.

Après plus de 150 concerts en France et en Angleterre, nous retrouvons les trois picards de The Swinging Dice et leur rock’n’roll influencé par le Rhythm & Blues de la Nouvelle Orléans et celui des Blues Shouters, le Boogie-Woogie, le Jive, le Swing de l'ère des Big Bands ou des groupes Westerns reprenant et réarrangeant de nombreux standards de Louis Jordan, Wynonie Harris, Merrill Moore, ou encore Nat King Cole...

INFORMATIONS
La grange à Musique / GAM

1479107098983905.description:
Fri 27 June: THE WATER RATS www.ticketweb.co.uk

HONEST JOHN PLAIN to play his first solo band gigs in London in 10 years.

Honest John Plain met Matt Dangerfield at Art College in Leeds and moved to London with him in 1971.  Dangerfield, joined London SS with Casino Steel, Mick Jones (The Clash), Tony James (Generation X) and Brian James (The Damned) with Plain joining them on drums for one session.  As London SS disintegrated in 1975 Plain, Dangerfield and Steel formed The Boys.  

The Boys quickly built up a reputation as a white-hot live band and in January 1977 became the first punk band to sign an album deal when they signed away their recording lives to NEMS.  After signing for NEMS Plain sold The Boys equipment for £500 and put it on a horse, which came second!  This and other dodgy deals quickly earned him the nickname ‘Honest’.

Widely tipped to make it big The Boys had an arsenal of killer songs penned by Steel/Dangerfield & Plain and were highly respected by both the music press and their peers.  They quickly became known as ‘The Beatles of Punk’ but unfortunately through a series of poor marketing, bad decisions and appalling luck they never converted their potential to chart success.  However they still managed to record four killer albums and release several sure-fire hit singles before finally calling it a day in the summer of 1981.  During 1978/79 Siobhan Fahay (later of Bananarama) and Hazel O’Connor ran The Boys fan club.  In 1979 Plain had a brief spell with The Lurkers and co-wrote their hit single “New Guitar In Town” with guitarist Pete Stride whom he subsequently recorded an album, aptly titled “New Guitars In Town.

After the demise of The Boys Plain joined the Dirty Strangers and recorded an album with Keith Richards and Ronnie Woods of the Rolling Stones.  In August 1984 he joined The Mannish Boys.  Managed by Denny Laine’s wife Jo Jo they quickly built up a live following and interest from several record companies before agreeing a deal with Motown.  Unfortunately the band were dropped as soon as Motown found out they were white!  

By this time German punk band Die Toten Hosen were beginning to make an impact across Europe and their lead singer Campino made it known that his favourite band of all time were The Boys.  He offered a support slot to the Tower Block Rockers on the proviso that they could persuade Plain to join the band.  Plain quickly came to realise that he and Tower Block Rockers guitarist Darrell Bath formed a formidable writing/performing partnership and they formed the Crybabys who were voted ‘Best New Band of 1991’ in Kerrang Magazine.

1n 1993 Plain recorded his first solo album “Honest John Plain & Friends”, which featured guest appearances from many of his friends including Dangerfield, Bath, Robbie Rushton, Campino and Vom Ritchie.  Plain’s second solo album “Honest John Plain & Amigos” was released on 12 May 2003 to great critical acclaim and consequently Plain formed a new band to promote it.  His old mate Robbie Rushton (Crybabys, Mannish Boys, The Gunslingers) was brought in on drums with Mat Sargent (Sham 69, Chelsea, Splodge) joining on bass.  They made their debut as headlining act at the Punk Is Dead Festival in Holland on 17 October 2003 followed by a European tour.  

Honest John Plain & The Amigos debut album “One More And We’re Staying was released on 10 April 2006 with a French tour to promote it.

At the beginning of 2007 Plain and his old friend Casino Steel agreed to form a new punk supergroup to play Ramones-influenced rock’n’roll with a hint of Dolly Parton.  The result was “The Last Rock’n’Roll Band” featuring Plain’s Amigos Mat Sargent & Robbie Rushton alongside Petter Baarli (Backstreet Girls).  Their self titled debut album was released on October 7 2007.  Plain released his first acoustic album “Honest John Plain Untuned” on Still Unbeatable Records in Germany in 2009.

In the summer of 2011 Plain went into the iconic Rockfield Recording Studios in Monmouth, Wales to record a solo album for release in the fall of 2012.  Amongst others Plain recruited Glen Matlock (Sex Pistols), Martin Chambers (The Pretenders), Michael Monroe (Hanoi Rocks), Sami Yaffa (Hanoi Rocks & New York Dolls), Casino Steel (the Boys & Holton/Steel), Darrell Bath (The Crybabys & Dogs D’Amour), Verden Allen (Mott The Hoople) and Die Toten Hosen.

During December 2011 Plain embarked on a month long European tour showcasing his solo acoustic show.  The following month he teamed up with Italian band The Landslide Ladies for an Italian tour with a live album “Honest Alive” released on 10  June 2012.

In July 2012 Plain recorded a video for his single “Never Listen To Rumours” with acclaimed director Tony Klinger (The Kids Are Alright, Deep Purple Rises Over Japan). Michael Monroe, Sami Yaffa, Casino Steel, Martin Chambers, Verden Allen & Darrell Bath all flew in from around the world to appear in the video.

He toured Europe again with The Landslide Ladies in 2013 as well as performing numerous solo acoustic shows.

The Boys have just finished recording their first album since 1981’s “Boys Only” and it is set to be released in 2014.  Plain continues to tour extensively with the band The Boys with dates in Uruguay, Argentina, Brazil, Spain, France, UK, Canada, Italy, Slovakia, Czech Republic, Norway, Sweden, Italy, Germany & Japan in the past couple of years to be followed by numerous live dates across the globe planned for 2014 and beyond.  

After almost 40 years in the music business Plain’s musical career is looking extremely healthy with many young musicians citing him as a major influence.  The release the new Boys album in 2014 along with gigs aplenty with The Boys as well as his own solo gigs is certain to enhance his growing reputation and increase his popularity even further.
1479107098983905.name: Honest John Plain & Friends Live in LONDON 2014

1488326698047673.description:
No pop, no commercial dance. Just cutting-edge house music.

*Please note that WRONG! is a mixed gay/straight party. Be nice or you won't get in. We're being strict on this*

Following the huge success of Jason Chance's return to WRONG! last week, we're back with 5 of our residents in charge!

WRONG! has built its reputation as Vauxhall's biggest, busiest, best Saturday morning afterhours party on the firm foundations of our friendly welcoming crowd and cutting-edge tech house. Always the friendliest welcome in Vauxhall (it's more like a family!), our established team of hosts are always on hand to welcome you on arrival: Robbie, Andy and Luis!

We open 2:30am Saturday morning and close around 1pm - often later!

£7 with a flyer, MOTD, ROAR. Get there early to avoid the queue.

The WRONG! residents this week:

Steven Sharp
Jamie de Rooy
Thomas Wonderland
Eduardo Herrera
Enrico Chirchiello

About our DJs:

STEVEN SHARP
With literally hundreds of productions and remixes under his belt as part of the Sharp Boys, and a good couple of decades tearing up the dancefloors, Steven Sharp has been at the forefront of the house music scene for a long time. He's promoted some of London's biggest parties, and played some of the world's biggest. Steven joined us as our new resident in January 2013 to play a great underground tech house set.
http://www.mixcloud.com/WRONG_Club/steven-sharp-at-wrong-17-august-2013/

JAMIE DE ROOY
Jamie de Rooy has for the past few years been bringing the London sound to Spain through his twice-weekly peak-hour mix show through Barcelona's premier dance music radio station, Styl FM. Jamie's supercharged tech house sets rock WRONG's parties, and will bring you up and then keep you on a peak til you can't dance anymore.
http://www.mixcloud.com/jamiederooy/

THOMAS WONDERLAND
Thomas is Wrong's Corsican import, and he's been partying since he was 13. Ibiza, Spain, London, France, Thailand, Goa - his travels have informed his music. WRONG! was one of the first club nights Thomas played, and we're delighted to have secured him as one of our forward-thinking residents.
https://soundcloud.com/thomas-wonderland

EDUARDO HERRERA
Eduardo fell in love with dance music way back in 1979 and since then he's never looked back. Originating from southern Brazil's capital Porto Alegre, Eduardo is a genius behind the decks. If you caught his set last time he played at WRONG! then you know you're in for a great experience - tough but alwyas uplifting, deep but never boring, he'll keep your feet firmly on the dancefloor!
https://soundcloud.com/theboxcollective/the-box-radio-show-ep-11-with

ENRICO CHIRCHIELLO
Enrico was born in Montreal, Canada in 1992 and moved to Italy at the age of 7. As a young boy he was already passionate about music and by the age of 13 he started DJing with turntables in small local clubs. Enrico has always been influeced and inspired by South American sounds. The style of music he DJs is predominantly Techno House. In 2011 he, with close friend Luca Donofrio, created a dual-owned record label called Mad System Brothers. That same year the two decided to move to London, for better opportunities, to meet new people and play in big clubs. In his endeavour to promote his DJing style and music, he has been resident at, and played in, a number of clubs in London. As his latest venture, Enrico has created and run his own events organisation called Last Drop, where he involves guest DJs and invites friends for a night of good music with a great ambiance. He has released tracks on labels like: Mr Ambrose Recordings, Finish Team Record, Housebeat Record, Black Eye Records, Jintonik Records, WOD Limited, Code2 Records, Beach Music Records, Celestial Recordings.
https://soundcloud.com/enrico-chirchiello
1488326698047673.name: WRONG! London's biggest, busiest and best Saturday morning afterhours!

156886837815709.description:
'Did you know that there are over 500,000 people of Turkish descent living in the United Kingdom? 

Did you know that of those, around 350,000 live in London?

Turkish day in London is a unique event inspired by the Turkish community living here in the United Kingdom. Our event offers a full day packed full of activities and features that deliver the best and most accessible way to enjoy a Turkish cultural experience outside of Turkey.  

From live performances by leading Turkish artists and musicians to  recreations of Turkeys greatest landmarks, visitors can enjoy a complimenting mixture of modernity and tradition in a quintessentially British location with a distinctly Turkish atmosphere.'

This year, UK & Turkey Events set out to organise “Turkish Day In London” in Trafalgar Square, exposing Turkish culture to the masses with an event that was to be the first of its kind in the United Kingdom and on a massive scale.

Our vision was to exhibit the diverse colours and vibrancy of the Turkish community in London whilst engaging with Londoners. Indeed, Turkish Day In London had the full support of the Turkish community of London along with many Anglo-Turkish institutions, the Turkish Embassy, Consulate and Chamber Of Commerce among them.

We have received feedback from our fans on Facebook and our community and discovered that there was a significant preference for Turkish Day In London to be held in either Spring or Summer rather than in November 2013. We appreciate that the British winter doesn't do a Turkish celebration justice!

Therefore we have decided to postpone the event to take place on the 17th May 2014, taking advantage of the beautiful British summer weather.

We appreciate that the postponement will be met by disappointment by some, but we are committed to holding a fantastic family-friendly Turkish Day In London and will continue as always to welcome the support of our community here in London. 

Watch this space!
156886837815709.name: Turkish Day in London 2014

1599369286954915.description: Fay Hallam, autentica icona Mod, tastierista di indiscusso talento che ha animato quella scena suonando in due band seminali come i Makin’ Time (assieme al futuro bassista dei Charlatans Martin Blunt) e i Prime Movers, gruppo del quale faceva parte Graham Day, già leader dei Prisoners e personaggio di riferimento della scena garage rock europea degli anni Ottanta. La cantante e hammondista, già a suo tempo definita la nuova Julie Driscoll, porterà sul palco in Italia il suo irresistibile mix di Mod sound, Hammond Beat, Soul e R&B. Fay Hallam è da sempre ammirata ed apprezzata per le sue grandi doti canore e l’incredibile groove all’organo Hammond. Dopo un lungo periodo di silenzio di quasi 15 anni, interrotto soltanto da due album registrati con la sua precedente formazione Phaze , Fay torna oggi in Italia come leader di Fay Hallam Trinity, gruppo che ha già all’attivo due album, Realm (2006) e 1975 (2009) e ben tre E.P.. E’ uscito nel maggio del 2012 l’album Lost In Sound, dove con Fay Hallam collabora il polistrumentista The Bongolian, (aka Nasser Bouzida). Il FHT in tour diventa quintetto, con un’inedita line up. Oltre a Fay, organo e voce, ai figli Josh Day al piano e cori e Sam Day alle percussioni e cori suonano anche il batterista Kieran McAleer (The Dilemmas), e al basso Dan Wilson. Il repertorio ripercorre la storia musicale di Fay dai Makin’ Time ai Fay Hallam Trinity, recuperando anche pezzi classici del Northern Soul e del Brit Rock anni Sessanta/Settanta, con il suono Hammond che caratterizza in modo inconfondibile le songs. Pronti quindi a gustare una serata di arrangiamenti memori del Mod sound di metà anni Sessanta, dell’ R’n’B di estrazione black, di ballate beat e di richiami acid jazz, con la tastiera ruggente e la voce magnificamente dolente di Fay Hallam.
1599369286954915.name: FAY HALLAM TRINITY (MOD SOUND\BEAT) LONDON UK

LINE UP ANNOUNCEMENT

***** WANT MORE ********
Want More Grant Nelson’s Housecall Guest Mix: https://soundcloud.com/grantnelson/housecall-ep-107-06-02-14-incl

Two friends, both passionate music lovers with a depth of experience and knowledge often spoke about doing “something musically” together. This began as a discussion about producing music, extended into DJing together, and evolved into the present day and the creation of one of the UK’s hottest new underground House acts in the business; Want More was born.

Want More, have already gained chart success with their first four exclusive Beatport DJ mixes reaching the top 10 in November & December 2013, and January & February 2014. The new year kicks off with scheduled remixes of Crosstown rebel favourite Him_Self_Her on Planet Acetate, Simma Black’s Low Steppa on his own imprint, collaborating with Off Recordings’ James Silk on Roland Knight’s Inner Coty Records & remixing for Kevin Saunderson’s Son Dantiez with Love LDN’s Paul Ward.

Already known for tearing up the dance floors globally over the past 10 years individually, the duo have managed to land themselves a residency at Undisclosed, one of London’s biggest and best underground raves, having played at the Super Secret Shindig to a whopping 6,000+ on New Years Eve, the pair now look forward to appearances on the festival circuit including Glastonbury, We Are FSTVL, Noisely and more.
Social Media Links:

- Beatport DJ’s: http://dj.beatport.com/wantmoredjs

- Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wantmoredjs

- Twitter: https://twitter.com/wantmoredjs

- Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/want-more-official


***** ONE BIT  ********

https://soundcloud.com/onebitmusic/cold

One Bit are the producer duo consisting of Jonty Howard and Joe Murphy, who alongside working on a wide variety of upcoming projects including Ady Suleiman (Sony), Will Heard (Polydor) and George The Poet (Island) amongst others, have quietly been working on their own artist project

The first release from One Bit titled ‘Cold’ received its first play on BBC Introducing via Dean Jackson’s show on January 11th to rave reviews, with Dean going so far as to say “I love it…stunning, I can hear it all over national radio.”

Shortly after the radio debut of ‘Cold’, the track was uploaded onto their Soundcloud profile, and in the first week amassed over 10,000 plays, averaging more than 1 play every minute, which as a result found them in the Top 30 most popular tracks on Hype Machine.

Attracting positive reviews across the blogosphere from the likes of Digital Spy “This is one of the most accomplished buzz tracks I’ve heard in a while” to Don’t Need No Melody “With a debut like this, things are pointing to a bright future”, it comes as no surprise that many people are already anticipating the next release from One Bit, titled Daydream, which will debut mid February.

Cold can be found exclusively on their Soundcloud profile for download and also to stream exclusively via Spotify.


***** NOISY AUDIO  ********

http://www.mixcloud.com/skiddle/skiddle-mix-022-noisy-audio-motion-presents/

Noisy Audio is a well-established dj and now moving in a fantastic direction with a unique team behind him. His sounds are melodic, high rising and most defiantly up there with the best.

Expect to hear sets splashed with wall-to-wall snares and hi hats; huge build-ups and rises, quirky vocal and brilliant baselines. Noisy Audios techno/ house sets are always a highlight.

Chris (Noisy Audio) started Dj-ing at a early age starting on vinyl moving through the genres, trying and testing different sounds. He was a regular on most scenes until he found his feet on the techno/house scene.

After a vast collection of vinyl and the movement of times Chris moved to the digital world this giving him the opportunity at production and developing further skills behind the decks.

In 2009 Chris joined the AudioVandlas after teaming up with Andy in a by chance set at the EGG in London, after that they went on to play Ministry of Sound, Pacha, The Egg. Koko London, Ultraviolet, just to name a few.

Following this Chris Joined the Ultraviolet team and become resident there with the AudioVandlas in 2011. Soon after AudioVandlas declared a Hiatus and chris continued to Dj and produce.

Going in to the best part of 2012/13 a unique team was built and the name Noisy Audio was born to the present day. Noisy Audio is now Founder of MOTION this year hosting guests from Circus, Robsoul records, Hot Creations, Waxxx, mUmU and More

MOTION is providing unique new underground house event near the heart of Liverpool in a never been used before art gallery The Fallout Factory. MOTION is designed to work with established nights not against them.

EASTER THURSDAY ... NO WORK FRIDAY
Tickets https://alist.ticketabc.com/events/i-love-pacha-king--2/

This is one of the biggest dates in the diary, the start of the long Easter Weekend and as we all know the biggest parties always start on the Thursday.

1st DRINK FREE with tickets from Alist (worth up to £6)
I Love Pacha” we hear you say.. So prove it! Bring your heart and soul to the dance floor and show us just how much you really do love all things Pacha. Head down to Pacha London on April 17th You can expect a night of decadence and excess, the sexiest crowd in London, cutting edge music all the way and of course the odd cherry or 2!

You can expect as much of our now renowned “in your face party vibe and sexy excess with a large dollop of decadence ” and of course a big red shiny cherry or two. Since our humble beginnings I Love Pacha has just got bigger and better with each party!

Room 1 - Motion -1

Trash You
Inspired by Funk, Soul and Disco, these influences all shine through in Trash You's music. Early support has come from Weiss, Giom, Audiojack, Steve Lawler, Midnight Love Club and OFF Recordings to name just a few.

Trash You is no stranger to the club scene having spent many years playing in Brighton, London and Ibiza. Residencies held at legendary venues like The Honeyclub, Zap and The Escape have provided a solid experience of working crowds in the way they should be. Drawing on inspiration from Funk, Soul and Disco, 

Trash You has kicked off 2014 with his first release on the mighty Berlin based OFF Recordings. ‘Watch This’ has gained support from heavyweights such as Audiojack, Steve Lawler, Weiss and Giom to name a few and reached number 23 in the Beatport Tech House Top 100 chart. The ‘1993 EP’ will follow on from this on up and coming label Midnight Love Club with lead track 1993 already causing a stir on the underground ahead of it’s official release in April. You can expect to hear a Chicago and Detroit influenced sound when Trash You is behind the decks, as he looks to show his respect to days gone by.

Over 18's / please bring photo ID
www.pachalondon.com
For info / press alistjohn@gmail.com

For more info on our movement go to www.rebelbingo.com

We're not sure how it happened, but Rebel Bingo has got a bit out of control. It's not just a game anymore. It's a way of life. And this Saturday, we will live it. The old school bingo traditionalists don't like us. They want us to disappear. But we should not be afraid. We should not be ashamed. We're just doing what we love to do. Stay strong. Keep the faith.

TIMES & LOCATION
The venue is Electric Brixton, Town Hall Parade, London, SW2 1RJ. Doors open at 8pm. Please arrive by 8.30pm. Tickets only guarantee entry until 8.45pm. The show will finish around 11.30pm and the after party goes on until until they kick us out.

OTHER STUFF
Please remember to print your tickets and have them with you at the door for scanning. If you can't find your tickets contact Fatsoma.com - they are the company who sell the tickets. Dress code: no plain white shirts, fancy dress, or anything adapted from a work suit. Please be aware that this is a party, not a gambling event. It's loud and emotional. Don't bring your nan. Our events are very busy and the cloakroom is a nightmare - please avoid bringing any unnecessary bags or jackets with you if possible :)

This is our time people. See you Saturday. Let's change some lives.

xxx
