185403301656377.description:
Birth of Joy
London Album launch
Tickets only £7 - http://bit.ly/JK6hf6 or http://bit.ly/1lvI2z4

with support from:
Nightworkers 
"and Black box Red

After 97 shows in 2013 all over Europe and USA, Dutch psychedelic rockers BIRTH OF JOY have already proven to be a true LIVE rock sensation! Besides creating catchy psychedelic 60/70’s-hooks spiced up with stoner, blues and rock&roll influences, this threesome is also master in invoking a primal emotion that lays hidden in many of us. The kind of emotion that craves to burst out when you experience something true, something real. Well, these guys are it, they ARE the real deal: sex, drugs and rock&roll! Blood, sweat and… ah, mostly alcohol!
 
New Album: Early November the band finished recordings for their second official album. JORIS WOLFF is behind the knobs (e.g. De Staat, Within Temptation and Mister and Mississippi) and mastering is done by BRIAN LUCEY (e.g. The Black Keys, Artic Monkeys, David Lynch and Dr. John).
 
Release Dates: For the new album BOJ signed a worldwide deal with LONG BRANCH RECORDS (e.g. Everlast, Prong and Chimaira), a label from SPV GmbH. For France and Japan the band signed with MODULOR/GRAND PALAIS, and SUBURBAN RECORDS takes care of the Benelux. The new album will be released in Benelux on February 1st and in all other countries in March.
 
European Tour: Birth Of Joy starts 2014 with 2 shows at EUROSONIC NOORDERSLAG and goes on to do an extensive European clubtour from February to May. In February the band plays Dutch and Belgian venues, in March USA, UK and Switserland will be visited, in April France and Germany and in May Denmark, Norway, Sweden and Finland. Quite a schedule, but yeah, touring is what these guys do best! From half May on the band will be trashing the summerfestivals of course! All dates will be announced asap!
 
www.birthofjoy.com
www.longbranchrecords.com
www.moduledistribution.com
www.suburban.nl

Nightworkers 
"These guys know what rock 'n' roll is. Mixing 60s psychedelia and English swagger, the band who could rock n' roll-wise be the cousin of The Small Faces (yes, really) offered ten songs to an audience who realised they were living some kind of historical musical moment" - High & Loud
 
BlackBoxRed
"This is one boy/girl duo who aren't dealing in cute and cuddly lo-fi. Fast, furious, and possessing more attitude in their smudged eyeliner than should be legal."

Tickets are also available from
Gigantic Tickets - http://bit.ly/1eQXMet
and 
SEE Tickets - http://bit.ly/1lvI2z4

We are delighted and excited to announce the MODSTOCK program here http://www.newuntouchables.com/home/

Tickets are on sale now here www.229thevenue.co.uk 

Write this date in your diary and grab yourselves a piece of the action folks, this is the BIG one. New Untouchables present ‘MODSTOCK- 50 years of Mod’ in London, the birthplace of Mod.
 
The Mod phenomenon has touched the hearts and souls of so many people and is still influencing fashion, music, art and culture in the 21st century. This event is a celebration of 50 years of Mod not from its mysterious birth but when it swept across the whole of Britain. Since then it has reinvented itself time and time again to each new generation in keeping with the spirit of its pioneers and originators.

The four day event over the Easter Holidays 2014 will showcase all aspects of Mod music and culture spanning the last six decades. The Mod scene is now truly global as this event proved ten years ago when artists and disciples from all over the World descended on London for ‘Modstock 2 - 40 Years Of Mod 

The whole festival will be filmed for a future DVD release and TV documentary so make sure you are part of this historical event!
191861257657662.name: MODSTOCK- 50 years of Mod - London, Easter 2014

1940130916125913.description:
Cand se desfasoara LONDON CUP?
LONDON CUP se desfasoara Sambata 12 Aprilie - Ora 10:30. Inscrierea participantilor va avea loc cu 30 minute inainte de inceperea concursului direct in club si acestia pot beneficia de antrenament gratuit maxim 30 minute.

Cine poate participa? 
Participantii trebuie sa aiba varsta de peste 16 ani, sa nu se afle sub influenta alcoolului sau drogurilor si sa aiba un limbaj si comportament civilizat pe toata durata concursului. Ne rezervam dreptul de a selecta participantii.

Exista o taxa de participare?
Da. Participarea la concurs presupune achitarea unei taxe de 30 lei / persoana sau 20 lei /persoana pentru posesorii de card LONDON CLUB si minim 1 ora de biliard jucata pana la concurs. 

De asemenea participantii pot participa GRATUIT la concurs daca au jucat minim 6 ore de biliard in perioada dintre concursuri. Taxa de participare se va achita in ziua concursului, la inscrierea efectiva.

Se acorda premii?
Da. Se premiaza locurile 1 – 8 cu diplome, medalii, cupa si divese alte premii inedite. 


Poti beneficia GRATUIT de cardul de membru LONDON CLUB daca instalezi aplicatia pe smartphone: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=ro.smartsetapp.londonclub

Aplicatia London CLub include:
- Prezentarea preturilor pentru jocurile de Biliard, Snooker si produsele de Bar
- Sistem de recompensare a clientilor fideli
- Posibilitatea de a ne trimite feedback
- Contact rapid
Fiecare utilizator al Aplicatiei London Club primeste reducere de 15% la jocurile de Biliard si Snooker, in baza Numarului de Card Loialitate care se primeste de la receptia Clubului.
Deasemenea, daca jucati cel putin doua ore de Biliard sau Snooker si scanati codul QR promotional din interiorul Clubului primiti o ora de Biliard gratis.Pentru a beneficia de aceasta promotie trebuie sa scanati codul QR de 5 ori. Scanarea codului se poate face la un interval de 12 ore.
Utilizatorii Aplicatiei pot primi mesaje de tip Push cu oferte promotionale care nu sunt accesibile celorlalti clienti. Acestea vor avea o frecventa de maxim un mesaj pe saptamana. Aditional, utilizatorii Aplicatiei pot primi mesaje de tip Push atunci cand se afla in apropierea London Club.
1940130916125913.name: London Cup

200897280108289.description:
Lock N Load Events present
MODA BLACK

Friday 21st March 2014
Village Underground, London

Ben Pearce
Jaymo & Andy George
No Artificial Colours
Hauswerks

TICKETS INCREASE IN PRICE FRIDAY 28TH FEBRUARY AT MIDDAY:
http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?556403&p=modablack

In just three years, Jaymo & Andy George's Moda Black record label has positioned itself as one of the world's most exciting imprints for forward-thinking electronic music. With a firm focus on high quality production and mould-busting ideas, the label has helped break artists such as Hot Since 82 and Mia Dora, as well as pushing established powerhouses such as Eats Everything, Danny Daze and Groove Armada. Alongside monthly EP releases, the annual Moda Black albums have received widespread acclaim, whilst the tail end of 2013 saw the launch of their new artist-lead project Little Black Book. In short, Moda Black is firing on all cylinders and 2014 looks set to be their biggest year yet. 

After a stack of roadblock London parties, the Moda Black boys will be back in the capital this March, for a one-night-only affair at the formidable Village Underground. To ensure maximum perspiration, J&AG have combined forces with Purp & Soul frontman Ben Pearce, MadTech's tag-team champions No Artificial Colours, and rising Moda Black star, and all-round groove connoisseur, Hauswerks. No ass will remain unshaken! 

Village Underground, 54 Holywell Lane, Shoreditch, London, EC2A 3PQ
Open from 10.00pm – 4.00am
Fully licensed bar until close
Nearest Tube: Old Street (Northern Line) / Liverpool Street (Hammersmith & City / Metropolitan / Circle Lines)

Os B4 - Los Compadres vêm a Londres apresentar a tour "Swaggelelíssimo". 

 Vai ser 1 concerto que promete agitar Londres na noite de 24  de Maio, com as 
 vibrantes actuações em palco dos artistas Big Nelo  e C4Pedro .

 A experiência e maturidade de Big Nelo, que conta com mais de 20 anos de carreira e a irreverência e talento de C4Pedro deram um cunho único e especial a este projecto, que já é um sucesso.

 O disco de estreia, "Los Compadres", traz a público 11 temas trabalhados na base do zouk, house, afro-house e R&B, de onde já foram extraídos vários sucessos, como "É melhor não duvidar", "Baby tu sabes", "Fazer-te Feliz" e, mais recentemente, "Swaggelelíssimo".

B4 - Los Compadres come to London to present the tour "Swaggelelíssimo". 

Will be one concert that promises to shake up London on the evening of May 24, with the 
vibrant performances on stage artists Big Nelo and C4Pedro. 

The experience and maturity of Big Nelo, who has over 20 years of career and irreverence and talent C4Pedro gave a unique and special nature of this project, which is already a success. 

The debut album, "Los Compadres", brings to the public 11 themes discussed on the basis of zouk, house, african-house and R & B, where many successes have been extracted, such as "You better not doubt", "Baby you know" "Make you Happy" and more recently "Swaggelelíssimo".

208109436066007.description:
It's true! If you don't ask you don't get as is the opposite so true! 

I have not pushed this thus far as i have friends also running the race with targets they have to achieve to enter....which i have not.


Please go to www.justgiving.com/smedgey1

Please donate or share my page. Scope is the charity i am running on behalf of for Virgin Media.

I don't have target as i am running for Virgin Media however please share or if you'd like to donate feel free! 

For the 3rd year on the trot I had missed a Virgin Media place. A tongue in cheek email to the team completely changed that!

"Please could i ask if the places this year have been released - i have either missed the email or chosen to ignore it through disappointment!" "Please be aware i live in central London so if you have any drop outs please consider me - even if it's an hour before ha ha!"

“Hi Chris thank you for your email - by coincidence someone has dropped out and you were next in line so you are in!”

Panic, anxiety, sweating set in! Thankfully followed very closely by excitement!

Please support me and a great charity which helps thousands of people seriously effected by mental and physical disabilities and those supporting them in day to day, allowing living as normal a life as possible!

Thanks in advance! 

Please feel free to share

210417052502100.description:
This Friday we welcome our new host Nick Valentine to Meursault, described by Rock Royalty, Roger Taylor, as “the indefatigable prince of the London party scene”, Nick is someone who knows the London party scene inside out. The founder of private members club The Cuckoo Club and renowned for his wild experiences Tom Parker Bowles adds that “Nick has seen more dawns around the world than even the most dedicated of blackbirds. For the past 30 years, he’s been a constant and ever-welcome presence on the nocturnal scene.”
Nick has been a regular presence at all the hottest parties in town. His dominance of social soirees even defies the likes of Tamara Palmer-Tomkinson who says, “When it comes to glamorous parties, I’ve seen Nick out more times than I’ve seen myself.”

Also recent author to his first book entitled Clubs, Drugs and Canapés: A Deep Journey into the Shallows of the Night which involves an ‘attempt to recall the last 35 years of partying’.

Join the fun at the new party homestead of Nick Valentine’s debauchery, every Friday. Expect nothing less than celebrity guests, the best of the West London crowd and great music provide by DJ Julian Jay Palomba at L’etranger’s members club, Meursault.
210417052502100.name: Meursault Launches Friday Nights with Party Prince Nick Valentine

Les Enfants Prodiges & BlackTime presentano:
BLACK BOX 2.0 ✮ Dj SHORTEE BLITZ Special Guest from London ✮ 
✮ N.1 UK Urban Clubbin' Dj ✮ SABATO 12 APRILE

OMAGGIO DONNA IN LISTA ENTRO LE 00.30
3 Rooms|Hip Hop|Latino|Afro|Reloaded Entertainment

Considerato il miglior dj urban del Regno Unito, Dj Shortee Blitz è pronto a far volare il Black Box con il suo show.
E voi siete pronti???

La sua carriera comincia nel 1990 e oggi Shortee Blitz è sicuramente uno dei dj più noti della scena europea e non solo. Dal 1995 è dj della popolare radio Kiss Fm di Londra. E' stato chiamato a suonare a numerosi festival di fama mondiale tra cui il Lovebox e il Glastonbury e grazie al suo lavoro in radio è entrato in contatto con tantissimi artisti come Snoop Dogg, Kendrick Lamar, A$AP Rocky, Jay-Z, LL Cool J, Eve, Nas, DJ Premier e aver suonato alle feste private di 50 Cent, Mariah Carey, Estelle e Paris Hilton e alle feste delle etichette discografiche come la Warner, Sony BMG e Universal. Ha fatto il giro del globo più volte portando il suo set a New York, Boston, Australia, Canada, Africa, Cipro, Papua Nuova Guinea, Thailandia, Cina, Malesia, Kazakistan, Russia. Questo gli ha permesso di vincere diversi premi tra cui l'U.M.A. 'Best DJ' 2010, 2012 e 2013 e il M.O.B.O. e conquistare il pubblico di tutto il mondo.

Evento da non perdere...

212781248920992.description:
After the amazing turn out for our 1st anniversary party we have now turned our attention a little more closer to home. 

As you may know here at Output our key to throwing such off the hook parties has been the consistency of quality underground music. This could not be achieved without the help of our resident's that have pitched in from day dot to make our parties happen.

With June being so far away our feet have started to itch so what better way to fill in the gap than to to throw a Resident's Party!!! 

For this event we've invited our good friend's Curtis Lee from Lustrino & also Felix Abba & Jordan Diston from the Don't Get Lemon crew to come and pitch in with the fun. As always Output residents Kiddo and JJ will flying the flag and need no explanation for what they do. 
 
Special Guest... 

Flighting in from Kyoto, Japan and making his first appearance here in Birmingham we have Jun Akimoto, part of the FUSE London family, to close our party with an exclusive 2 hour set of deep dark dubby techno just the way we like it.

This is a very rare opportunity to see a true mastermind at work as he demonstrate his crazy skillz behind the turntables, unleashing some of the most exclusive underground music on the circuit to date.
https://soundcloud.com/jun-akimoto 

This will be an intense night of music not for the faint hearted but as always set within a friendly laid back environment. Attendance is a must! 

Line-up:

Jun Akimoto (FUSE London)
Kiddo Anderson
Curtis Lee (B'day Set)
JJ Mowbray
Felix Abbà
Jordan Diston

Music Policy: Deep / Techno / Minimal

Entrance : £7 Before 2:30
212781248920992.name: Output / Lustrino / Don't Get Lemon - Residents Party w/ Jun Akimoto (FUSE London)

213519238858989.description:
Liebe Leute,

wir hatten es bereits angekündigt und nun ist es endlich bald soweit:
Aus ganzem Herzen und tiefster Seele laden wir euch zu unserem nächsten BAHUMA Konzert ein! 

Lange haben wir uns "backstage" aufgehalten, doch dabei alles andere als Urlaub gemacht, sondern uns intensivst mit unserer Freundin der Musik auseinandergesetzt. 
Dabei ist die Kombi aus beflügelter INSPIRATION und harter ARBEIT das, was uns und unsere Lieder ausmacht. Wir würden uns WAHNSINNIG freuen, wenn ihr euch selbst davon ein "Gehör machen wollt" und bei unserem Gig live mit dabei seid!
Bereits etablierte Fans werden bei einigen Songs mitsingen und sich über neue Klänge (hoffentlich) erfreuen können!
Neulinge werden fix den einen oder anderen Song für sich entdecken!
SkeptikerInnen sind sowieso auch gerne gesehen, denn wir sind für jede Kritik - solange sie gut begründet werden kann - offen ;)

Für die perfekte Eröffnung dieses Abends haben wir uns sogar Verstärkung geholt: unsere Freundin und Künstlerin Sumi SueMe (schreibt Prosa, Lyrik und neuerdings auch Raptexte) wird uns einige ihrer Werke vortragen!

Also, freut euch auf einen Abend für Herz und Verstand, mit aussagekräftigen Texten, eingängigen Melodien und nem guaden beat & flow ;)

_______________________________________________

"Was ist das? Es ist mehr als das! (...) Das was wir nehmen und geben, das Lied der Ewigkeit in unserm Leben." (BAHUMA)

"Das Wort ist die Krone meiner Seele. Durch sie trinke ich 
jeden Tag vom Fass einer Königin." (SueMe)

_______________________________________________

!!! Freier Eintritt !!!

!!! Whisky Cola und Gin Tonic um 2,60€ !!!
213519238858989.name: Sumi SueMe & BAHUMA live @ London Club

214936408715954.description:
A day of instruction on the Nyungney Practice, the Fasting Ritual of 1000-Armed Chenrezig. The practice is a meditation on 1000-armed Chenrezig, the deity associated with great compassion. Nyungney practice is renowned as a supreme method of purification as well as for the development of loving-kindness and compassion. Through giving up food and drink, we learn to accept discomfort and to pray for those who are suffering the torments of the lower realms.

This practice involves not eating, drinking or speaking on the second day of each pair. On both days, the Sadhana of 1000-armed Chenrezig is recited three times, with each session of practice lasting for approximately two hours and containing chanting, meditation and prostrations.

"The instructions will cover the text and visualisation, and are only open to those who have taken Refuge and have received the Chenrezig Initiation."

When/Where:
18 Apr 2014 to
10:00am to 5:00pm

Suggested contribution: £30.00

*For the courses provided and run by our centre we ask participants to pay a suggested contribution. However concessionary prices are offered for students, pensioners, the unemployed etc. and any lack of funds should not prevent anyone from attending our courses.  For concessions and other questions about prices please call our office on 020 3327 1650 or email us on ksdlondon@samye.org.

215275232015730.description:
Saturday 10th May - 6PM - 8PM, GMT - 
www.Hoxton.FM 

This week State London are thrilled to bring you STARK. STARKfutures. who will be performing LIVE from our new Hoxton FM studio's.. join host Pablo Godofredo for what will be a superb audio experience to blow the mind... 

STARK

"Never following trends always trying create a new feeling and a new vibe, staying with the underground so that there will always be something to be inspired by."
Founder members of the formidable NITZER EBB and champion of their own standout techno sound.
The EBB had many tracks remixed by everyone and their dog, from George Clinton to William Orbit and their unique sound put them way ahead of their game.

More recently, after many months of hard work, David & Simon are very pleased with their releases on Affie Yusuf's Laila Music & also Superfreq, Momo, their remix of Mr C's The Future & their own Velorum EP out currently.

They have also become two thirds of STARKFutures Recordings alongside Paul Fossett with the labels fourth release out May 1st via Beatport.

Their first performance in March 2013 can be rivalled only by very few, also appearing at Superfreq Calais last year  & we look forward to many more in 2014.

Expect a groove of wonky, twisted electronic music and a whole lot more….a live act definately not to be missed.

https://soundcloud.com/davidgooday

Brooklyn-based, Tennessee born and bred Jessi Wade and Tiffany Nicole Clark are partners in crime in their duo Dark Sister. Self proclaimed nü-metal priestesses these girls are spiritual feminists whose music reflects riot grrrl ideals. Their performances are visceral and engaging, while their sound is a blend of hip hop and hardcore breakdowns that mix with occult laced lyrics — creating a cyberpunk band that is bending genres and creating the next wave of grunge.

LOVE AND TAKE OUT: AN EVENING OF ORIGINAL SONGS BY MICHELE BROURMAN
In her first London appearance, singer/songwriter Michele Brourman steps into the spotlight to perform an evening of her own material.  Passionate, funny, and deeply moving, Michele’s songs speak directly to our hearts. Best known for her song “My Favorite Year,” Brourman has created music for theatre, film, television, and the concert stage. Her songs have been recorded by such artists as Michael Feinstein, Amanda McBroom, Margaret Whiting,  Dixie Carter, and even a family of animated dinosaurs in the beloved “Land Before Time” movies.  She is, in the words of Broadway World, “an unquestionably amazing talent whose music should be heard by the whole world.”

★ RANDALL M (tINI & The Gang / Karton)

★ BRETT JACOBS (Solo Danza)

★ CRISTOF (Minival)

★ GANGS OF SEATON (Minival)

★ SUPPER CLUB RESIDENTS (Secret Supper Club)

***********************************************************************
The Electronic Carnival for Freaks rolls into London Town.
***********************************************************************

Over years of Scotland-based residency we've had beach raves, rooftops, converted restaurants, eerie vibes, sunshine, plenty of sand, sun, rain, a phenomenal list of guest DJs, and of course the freaks, clowns and ever growing Mnvl family members that have supported us along this incredible journey. Ladies & Gentlemen, Milfs, Cowboys, Cowgirls, and all sorts of freaks, April 5th will go down as the day Minival finally hits the Big City. 

For this special date we've joint the musical talent of two of our current favourites.. 

:: RANDALL M (tINI & The Gang / KARTON)

Hailing from Miami, as a DJ and producer, Randall M has rapidly gained the support and recognition of some of today's most sought after artists, most notably tINI. After his prodigious Mnvl rooftop set facing the North Sea in 2013, we've been secretly craving for his return to the Minival booth. Expect balls deep house/techno..

https://soundcloud.com/randall-m

:: BRETT JACOBS (Solo Danza)

Brett 's calling came very early on. We can safely say his obsession and talent for electronic music married young and produced a beast of an artist. Many of you are acquainted with East London born and bred, and it is with great anticipation that we look forward to him dishing his signature sound from the booth at 281. 

https://soundcloud.com/brettjacobs

..Obviously supported by our ever-stellar resident crew

CRISTOF 
GANGS OF SEATON

Upstairs in the Paradise Inn Bar, we have the honour of hosting some of Gravesend's finest

SUPPER CLUB RESIDENTS

***********************************************************
The Venue: GROUND 281 (Paradise Inn) : We'll be taking over an intimate East London basement space by the name of Ground 281, which sits under the paradise Inn pub. Reminding us of the various caverns we've used before, we will add a minival touch to this raw underground space that has been recently used by the boiler room. Close to Shoreditch, Hoxton, Dalston. 

281 Kingsland Rd, E28AS

***********************************************************

FULL TICKET INFO SHORTLY. 

***********************************************************

218781648329255.description:
KAUTZRECORDZ & Gross Art IG präsentieren...

Djevara experimental hc punkrock from london, uk
www.djevara.bandcamp.com
GOSHAWK weird jazzy freakkel rock, berlin
www.goshawkberlin.bandcamp.com
Watered deep dark postrock, karlsruhe
www.watered.bandcamp.com

Djevara:
In den letzten 10 Jahren haben die drei Briten ca. 450 Shows in England und ganz Europa gespielt, eine Lieblingsstation ist und bleibt dabei Halle. Djevara haben sbchon sieben mal hier gespielt; davon sechs mal in im Hausprojekt Reil 78. In ihrer Heimat ist die Band für ihr soziales Engagement, Unterstützung von Menschenrechten und dem Kampf gegen Armut bekannt. Die drei sind aktiv, wo es nur geht. Auch dieses Jahr geht es wieder mit poetischen Texte gepaart mit progressivem Hardcore auf Tour, in Halle spielen sie nun erstmalig im Hühnermanhattan.

Watered:
WATERED wurde 2010 als Jam-Projekt, initiiert durch die Faszination an Bands wie This Will Destroy you, gegründet.
Nach ein paar Monaten wurden diese Jams in Songs kanalisiert und die Band spielte 2011 ihre ersten lokalen Shows. Im selben Jahr enterte die Band das Studio, um ihr erstes Album 'To Those Who Will Never Exist' aufzunehmen, welches Ende des Jahres selbstveröffentlicht wurde und viele gute Reviews in diversen Onlinemagazinen erhielt. Das Album enthält eine ausgewogene Mischung aus melodischen, ruhigen und heavy parts und Songs, die manchmal mit elektronischen und -Sprachsamples kombiniert werden.

Goshawk:
Chaotischer instrumentalrock angereichert mit zuckersüßen Melodien ergibt "Dyskalkulepsie"! Eine neues Genre initiiert & inszeniert von Richi Famous an den Drums, Leo Famous am Bass & Norm an der Gitarre. Ein gänzlich unbekanntes aber dafür echt heißes Berliner Trio!
218781648329255.name: DJEVARA london, uk // GOSHAWK berlin // WATERED karlsruhe

219354674924289.description:
Cloud9 are proud to present our opening night at the Garage, London. Giving you the best in the deep and soulful House music through out the night, provided by the leading DJ's form the U.K and worldwide.

DJ SPEN 

Spen began his career at the age of 13, producing mix shows for WEBB AM in Baltimore. Even at that young age, Spen founded one of the area's first hip hop production groups, the Numarx. In 1986 they wrote and recorded a track called "Girl You Know It's True", which was later covered and made famous by Milli Vanilli.

Spen's radio career continued to grow and lead him to a radio career working at various FM radio stations in the Baltimore and Washington areas. In 1992, Spen developed a mixshow on 95.9 FM in Baltimore called the Flashback Saturday Night Dance Party. Though Spen eventually moved on from radio, the show is still a hit today, with Spen's close friend KW Griff at the helm.

Spen's production talents lead him to Basement Boys Records in 1989. With the formation of The Basement Boys record label in 1994, Spen formed Jasper Street Company, and released his first full production, A Feelin. With the Basement Boys and Jasper Street, Spen gained consistent commercial and dancefloor success, and became an in-demand remix producer. He has created remixes for some of clubland's biggest names, such as Diana Ross, Everything but the Girl, Ann Nesby, and Shaun Escoffery. While at Basement Boys, Spen partnered with Teddy Douglas, Thommy Davis and Karizma to create works that are still considered house anthems.

Having reached his full potential with Basement Boys, Spen stepped out on his own and partnered with Gary Deane to form the Code Red Record label in January 2004. He hasn't stopped moving since! Spen is still producing and making records that are sure to become legend. Spen's new venture found him back with former partners Thommy Davis and Karizma creating the successful Voodoo Ray, Nightrain and 4 the Love. Not long after the formation of Code Red, Gary Hudgins and Irvin Madden, key musicians and writers from Basement Boys days, joined Spen and Gary Deane to form a new production team called the MuthaFunkaz whose first release, "The Best I Can" shows a new side of Spen. The Muthafunkaz soon added soulful vocalist Marc Evans to the group. Code Red joined Defected Records for a partnership that would see the release of one of their earliest successes. “The Way You Love Me”, featuring Marc Evans, has gained worldwide attention and become a soulful house anthem. In 2008, the MuthaFunkaz completed production of Marc Evans' full length LP. In addition to the original group, the MuthaFunkaz now includes vocalist Sheila Ford, vocalist Biblical Jones (formerly of Jasper Street Company), drummer Robert Wright, horn player Eric Marner, and vocalist Erin Madden. In October 2010 Code Red will release the MuthaFunkaz LP entitled "The MuthaLode". The first single, "A Reason to Love" has been released and is already burning up dance floors all over the world. True to his roots, Spen formed the Spiritually Sound label, which will be sure to give Spen fans more of the gospel and inspirational house music Spen has become famous for.

With a career span of more than 20 years and his famous studio and production work, Spen has become one of the most sought-after DJs in the U.S. Spen can be found jetting off to gigs at some of the premier clubs around the world. He plays regularly in the UK, as well as France, Italy, Japan, and Australia.

Also In the main room we are excited to have U.K House and Disco legend, JOEY NEGRO who is the most well-known pseudonym of master British DJ/producer/remixer Dave Lee. Under a plethora of other monikers including Jakatta, Akabu, Doug Willis, Raven Maize, The Sunburst Band, Sessomatto, and Z Factor, Dave was one of the first artists to incorporate disco samples in house music when he began his production career in 1988. Indeed, he was in the studio making credible and outstanding British House music when many luminaries around him were still busy getting to grips with their decks. Little has changed since then and Dave is still widely regarded as one of the most commercially successful and in-demand artists on the global scene.

With full support from Rhemi, who have taken the soulful House scene by storm in the last year. Producing top quality music, and working with artist such the likes of Quentin Harris and Lynn Lockamy as well running their own Rhemi Music imprint. Soul heaven / Groove Fest resident Sy Sez will be warming proceedings up on the night to get your dancing feet going for what is going to be a amazing night of music!!

If this wasn't enough already, we have a very special Dj/Producer flying in from Balitmore,USA for an exclusive performance on the night. Full details will be announced on 30th of March.

Upstairs we take things a little deeper with some of London's most renowned underground Dj's in the form of Rap Saunders from the legendary London night Soulmates, Jamesey from Making Moves,Leon Paul of Nyumba Deep and last but not least Shaun Ashby and Joshua Allen from Fused Records.

220276478182191.description:
Hi all,

As many of you already know, on Sunday 13th April (next weekend) I'll be running the London Marathon.

Training started back in November and was all going swimmingly until 8 weeks ago when I picked up a knee injury.

I've managed to fumble my way through training over these final 8 weeks and I'm pleased to say that I'll still be lining up at the start line. My ability to achieve the time I want has probably gone but I'm determined to get around the 26.2 mile course regardless.

I'm raising money for Asthma UK so if you'd like to sponsor me for this gruelling challenge you can do so at the following link:

http://uk.virginmoneygiving.com/MarkMayor

Alternatively, if you'd prefer to do it the old fashioned way with a pen & paper I have a sponsorship form so just get in touch with me and we can sort it out.

The London Marathon is always one of the best days out in London and this year it doesn't look like being any different with Mo Farah running his first marathon and the weather currently forecast at 15 degrees and sunny. It'd be great to see as many of you there as possible whether you're supporting or abusing me. The below attachment takes you to a Spectators Guide showing you the route. It also gives some more info about each section of the course as well as the pubs en route.

http://static.london-marathon.co.uk/uploads/marathon-centre/2014-online-spec-guide.pdf

I'm heading to the expo on Thursday to pick up my number etc so let me know if you intend to come and watch on Sunday and I'll pick up a route map and drop it over to you. I'll also make up a little pace guide so you'll have a good idea of the exact time that I'll be passing each mile marker. On race day the London Marathon website will also have a tracker button meaning you'll be able to see my progress. If you do come along on the day, the best thing to do will be to text me where you are on the course (between miles x & y) and what side of the road you will be on to me. That way I'll be able to work my way over towards that side of the road to give you the best chance of spotting me and me seeing you!

I'm thinking about heading for a celebratory drink in and around Fenchurch St after I've finished so would be great to see you and thank you for your support. Let me know if you're interested in doing that and I'll arrange something.

If you have any questions don't hesitate in firing them across to me. Thanks for all of your support!!

Much love,

Mark/Biscuit/MJ
xx
220276478182191.name: Mark/Biscuit/MJ is running the London Marathon

220930021449943.description:
dəprɛʃ dəprɛst

Students from the Slade School of Fine Art will once again take up residence at the UCL Rock Room for a single day of intervention.

The project explores exhibition making, the materiality and organisation of space, as well as the fantasies surrounding the respective disciplines.

These may or may not include non-rational geology, tacit knowledge, social haptics and the composition of technology, studio versus laboratory as well as ðə fri ple əv ɪts ɔl əbawt spes.

The project this year has included excursions through a series of UCL Earth Sciences labs and to places such as Fracture Mechanics, Vibration and Cold Rooms, as well as the UCL Mullard Space Science Laboratory in Surrey.

Slade at Rock Room

Friday 9th May 2014

1 - 5 pm open to the public

3 pm discussion


UCL Geology Collections
Rock Room, 1st Floor South Wing
Gower Street, London W1E 6BT
geocoll@ucl.ac.uk
www.ucl.ac.uk/museums
220930021449943.location: UCL Geology Collections Rock Room, 1st Floor South Wing Gower Street, London W1E 6BT
220930021449943.name: dəprɛʃ dəprɛst: Slade at Rock Room

CROSSFIRE started back in 2001 bringing together all the different elements of the London 60s scene for a big night of pure vintage underground partying.

In the main ballroom with huge wooden dancefloor the history of NORTHERN SOUL hosted by Kent Records and 6TS promoter and DJ Ady Croasdell. Expect the classiest Northern oldies from the Twisted Wheel, The Torch, Wigan Casino, Stafford & The 100 Club from top jocks Ginger Taylor, Mick H, Mick Smith and Chris Dale joining Harboro Horace.

The R&B ROOM is hosted by MOUSETRAP allnighter Special guest DJ's Callum Simpson & Alan Handscombe join the resident Chris Dale, Lee Miller & Rob Bailey with authentic Rhythm and Blues, Ska/Reggae and Club Soul on the menu. 

The BEAT BASEMENT with resident DJ Dr Robert (Le Beat Bespoke) and International guests spin the primest 60’s Beat, Garage, Psych committed to vinyl. Expect maximum fun, gorgeous go-go girls to a backdrop of kaleidoscopic visuals and the best live acts. 

Adm £12 in advance https://ishportal.org.uk/StarRezPortalEventTicketing/Default.aspx?Params=L9ezxPcQnQvPF6HX%2bWhPkPJMQLof0AJms%2b%2f7bqyGkkQ%3d

223189054558313.description:
A PEACEFUL TAKEOVER OF PLACES THAT ARE ALREADY OURS!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ladies and Gentlemen, I would like to introduce you to London’s hottest new poetry venue, the 242 bus.

On Wednesday 4th of June, The Freewheelin’ Troubadour and Prowl House invite you to ‘Bus Da Rhymes’, a completely new concept which is taking spoken word poetry back to the streets.

ROUND 1: A Circle is Drawn (7pm-8pm)

We begin in Hackney Central, (at the fancy, unused bus stop opposite Marks & Spencer) where a circle is drawn on the floor. This is the open mic spot where you can hear words of wisdom from minds both local and intergalactic, delivered live and unplugged, or better yet, relieve yourself of that albatross around your neck and let your poetic soul FLY!

OUTBOUND: All Aboard (8pm-9pm)

Our onward journey starts around the corner (bus stop T), where we will board the 242 bus at 8pm sharp and take over the top deck. Seated amongst you will be numerous featured poets, who will go back to back whilst you simply sit and let the brainwaves wash over you. A sign will be placed on the front window for those who'd like to board later down the line.

ROUND 2: The Last Stand (9pm onwards)

For the culmination of our evening we will congregate on the street at a sweet spot a short walk from Tottenham Court Road, a second circle will be drawn and the platform to perform will once again be yours.

The poets who get the best response will receive future featured slots and opportunities to be published in Prowl Magazine and on-line.

PRICE:
1 swipe of your Oyster.

The event will be free, but we will be accepting donations to split between the featured poets for travel expenses etc, so if you have a few quid then spare a few quid, and if you don’t then don’t.

THIS MONTH’S FEATURED POETS:

David Lee Morgan:
We are incredibly excited to welcome the incredible genius of this soulful and zany man amongst us fellow riders. Expect Science, Love, Revolution and prepare your mind for a spin around our city, country, world as his stories are told.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XizIs7IzlZ0

Jah-Mir Early:
Have you ever heard someone talk in such eloquent and stylish way you think they can ONLY be a poet? Well in this case it is true. Our very finest 'Freestyle Talker' and freewheelin' moonwalker will take you backwards through his soul and into yours with words that are as new to him as they are to you. It will be beautiful, guaranteed.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g4VCvSEnakc

Nat Nye:
On point and direct, but with more heart than a Carebear, Nat Nye can make you laugh, cry, shout and sigh with his social commentary that sets the world to rights.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jJyB9RNSy2E

Bathos City:
This months musical interlude will be provided by funky visionary Guy Trinder's latest outfit. Music so fresh and so clean that even Andre 3000 and I are yet to be blessed with it's aural pleasure.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

The above will be joined by THE USUAL SUSPECTS, who include:

The Freewheelin’ Troubadour:
Pyschedelic punk poet with his own friendly blend of social commentary, tales of freedom and pro-protest protesting.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZV6YmPJWcJc

Max Quinn:
Streets disciple Max Quinn will take you on a journey through London and beyond with his heavy slices of introspective lyrical mastery.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1iF3qfMmilg

Lisa Luxx:
Cunning linguist and Predator in Chief of Prowl House, Lisa Luxx bares her soul and more, as she romances your mind with loving words that linger long after she’s gone.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h7M3ndD7iz4

Jake Higgins:
The boy is like an inverted lighthouse, you cannot help but drift towards his words which shine out like a beacon across the sea.

https://vimeo.com/87780407

Jason Pilley:
Mad as a bag of cats and twice as likely to make you purr, this Tasmanian Devil will spin you into a frenzy of thoughts and feelings.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jg5y-AU21Oo

WOO HA.
223189054558313.name: The Freewheelin' Troubadour presents BUS DA RHYMES #3. Route 242. Poets In Public Places + OPEN MIC

Nerd Rage

140 Palmetto St Destin, FL 32541

18+ to Party 21+ to Drink // Doors Open @ 9PM

Pre-Sales Hardcopy $10 limited to 100 will sell out!
(Available at venue and from our street team)

General Admission $20 (All You Can Drink)

Nerd Rage - Tampa, FL (Subhuman / Ultragore)

FB
https://www.facebook.com/NerdRage.music

SoundCloud
https://soundcloud.com/nerdrage

Nerd Rage's music, hand-in-hand with his stage presence, is loud, aggressive, and right in your face. Never taking himself too seriously, Nerd Rage continues to deliver good vibes whether he’s behind the decks or in front of his computer. The phenom has developed some serious production skills as well as respect throughout the Bass Music community since exploding onto the scene last year, and demonstrates his progress every step of the way.

Nerd Rage has quickly risen to the top of the heap beginning with his first single, "Real Life," hiting top 10 on the Beatport charts. One of the tracks was also featured at number one on Beatport's "Top 10 Must Hear Dubstep Tracks."

Korn Frontman Jonathan Davis also listed the track, “Dark Crystal,” as one of his top 5 favorite EDM songs for Revolver Magazine.

His tunes can now be heard on dancefloors and radio around the world, with top DJs such as Terravita, Dirtyphonics, Evol Intent, Pendulum, Excision, Funtcase, Datsik, Downlink, SKisM, Bare, and Dieselboy playing his musical creations.

Supporting Talent (Alphabetical Order)

EyEnI Bryon Logan

Simply Butta Todd Simplybutta Keith
Type R Ryan Type R

10k Lumens of front and rear projection mapping

224145747793783.description:
No pop, no commercial dance. Just cutting-edge house music.

*Please note that WRONG! is a mixed gay/straight party. Be nice or you won't get in. We're being strict on this*

The party that everyone talked about through 2013, that transformed Saturday morning clubbing in Vauxhall, WRONG! has built its reputation as Vauxhall's biggest, busiest, best Saturday morning afterhours party on the firm foundations of our friendly welcoming crowd and cutting-edge tech house.

Always the friendliest welcome in Vauxhall (it's more like a family!), our established team of hosts are always on hand to welcome you on arrival: Robbie, Andy and Luis!

We open 2:30am Saturday morning and close around 1pm - often later!

£7 with a flyer, MOTD, ROAR. Get there early to avoid the queue.

The WRONG! residents this week:

Steven Sharp
Jamie de Rooy
Thomas Wonderland
Enrico Chirchiello

About our DJs:

STEVEN SHARP
With literally hundreds of productions and remixes under his belt as part of the Sharp Boys, and a good couple of decades tearing up the dancefloors, Steven Sharp has been at the forefront of the house music scene for a long time. He's promoted some of London's biggest parties, and played some of the world's biggest. Steven joined us as our new resident in January 2013 to play a great underground tech house set.
http://www.mixcloud.com/WRONG_Club/steven-sharp-at-wrong-17-august-2013/


JAMIE DE ROOY
Jamie de Rooy has for the past few years been bringing the London sound to Spain through his twice-weekly peak-hour mix show through Barcelona's premier dance music radio station, Styl FM. Jamie's supercharged tech house sets rock WRONG's parties, and will bring you up and then keep you on a peak til you can't dance anymore.
http://www.mixcloud.com/jamiederooy/

THOMAS WONDERLAND
Thomas is Wrong's Corsican import, and he's been partying since he was 13. Ibiza, Spain, London, France, Thailand, Goa - his travels have informed his music. WRONG! was one of the first club nights Thomas played, and we're delighted to have secured him as one of our forward-thinking residents.
https://soundcloud.com/thomas-wonderland

ENRICO CHIRCHIELLO
Enrico was born in Montreal, Canada in 1992 and moved to Italy at the age of 7. As a young boy he was already passionate about music and by the age of 13 he started DJing with turntables in small local clubs. Enrico has always been influeced and inspired by South American sounds. The style of music he DJs is predominantly Techno House. In 2011 he, with close friend Luca Donofrio, created a dual-owned record label called Mad System Brothers. That same year the two decided to move to London, for better opportunities, to meet new people and play in big clubs. In his endeavour to promote his DJing style and music, he has been resident at, and played in, a number of clubs in London. As his latest venture, Enrico has created and run his own events organisation called Last Drop, where he involves guest DJs and invites friends for a night of good music with a great ambiance. He has released tracks on labels like: Mr Ambrose Recordings, Finish Team Record, Housebeat Record, Black Eye Records, Jintonik Records, WOD Limited, Code2 Records, Beach Music Records, Celestial Recordings.
https://soundcloud.com/enrico-chirchiello
224145747793783.name: WRONG! London's biggest, busiest and best Saturday morning afterhours!

شاركو معنا في بطولة العالم للمبدعين العرب ٢٠١٤
الجدول الزمني لبطولة العالم للمبدعين العرب في لندن 2014
لا يزال الوقت متاحاً للإشتراك في بطولة العالم للمبدعين, المنتجين و المخترعين العرب 2014 المقرر عقدها في لندن هذا الصيف. تقبل جميع الإختصاصات.
موعد التقديم على الفيزا: إبتداءً من نهاية الشهر الخامس أيار (مايو) ٢٠١٤
أخر موعد لدخول المسابقة هو: يوم الأحد ١٥ حزيران (يونيو/يونية) ٢٠١٤
أخر موعد للتصويت هو: يوم الإثنين ٣٠ حزيران (يونيو/يونية) ٢٠١٤ في الساعة العاشرة مساءَ بتوقيت لندن.
موعد السفر إلى لندن هو ٣ أيام قبل موعد الحفل الختامي.
الحفل الختامي سيكون في فندق الهلتون متروبول في مدينة لندن يوم السبت ٣٠ آب (أغسطس) ٢٠١٤
ستعلن نتيجة الفائزين و الفائزات في نفس ليلة الحفل الختامي و في آخر كل عرض..
موعد السفر إلى بلدك الأم هو ٣ أيام بعد الحفل الختامي.
إذا كنت مبدعاً, مخترعاً, مبتكراَ, رجل أعمال منتج أو ماهراَ في أي مجال من المجالات (علوم, رياضة, تجارة, طب, هندسة, فن, موسيقا, غناء.....) أو إذا كنت تعرف شخصاَ ما, نريد أن نسمع منك. لا تتردد / تترددين في الإتصال معنا.
للإشتراك الرجاء إرسال رسالة للصفحة التالية:
https://www.facebook.com/thearabsgroup
يمكنكم أيضاً الإتصال معنا عبر الأرقام: ٠٠٤٤٧٥٣٥٠٣٣٠٢٢ / ٠٠٤٤٧٩٧٥٨٠٠٨١٩ / ٠٠٤٤٢٠٣٥٥٦٧٦٧٤ 
أو إيميل: info@thearabsgroup.com
مع التمنيات لكل المشاركين والمشاركات بالتوفيق والنجاح.

What better way to remember the Saviour than by taking a trip to his Holy Temple!                     

EVENTS INCLUDE:                         

YSA PICNIC: 12:00-1:15pm (food & refreshments provided so come hungry & ready to feast!)

DEVOTIONAL: 1:30pm at the Visitors Centre with Elder & Sister Pinegar

BAPTISMS: 2:45pm to meet at Temple Baptistery for temple babtism ordinances (remember to bring/get your temple recomend from your bishops.)

OR you may choose to TOUR THE beautifull TEMPLE GROUNDS or watch a moovie at the Visitors Centre :)

5:00pm- Return to London

If your not in the Peckam ward, speak to you individual bishops so that a lift can be organised for you & ysa's in your wards that plan on attending.)

HOPE TO SEE YOU ALL THERE :)

225502614318907.description:
TICKETS NOW AVAILABLE FOR rare UK cinema premiere of Caribbean film.

"Keeping Up With The Joneses: The Movie" 
 - based on the popular TV series from Barbados.

London screening 6pm on 27 March 2014 at the Picturehouse Cinema in Stratford.

TICKET PRICES : 
  ADULTS - £6.50
  STUDENTS - £5.00
  RETIREES (60+)  - £5.00
                
Online tickets via http://bit.ly/1hZIFyB 
Phone 08719-025740 or 
Visit the cinema box office in person between 1pm and 9pm at Salway Road, E15 1BX (next to the Theatre Royal).

Including all your favourite characters from the TV series, "KUWTJ: The Movie" is centred around the fictional Jones family (father Irving, mother Angela, daughter Tracy and son Nathan) who became famous after featuring in a TV reality show. Life is going well but when the Joneses are kidnapped at a family picnic, all seems to be lost. But hope is at hand when Angela's brother and three of his friends from a local institution go on a mission to save them.
 
This comedy-thriller is well scripted and sympathetically portrayed - thrills and laughs abound!

This will be the first cinema premiere of a Caribbean film in the UK for 2014 and the first British official cinema screening of a full feature film from Barbados ever!

See the trailer for the film: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rLfHpfODB9M

See the audience reaction: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YmNOinl19kk

More info here: www.sankofa-tv.co.uk
225502614318907.name: London Screening of Keeping Up with the Jones (The Movie)

If Kurt Cobain taught me anything, it's that angst makes you interesting, and everything worked out just great for that dude, so...
What was I even talking about?
OH I KNOW! IT'S THIS GODDAMNED HILARIOUS COMEDY SHOW THAT YOU SHOULD GO TO FOR FUCK'S SAKE
SOME FUNNY BUTTQUEERS FROM SEATTLE ARE COMING DOWN TO MAKE SURE THAT EVEN THOUGH THERE ARE THINGS IN LIFE THAT ARE STUPID AND ANNOYING, YOU WILL FORGET ABOUT THEM FOR 90 WONDERFUL MINUTES.

IT'S A GIRL THING!

Cuban Salsa workshop for women only @ the Place Dance Studios

Join highly acclaimed dance teacher Susan Hacking this Saturday (12th April) for ‘It’s A Girl Thing’ a very special workshop for women only, exploring Cuban movement and musicality (for all levels), including:

SOLTURA
connecting footwork to hip, torso, arm & shoulder movement to give you that
effortless, expressive, coordinated dance style in turn patterns, partner hold and when improvising

DESPOELOTE & SALSA SUELTA
body isolations and spinal movements to make your winding and grinding come from deep inside
footwork variations to give your salsa extra sabor and flair
so you're never short of inspiration when your partner lets you go to dance solo

RITMO CUBANO
salsa with rumba, son, mambo, cha cha cha, reggaeton & Afro-Cuban to help you respond to the music more and interpret rhythm changes

Wherever you've got to with salsa, this workshop will help you gain confidence & enjoy your dancing more.

2pm- 4.30pm Saturday 12th April 2014

Price: £17 (no need to book, just turn up on the day)

The Place 16 Flaxman Terrace London WC1 (Kings Cross/Euston stations)

* please bring a change of shoes or trainers (indoor only with non-marking soles) to wear in the studio*

Our special guests, LOVERDOSE are rapidly establishing themselves internationally as great electronic music producers. Both these artists, Gepy & Levan aka LOVERDOSE have over 10 years experience in producing and playing all around the world: Ibiza, Tokyo, Moscow, Rome, Kiev and all main London clubs. Everything started casually after a cool Boat Party on the Thames. After a few studio Sessions, they both realised that as a Duo they have a unique Sound, so LOVERDOSE was born during the Summer of 2011. Their first release “Tabula Rasa” instantly became a classic of electronic music with support from music lovers around the World and more than a million hits on Youtube.

Their Back to Back partner on the night is our good friend, producer and the member of multiple record labels around US and UK, representative of ReSolute Label - JOE LE GROOVE, experience and solid style of play, Groove is not only is in his name, it's everything about his style of play and producing the music. The latest collaboration with international DJ and producer tINI has brought them to the top 10 chart positions of the Tech House Music on Beatport. London Irish have teamed up with Nando's and RUSU (Reading University Student's Union) to put on this fantastic Student Event. 

For JUST £10 Students get a ticket to London Irish's biggest game of the Season AND a free Nando's combination meal before the game!

From 1pm our whole car park is transformed into our St Patrick's Village with entertainment, bars, a DJ performing and live Irish music. This continues right up until kick off at 5.30pm when London Irish take on Bath. The party then continues after the game with the Village open until 9pm.

One of the best things about London nightlife is the big boat party! Party hard while whilst taking in the amazing sights of London that can only be seen the Thames! Paul Thomas: a biography / TOOLROOM
The last five years has seen the UK house music scene storm the world like never before, with a vanguard of talented new DJs and producers who have welded the traditional sound with techno, progressive, trance and electro influences in explosive fashion. Their time is now, and Paul Thomas is amongst this new wave’s brightest stars.
Paul’s big break was landing a residency at Birmingham’s Godkitchen and their globally-syndicated Global Gathering festivals half a decade back; a dream foundation for any aspiring DJ to build their career on. From here on his destiny as a DJ was inevitable, with global tours and critically-acclaimed compilations for the brand and for Toolroom Records’ burgeoning Leaders Of The New School imprint all soon in the bag.

While many successful jocks may have been content to rest on their laurels and perhaps release the occasional track, Thomas has been both prolific and hugely consistent over the past few years, establishing himself as a serious production force who blends those aforementioned styles to epic effect. His focus is squarely on the big room and on bringing his different influences together within one track, perfectly representing the different genres that are at the core of the brand that helped to bring him to prominence.
“I put a lot of the success down to the productions. It took me quite a while to find my sound, and I would say I've only done so in the past year or so. Since then, with the success of tracks like 'Tomorrow' & 'Ultraviolet', more and more doors have opened. Now I'm remixing the likes of Gareth Emery, Sander van Doorn and Paul Oakenfold - artists I would never have been involved with if it wasn't for the tracks I've been making.”

This is made all the more clear when you take a look at the impressive and varied list of labels he’s had track signed to: Steve Angello’s SIZE Records, Positiva, Data, Toolroom Records, Doorn Records, Sander Kleinenberg’s Little Mountain Recordings, Ultra, Baroque Records, Gareth Emery’s Garuda, Hotfingers, Spinnin’ Records, 303lovers...the list goes on and on. His golden remix touch has been requested for releases by legends like Basement Jaxx, Chicane, Underworld, Josh Wink, D Ramirez & Mark Knight, Sebastien Leger & Deadmau5, and he’s collaborated with Knight, Funkagenda, Jerome Isma-Ae and Manuel De La Mare amongst others..

He’s firmly established himself as a leading name in the wider sphere of house music across the globe thanks to all this, and the small matter of 9 separate Beatport genre Top 10 successes. His Ultraviolet track in Toolroom hit the No.1 spot in the Progressive Chart (as did other singles Tomorrow and Sunrise), and No. 5 on the overall sales chart, while remixes and collaborations with Sander Van Doorn, Funkagenda, Gareth Emery, Weekend Heroes & Ticon, Serge Devant, Jerome Isma-Ae, Kim Fai and Manuel De La Mare are all upcoming.

“I guess I have gone back to my melodic roots over the past 12 months, making tracks with melodies and big chords, while keeping the beats and bass quite techy and rolling. It seems to have worked well, as I have a lot of cross-genre support, from Van Dyk, Sander van Doorn and Gareth Emery, to Mark Knight, Funkagenda and Steve Angello. But generally I'm just making tracks that I love and that fit into my sets.”

With continual touring across the world with GlobalGathering and a relentless studio diary to attend to, his name continues to rise up the ranks of the international dance music scene. His wide-appealing sound and die-hard work ethic will ensure that his name is one you’ll be hearing even more of over the next few years.

For info and press 07546 929786
Email : alistjohn@gmail.com

228742303975552.description:
Lock N Load Events present
BEDROCK
Easter Thursday 17th April
Fire & Lightbox, London
http://www.bedrock.org.uk
http://www.johndigweed.com

FIRE:
John Digweed (6 hour set)
Ripperton

LIGHTBOX:
Gregor Tresher (OFFICIAL)
Harvey McKay
Darren Emerson
Eagles & Butterflies

PROTOCOL: Subculture
Dubspeeka
Blue Amazon
Matt Tanner & Grant Nichols
Neil Browne 

CLICK HERE FOR TICKETS:
http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?559065&p=bedrockeaster

Having enjoyed a storming start to 2014 with a sold out event at Shoreditch’s Village Underground, John Digweed’s Bedrock returns to London for the imprint’s traditional Easter celebrations on Thursday 17th April. Taking place at the subterranean hideout that is Vauxhall’s Fire & Lightbox, Bedrock will showcase three rooms of house and techno. With some of the scenes most exciting players showcased in the Capital over the past fifteen years, Bedrock will again leave no stone unturned and deliver a forward-thinking line-up which encapsulates a wide spectrum of sounds.

At Easter Bedrock John Digweed will deliver another timeless journey through his trademark beats via an extended six hour main room set alongside some very special guests. This bespoke collection of artists are either signed to Bedrock Records or long time favourites of John and all will reflect the imprints underground ethos. This will be John’s second visit to the Capital this year following the sold out Village Underground event. His headline performance at Bedrock is the ideal platform through which to see this master at work and is certainly not to be missed.

As one of house music’s finest producers, we are delighted to welcome Ripperton to Bedrock for the very first time. Firmly established as a true ambassador of dark and melodic beats, Ripperton’s most recent studio output has been in the form of his second album ‘A Little Part Of Shade’, three track EP ‘77’ and a Robert Babicz remix. The immersive techno and refined house prevalent in these productions have proven hugely popular in his sets at Europe’s seminal nightclubs and it’s with great excitement that we look forward to Ripperton’s Bedrock debut.  

In the Lightbox Bedrock welcomes one of the most sought after female DJs currently residing on the house circuit, the magnificent Kim Ann-Foxman. Having built a globetrotting schedule from her own DJ and production pursuits, Kim can be found touring the world’s finest clubs and festivals. Her sound boasts intense and chunky grooves placed on top of raw and directive basslines as evident in her recent collaborations with Maya Jane Coles and KiNK. Having delivered standout performances at The Warehouse Project and Fabric, we welcome the Big Apple’s finest to Bedrock as she intoxicates the Lightbox with her infectious sounds.

Kim will be joined by one of electronic music’s hottest prospects, Harvey Mckay. Harvey is a name that has continued to rise thanks to a reputation for one-off originals, killer remixes and energetic DJ sets. His powerful productions have been released on labels including Drumcode, Bedrock, Soma, Saved and Cocoon, with his ‘Lost’ EP continuing to dominate Beatport’s techno chart three months after its release. With his new EP ‘Illusion of Control’ set to have a similar impact, Harvey’s debut performance at Bedrock is set to be a true highlight on Thursday 17th April.

As one of the most influential figures dance music has ever seen, Darren Emerson’s history has been well documented; a former member of Underworld and producer of one of the greatest tracks ever in 'Born Slippy', he also captured the public’s imaginations with dancefloor anthem 'Scorchio' (with Sasha) plus unforgettable remixes for The Chemical Brothers and Björk. More recently, Emerson’s debut Bedrock release ‘Hotdog’ and EP on Hotflush (as ‘The White Lamp’) has caused huge waves. Joining us off the back of a Japanese Tour as well as performances in India, Australia and Argentina, Bedrock please welcome Darren Emerson. 

Also playing the Lightbox following his outstanding performance at the fifteenth anniversary party, is one of 2013’s breakthrough artists Eagles & Butterflies. Since emerging onto the scene, E&B has come a long way in establishing himself. Having gained significant interest by spinning at Space Ibiza’s Clandestin party throughout last summer, Eagles & Butterflies’ latest studio offering, the ‘SYW003’ EP will be released on his own imprint, Spread Your Wings. Joining us ahead of the release of his debut artist album, ‘The Butterfly Effect’, Eagles & Butterflies completes the Lightbox lineup brilliantly, thanks to his forward-thinking track selection and superb technical ability. 

Elusive Bristol based producer Dubspeeka, who recently debuted on Oliver Huntemann's Ideal Audio label, headlines the Protocol room hosted by Subculture. Having impressed with an array of releases over the past twelve months, on labels such as Bedrock, Truesoul, Hope and on his very own Skeleton imprint, he's now focussed on exploring the full spectrum of electronic music under his Dubspeeka alias. Exciting many of the underground's elite over the last year with his distinctive sound, his tunes are driven by the heaviest of basslines and kick-drums, plus a dark and industrial edge.

Completing the bill for Bedrock’s Easter showcase is Blue Amazon. His direct approach to mixing allows him to dive deep into the realms of tech house and techno to energize and stimulate the crowd. Blue Amazon’s performances are always seamless, building dynamically from melodic basslines to high-energy techno beats. Having originally developed from his hip-hop based roots, Blue Amazon’s technical ability to manipulate effects, loops and everything in between is second to none and has been evident in his previous sets alongside the likes of John Digweed, Sasha and Danny Howells to name a few.

Fire, South Lambeth Road, London, SW8 1RT
Open from 10.00pm – 7.00am
Fully licensed bar until close
Nearest Tube: Vauxhall (Victoria Line)

NIKITA's London Calling (Chapter 4 of 7) featuring:

JENO

JENO (Wicked, Enter the Void)
www.soundcloud.com/jenovoid
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/jeno
www.facebook.com/jenovoid

Fueled by an enigmatic nature, DJ Jenö has remained one of San Francisco’s most beloved and sought after DJs for over two decades. Developing a passionate love for music from an early age he spent several years as a punk musician & songwriter, before discovering djing and falling into the vibrant London warehouse party scene of the mid 80s. Once Acid House fever hit the UK, Jenö never looked back, becoming known for his heady Whoosh parties, and his involvement in the early days of the notorious Tonka Sound System.

Inspired by Tonka's cheeky f**k the rules attitude, and in search of a more psychedelic groove, Jenö, along with his British cohorts Garth, Markie & Thomas headed to San Francisco in the early 90s. This was the beginning of the now world renowned Wicked Crew, who were instrumental in firing up the SF dance music scene with their now legendary “Full Moon” parties. These wild & free outdoor gatherings were the foundation for an eclectic and soulful underground dance scene, and the driving force of the growing rave community on the West Coast.

By the mid 90s, Jenö‘s musical talents and commitment to the dance floor had helped inspire and define a new “San Francisco sound,” bringing international attention to the city's burgeoning dance music scene. With all eyes on San Francisco, DMC sought out Jenö’s talents for a mix on their prestigious CD series “United DJs of America.” Joining the ranks of legends Frankie Knuckles, David Morales, Little Louie Vega and Doc Martin, he put together a mix of fresh local music and classic house sounds that helped put San Francisco firmly on the dance music map.

In 1995, he and the Wicked Crew took things to the next level, importing a custom made Tony Andrews designed Turbosound system from the UK. With Wicked very much in demand there was nothing else to do but hit the road, piling into a beautifully restored 1947 Grayhound bus with their own band of merry pranksters, delivering their soulful psychedelic sounds with a rock'n'roll attitude that took the U.S by storm. The touring continued through the late 90s, including some unforgettable stops at Burning Man, Reggae on the River, and even a Jane's Addiction concert in 2001.

As the new millennium approached, Jenö took his talents to the studio and began producing his own unique take on dance music. He met all expectations with several remixes on fellow Wicked DJ Garth's Greyhound label, including the internationally acclaimed “Stormy Weather” remix of Rocket’s “People." This was followed by remixes on Cheeky, Turnaround Sound, NRK & others. Jenö’s production talents aren’t limited to the dance floor, having worked on some dark brooding indie music in recent years, and currently producing live acid house for his monthly "Cult of the Acid House" party.

In 2004, Wicked disbanded after 13 years of amazing collaboration. Undeterred Jenö and Garth have kept the spirit alive with their regular Back2Back appearances up and down the West Coast; a fun loving and boundary pushing musical romp through the last 40 years of dance music.

In 2011, Wicked reformed with a “Twenty Years of Disco Glory,” reunion tour encompassing 13 cities across the country. The success of the tour has put a vital missing piece back into the global dance community, and a newly inspired Wicked will be hitting the road again in 2012 and beyond.

Jenö’s mythical mixing talents have translated far and wide with a diverse international cult following. He has demonstrated these talents on the decks in the premier clubs across the globe, including the legendary Twilo in NYC, The End, Fabric & Ministry of Sound in London, Unit in Tokyo and the Rex Club in Paris. Jenö continues to perform & present music with a unique and psychedelic perspective, djing regularly again across the US, as well as hosting his own musically mischievous cult radio show - Noise from the Void, every Tuesday night at 90hz.org.

///

JOSHUA IZ (Vizual Records, Iz & Diz | Chicago)
www.joshuaiz.com
www.soundcloud.com/joshuaiz
www.residentadvisor.net/dj/joshuaiz
www.izanddiz.com
www.facebook.com/joshuaiz1

Joshua Iz is a dj, producer, designer and writer based in Chicago. Although known and respected worldwide in the house music community, Joshua listens to, produces and djs a wide range of music: from house, disco, hip-hop, jazz, funk, and rock, to brazilian, dub, techno and everything in between. He has been djing for 24 years and has over 200 production credits to his name for well respected labels including Prescription, Balance, Classic, Junior Boys Own, OM and Guidance, Sony, and Six Degrees. Joshua's music has been played and charted by Giles Peterson, Mark Farina, François K, Derrick Carter, King Britt and Jason Bentley to name a few. Recording under many pseudonyms including: Joshua, Circulation, J-Boom, C++, Free Energy, Stereo People, Dubwise and as Iz of Iz & Diz, his music and djing have brought him around the world, with residencies at Fabric (London), Bionic (San Francisco) and regular gigs all over the US, Canada, Europe and the far east. Joshua runs his own label Vizual Records which launched in 2009 and his debut album 'It Iz What It Iz' was released in early 2011 to widespread critical acclaim.

With well over 200 releases bearing his name, Joshua’s production and remix work is respected and in demand worldwide. Operating under many guises, including Stereo People, Free Energy, C++, Dubwise, and J-Boom, Joshua has drawn on his many musical influences to create a sound all his own, yet never formulaic. Recently he has recorded projects and remixes for labels such as Columbia/Sony, Junior Boys Own, Ubiquity, OM, Classic, Developed, Nightshift, Seasons and NRK as well as original material for his own Vizual Records imprint. Check out Joshua’s extensive discography here: http://www.discogs.com/search?q=Joshua+Iz&type=all&btn=Search 

As Iz & Diz, Joshua and Diz have developed their own signature sound and playing style. Their studio sessions can only be described as magic, culminating in the release of seminal cuts like “Mouth” (Classic) and
“Magnificent” (OM), as well as the recently released “Juventated” on Vizual Records. While djing, the duo complement each other perfectly, with each adding their own flavor to the mix.

Joshua’s dj philosophy is simple: play amazing music and make people dance. And he does this in a unique way - mixing house, techno, dub and disco to create a perfect blend of the organic and electronic that always rocks the party.

229495130591988.description:
The London Cabaret Society is dedicated to showcasing the very best in cabaret, circus and neo burlesque in the historic Cafe de Paris, London’s most famous cabaret stage. Exploring the darker side of the arts expect to be challenged and entertained by some of the world’s most daring performers. Once initiated into the society its patrons will wine and dine to the unexpected, the awe inspiring, the seductive and the downright hilarious. Join us if you dare!

We look forward to hosting you at Cafe de Paris, London’s most famous Cabaret, home to the great, the good, and the not so good, since 1924.

‘General Admission’ gives access to the mezzanine. Upon the mezzanine there is waitress service, a bar, and seating on a first come first serve basis. The views of the show are excellent from this elevated position.

‘2 & 3 Course Dining’ are on the ballroom floor. We will send you the menu by email after you have
purchased your tickets and ask you to pre order your food for the evening.

‘VIP Dining’ is available on the top tables and includes a glass of champagne on arrival. We will send you the menu by email after you have purchased your tickets and ask you to pre order your food for the evening.

 

Doors open at 19:00. Diners must be seated by 19:30. Show commences at 20:30 and finishes around 22:30.

All dining at Cafe de Paris is on shared cabaret tables.

As you approach the door of Cafe de Paris on the bustling pavement of Coventry Street you will be greeted by our friendly door staff. They will direct you down the staircase to meet our glamorous hosts who will check you and your party in. You will need to bring evidence of your purchased tickets and some identification. You will be invited to leave your coats and bags in our complimentary cloakroom, after which you will be walked through into the world famous ‘Titanic Ballroom’.

‘General Admission’ guests will be guided round onto the mezzanine. Dining guests will be shown down the sweeping staircases to your reserved seating. When comfortable our waiting staff will introduce themselves and attend to you throughout the show.

When the show has finished all cabaret guests are invited to join the cast and crew in our VIP room. The tables are cleared from the ballroom floor and the club night will begin. All cabaret guests are encouraged to enjoy the atmosphere of this iconic venue until 3am. Drinking tables are available on the mezzanine after 10:15pm subject to minimum spend and availability.

Licensed minicabs are available from our foyer upon exit.

Further information on your night please call 0207 734 7700

229895480541565.description:
The Human Zoo Theatre Company in association with Jacksons Lane presents 'The Hive', an award winning dystopian love story about rediscovering human connection. 

Performances are the 1st- 3rd May and tickets can be found here: http://www.jacksonslane.org.uk/whats-on/event/2014/the-hive/ 

Trailer here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XI8Ur3Czauk

3 for 2 offer on Friday

In a world where everybody lives in isolation, is it possible to re-connect?

Exploring this idea through the use of puppetry, story-telling, poetry and choreographed movement, The Human Zoo bring to the stage a show which is visually spectacular, cutting straight to the centre of what is rapidly becoming a modern day dilemma. What are we left with when technology fails?

Winner of the Les Enfants Terribles Edinburgh Award 2014

This is our London premiere as a company, we're ever so excited and we would love to share it with you.

230798443788040.description:
Day Drunk is competing in CBC's Searchlight Contest with the chance to win 20,000$ and a festival gig! Please help support us by voting every day and getting others to vote as well.

VOTE HERE: http://music.cbc.ca/artists/Day-Drunk

WE'RE TOP 25!!!

Voting for Regional Top 10 runs April 7th-13th






 "We've chosen the song The Stories We Will Tell  for CBC's Searchlight not only because of it's original meaning but because it's meaning grows with the ever growing story of our lives. The song was written telling the story of my housemates who helped me through a lot, and are closer to me than brothers. The narrative that is told throughout the song are real events from my life that I hold dear. The opening line "I watch the stars with a million other people" is inspired by a tattoo my housemate has. The tattoo was meant as a reminder that no matter where he is, he is always looking at the same night sky as his loved ones, which would help bring comfort on long outdoor trips. This was a sentiment shared with him by his father, which inspired him to get the tattoo. I use the line to express that even though one day when we all are off living our separate lives, we can always be brought back together by looking up at the stars. One night in particular he was outside looking up at the stars, and myself and the other housemates came out to join him. We talked of our friendship and about how one day, it'll be these moments, these stories, that we will share of each other to our children.


I could come home after the shittiest of days and within minutes of being home, I would feel like everything would be alright. The fact that I landed in a house with these guys was entirely by happenstance, which inspired the line that the pieces just seem to have fallen into place.

The bridge is meant as a toast to life, and living it to the fullest and not being afraid to give love. I've lost friends to suicide, and to think that they didn't know the love I had for them is a mistake I never want to have happen again. Love is indeed worth giving and life is worth living, if only for the precious moments we share with even more precious people.

They say these are the best years of our lives and I believe it, and knowing I can look up at the night sky and be back in these moments with such wonderful people, I know I'll never have to truly say farewell.

But as I said before, the song's meaning grows with every new story. The story of the band coming together itself was really random as well. I saw a poster for McMaster's Last Band Standing, and figured since I'd always wanted to do something like that, that I should go for it. Marty was an acquaintance who was a friend of my housemates. Rhett was his housemate and joined the band once we jammed with him. Now I couldn't ask for two better friends to be sharing the stage with, and doing what we love to do, playing music. We recently competed in LCBO's Whiskey Rocks and got to open for Theory of a Deadman, which was unreal, but the most incredible thing was getting to rock out on that stage and just have fun with two great buddies. Our main band photo is actually from that show, and we decided that Stories would be one of our songs for that set because that moment would in fact be a story we would tell. The photo was taken perfectly fittingly during the bridge, which as I said is a toast to life, we asked the audience to toast with us and the crowd of two thousand people toasted with us.

We're so grateful to our unbelievable friends, families and fans who have really gotten our music out there and have given us huge opportunities like that.

We've only been a band for just over a year but are already getting airplay around college radio, with our debut EP charting on CFMU's Chart Top 30 for 7 weeks, peaking at #4. 

Lastly, what I find so wonderful is that everyone has stories they will tell, of the moments and the people that have impacted their lives, and I hope that this song inspires people to think of those memories."

- Jordan Hallin

In November Cocoon returned for a sell out show at Building Six, making North Greenwich feel a little like Ibiza and left us dreaming of Mediterranean sunrises. This spring Cocoon returns with a medley of producers that have consistently been at the forefront of the European DJ circuit. Joining talisman Sven Vath in the main room will be Tim Green whose reverberated himself through the realms of house and techno with a distinctive charm.

Calling on the very capable mixing fingers of mobilee records to go up against in the Cocoon posse in room 2; label owners Anja Schneider and Ralf Kollmann will be representing the Berlin based outfit. Battling against Timo Maas this will be Anja’s first set in London since she tore apart the Tobacco Dock New Year’s Day party. Seeking only inspiration from the world’s best clubs has allowed Tim Maas to create a sound that’s direct and gripping. Reflecting exactly the mindset of what Cocoon has always been.

232033750289995.description:
Dear Students,
This is your Capitant speaking!

London is the capital of the business world and many young people aspire to work in this vibrant city. That is why Capitant gives its members the opportunity to visit some of London's oldest financial institutions. Explore its gleaming new walkways, hallowed halls and appealing outdoor spaces and discover the underlying history of our love affair with trading. Our range of Business visits includes some of the world's best-known companies as well as the banks and stock exchanges of the world's leading economic centres: 
- BlackRock
- Aberdeen
- Bloomberg
- Lloyds of London
- Morningstar
- Rabobank
- ..

Capitant offers you this amazing trip for just € 250! This includes the following things:
- All transport (train and public transport)
- Accommodation in the heart of London
- A big surprise event on Thursday evening
- London's nightlife
- And much more !

We will leave on Wednesday the 2nd of April in the afternoon and return is scheduled on Saturday evening the 5th of April.

During these couple of days, you will receive tours, company presentations, details for a potential application, an extensive Q&A session and networking opportunities

HOW CAN I APPLY?
You can apply by sending an e-mail to financetrip@capitant.be and attaching your CV in annex. 
Note that we do not screen CV's on their content, although they will be delivered to our partners in London so make sure your CV is error-free. (Yes, we will check on grammar and spelling)

WHEN CAN I APPLY?
For Master-students, applications will open on the 12th of November at 7:00 PM.
For Bachelor-students, applications will open on the 18th of November at 7:00 PM.

Please note that applications received before this date will not be considered.

Intake is limited to 25 students in each city, so early application is advised.

If you have any more questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at financetrip@capitant.be.

We look forward to welcoming you on our trip!
Capitant 2013-2014
