232456920284632.description:
Liam Large presents JUKEBOX JAM in Paris.

The best selection of vintage R&B, early soul and latin flavored slices of vinyl branded to set the dancefloor on fire ! All on genuine 45RPM!

Spécialisé dans les musiques afro-américaines des années 50 et 60, Liam Large est un DJ Londonien dont la réputation de dénicheur de pépites et enflameur des dancefloors n'est plus à faire!
Depuis 2007, il anime les soirées Jukebox Jam à Londres dont le succès grandissant le fait rapidement connaître sur la scène internationale. Il fonde dès lors le label du même nom qui, associé à Jazzman Records, réédite certaines de ces pépites alors introuvables pour le bonheur des amoureux du Rhythm&Blues original. A ce jour, trois compilations aux succès retentissants ont vu le jour en format LP et CD distribués aux quatre coins du globe: d'abord "Jukebox Jam" (rapidement épuisé), puis "Jukebox Mambo" et enfin, "JukeboxJam 2" en novembre 2013. Véritables révélations discographiques, celles-ci rassemblent une irrésistible collection de R&B vintage et musiques afro-latines. Liam est alors régulièrement invité derrière les platines de tous les Soul clubs de la planète.
Pour sa toute première apparition en France, c'est à l'Alimentation Générale que Monsieur Large présentera une sélection de 45t garantissant une nuit mouvementée et des secousses sur le dancefloor! Il sera épaulé pour l'occasion par deux DJ's bien connus des habitués des soirées Soul et Rock'n'Roll parisiennes: Le Pacha et David Baker.

Chaussez vos dancing shouzes et préparez-vous à une explosion de vintage Rhythm&Blues et à un feu d'artifice de 60's Soul, early Funk, Mambo, Jump Blues et Rock n' Roll!

232674550267430.description:
Safe Place is a synergy of artists, designers, performers, writers and musicians. The essence of Safe Place is the investigation of what a safe place embodies.

Participant Artists take you on their unique journey through the world of imaginary landscapes, experiencing and sharing each other's works creating a fusion that is deployed to a larger coherent collective experience.  

The visitor/spectator also has a share in Safe Place. During the opening dinner the visitor will be invited to participate with all their senses.   

What you see, smell, taste, feel and hear is the menu for this evening.

In addition to the exhibition there is also a Safe Market Place, which operates in A Pop-Up Recycling hyper-store formula where art, clothing, design, literature, and biological food is offered. This is also accessible online.

 Consumption patterns and production processes are subordinated to the ecological, sustainable, socially-friendly ideas of Safe Place and its daughter operatives.

This event will feature the work of 20 artists, occupying the Master Shipwrights House, across the whole weekend.

Artists: Zoe Hamilton-Peters, Zusi Rongen, Valentina Di Maio, Jan Paul Vd Weerd, Janet Currier, Boris Injac, Jaya , Victoria Vintage, 'La Gosse & Niko T' Aka SIBLINGS, Der 5te Roboter, Arno Tegelaers, Hey Maggie- Josh Cigano Parnell, Matthew Cox, Jules Madjar, Josh Lambert Price, Trent Castro, Mark Camateras, Jimmy Ross.  

Ticket & program 

Saturday 7th of June 18.00 - 23.00 

Private view: to register yourself and make a donation of £19 which includes a 3 course dinner and 2 drinks (wine/ beer), performance shows, dj's and vj’s. 
The guest list is limited and closes on 7th of June 14.00

Sunday 8th of June 12.00 - 17.00 open viewing. 
No reservation needed 
Entry fee £ 4 (at the door)

More info @ safeplaceinfo@gmail.com

233077220231813.description:
For the first time ever The Yard opens its theatre space to a live exploration of electronic music with Mika Vainio + London Modular Alliance.  
_______________________

There are few people alive that have pushed the boundaries of electronic music as far as Mika Vainio. Either as one half as Pan Sonic, under his Ø alias or his own name, Mika Vainio has turned noises made by machines into beautiful soundscapes and coarsely textured tracks, ambient electronica and ice cool minimal techno. He’ll be flying over from Berlin for this occasion to perform solo in London for only the second time of his 20 year career.

Co-headlining are local legends the London Modular Alliance. Based a stone’s throw from our venue, London Modular run the only shop in the U.K dedicated to modular synthesis. 

Modular synthesis is the most fundamental way of producing electronic sound and forms the basis of so much of the music we love and dance to today. Recently the 4-piece group wowed those at the V&A for the Boiler Room takeover by showcasing not just their sonic arsenal but the technological spectacle of their music-making process. 

No laptops, just three dudes, serious machines and a bunch of cables. A London Modular Alliance performance is truly worth watching and perfectly suited to the theatrical setting of The Yard.
_______________________

This is an incredibly rare and one-off opportunity to witness two spectacular live electronic performances in a small but perfectly formed theatre within a warehouse. Mika Vainio's last show at Café OTO sold out well in advance and the uniqueness of this event will ensure it too is a sell-out. We’ll be using a very special custom built PA and acoustically treating the theatre to our needs to ensure the highest aural pleasure for you. 

There are only 130 places available. Don’t miss out!

This event is produced by Liquid Amber as part of The Hive Project's new season.
233077220231813.name: Mika 'Ø' Vainio + London Modular Alliance

233336230207561.description:
Vous avez aimé les soirées du ski ? Vous allez adorer notre nouveau week-end :

LONDON'S CALLING

Votre BDE préféré vous propose de venir découvrir du 27 au 29 juin la ville de Londres, la légendaire Big Ben, son quartier de Notting Hill, le marché de Camden Town mais surtout les folles soirées britanniques !

Que vous soyez plutôt shopping TopShop ou Harrod's, visite de Buckingham dans l'espoir de croiser Kate ou William ou encore pub-friendly il y en aura pour tous les goûts.

Départ le vendredi soir vers 23h-minuit en autocar (Rendez-vous fixé plus tôt pour ceux qui souhaitent prendre l’apéro !). 

Sejour dans une charmante auberge de jeunesse située à King’s Cross, en plein cœur de Londres et à proximité des meilleurs spots de la ville.

Pour les repas, nous trouverons sur place de quoi nous restaurer, il paraît que les anglais font de très bons fish ans chips... Le petit déjeuner est inclus dans l’hébergement.

Alors si vous souhaitez retrouver l’ambiance Hedacienne ou si tout simplement vous souhaitez visiter Londres n’hésitez plus cela ne vous coutera que 110 € !

ATTENTION : Les places sont limitées, les premiers arrivés seront les premiers servis ... 

N’oubliez pas l’Oyster ;)

A très vite,
L’équipe du BDE :)

For an Easter Thursday special we’ve invited Axel Boman to join us in celebrating our 7th birthday party! 

The dark, base-fueled ‘Purple drank’ became the breakthrough track for Swedish dj/producer Axel Boman. In 2010 he moved to London becoming the newest student at the Red Bull Music Academy. Alongside Kornél Kovács & Petter Nordkvist their lovechild was born, Studio Barnhus. 

2013 saw various releases including his debut full-length album ‘Family Vacation’ a dark, soulful mixture of deep house and groovey disco. With an extended 5am license for this special occasion, his eclectic taste of electronica will be the perfect way to welcome in the Easter weekend! 

Dance Tunnel/ 95 Kingsland High Street; Dalston; London E8 2PB

Contattate me o i promoters del nostro team sú italiansdoitbetterparty@gmail.com per early bird tickets o per essere inseriti nella nostra guestlist personale. ITALIANS DO IT BETTER, JUST FOR THE BEST!

This is one of the biggest dates in the diary, the start of the long Easter Weekend and as we all know the biggest parties always start on the Thursday.

1st DRINK FREE with tickets from Alist (worth up to £6)
I Love Pacha” we hear you say.. So prove it! Bring your heart and soul to the dance floor and show us just how much you really do love all things Pacha. Head down to Pacha London on April 17th You can expect a night of decadence and excess, the sexiest crowd in London, cutting edge music all the way and of course the odd cherry or 2!

You can expect as much of our now renowned “in your face party vibe and sexy excess with a large dollop of decadence ” and of course a big red shiny cherry or two. Since our humble beginnings I Love Pacha has just got bigger and better with each party!

Trash You
Inspired by Funk, Soul and Disco, these influences all shine through in Trash You's music. Early support has come from Weiss, Giom, Audiojack, Steve Lawler, Midnight Love Club and OFF Recordings to name just a few.

Trash You is no stranger to the club scene having spent many years playing in Brighton, London and Ibiza. Residencies held at legendary venues like The Honeyclub, Zap and The Escape have provided a solid experience of working crowds in the way they should be. Drawing on inspiration from Funk, Soul and Disco,

Trash You has kicked off 2014 with his first release on the mighty Berlin based OFF Recordings. ‘Watch This’ has gained support from heavyweights such as Audiojack, Steve Lawler, Weiss and Giom to name a few and reached number 23 in the Beatport Tech House Top 100 chart. The ‘1993 EP’ will follow on from this on up and coming label Midnight Love Club with lead track 1993 already causing a stir on the underground ahead of it’s official release in April. You can expect to hear a Chicago and Detroit influenced sound when Trash You is behind the decks, as he looks to show his respect to days gone by.

Over 18's / please bring photo ID

237723233018576.description:
Trapeze's weekly Saturdays continue with the finest house music each week in the basement. Once a month we will be paying homage to London house djs who have made their indelible mark on the capital's house music for the past two decades but who still remain relevant and busy in the scene. 

A ground breaking female DJ, Jo began playing in 1990 and became the first (and still the only) female DJ to win DJ Magazine's coveted DJ of the Year award. She has played virtually every major club across the globe including Womb in Tokyo, Panorama Bar in Berlin, Warung in Brazil, Cavo Paradiso in Mykonos, Space Miami & Ibiza, Crobar + Vinyl in New York, Zouk in Singapore and still holds down a 22 year! residency in Ibiza at Space. Jo also played all the seminal Uk clubs that set the template for today's scene including Boy's Own, Back to Basics, Full Circle and Pushca. Supporting Jo in the house basement is resident Stuart Patterson and warming up the room in proper style are Katie Barber and T. Maronie OF Lady Bugz fame.

Upstairs the six strong YO!MySiZe crew drop a credible party mix of disco, funk, latin, reggae and soul. The musical pedigree with all of these ladies is top draw so its another musical treat of a night at Trapeze not to be missed.

PLEASE NOTE PHOTO ID REQUIRED BY ALL - LAST ENTRY IS 1AM THANKS

Hi,
 
This is going to be no ordinary spring / summer season. Are you ready for a brand new you? Look out for the clothes, jewellery & accessories that will empower you to be the best that you can be. And with that in mind, who do you want to be? The answer is here… ‘London Market’ Spring Summer Edition takes us through this season's top trends.
 
Why not come and dip a well-dressed toe in the start of the new season? Get ready to play with new shapes, silhouettes and stripes. Spring Summer is often one of the most wearable seasons; it's about flirting with trends & colours, and having fun with a new style mood. This is not about rules – this is about raw originality.
 
Very happy to present the participation list of 'London Market at The Royal City of JAIPUR' at Hotel The Lalit, Malviya Nagar, Jaipur on the 25th & 26th of April'2014 from 11am to 10pm;
 
From the Haute Collection by Top Fashion Designers to latest brand launches to exclusive pop-up shops, ’London Market’ presents the most exciting products arriving this season. It’s time to start making your wish list.
 
With the launch of our Spring Summer Jaipur Edition, ‘London Market’ is the ultimate destination for starting your Spring Summer shopping list.

Fashion Walk 
 
At 'London Market', there will be a fashion walk showcasing our ‘Designers in Focus’.

The Attendees 
 
This will be a wine & cheese event attended by the whos & whos of Jaipur including Royalties & Politicians. We have also invited the prominent members of Ficci Flo and tied up with various expat groups.
 
The decoration of the event is being handled by professional Italian Designers who are specially flying down for this event.
 
The Media
 
Various Print and Electronic Media will be present for the coverage of this event. We will also arrange for one on one interviews of the designers by the media. This event will be highly covered by the media and you can expect to be covered extensively as well. 
 
In essence this will be a very prestigious event, such that the City of Jaipur has never seen before. 
 
WELCOME TO ‘LONDON MARKET’, :)

239489372910376.description:
… I have create the event to raise awareness that I'm running for CLIMB in the hope that people will be kind enough to show their support by donating EVEN a couple of Quid …. EVERY little helps ….x x

And this is WHY I am running …

I recently discovered that lovely friends of mine, Anna Greenhouse and Stuart Miller, had lost their Beloved Son Jack a few years ago to Ornithine transcarbamylase deficiency (OTCD). This is one of a great many INHERITED METABOLIC DISEASES. As can be seen metabolic diseases are life threatening inheritable, genetic disorders in which errors of metabolism occur, involving a block where a catalyst or enzyme is absent or malfunctioning. This defect results in the build up of chemicals on one side of the metabolic blockage and a deficiency of vital chemicals on the other. This causes an overdose of one or more, often toxic, chemicals and the shortage of others, which are essential to normal body functioning.  The consequences of such chemicals are often fatal, leading to either a slow deterioration with progressive physical and mental issues, or to rapid decline and death. 

CLIMB is a registered Charity which provides information and support to children and their families around all Inherited Metabolic Diseases and also supports Genetic and Other Research into the conditions. As a Parent myself, I was very moved by their story and inspired by the work of CLIMB to apply to run the Marathon to raise funds for this WONDERFUL CHARITY.

Thank you for taking the time to read this and for your Support ... A pledge of ANY amount is very much appreciated ... THANK YOU X X   

https://www.justgiving.com/Steve-Proctor1
239489372910376.name: I'm Running The LONDON MARATHON

240312246150375.description:
Info & tickets: http://www.residentadvisor.net/event.aspx?555838

Derrick May /// Deetron /// Arnaldo /// Peverelist /// Kowton /// Asusu /// James Priestley /// Giles Smith @ Electric Brixton

Kicking things off in style, the party returns to South London for their annual Easter Special at Electric. After sell out shows there with Nina Kraviz last Spring and Levon Vincent this NYE, they come with a typically heritage-meets-cutting-edge line-up that makes it a must go to event for any discerning house and techno fan alike.

Headlining the event is none other than Derrick May, Detroit innovator and famously part of the Belleville 3 alongside Juan Atkins and Kevin Saunderson. Spanning a career of decades and responsible for various classic productions along the way, Derrick is now most renowned for his prowess as a DJ and is a man still very much at the top of his game. Effortlessly combining a raw funk backbone with a smoother more hypnotic sensibility, his set for secretsundaze last year at the Opening Party at Studio 338 was the highlight of our summer so we cant wait to welcome him back, but this time, presenting him in a different scenario, as we witness the damage he can do in a packed theatre house with disco lights.

Co-headlining is Swiss veteran Deetron, whose skills as both a producer and as a technically genius 3-turntable DJ, has earned him a unique position in the world of house and techno, fiercely independent, and not aligned to any particular crew or label. His stock has steadily risen and now, whilst inspiring a new generation of young artists along the way, is one of the most in-demand DJs out there. These skills can be heard on his highly rated Balance CD compilation and most recently his natural flair in the studio 'Music Over Matter', his second artist album. Many of Deetron's roots are in Detroit techno so he was our first choice to pair alongside Derrick May for an enticing US / European meeting of minds..

As a 3rd guest in the main room we welcome rising star, Argentinian but London based Arnaldo, who has steadily been carving a reputation as one of a new wave of serious deep house artists emerging from the city. Playing only the coolest spots and often publishing his long live sets online to much acclaim from the heads, he is also more than handy in the studio, recording for esteemed labels such as Lawrence's Smallville and Blank Slate no less.

As ever, secretsundaze founders James Priestley and Giles Smith will be on residential duties, warming up and rounding off proceedings as only they know how.

Taking over Room 2 is one of favourite labels right now, Bristol based Livity Sound. The union of artists Peverelist, Kowton & Asusu is releasing some of the most forward thinking music out there, taking inspiration from dub, jungle and crucially techno. They are at the forefront of a new wave of UK labels exploring these crossroads. The results are formidable, rightfully earning them the highly respected accolade of Top Label of 2013 on Resident Advisor. Their string of vinyl only releases have been charted by some of the world's most adventurous DJs, but it was the Livity Sound CD compilation that has transcended them onto the lips of any UK electronic music lover worth their salt.

Early bird tickets are now on sale exclusively through Resident Advisor.
240312246150375.name: Secretsundaze Easter Special - DERRICK MAY, DEETRON, ARNALDO, PEVERELIST, KOWTON, ASUSU, JAMES PRIESTLEY & GILES SMITH @ Electric Brixton, London

— YUNG LEAN (Live)

"Yung Lean is a beguiling mishmash of American hip-hop’s more peculiar, Lil B-indebted elements, and he raises a lot of questions. Mainly, who the fuck is this kid? And why is he like this?" - Noisey
http://bit.ly/1e7ArAS

"Yung Lean, despite all the rap posturing, is really making outsider music – this is his deeply Scandinavian take on a sound he has about as much in common with as he does the Delta blues, and it doesn’t seem to matter. Like Riff Raff before him, Lean appears oblivious to these concerns, and has quickly and quietly cut-and-pasted himself a rap career replete with a crew (The Sad Boys), a sound (cloud rap via Japan), and a look (very young, very white)." - FACT

"Yung Lean has styled himself somewhere between Lil' B and Chief Keef" - VIBE

— PIFF GANG (Live)

"This is weird. Good weird, but weird nonetheless. Piff Gang are Londoners doing what, as far as we know, no one from the capital has done before: offered a UK version of the torpid, hazy, woozy, luxuriantly produced hip-hop we've been raving about these past few years." - Guardian

Cirque Du Soul is a travelling collective energy of colour, magic and dance. Only the most vibrant and open-minded party goers need apply. The 21st Century’s Moulin Rouge - burlesque meets bass. It's time for you to know about Cirque Du Soul.

Once a month we will invade the most quirky of hideouts in a selected city, dusting out the cobwebs, chalking up the cocktail menu and sweeping the stage for a sell-out showdown of bohemian madness.

The air will be soaked with the freshest collection of house, funk, soul, electro-swing, disco, garage and hip-hop this side of Chicago. Each city bags its own headliner - and the junkies can hop skip and jump to the next performance with our travelling troupe.. but space is limited.

You have to play by the rules of the circus. Visual delights welcomed. Long tails and corsets, top hats and canes, glitter, sequins and feathers, blacks, reds, golds - the boys dress up and the girls dress down.

Goldfish Live in London!

Goldfish: Three Second Memory Tour @ Electric Brixton
 
Multi-instrumentalist electronic wunderkinds Goldfish return to London to perform their explosive live show at the Electric Brixton on Sunday 20th April (Monday is a Bank Holiday)

Their genre-defying mix of live saxophones, double bass, keyboards and pounding house beats has touched a nerve with audiences across the world, performing everywhere from Ultra Music Festival to Pacha Ibiza. Rather than bash out boring loops in Ableton this duo build their sounds from the bottom up using a wide selection of live instruments to create a live show which leaves audiences gobsmacked around the world.

For this very special London show they will be joined by the Berlin based young talent Wankelmut - known for his rolling Techno plus hits One Day Reckoning and My head is a Jungle ft. Emma Louise. Wankelmut’s support will ensure the dance floor is nicely warmed all night long. 246328388883763.description:
A series of 32 talks on famous Londoners curated by Suzette Field of A Curious Invitation and Antique Beat will take place on the EDF Energy London Eye on May 1st 2014. 

In the fifteen years since it was first built the London Eye has come to be regarded as perhaps the capital's most iconic landmark.  So what more fitting place could there be to host a series of thirty-two talks on some of the men and women who helped make London one of the world's pre-eminent cities? 

On May 1st 2014 the London Eye will be set to a special slow rotation speed and each of its 32 capsules will be given over to a talk by a well-known authority on a famous Londoner. The subjects will range from Thomas Becket to Joseph Bazalgette, from WS Gilbert to Ray Davies and from Queen Victoria to Zadie Smith. The lecturers themselves will be a roll call of those who have contributed to the capital's cultural legacy: from former Mayor of London Ken Livingstone, to ex-Poet Laureate Andrew Motion, film director Julien Temple, broadcaster Robert Elms and biographers Claire Tomalin and Kate Williams. 

As you soar high over two thousand years of London's history in the hands of our expert guides what better insight could you have into the lives and works of the influential figures who have shaped the heritage, culture and image of our ancient and celebrated capital? 

To commemorate the occasion Hendrick's Gin have devised 32 bespoke cocktails, one in honour of each London borough. Each guest will be served a complimentary cocktail of their choice during the lecture. After disembarkation there will be an opportunity to share a drink with your fellow participants and speakers and discuss this singular and inspirational event. 

32 Londoners has been curated by a Curious Invitation and Antique Beat as a unique experience intended to strengthen the cultural connection of Londoners with the city in which they live and work.

THE TALKS

Anne Duggan on THOMAS BECKET - Saint, b. 1118 Cheapside
Henry Eliot on GEOFFREY CHAUCER - Poet, b.1343 London
Dan Cruickshank on JOHN STOW - Historian, b. 1525 Cornhill

Essie Fox on MARIE LLOYD - Singer, b. 1870 Hoxton

Bryony Dixon on CHARLIE CHAPLIN - Actor, b. 1889 Walworth
Nathalie Morris on ALFRED HITCHCOCK - Film Director, b. 1899 Leytonstone
D J Taylor on EVELYN WAUGH - Writer, b. 1903 West Hampstead
Hugo Vickers on CECIL BEATON - Photographer, b. 1904 Hampstead
Peter Berthoud on PHYLIS PEARSALL - Inventor of the A-Z, b. 1906 East Dulwich
Jude Kelly on JOAN LITTLEWOOD - Theatre director, b. 1914 Stockwell
David Stafford on LIONEL BART - Composer, b. 1930 Stepney

DJ Nihal on JAZZIE B - Music producer, b. 1963 Hornsey
Gavin Evans on LENNOX LEWIS - Boxer, b. 1965 West Ham
Jacqueline Shaw on OZWALD BOATENG - Fashion designer, b. 1967 Muswell Hill
Lesley-Ann Jones on NAOMI CAMPBELL - Model, b. 1970 Streatham
Philippa Thomas on ZADIE SMITH - Writer, b. 1975 Brent
Each ticket includes a complimentary Hendrick's Gin cocktail with a unique recipe for each of London's 32 boroughs and admission to the exclusive Featherless Flight Lounge in Jubilee Gardens next to County Hall.

Every year, the November 5th Resistance movement in the UK grows bigger and stronger. In 2011 there was 500-600 people, in 2012 there was over 1000 people, this year in 2013 there was over 2000. This Idea is not going away.. 

In 2015, we will once again march on the houses of Parliament in London , leading up to 2016 when November 5th falls on a Saturday ! The standard has now been set , next year we will have bigger banners, louder voices, more fireworks, more people and a louder sound system ! 

Why are we doing this?.... simple... Because governments need to be reminded that the people will NEVER be oppressed again. The Internet Awakening is on-going and the people will not be divided by subject, race, age or religion. We are a diverse collective of human beings fighting for overall human freedom, we will not be silenced and we will not be negotiated with, we have no leaders, only ideas ! 

We are Anonymous 
We are Legion
We do not forgive 
We do not forget
EXPECT US ...

JOIN US IN 2016 ! 

IMPORTANT: Please invite as many friends as possible ..

255142294665036.description:
Vi har finfint besøk fra London denne gangen, så tar det på engelsk: 

FBR is a London based DJ who hosts a weekly show on worldwide radio station Nasty FM. He's performed across the UK at venues including Plan B, Roundhouse, The Pad, Queen of Hoxton and in room 1 at London superclub Fabric, and is also a resident at Dalston based Ooh La La. Forays into production include the 2012 remix of Wrongtom and Demus J's 'Jump, Move, Rock' which was released on Tru Thoughts recordings. With a style that traverses an array of electronic genres, FBR's sets are typified by smooth blends and varied selection.

Dave Gamble books for Fabric, plays at Fabric and breathes Fabric. When he isn´t allowed to play Frank Zappa, he plays B-sides and unrealeased tracks from "that" artist that never quite broke it from the late 70´s... Dave also runs his own label Yumé Rec. Check it out here: 

https://soundcloud.com/yumerecords

+ Resident Gaute Haaversen

Hvad er bedre ved London, end deres Pub's?
2.Y vil den 22. marts give jer en gylden mulighed: 
Vi vil give jer muligheden for, at besøge en traditionel engelsk pub, her på Himmelev Gymnasium!

På pubben vil der være kolde øl, live fodbold på storskærm, bordfodbold og dart.
Vi vil sørge for en masse sjove konkurrencer, med fede præmier!
 

Kom og vær med. Nyd en kold bajer, hyg dig med fodbold, venner og familie over et sjovt spil bordfodbold eller dart. Alle er velkomne store som små!

Under arrangementet har vi "skaffet" et upcoming band kaldet "The Sizzling Sassy Sisters" bestående af Axel Illeris Poggi, Cemil Burak Altinkaya, Lasse Björn Lautrup, Simon Zangger Christiansen og Magnus Glasdam Jakobsen.
Vi vil spille et par svedige numre som i kan hygge jer til.

Så kom og hav en hyggelig eftermiddag lørdag D. 22. marts i lokale 22 (grøn hjemstavn)

2.Y glæder sig meget til at se jer, og drikke en kold øl med jer!

256894301144064.description:
Hi, thanks for visiting my fundraising page. 

To Donate: http://www.virginmoneygiving.com/NathanViva

A few years ago after a particularly hard time for me, I made a bucket list. On that list were many things... some I have managed to do, others that are in the pipeline and some that are still just items on a list. But one of the top ones was running the London Marathon. It took me 2 years of applying and even then I just got in with only 11 weeks to go as a back up. So here I am, kinda unprepared for it all, but determined to give it my best shot. 

To let you know why you should sponsor me it might help to let you know how much of a challenge this actually is for me... Well, I have been running to keep fit as part of my kickboxing fight training for a few years now (another thing on my bucket list...) but I have never run anything further than 15km, I usually run around 5km. The Marathon is 42km. Marathon training normally requires a 24 week build up and intensive training, I have 11 weeks and haven’t run AT ALL in the previous 3months. So, as you can see... this is going to be a challenge.

Why have I chosen The Royal British Legion and why do I think that you should want to donate to them, via me? A lot of people are just happy to take part and will run for anyone that needs people to run for them. I, however, specifically chose the British Legion as they are exactly the kind of charity that I love to support. They help real people, in real need. They are not a faceless research charity, but one that helps those who have laid their lives on the line to defend the country that you most likely call home. World War II veterans in need of care, support and to know that there are people out there that appreciate the sacrifices that they made for us. Its all too common that we forget those that were part of such a pivotal moment in our history. So, my targeted £3000 will go towards wheelchairs, home care, medicine and vital care equipment to make their lives comfortable when they most need it. I am sure this now sounds like something you can feel comfortable donating towards, so for just the price of a pint (or hopefully more!) you can help. If you met some of the guys I am trying to help down the pub, and knew what they had been though for you all those years ago, you'd want to buy them a pint, wouldn’t you? So, imagine that is what you are doing... if you can afford the price of a round, and a packet of cheese & onion with some pork scratchings on the side, then wicked!

Don't forget to use the "gift aid" feature as they will give more on your behalf meaning that the target will be reached ever quicker, and more money will go to a good cause. Thank you and wish me luck!!

Through Virgin Money Giving, you can sponsor me and donations will be quickly processed and passed to charities. Virgin Money Giving is a not for profit organisation and will claim gift aid on a charity's behalf where the donor is eligible for this. I really appreciate all your support and thank you for any donations.

To Donate: http://www.virginmoneygiving.com/NathanViva
256894301144064.name: Nathan Viva Runs The London Marathon for The Royal British Legion Charity

Reuben P. Joseph in collaboration with Yaa Asantewaa Arts

Presents

London Fashion Week September 2014

L'art de la Mode

"Midnight in Rio”

     . World renowned catwalk choreographer, BEFFTA award winning “Best Art Director” and London Fashion Week expert Reuben P. Joseph brings to you the unique combination of art and fashion at the explosive event for London Fashion Week.

This one day event will celebrate the exciting cultural mix, ever present in the fashion and art world. It epitomises the statement below:
“Fashion Changes, Styles Remains.”
Gabrielle ‘Coco’ Chanel 1883 – 1971

The collections will be enriched by household art and costumes designer - Carl Gabriel who will present his magnificent sculptural pieces and costumes against a gallery of magnificent paintings designed by Michael Connell.  

Thirty -five and stunning models and eighteen top designers will each take centre stage in a series of spectacular theatrical catwalk show. 

We will be showcasing breath-taking designs from Brazil, UK, Africa, and the Caribbean that will be presented with live African  and Samba Drums,  and Soca Music together with live performers and special guests. There is also the added opportunity to view and take part in our exhibitions.

Live Mannequins will take the spotlight to further complements one of the most intrigue Fashion events for London Fashion Week September  2014, L' art de La Mode, "Midnight in Rio."

The LSE SU London Society Presents:
The LSE London 2030 Summit 

Days: Tuesday &/ Wednesday 

Get Tickets directly from Link Above!

The London 2030 Summit is a two-day event due to be held at the London School of Economics in March 2014. It combines Ted-X and Question Time. 

The aim of the Summit is to bring together current decision makers to discuss pertinent issues regarding the future of London. 

The Summit will focus on the following four topics; 
London in the World, Business, Politics and Society and Making London Work. The Summit's parent society ‘LSE SU London Society’ is currently partnered with Google, Harvard Business Review and Boston Consulting Group.

258150851021212.description:
Lock N Load Events in association with Data Transmission presents
KÖLSCH
Thursday 10th April
Fire, London

Kölsch [Live]
Dolan Bergin (Electric Minds) 
Will Taylor

CLICK HERE FOR TICKETS:
http://firelondon.eventgenius.co.uk/events/K-lsch-Live/index.html

Kölsch returns to London for the first time this year as part of his inaugural UK headline tour. Landing at a trio of the finest underground spots the UK has to offer, Kölsch has timed this tour to precede a series of high profile summer dates and forthcoming releases. Taking place on Thursday 10th April, the first date will welcome Kölsch to London’s subterranean hideout Fire, for an intimate session of his much lauded live show. 

Since the release of his artistically brilliant album 1977 on Kompakt last June, the electronic world has been in admiration. Fittingly described as romantic techno, each of the thirteen tracks are melodic electronic anthems that leave the mind in state of euphoria. The end of the year saw Kölsch tour his beautifully crafted sound across Europe with dates in Belgium, Switzerland, Netherlands, France and Spain to name a few. Following this Kölsch opened 2014 in fine form by kicking off BBC Radio 1’s Essential Mix Future Stars with a mix that set the precedent for rising artists taking part in the internationally acclaimed series. Having gained a vast amount of support from a plethora of the world’s leading talent, it’s clear that 2014 is the year of Kölsch. 

With the next few months already shaping up nicely for the Dane, the rest of the tour will see him touch down in Manchester and Glasgow before taking on the mighty Amnesia Opening Party, Snowbombing and Mysteryland USA amongst others. With support coming from Electric Minds’ Dolan Bergin, The Willers Brothers and Will Taylor do not miss this rare opportunity to experience Kölsch at his very best.

Fire, South Lambeth Road, London, SW8 1RT
Open from: 21:00 – 01:00
Full licenced bar until close
Nearest tube: Vauxhall (Victoria Line)

.......::::::: Hot In Here :::::::..........
:: The Color Deaf launch party ::

Color Deaf Records has been created with the underground in mind, meticulously culling release selections from some of today's top-charting players in House and Techno. We took our time with the label, over a year in the making, before breathing a word about it -- to make sure that things were moving in the desired direction and that we understood our vision. And our vision is clear: refined underground for discerning tastes.
It is with the underground in mind that we've chosen to host our launch party in Detroit, Michigan, during Techno Week and the Movement Electronic Music Festival. We couldn't think of any better place than the birthplace of modern Techno on a weekend like no other. And rest assured that our planned unique audio-visual taste will stand out as a highlight when you look back on your 2014 Detroit Memorial Day Weekend experience.

260835050756301.description:
SE7ENTH HEAVEN is a new trance night going to take London by storm, bringing you some of the best global DJs in the trance genre.

We are very pleased to announce our huge launch night planned for May! On Saturday 31st May we have booked 6 of the finest Trance DJ/Producers in the scene today. 

MARCEL WOODS
JORDAN SUCKLEY
SIGNUM
FERRY TAYLE
DARREN PORTER
JOHN NEWALL

Jordan Suckley -
Only a handful of artists can be named as DJs, Producers and technical magicians. Many perfect and hone their talents to an extraordinary standard in one wing of Dance Music but to become known for your live performances, to hit the top spots with your productions and to become renowned for breathtaking skills when unleashed on all manner of equipment is a very rare entity – Jordan Suckley is a member of that elite.

Having gained a residency on the internationally revered station BBC Radio 1, as part of the In New DJs We Trust rotation, further cemented Jordan’s inauguration among the Superstar realms. He’s received high praise from the likes of Armin van Buuren, Paul van Dyk, Paul Oakenfold, John O’Callaghan, Simon Patterson and with both Mixmag and Beatport tipping him as ‘One To Watch’ no one can ignore his success and promised potential.

Marcel Woods -
Exactly what doesn't fit is Marcel's mind-blowing mix of raw and energetic dance music. Dance floors and festivals have fallen before him in swift succession. Global Gathering, Mysteryland, Dance Valley, Trance Energy, Gatecrasher Summer Sound System, Escape Into The Park, Planet Love and Sanctuary just in one summer run! And possibly more than anything else underlining Marcel's diverse nature, 2008 even saw him become the only DJ ever to play the White AND Black Edition Sensation parties in one season.

Looking back at Marcel's unrelenting tour diary of the last few years and its evident his name reached fever pitch with clubbers on a global scale with the diary consuming tours of China, Japan, Korea, Taiwan, Singapore, Thailand, Kuala Lumpur, Australia as well as Russia and North America to great success. Summer 2011 he touched Ibiza soil more than ones with indelible nights on "Judgment Sunday" at Eden, "Gatecrasher" at Privilege and three times on "Tiësto's Club life" at Privilege. 


Supporting our headliner we have the amazing up and coming uplifting producer DARREN PORTER, With massive uplifting tracks such as Spellbound and Terraforming, Darren's set is not be missed. Our second headline support act is JOHN NEWALL, John Newall has smashed his way into the global trance scene in just a few short years, picking up support from Paul van Dyk, Armin van Buuren and Aly & Fila, while performing in some of the world’s most respected clubs from London’s Ministry Of Sound, to LMD in Los Angeles.


We also have our very own Van Harsents resident DJ JIMINI eager to impress so join us for what is a monster line up. We will be having a CRAZY laser light show and the best sound system around. This is one event you cant miss.
 
31st May 2014 - 9PM - 6AM

264480593702970.description:
London Lunar Immersion with Jason Nemer & Erica Montes
29th March to 2nd April 2014 at Triyoga Soho 

The Lunar Immersion focuses on the healing, relaxing and rejuvenating practices of Thai massage and therapeutic flying. The Lunar Asana Sequence teaches basic body mechanics with a focus on self-love cultivation, in preparation for the dance of Thai massage. The techniques learned on the floor are then translated to the flying work, using the element of gravity to amplify the healing flow of prana (life force). Often, we will work in teams of three for safety and support, and everyone will have the opportunity to base and fly, heal and be healed. This training offers invaluable tools for yoga teachers, massage therapists, and energy workers who wish to develop a new dimension of healing touch for students or clients.
Skills Covered:
• Lunar Asana Sequence
• Thai massage in Supine, Prone, Side Lying, & Seated positions
• Forward, Backward & High Flying Whale Therapeutic Flying Sequences

The full 30 hours fulfils a prerequisite for AcroYoga Teacher Training. Please attend with your own copy of "Elements of AcroYoga" manual.

Join for the first day, the weekend or the full five days at TriYoga Soho! Follow the link below for details on half day attendance:
http://www.triyoga.co.uk/book-courses-workshops?x=1&teacher=100000423

open to all levels
£175

264526997033145.description:
The Brazilian singer, songwriter and instrumentalist Ed Motta is a popular artist with the soul of a jazz musician. He makes light, seemingly effortless music that connects with musicians and jazz fans at a profound level, through artistry, musicianship and an engaging personality.

His work covers many genres utilising influences from jazz to popular Brazilian music, rock to Hollywood film soundtracks, funk, classical, bossa nova and reggae.

Tonight Ed, backed by his stellar band,  plays from his substantial back catalogue and  showcases music from his latest release AOR, an outrageously accurate tribute to the super-smooth, musicianly ‘Yacht Rock’ of the late 1970s (Steely Dan, Doobie Brothers, etc.)

Ed has played with names such as Roy Ayers, Chucho Valdés, Jean-Paul “Bluey” Maunick, Ryuichi Sakamoto, Paul Griffin, Bernard Purdie, Bo Diddley, Ed Lincoln, Mondo Grosso, Marcos Valle, João Donato and Dom Salvador, among many others.

“Absolutely Sublime” The Independent on Sunday

“Ed Motta is the Don!” Gilles Peterson

“Maybe the UK is finally ready for this Brazilian giant.” John L Walters

Ed Motta is also on a La Linea tour:
Band on the Wall, Manchester April 3; The Sage Gateshead, April 4; The Wardrobe, Leeds April 5; Turner Sims, Southampton April 8 and more tbc

266259366865647.description:
All female Japanese legends Shonen Knife return to London 'Rock City' & Dingwalls in May 2014 with their 20th album "Overdrive", released April 14 on Damnably


Doors: 7:30pm
Former Utopia : 8.15-8.45
Smallgang: 9.00-9.30
Shonen Knife 9:50pm
band signing 10.50-11.15


Formed in Osaka almost 33 years ago, the trio rose from humble DIY beginnings to touring with Nirvana on their ‘Nevermind’ tour, trailblazing a path for women in music and inspiring legions of bands. Championed by Nirvana, Sonic Youth and hailed as a favourite by the crème-de-la-crème of Alternative Rock, Shonen Knife remain one of the most influential and beloved of Japanese rock exports.

Live, they are a tight with machine-precision, punching out fast, highly exciting sets of Punk, Pop, Rock & Metal hits, all coated with their own distinctively quirky and life-affirming charm. As they fast approach their 1,000th gig, Shonen Knife's joy and invention shows no sign of fading. As Naoko says, “Let's Rock!”

"When I finally got to see them live, I was transformed into a hysterical nine-year-old girl at a Beatles concert." Kurt Cobain.

Press for 'Overdrive' so far:
7/10 UNCUT
7/10 NME
7/10 Clash  
7/10 TLOBF
4/5 The Skinny 
5/5 Narc
NEW Video>> 'Like A Cat' https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f4d1Nup38Do 

Supports:

SMALLGANG
Half-japanese London based trio fronted by two baritone voiced brothers that have been making a name for themselves with volcanic live shows exploding tight poppy post-punk with effortless complexity and crazed solo's. Last year the band toured the UK with Bored Spies (members of-Seam/Bitch Magnet/OWC) and this May release their 3rd album on Damnably.
“Stylish art rockers “ - Time Out
“deceptively deadpan songs often mutate into noisy but controlled thrashing. (Cockpit) is a particularly fine tune.” - Artrocker
“Great record” - The Line Of Best Fit
https://soundcloud.com/damnably/smallgang-dust-from-san
NEW Video>>'Dust' https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1qRQ8u8g2wE
http://www.damnably.com/smallgang/

Former Utopia
East London's post punk trio who've toured throughout the UK, Italy and Europe with Shonen Knife & Julie Doiron. Released their Collapsar
EP in 2013 that saw mostly 8/10 reviews and garnered radio love from Gideon Coe & Tom Ravenscroft on BBC 6 Music.

John Kennedy XFM Radio “FANTASTIC!”
Pocket Jury “The overall highlight is the fantastic ‘Blue Fugue’, which sounds like a collision between Frigid Stars era Codeine and Zuma era Crazy Horse"
Slowthrills “…subtle melodies delivered in an understated baritone vocal coupled with edgy, occasionally heavy guitars. The way the songs creep up on you and develop is reminiscent of that great, often overlooked band Silkworm.”


SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/formerutopia/a-love-like-infinity
More info: http://www.damnably.com/former-utopia/

270451109799774.description:
AcroYoga Elemental Weekend 
with certified teachers Marc Bauchet & Erica Montes
Saturday, 26th & Sunday, 27th April

Join our special weekend of workshops with 'extraordinaire' guest teacher Marc Bauchet from France. 

The Elemental weekend offers you both the Lunar and Solar practices of AcroYoga giving you a full taste of the different flavours that we can experience. The mindfulness of yoga creates a steady foundation from which to explore the power of Acrobatics and the loving-kindness of Thai Massage. The interplay of all three disciplines will empower everyone to embody the practice with grace, ease, and joy.

********
Schedule:
Saturday, 2-6pm
LUNAR DAY
The lunar practices focus on the therapeutic aspects of AcroYoga. We'll learn basic body mechanics with a focus on self-love cultivation, in preparation for the dance of Thai massage. The techniques learned on the floor are then translated to the flying work, using the element of gravity to amplify the healing flow of prana (life force). Often, we will work in teams of three for safety and support, and everyone will have the opportunity to base and fly, heal and be healed.  

Sunday, 2-6pm
SOLAR DAY
This is the day to get your solar power on! We'll learn drills to integrate the body and be able to get upside down on the floor and on a partner. In a supportive and playful environment we'll practice partner acrobatics, conditioning, inversions, flying flows and transitions. 

THIS WEEKEND IS OPEN TO ALL LEVELS. Variations will be offered accordingly. Come hone your skills or begin your AcroYoga journey!

No partner necessary. 

Yoga mats will be provided. 

*******

Venue: 
TRIPSPACE (www.tripspace.co.uk/contact/)
Arch 339- 340
Acton Mews
E8 4EA

*********

Costs:
*Whole weekend (8 hours) - £75 early bird (paid before 17th April) or £90 full price
*Single day (Sat or Sun - 4 hours) - early bird £40 or £45 full price

********
Registrations and enquiries:
Email: erica@acroyoga.org or call 07815 610 793

More info about AcroYoga:
www.acroyoga.org

About the teachers:
Marc travels the world teaching AcroYoga, Tulayoga and Thai massage. From martial arts and science backgrounds, he started exploring yoga(s) over 12 years ago, on the way discovering disciplines which are now integrated in his practice and teaching: AcroYoga, Tulayoga, acrobatics, tango, meditation, Thai massage... Marc has the passion to share the joy and benefits of these ancestral and modern practices, which empower individuals and communities.

Erica Montes RYT500 has a background in the fields of physical theatre and acrobatics. She first encountered Yoga and meditation as a teenager and, after years working as an actor, found a common ground between her intensely disciplined theatre work and Eastern practices which connect body and mind. Her avid interest in conscious movement and the exploration of the body's capabilities led her to the practice of Vinyasa Yoga. Erica completed her 500 hour Yoga certification with Edward Clark's Tripsichore Yoga. Her deep love for sharing AcroYoga comes from a natural need to bring Yogic principles to a place of interaction with others.
270451109799774.name: AcroYoga Elemental Weekend with Erica Montes & Marc Bauchet in London

271454269696736.description:
Echt opwarmen voor de lente-editie van London Calling op 9 en 10 mei in Paradiso? Dat kun je twee avonden lang in de Tolhuistuin in Amsterdam-Noord doen, waar je dit jaar in de Tolhuistuinzaal nog meer bands kan kijken. Het reguliere programma raakte zo overvol dat er wel twee dagen bij moesten. London Calling in de Tolhuistuin biedt op woensdagavond 7 mei en donderdagavond 8 mei een divers programma aan met vernieuwende en veelbelovende indie- en electropop. 
----------------------------------------------------------------------

WOENSDAG 7 MEI

KLAXONS
Met Klaxons haalt London Calling een waardige headliner binnen voor de eerste dag van London Calling in de Tolhuistuin, woensdag 7 mei. De Britse band staat bekend om hun stevige new-rave en dance punk, waarvan de hits ‘Gravity’s Rainbow’, ‘It’s Not Over Yet’, ‘Golden Skans’ en ‘Magick’ de bekendste singles zijn. In 2007 haalde de band de Mercury Prize binnen. De band speelt slechts een handjevol Europese shows om daar materiaal van het nieuwe album ‘Love Frequency’ te spelen, dat in juni uitkomt. 

SIVU
Zanger en multi-instrumentalist Sivu, uit Groot-Brittannië, heet officieel James Page. Zijn artiestennaam is de Finse vertaling van zijn achternaam. Dat is wel leuk maar zijn muziek is heel leuk. Prachtige elektronische singer-songwriterpop. Liedjes met beats, synths, gitaren, zeer rijk georkestreerd en de indrukwekkende vocalen van Sivu. Ergens tussen bands als Wild Beasts, Alt-J en Arcade Fire in.

EAST INDIA YOUTH  is William Boyle, een jonge geluidskunstenaar die op een positieve manier niet erg stijlvast is. Hij legt zichzelf weinig beperkingen op. Debuutalbum ‘Total Strife Foreve’ is een enorm rijke techno-ambient-popplaat geworden. Het lijkt alsof Boyle alle stijlen aangrijpt die hij leuk vindt.

Met YOUNG & SICK maakt de Nederlander Nick van Hofwegen vanuit de Verenigde Staten furore als muzikant en grafisch kunstenaar. Hij werd bekend als vormgever van platenhoezen voor bands als Foster The People en Maroon 5. Zijn muzikale carrière is nu echter eventjes iets belangrijker. Zijn debuutalbum is net uit en na optredens op SXSW en Coachella is nu London Calling aan de beurt. Hitgevoelige soulpop met veel swingende synthesizers maar ook een akoestische gitaar en vooral de hippe stem van Nick van Hofwegen.

------------------------------------------------

DONDERDAG 8 MEI

GLASS ANIMALS
Glass Animals is een kwartet uit Oxford en het is de eerste band  die getekend is  door  het nieuwe label van superproducer Paul Epworth (Adele/Friendly Fires/Bloc Party e.v.a.). De band maakt electronische hypnosepop. Sfeervol, soulvol en mysterieus met donkere drums en elfachtige vocalen. 

DEATH VESSEL is Joel Thibodeau. De met een opmerkelijk hoge stem gezegende Amerikaan maakt wonderschone indiefolk. Na een tour met Jónsi raakte Thibodeau bevriend met de Sigur Rós-zanger en reisde hij op diens uitnodiging af naar IJsland voor de opnames van  zijn tweede album ‘Island Intervals’, geproduceerd door Jónsi's partner Alex Somers en dat hoor je.

CASUAL SEX laat zich inspireren door onder andere Franz Ferdinand. En het zou zomaar kunnen dat we over een tijdje kunnen spreken over: “De nieuwe Franz Ferdinand”. Het Schotse kwartet maakt intelligente postpunkfunk. Swingend, dwingend en sexy.

SEOUL is een band uit Montreal die droompop maakt die op een soort coole manier heel catchy is. Een groovende bas, een jaren negentig gevoel, een haast vloeibaar synthgeluid, een eenzame zanger en een hip gitaarlijntje. Seoul dus. De single ‘Stay With Us’ is al een bloghitje en het debuutalbum ‘I Become A Shade’ zal niet lang op zich laten wachten.

London Calling Tolhuistuinzaal 
Adres: Tolhuisweg 5 1031 CL Amsterdam
Datum: woensdag 7 en donderdag 8 mei 2014
Prijs: €15 voor woensdag, €12,50 voor donderdag incl. daglidm.
Open: 18:30 uur
Aanvang: 19:00 uur
De voorverkoop begint op zaterdag 15 maart
271454269696736.name: London Calling in de Tolhuistuin 7 & 8 mei:  Klaxons, Young & Sick, East India Youth, Casual Sex, Death Vessel, Sivu, Glass Animals e.a.

271628536333045.description:
"I AM WOMAN, HEAR ME ROAR"
★★★★ Times, Guardian, Scotsman, List, Herald, Skinny
★★★★★ BritishTheatreGuide, Examiner, BroadwayBaby, ThreeWeeks, Fringe Review, Exeunt, Examiner

Header photo by Guido Harari.

In Cristian Ceresoli's critically acclaimed and angry play, a ‘young’, ‘ugly’ and literally naked Silvia Gallerano captivatingly reveals her revolting secrets, as she struggles with obstinacy, resistance and courage for her own celebrity breakthrough in the society of Thighs and Liberty.

Winner of six major awards, including the coveted Scotsman Fringe First Award and the Stage Award for Best Actress, La Merda caused a sensation on its 2012 Edinburgh Fringe World Premiere, returning in 2013 for a sell-out Fringe run and successful European tour.

"If you are too fragile for the experience of being shouted at for an hour by a beautiful stark-naked Italian woman – this is probably not for you. Devastating stream of counsciousness. One of the most wonderfully full-on performances ever seen at the Edinburgh Festival" Joyce McMillan, Scotsman

‘A piece so literally and metaphorically naked, raw and angry that you leave the theatre feeling as if you’ve had all your skin scraped off.’ Lyn Gardner, The Guardian

‘Raw, touching, intelligent and mesmerising ... an unforgettable piece of theatre
that reveals our universal inner thoughts, fears, desires and memory with almost frightening accuracy ... Brash, brutal, beastly, yet beautiful ... a near-perfect recreation of humanity, and indeed, society at its most powerful, most desperate, most vulnerable and most cutting.’ Amy Taylor, The List

‘Utterly compelling verbal symphony. Somewhat perversely, the compelling honesty of what follows is simply irresistible.’ The Herald

‘Lots of awards for the revolutionary monologue.’ Il Sole 24 Ore

‘A howl of sorrow, an incitement to free our country.’ L’Unità

‘The rage is nude.’ Vogue ‘Pasolinean Rage, sublime acting.’ Radio 3

 ‘Shocking monologue in the dying country.’ Corriere della Sera

Silvia Gallerano is superb’ La Repubblica‘ 

You’ll leave feeling Italy’s anger in your bones.’ The Stage

‘Acclaimed opera of Cristian Ceresoli ... excellent writing with a Shakespearean aftertaste and a Pasolinean fil rouge.’ Il Fatto Quotidiano

‘Truly shocking and brilliant.’ British Theatre Guide

‘Often irritating, disgusting and politically incorrect, yet so human, so terribly human to deserve a massive and touching standing ovation‘ La Provincia di Cremona

‘A gem. Sixty minutes of amazing show where, and it is synonymous of excellence, you struggle to paying compliments primarily for writing or interpretation.’
Il Giorno

'The audience feels pinned back in our seats with the full force of the words" The Skinny

‘This is skin in the tradition of Artaud and it is powerful, political and poetic.’ ExaminerTi
271628536333045.name: LA MERDA IN LONDON, WEST END 15Apr-4May

La fiesta volt es un nuevo espacio de recreo nocturno en la noche de Bs. As. La misma se realizara el sábado 3 de mayo, en G104 ubicado en la calle Gascón 104 en el mítico barrio de  Almagro, de la Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires. 

La Volt regresa de la mano de cuatro poderosas agrupaciones como Cabeza Flotante, Los Sub. Shaman y los Pilares de la Creación y Matt Buzz y los de London Luego de los recitales, el público está invitado a danzar al ritmo del DJ residentes Ursa Minor y Dj Tarántula, quien realizara un repaso musical de los 70’,80’,90’ y 00’, pasando desde el rock nacional, al britpop, del britpop al synth pop, dance, rock y diversos estilos musicales, sin caer en el prejuicio nocturno de cierta clase de estirpe, evitando abrir la boca y hacerse el asombrado, esta es una fiesta popular, veni a la Volt y entérate.

BARDZO PROSZE O ZABRANIE ZE SOBA KARTY KREYTOWEJ ORAZ DOKUMENTU ZE ZDJĘCIEM, OCHRONA KLUBU MOŻE POPROSIĆ O OKAZNIE ID NA WEJŚCIU !

info : www.megayoga.co.uk www.facebook.com/megayoga , www.indiosbravos.com

Bilety: 16 przedsprzedaż / 20 w dniu koncertu

Rezerwacje biletów przez strone organizatora:
http://megayoga.co.uk/pl/imprezy/s/indios-bravos-trasa-jatata

Po dokonaniu rezerwacji i platnosci w PAYPAL,prosze o wydukowanie strony z potwierdzeniem lub emaila od PAYPAL. 
Bilety zarezerwowane przez internet będą do odebrania w kasie CARGO w dzień występu od godziny 7PM na podstawie wydruku płatnośći oraz ID/karty płatniczej osoby która dokonałą płatności.

NIE WYSYŁAMY PAPIEROWYCH BILETÓW 
………………………………………………………………………...


Zapraszamy wszystkich serdecznie na kolejny koncert w "pozytywnych klimatach";  już 13 kwietnia w klubie Cargo wystąpi zespół Indios Bravos.
Grupa istniejąca od niemal dwóch dekad pod przewodnictwem Piotra Banacha - związanego poprzednio z grupą Hey - dostarcza swoim słuchaczom pozytywnych wibracji, płynących z połączenia klimatów reggae z rockiem . Wokalista zespołu jest  Piotr "Gutek" Gutkowski znamy też ze wspołpracy z wieloma artystami hip-hop'owymi min. Abradab, Joka, Vienio, Pelson, Tede, Mustafarai. Jego głos w połączeniu ze świetną grupa muzyków, sprawia ze koncerty Indios Bravos stają sie niezapomnianymi wydarzeniami. Koncert odbędzie sie w ramach trasy koncertowej promującej nowy album zespołu "JATATA", będzie można usłyszeć nowe piosenki oraz największe przeboje z wcześniejszych wydawnictw zespołu.
Zapraszamy wszystkich gorąco !

YOU WERE AMAZING!!!
Please check us out on KICKSTARTER at https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/110577683/sound-asleep-a-comedy-film-about-insomnia-top-up-f - 

YOUR SUPPORT MEANS THE WORLD TO US.

PHOTOS & VIDEOS OF THE DAY

Please upload to our wall at www.facebook.com/SoundAsleepFilm

You can see the Sound Asleep Team's photos at https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.487226524736706.1073741839.305330386259655&type=3

And all the photos your fellow pillowfighters at https://www.facebook.com/SoundAsleepFilm?sk=wall&filter=2&notif_t=wall

Post your Youtube Videos to our wall and we'll add them to our official Youtube Playlist at http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2wLjH33TVf3CrVJLDkq4uhNJpnnh8kIP


















----
Scroll Down For The Rules
----
1 day to go!

Like Sound Asleep at www.facebook.com/soundasleepfilm for latest info on the event, prizes, competitions and a chance to be in our movie. 

Why are Sound Asleep spreading the word about pillow fight day? 

We are making a movie about pillows, bed time and insomnia. We'll shoot some scenes for the film at the pillow fight - you could be in the movie!. Spread the word about us and in return we'll keep bringing you madness like this. 

----
PHOTOS AND VIDEOS:

Post your photos and videos to our facebook page and we will share them all to everyone who attended. 

Tweets: Use the #soundasleeppillowfight hastag and we'll add your videos to our official youtube playlist, and retweet your photos.

Playlist: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2wLjH33TVf3CrVJLDkq4uhNJpnnh8kIP

----
PILLOW FIGHT RULES


WAIT FOR THE SIGNAL  -  BARKING BATTERIA SAMBA BAND and SOUND ASLEEP will count the event in. Wait till you hear "READY, TEDDY, GO!" - Then the Band will go for it, and so should you!


**PLEASE PLAY NICE! NO ONE WANTS TO GET HURT**

1. Wear something that says bedtime: 
PYJAMAS, Dressing Gown, Onesie. And take your glasses off.

2. Bring a pillow. 
And keep it HIDDEN till we start at 3pm. (LISTEN FOR THE SAMBA BAND)

Using foam pillows or pillow slips will help reduce mess.  

No cushions and don't over fill or harden your pillow. Soft and fluffy is just right. This is just for fun!

3. Play nice - don't pick on anyone much smaller than you, don't hit anyone too hard.

4. Only pillow fight with people holding pillows. If someone looks unhappy help them away from the action.

5. If you have allergies to feathers make sure to take your anti-hystamines.

6. Don't hit anyone holding a camera.

7. Please bring a plastic or BIN BAG. If we each CLEAN UP THE MESS of one pillow, maybe they'll let us do it again next year. 

8. Updates on the day from Sound Asleep on facebook - 
www.facebook.com/SoundAsleepFilm 
and on twitter: 
www.twitter.com/SoundAsleepFilm - #soundasleeppillowfight 

9. Share your photos and videos on the sound asleep facebook page. We all want to see those amazing photos afterwards and we'll be running our photo competitions for photos shared at www.facebook.com/SoundAsleepFilm


Sound Asleep did not set this up, in fact we have no idea who did!   We just like to spread the word.

-----
UPDATE:

Timeout are reporting that the Mayor's office have warned that there will be some maintenance on the square on the day. We cannot comment on the authenticity of the reports but suspect they are keen to reduce numbers. It's up to you if you attend. This is not Sound Asleep's event to cancel, it is yours. We will continue to spread the messages that we believe encourage this event to go off in a safe, responsible and light hearted way. 

Please clean up after yourselves.
Please don't fight too hard and don't risk hurting anyone.
274286046068167.name: Sound Asleep at the World Record Attempt Pillow Fight London

That's right we are having a little break for now , but we will be back and throwing a totally free party on the 26th of July as a little thank you to everyone who has supported us and come down and partied at Ohm in our first year. 

We thought we would invite back one of our favourite guests so far, Mosca! He loved playing for us last time and couldn't wait to come back and when we got asked wether we would like to book him we couldn't  really say no to a DJ who starts his set with Wu Tang's "36 Chambers" and finishes off with some heavy techno.

https://www.facebook.com/officialmosca

South London Ordnance has been someone who we have kept a very keen eye on and with a run of releases on labels such as Hotflush, Aery Metals and Warp he has established himself as a massive force within the electronic music scene and 2014 is looking set to be his biggest year. With a huge release due to drop soon on  Scuba's mighty Hotflush we are very excited to be giving him his Sheffield debut!

https://www.facebook.com/southlondonordnance


In support of the above is Ohm Sweet Ohm resident Pedram who will hopefully be in a fit enough state to play having played at Global Gathering the night before with the likes of Dense & Pika, James Zabiela  and Cirez D.

280059142145309.description:
With the album ”Electric” Amund Maarud (30) is kind of back where he started deeply into the blues tradition. The album marks Amund´s 20 years as a blues musician with release as early as the age of 10! However for those who think this is a regular blues release, do think again. There are a variety of styles on this album, and people in guitar rock tradition will probably note this as a rock release.

Amund Maarud first started in the band Maarudkara at the age of 6 with his brother Henrik on drums and his father on bass. They came second on the yearly talent competition on NRK in 1997 and released the first album ”First Blues” the year after. Later he had his youth playing in the houseband at the Oslo´s legendary blues club Muddy Waters.

”Some choices you just make without considering options. When I was 10 I just decided to become a bluesguitarist fulltime. It didn´ seem any more strange to me than the wish to become a fireman” says Amund Maarud

In the year 2000 he started Amund Maarud Band, still with his brother Henrik on drums and with straight blues on the repertoire. The band was nominated for a Norwegian Grammy at Spellemannprisen 2003 for the debut album ”Ripped, Stripped & Southern Fried”, and received good acclaim for the follow up album ”Commotion”.
The band was one of the most sought after on the Norwegian live blues scene, but the ”young hope” of blues wanted to experiment more with rock musicand in 2006 they started The Grand.

They started their own record company and released both an EP and album in 2007. They were nominated to the Alarm‐award for best live band the same year. 

The Grand held a number of concerts both in Norway and abroad and was noted at festivals such as Øya festival, Roskilde, Eurosonic and even ”Rockpalast” on German TV.
280059142145309.name: AMUND MAARUD | THE ISLINGTON | LONDON

It's been an epic few years for everyone at our little 200 cap party pad in Finsbury Park. So far our crew has played host to RUDIMENTAL, LORDS OF THE UNDERGROUND, JERU THE DAMAJA, THE HERBALISER DJs, THE MAD PROFESSOR, THE MACCABEES, MYSTERY JETS, SKIP MCDONALD, FUNKDOOBIEST, TEED, DON LETTS, DJ DEREK, JOHN NEWMAN & many more!

ELECTRO-SWING / DUB / REGGAE / HIP HOP  /  BASS /  JUNGLE  / SKA / ROCK 'N' ROLL / RHYTHM & BLUES / JAZZY GOOVES

We've also had the pleasure of working with top promoters & musicians 7 days a week. So wanna say a big thanks to everyone that's thats helped make this a proper buzzin' live music house party venue. 

We have a wicked crew - we love what we do - and we hope you all do to... Join us on FRIDAY 30th May as we light the candles, dish out the cake and don our finest dancing shoes for the BIGGEST birthday bash yet...

▲ CONGO NATTY aka REBEL MC (Big Dada)
Video 1 www.youtube.com/watch?v=-vUupm0Fn_c
Video 2 www.youtube.com/watch?v=Guc3xSj7wQs
Congo Natty aka Rebel MC has a career dating back to his early hit with Double Trouble, "Street Tuff," but is probably most respected as one of the pioneers of Jungle - perhaps the first uniquely UK-born bass music.

▲ CONGO DUBZ (Up 2 Beat)
www.facebook.com/up.beat.942?fref=ts
Dubz is a DJ, promoter & part of the Congo Natty Family and the Up 2 Beat crew who are set to host some heavyweight line-ups here in 2014.

▲ KWAKE BASS & DJ SNUFF (Caxton Press / Zulu Nation)
www.youtube.com/watch?v=lVP6dQyfcS4
Kwake Bass is an accomplished drummer who's currently collaborating with MF Doom & loads of internationally renowned acts. On the 30th May Kwake hits the stage with part of the Caxton Press Posse.. its DJ Snuff. Expect an amazing live show from this DJ & Drummer duo who are set to take us on a journey through the spectrum of sound. 

▲ LUNATRIX (Live)
www.youtube.com/watch?v=A6Ocsjg-B5M
Lunatrix take the acoustic elements of the past and combine them with electro-swing, live drums and electric guitars to create a fusion of the past and contemporary. This lively 7 piece contemporary swing band are bleedin' rad. Check their link for a listen :]

▲ THE TIGHTEN UP CREW (SB Residents)
www.facebook.com/TightenUpCrew
Regular SB promoters Mistah Brown, Tim P & Champian MC give you a taste of their Tighten Up Club Nights: Hot Ska! Cool Rocksteady! Boss Reggae! Tuff Roots! Vital Dub! Old-School Dancehall! Good Vibes! Rewinds Galore! Nuff Said!

▲ THE BLACK CAT CLUB (SB Residents)
www.facebook.com/Blackcatclub
Pouncing into action the Black Cat Club bring the best 60s Soul & Rhythm 'n' Blues, Latin Boogaloo, Funk 45s , Ska & Reggae and Jazzy Grooves to the Bullet on a bi-monthly basis!

▲ SONNY DELIGHT (Strictly Business)
www.mixcloud.com/sonny_delight/
The co-promoter & DJ from the legendary Strictly Business Events presents his pick of the best 90s hip hop, funk and party pumping records.

▲ AMBASSADOR (What We Do / Kane FM)
www.mixcloud.com/Ambassador_DaVinciSound/
The DJ & promoter from of our monthly What We Do event hits the decks with his mighty mix of dub, reggae & hip hop records. Hear him every Monday live on Kane FM!

ABOUT US! 
The Silver Bullet is a live music and party venue outside Finsbury Park station, open 7 days a week and until 3.30am on Friday and Saturday nights with a seriously fat sound system, super safe bar staff, amazing artwork, brilliant booze selection and a house-party/family ethos that represents the whole rainbow of genres. 

Support our independent party pad and SHARE the love!

TANIA VULCANO: (dc10 / circo loco) The indisputable First Lady of Circo Loco and Queen of DC10 Ibiza, Tania Vulcano was there when it all began on those Monday mornings back in 1999 and continues to be a beacon for quality underground music. Whilst still typically playing the headline Terrace set for Circo Loco at DC10, Tania is global representative for the brand and continent-hops every weekend to meet the persistent demand for her music. Unsurprisingly, in many ways it is Tania's sound itself that acts as a showcase for what Circo Loco is all about. Vulcano, Uruguayan incidentally, now also runs the successful label Isgud Records along with Tato. Featuring her own productions and others that truly embrace the deep spirit of deep, percussive vinyl grooves, Isgud has rapidly garnered a reputation for only the finest house music.

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/nightclubber-ro/tania-vulcano-closing-2011

--

MARTINEZ: (cocoon / cadenza / moon harbour) Martinez, by birth Martin Swanstein, was born in 1981 and raised in the southernmost part of Sweden. At an early age he discovered techno and house music. Since he already played various instruments it was a natural progression to begin producing music himself. He also got into DJing and started hunting down techno records and got into mixing. Some years later, a demo tape earned him the opportunity to develop his production skills in the Wrong Steps studio in Stockholm, where he co-produced some of his own tracks together with the French producer Manuel Perez. One of these early tracks later appeared as “Late Night Groove” on Martin's debut 12" on the Swedish label Deeplay Music.
In 2000 Martinez moved from his small hometown in Swedish to the more open musical climate of the Danish capital, Copenhagen. This encouraged him to put even more time and energy into his music productions and not long after this he landed a record deal with the renowned Guidance Recording label in Chicago. First out was the “Laidback Grooves EP” with its mix of Deep House and Broken Beats and two more EP were to follow. Martinez earlier work includes remixes for Danish pop/house act Filur as well as Silicone Soul, Jussi Pekka, Dibaba, Spiro Projecto and later Underworld, Luna City Express, Miss Kittin, Mathew Dear & Seth Troxler, Joel Mull, Leon and his remix of Nathan Fake's “The Sky Was Pink” was a big hit in the DJ world.

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/martinswanstein/martinez-bonheur-podcast-01

--

COPY PASTE SOUL: (exploited / gruuv) The rise of new artist Copy Paste Soul over the past 18 months has seen the elusive producer garner the support of the electronic music elite, with luminaries such as Annie Mac, Justin Martin, MistaJam, Skream, T. Williams, Modeselektor, Disclosure, and Tensnake all supporting his soul-quenching sub-heavy rave inspired sound. By incorporating his love of Detroit Techno, Drum & Bass and UK and US garage into a finely honed style, Copy Paste Soul is leading the charge with his left-of-centre broken-house sound.
Releases such as his ‘Blink’ and ‘Look At Me’ EPs on the highly respected Exploited earlier in 2013 caused respective storms, and remixes for the likes of Photek, Deadmau5 and Alex Barck on Sonar Kollektiv, as well as Hugo on Gruuv signal that his production nous is respected and sought after by those in the know.
Recent high-profile gigs such as the O2 Academy Oxford for Annie Mac's Presents Party have had the industry talking and his terrace performance at Carl Cox’s Revolution Night at Space Ibiza had the likes of Carl Cox, Loco Dice and Louis Vega all dancing in the booth as he closed his set. Upcoming gigs at Bestival and IN:Motion in Bristol signal that Copy Paste Soul’s assault on the elite is happening in double-time.
2013 is still yet to see a return to Exploited for two more EPs, plus an outing on Gruuv following the successful remix for Audiojack's imprint earlier this year. So watch this space, sit back and have your soul soothed by the bass heavy beats of Copy Paste Soul.

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/copy-paste-soul

--

COLIN CHIDDLE: Colin Chiddle is the co fouder of Art of Dark which is one of Londons most successful events providing the best underground parties around. Art of Dark is the label recently born from one of Londons most successful new parties. Beginning life as a secret, invite only adventure for those closest to house music’s cutting edge, it has since gathered together a collection of residents and regularly returning guests. The output of the label will consistently reflect the sound of that collective.


--

METS: DJ Mets has been around for some time now. Resident DJ at events like Funkinyou, Key Of Life and Promised Land, he is constantly DJ'ing at the top events in the UK.Turning his successful promoting hand at music production, Mets debut EP came out on Funkinyou records last year and his track 'Not Over' out on brand new record label Cut A Rug Records recently received big support from many artists, further releases music due from Mets in 2014.

soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/dj-mets-1/dj-mets-key-of-life-january

287565234738927.description:
Chris Collins

After being part of the Geushky crew in the 90's and playing alongside Ian Void, Dave Clarke, Surgeon and The Advent to name a few, Chris joined the digital revolution and started his show Break on Fnoob Techno, an hour from a guest followed by an hour of new, unsigned and up and coming artists and labels. Focusing on the tougher side of techno the show is in its second year and going well. 

Chris' uncompromising style has seen him play with Billy Nasty and with gigs at Phase 9 in Belfast and the Fnoob Bristol show with Hans Bouffmeyre planned things are looking good.

Chris has just started his own free label Anti Gasmask Techno Militia

https://soundcloud.com/pompey-chris

Nomad Spectrum

Nomad Spectrum who produces a spacey dark flavour of techno with a number of releases on Rough Rabbit, Sonic Boom, Viral Outbreak Digital and Dark and Sonorous with more releases in the near future. He can be heard on various Podcasts with his own monthly shows playing flowing, ambient, dark, experimental and hard techno 

Nomad Spectrum has gigged extensively in London, the home counties and Europe since the early 90s 

Also he is the Director of Fnoob Techno Radio a popular internet channel with over 200 residents he is also the co-founder of Subsekt.com a techno production community, which has a forum,blog and podcast 

https://soundcloud.com/nomad-spectrum


400cc (France)

"Resident on Fnoob radio since last September, 400cc has been spreading the techno word throughout her city of Lyon, France for the past 6 years.
The very minimal playlist of the starts has made way, little by little, to more punchy sounds. 400cc has negotiated a fair deal between her love for heavy rock guitars and fat beats: TECHNO IT IS, and techno it has been since then. Her main influences are producers like Industrializer, Hackler & Kuch, Niereich, Sebastian Groth, D.A.V.E. the Drummer.....
She's now working on releasing her own tracks.
Banging sounds and no concessions, but also and above all a true pleasure at sharing her discoveries, 400cc has always put forward in her sets the happy and wild atmosphere created by techno music and the crowds dancing to it.
Music without concessions, pounding beats for happy people: Join the party d°°b"

https://soundcloud.com/400cc
https://www.facebook.com/DJ400cc

DJ LP

DJ LP aka Leon Pakiry has been playing at Portsmouth Techno Parties since the late 90's, having been heavily influenced by UK legends Colin Favor, Colin Dale, Dave Angel & DJ Warlock in the mid 90's, once he reached the age he was legitimately allowed into clubs, the natural progression was to get behind the decks & become a part of  a thriving techno scene that was around in Portsmouth at the time....
Fast forward 15 years & now a resident DJ & Co-Promotor of Portsmouth's Best Underground Techno Night: Perforate, who have weekly radio shows on local station LushFM & a monthly residency on Fnoob Techno Radio, plus regular monthly Parties at Portsmouth's best underground venue The Barn.....
All of which provide DJ LP with a platform to showcase his energetic DJ sets of Machine Funk style Techno to the Down Right Banging style he grew up with!

https://soundcloud.com/leon-pakiry

Dj Altered State

Dj Altered State is new to the DJ'ing side of the music scene but has always been into music from an early age. It was not until the age of 20 when she had a go on Technics 1200's and loved the feel of it. In late 2013 she became a resident DJ on fnoob.com doing a monthly show called Paradisiak. Also she has released music on various labels under the name Minimal Widget.

https://soundcloud.com/minimal_widget
287565234738927.name: Fnoob Techno Live - London 2

288819244609935.description:
The HiFi Club is proud to present JEROME LOL and ONEMAN w/ DJ Reece, Wax Romeo and A-Mac

Tickets Available @ Grassroots, Group Seven & Sloth Records

JEROME LOL______

Jerome Potter's talents first found a home within the electronic duo LOL Boys, a collaborative project sparked via an online message board with likeminded DJ/producer Markus Garcia. Around the same time, Jerome also ignited a relationship with fellow LA resident Samo Sound Boy that developed into them starting the record label BODY HIGH, a preeminent platform for underground club music in America that's housed releases from the likes of Todd Edwards, DJ Sliink, DJ Funeral and more.

In September of 2012, after multiple releases under the LOL Boys pseudonym - including the critically acclaimed Changes EP - Jerome and Markus decided to go their separate ways birthing Jerome's solo enterprise, Jerome LOL.

Since the parting, Jerome LOL's touring and DIY releases have been essentially non-stop, debuting his innovative "One Day" music series as well as multiple remixes for the likes of Classixx, Tomas Barfod, D33J, and more.  With all this under his belt, Jerome LOL is set to make his official debut on Friends of Friends with the four-track EP "Deleted/Fool."  The EP is a continuation of the dualities Jerome explored in his "One Day" series. He shows us how easily he can manipulate satisfaction into melancholy, evoking an array of emotions.  

ONEMAN_________

“There are DJs that are heavily tied to styles, people who go on to become figures synonymous with a certain sound or a particular approach to mixing; and then there are DJ’s DJs – a different breed of people who manage to make the whole process of blending records from disparate genres look (and sound) seamless. Often, it’s not just about beat matching perfectly, it’s as much about capturing a mood and evolving it through your record selections as it is locking on to a consistent rhythm and that’s something that Streatham bred DJ, Steve Bishop, has proven himself to be mightily adept at over the years.” Fabric, 2012

"Oneman has almost single-handedly
re-invented old school garage - taking the art of djing to a new level - recontextualising 2 step garage into dubstep, grime, funky, 'wonky' and beyond. He is the only artist ever to appear on Mary Anne Hobb’s BBC Radio 1 show without releasing a single record." - Cargo, London.

"It's a kind of an unwritten rule but by and large to become a big DJ in dubstep you need either two things: An incredible arsenal of new dubplates, or a talent for production such that you have, well, an incredible arsenal of new dubplates. But recently a DJ has managed a steep climb up the scene's ranks without either. He is DJ Oneman." - Martin Clark, Pitchfork.
288819244609935.name: JEROME LOL (Body High/LA) X ONEMAN (502/London) w/ DJ Reece, Wax Romeo and A-Mac
