449979365147480.description:
Né au Cap Vert,c’est à l’âge de 10 ans qu’il arrive en France. Après un parcours prometteur dans le football, c’est suite à une blessure que ce mélomane inconditionnel découvre peu à peu l’univers de la musique...Evoluant tout d’abord dans le rap,son esprit ouvert et sa passion pour les rencontres lui permettent de découvrir et de s’exercer à de nombreux styles musicaux. Repéré par l’association «Cannes Jeunesse», c’est lors d’un échange culturel deplus d’un mois à Londres qu’AL’ VARELA es surnommé par ses amis PAPA LONDON.
Curieux par nature,AL’VARELA se cherche pendant près de deux années...Entre rencontre et découverte, il affine son style dance hall latino et perfectionne son travail...Auteur, compositeur, interprète, il est reconnu par ses pairs dès 2006, notamment en se produisant à Londre qu’il avait découvert quelques années auparavant, pendant les festivals et autres événements. En juillet 2009, AL’VARELA aka PAPA LONDON sort son premier titre en solo«DANSA KUDURO». L’accueil du public est plus que favorable et lui permet de se classer pendant plusieurs
semaines dans le Top10 Yacast Club. Entre shows, concerts et séances studio à travers le monde, AL’VARELA prépare depuis mai 2012 son premier album intituléNUNCA ES TARDE, dont est issu le premier single: SUENO CALIENTE un son vraiment caliente.
449979365147480.name: Show Case Al'Varela aka Papa London

452438851553393.description:
A night of hip hop, breakbeat, and dubstep....

PETE CANNON & DR. SYNTAX
JMAN
SUPER SOUL SOLDIERS
PWORD
MAIR OF LONDON
DISTURBANCE
MR. BRISTOW

Pete Cannon  
 
"Boisterous Blackpudlian super-producer with hair so genius it's underappreciated in its own time.” 
For years – decades, even - hip hop music admirably trundled along, noticeably lacking a certain something.  
Nobody knew what that something was. All we knew was, it was something… Blackpool.  
Until the chance discovery of a battered old Moog synthesizer in a skip by a 12 year old Pete Cannon’s father gave birth to a musical prodigy who has become one of the most prolific producers and hairstyles in the country. It’s fair to say that if you have even a passing interest in UK hip hop music then there’s a good chance you probably already like Pete Cannon.  
Producer, DJ, Lad, Video Maker, Hair Mogul, Pete has amassed a list of production credits longer than some sort of massively long thing (like a huge snake or a tapeworm or something), with projects with the likes of Sway, Jam Baxter, Dirty Dike, Sonnyjim, Lunar C, Stig of the Dump, Million Dan and trans-Atlantic collaborations with Detroit legend Guilty Simpson, Action Bronson, Maffew Ragazino, with a cheeky play on US radio by DJ Premier thrown in for badman measure. Soz.  
Alongside producing the hugely successful and adorably named Dirty Dike album ‘Return of the Twat’ (High Focus records), 2013 also saw Pete yield mainstream chart success by producing two tracks on Rizzle Kicks’ album Roaring 20s - including the hit single Lost Generation.  
Outside of hip hop production, Pete has been known to occasionally get on the mic – although he definitely isn’t the elusive BARZ baron MC Double Mint – but does operate under the headband-donning, synth and bass impresario alias Opal Block, with a 12" vinyl release due in 2014 through Astral Black records. 
 
Dr Syntax 

“A Banbury rap baritone with sounds smoother than a sanded egg” 
As a fresh faced teen in the early 00s, Dr Syntax packed a knapsack full of Big Daddy Kane, Wu Tang and Redman cassettes, and bid farewell to the lush Oxfordshire countryside, moving to Brighton to follow his ambition of making hip hop music. 
This Slick Wittington rap pilgrimage soon bore fruit with Syntax becoming a prominent figure in the city's hip hop scene, winning various local battles, and forming The Menagerie with Professor Elemental, Tom Caruana and DJ Nick Maxwell.  
Shortly after the release of their debut album – 'Wild Kingdom' in 2003, Syntax met the legendary Foreign Beggars, promptly appearing on their debut 'Asylum Speakers' on 2 tracks (What Goes Up and Glacial). He became a regular collaborator, appearing on their next 2 albums 'Stray Point Agenda' and 'United Colours of Beggatron', touring extensively with them at festivals including  Glastonbury festival and Hip Hop Kemp.  
The release of his next album 'Self Taught' brought Syntax critical acclaim, appearing in Hip Hop Connection's 'Top 100 UK hip hop albums of all time' list, and high profile support slots at this time included Slum Village, The Pharcyde, People Under The Stairs, Necro, KRS One and Wu Tang Clan.  
After winning a UK heat of New York's legendary emcee competition 'End Of The Weak' in London in 2007, the release of second album 'Benny Huge' saw his first link with Pete Cannon, and following a move to Manchester, they have been performing live together ever since, including support slots for Ugly Duckling, Pharoahe Monch, and Chali 2na.  
A Slice Of Fried Gold followed Benny Huge – conceived after Shaun Of The Dead director Edgar Wright sent producer Tom Caruana all the audio from his films dialogue with carte blanche to sample on the album. The pair gained vocal fans in both Wright and Simon Pegg in the process, with the former playing album track ‘Universal’ in a mix for BBC Radio 1.  
In 2013, Chart sensations Rizzle Kicks enlisted Syntax in an incredible  line-up for the posse cut remix of their hit single, ‘Dreamers’, alongside Ed Sheeran, Pharoahe Monch, Chali 2na, Professor Green OV (Foreign Beggars) and Hinesy Hines.  
Syntax’s more recent work with Manchester band The Mouse Outfit has put Syntax at the forefront of one of the most exciting unsigned acts in the country. The 9-piece band and emcee collective garnered massive support from the UK hip hop scene and further afield, touring extensively across the country and Europe, with their debut album Escape Music being featured by US News website ABC in their best worldwide albums of 2013.

You can download the mixtape 'Still At Large', mixed by DJ Woody, for free from www.drsyntax.bandcamp.com.


JMAN, the verbally gifted, dreadlock sporting, baby faced charmer that has been compared to “Blanka when charging up from streetfighter when he spits” is a jack of all trades from Mcing/hosting Hip hop, Grime, Drum & Bass, Dubstep to producing, Dj’ing and engineering. Born & raised in Croydon, Jman was always eager to be involved in the Garage/Grime scene that surrounded him at a young age. Over the past couple years he's been all over the country and parts of Europe, drawing people in with immediate stage presence hitting you with conscious topics too vibrant comedy tracks and ending off with a surge of energetic madness using his notorious triple time flow that will leave you wanting more and more.

Jman is currently working on his debut Album "Auranography" featuring some of the U.K's finest and has released his first three singles “4D Reality”, “Any point of the day” & “Father figures” 

Over the years, Jman has hosted/Mc for: Skream, Benga, Artwork, Caspa, Rusko, Ntype, Kromestar, Coki, Distance, Hatcha, Terror Dainjah, Spooky, Spyro, Pantha, Cluekid, Lurka, Pinch, Redlight, Sukh Knight, Plastician, Wookie, Chase & status, Breakage, Chef, Komonazmuk, Reso, Joker, Mary Anne Hobbs, Doctor P, Trolley Snatcha, Funtcase, Flux Pavillion, 16 bit, Cookie monsta, Eddie K, The Others, Jakes, Chasing Shadows, Skizm, Scratch Perverts, Emalkay, Synkro, Kryptic Minds, Icicle, Benton, Unitz, Terrafonix, Jfb, Andy C, High Contrast, Shy FX, Alix Perez, DJ Fresh, Rockwell, Drumsound & bassline smith, Brookes bros, Original sin, Taxman, Wilkinson, Commix, N.Blackmarket, Crissy Criss, Benny Page, & more.

He then went on to perform his solo Hip hop/Grime here, there and everywhere being the support act for such artists as Immortal Technique, R.A the Rugged man, Afrika Bambaataa, Akil, Souls of Mischeif, DJ, Vadim, David Rodigan, Sha Stimuli, Rodney P, Taskforce, Skinnyman, Phi Life Cypher, Jehst, Klashnekoff, Micall Parkunsun, Foreign Beggars, Pmoney, Newham Generals, Lethal Bizzle & much more...

You can download his debut album 'Auranography' here
http://greasyvinyl.bandcamp.com/album/auranography

MORE RIGS, DJ'S AND SITE CREW WANTED!!
Please get in touch if you want to volunteer for this event, and  FIRST AIDERS please get in touch and make yourselves known, the safety of the people is important to us and we appreciate your assistance if and when it's necessary.
Also burger vans, tea stands, ice cream vans etc are also welcome. 
Follow the links at the bottom of the page and get in contact.
Any market places will be charged a £30 tax to cover rubbish disposal costs, however we offer a 50% refund to outfits that help out with the clean up operation.

RULES TO THE RAVE:
FIRST AND FOREMOST ENJOY YOURSELF!!!

but...

Please respect the land and keep your area tidy.

Please no selling nos or risk confiscation, you may bring your own whippets, but please recycle your balloons and tidy up after yourself.

Please no glass bottles.

Please no offensive weapons. drugs, mugs, thugs or thieves.

Subject to searches upon arrival, refusal of admission reserved but unlikely.

FURTHER INFO:
Message us with your name and number and email address, we will in turn (a week before) message you back with info line details, we also send you a email to confirm that we have recieved your number cheers :).

Since the release of the iconic ‘Dance for JAPAN’ video published over 3 years ago – LONDON is now back to present another charitable event. For this upcoming event, we will dance to help raise monies to assist the Philippines from their recent Typhoon Haiyan disaster. Come out for a very special afternoon packed with live performances and a vibrant atmosphere to support the people of the Philippines as they struggle to rebuild their homes. 

All donations collected will proceed to the British Red Cross charity; to aid the Philippines through their recovery from Typhoon Haiyan. 

****************************************************
Date: Saturday 12th April 2014
Time: 1:00PM – 5:00PM
Location: The Scoop at More London, Queen's Walk, London, SE1 2DB. UK
****************************************************

ATTENTION TO ALL DANCERS:
Please prepare a solo or group performance showcasing the very best of your dance moves! Those who are unable to form a group will have to improvise on the day – you will be allocated into groups by the team of organisers. 

DJ GOSU will be creating EXCLUSIVE mixes for the event. Prepare yourselves for MIND BLOWING MASH-UPS to accommodate even your most CRAZIEST & DARING set of dance moves ;)

JORDAN BELFORT IS COMING TO LONDON!!!

If you're a fan/ entrepreneur and/ or in sales don't miss this AMAZING opportunity on the 28th May in London Excel Centre!!! 

His website: 
http://wolfofwallstreetuk.com/special/

For group deals or to win a FREE ticket, please check with me. 

To book your seat call me on: +44 (0)75 0325 3079

Time: 6.30 pm - 10.00 pm 
Location: London Excel Centre 

Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sv-JMlQWUWY

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Your opportunity to discover
The Ever Evolving Formula for Success

Jordan Belfort learned the hard way that success at anything in life – from building your career or business, defining entrepreneurial vision, enhancing relationships to creating wealth - has a ‘formula’… a system of ‘rules’.

By developing a unique understanding of those rules he now knows how to “fail elegantly” - because the real lessons are in the failures. And he knows how to succeed wildly!


Getting behind the Truth of Jordan’s Success

Jordan is committed to showing you how you can replicate his strategies for massive success without having to endure his punishing failures.

From his paper route at age 8 to the brokerage firm he launched in his early twenties: You’ll have the unique opportunity to hear about pivotal moments in his life story. The first flush of success. The near destruction. And the lessons he learnt from them.

WHAT WILL YOU LEARN?

** What holds back the average person from achieving more in life?

** The 8 skills you must know for business, sales & entrepreneurial success

** Overcoming the 6 limiting beliefs about money
** The 4 Rules of entrepreneurship
** His “Three Tens” - creating and measuring certainty
    Mastering the hidden language of influence
    The power of modelling and mentorship

** The crucial difference having goals and having a vision
** Increasing your sales confidence, closing rate and income
** How to establish instant rapport with your sales prospects
** The ten-step formula for creating referrals and customers for life
** How to raise money through Venture Capital and Angel Investors

464102257069598.description:
Mittwoch, 30.4  -  JSTAR & DJ CONSTRUCTION

“Jstar is an original don… Early dj that helped inspire the Major Lazer crew! Bad man!” - DIPLO

Jstar, seines Zeichens Remixer, Produzent und DJ aus London begann 2003 mit einem kleinen Underground Label auf sich aufmerksam zu machen, auf dem er eigene, dublastige Remixe vertrieb, die sich schnell hoher Beliebtheit erfreuten und alsbald fester Bestandteil in den Dj Sets von Größen wie Sir Norman Jay, David Rodigan, Grandmaster Flash, Dj Vadim, Benji B und Diplo wurden.
Neben seinen richtungsweisenden Produktionen überzeugt er zudem auch mit genreübergreifenden Dj Skills und versteht es in seinen Sets DnB, Moombahton, HipHop, Reggae und den Boogaloo Sound der 60er zu einem einzigen tanzbaren Schmelztiegel zu vereinen.
Beim Tanz in den Mai im Kurt & Komisch wird Jstar begleitet von Dj Construction aus Hamburg, Turntablist with Attitude und einem Näschen für neue Sounds und Beats, die die Seele verwöhnen. What more can i say?

465389490237964.description:
The Zenaswingers 
WITH Adamo Ciarallo  and Vicci Moore 

proudly announce
the first workshop of the series

CONFESSIN' THE BLUES

March, 29th-30th 
in Genova, 
Immagine Danza - Via Carlo Varese 1

2 days of classes - 2 giorni di lezione
2 night of music - 2 serate di musica e ballo

Sabato dalle 14 alle 19
domenica dalle 15 alle 19.30

sabato sera, serata di ballo con Guitar Ray and the Gamblers al Teatro della Gioventù!
Domenica serata al Kitchen Genova.


bookin on-line
per prenotare on line

www.swingdancegenova.net/blues

CHI SONO VICCI&ADAMO? 

Vicci e Adamo stanno rapidamente diventando la coppia d'insegnanti di blues preferita in Uk ed in Europa.

Insieme organizzano Sin City Blues e Stompin' the Blues, lezioni di Blues ad East London e sono responsabili di Blues at The Ritzy, un evento mensile di blues che si tiene nel Sud di Londra. Sono anche co-organizzatori dell'Espanish Blues Festival a Madrid. 

Sono due dei primi insegnanti di Blues europei ad essere andati ad insegnare negli USA, a NYC, in agosto, dove hanno insegnato a Nocturne Blues .

Adamo e Vicci hanno un'alchimia incredibile in pista, dove esprimono intensità, eleganza e musicalità. La loro passione per il blues è evidente e traspare dalle loro lezioni che donano ispirazione, dando un'impronta energica e dinamica, con un occhio alla creatività; imparerete con loro a sviluppare una profonda relazione con la musica, mentre loro vi incoraggeranno a trovare il vostro blues.

Entrambi insegnanti esperti, Vicci ed Adamo amano creare nuovi modi intuitivi per comunicare concetti tecnici ai loro studenti. Le loro lezioni sono interattive ed interdiscipinari e spesso comprendono disegni, discussioni, bande elastiche giganti e persino bacchette! :)

Per loro, il vostro corpo è uno strumento ed il vostro ballo è la musica che suonate, e vi aiuteranno a scoprire il modo in cui si muove il vostro corpo, sotto una luce nuova.
Nelle loro lezioni, imparerete davvero a sentire il Blues!

www.adamociarallo.com
www.viccimoore.com

Non perdete questa fantastica occasione
CONFESSIN' THE BLUES - A SERIES OF WORKSHOPS sta arrivando!!!

per info
info@swingdancegenova.net
Silvia +39 349 70 66 009

471549089637212.description:
This month, your good friends at UNWIND, together with the fine folks of PLSTK & Future Sounds Classic proudly present:

SWINDLE
BUTTERZ . DEEP MEDI . RINSE FM - LONDON U.K.

ALSO WITH...

W1SHONE . MONIQUECOQUILLA . QUIXSLVR . MARKPLSTK 

UNWIND IS LOCATED AT BACK BAR
FRIDAY MARCH 28 . 21+ . 9PM - 2AM . $10 DOOR

---- 

SWINDLE
BUTTERZ . DEEP MEDI . RINSE FM
A man with a penchant for funk-fuelled productions with a grime twist, South-Londoner Swindle has firmly cemented his place on the UK’s electronic music circuit over the last three years thanks to his psychedelic approach to anything he turns his hand to.
Taking time to hone his craft through working with highly-revered UK artists such as Roll Deep, Chipmunk, Professor Green and Asher D, the producer began to focus his attention on solo instrumental productions with 2009’s Curriculum Vitae album showcasing his interpretation of Grime and electronic music on the whole that falls in the 140 BPM template.
 
His work instantly grabbed the attention of Rinse FM DJ duo Elijah & Skilliam and soon after they gave his music a platform on their weekly radio show and further down the line their record label, Butterz. This led to heightened interest from the wider electronic music scene and spurned singles such as Airmiles (released via-Planet Mu) and Mood Swings (released via Butterz) which propelled him onto the DJ circuit where he has become a mainstay in clubs up and down the UK and Europe.

The 25-year old prides himself on a distinct sound that is rooted in Funk – from George Clinton and Parliament Funkadelic to Roy Ayers he encapsulates the spirit of the sound in his work, whether it be the bass-heavy exploits of Pineapple or the intricate melodies on recent Deep Medi heavy hitter Do The Jazz.

2012 has already seen Swindle release Ignition (which featured one half of Newham General’s Footsie and Nadia Suliman) and Need To Know (co-produced with BBC Radio 1’s Toddla T) that featured the Roger Troutman-esque vocals of Sam Frank. He’s also teamed up with fellow Deep Medi artist Silkie on the production front with the single ‘Unlimited’ which finally saw the light of day on Butterz and their relationship promises to be a fruitful one if their back to back sets at seminal London club nights FWD and Butterz & Hardrive are anything to go by.

Showing that he’s no one-trick pony he’s also been featured in Q Magazine where he featured on Amy Winehouse’ Back To Black tribute compilation.  To commemorate the late-singer’s debut album, Swindle teamed up with songstress Baby Sol and covered ‘Some Unholy War’ – managing to add his creative input to rework a track from one of his musical inspirations.
The road ahead for Swindle looks promising. With more diverse projects on Deep Medi to come as well as holding down his radio show on Rinse FM there’s no doubt that he’s carrying the torch for funk and has no intention of letting it die out anytime soon.
471549089637212.name: UNWIND & PLSTK PRESENT - SWINDLE [BUTTERZ . DEEP MEDI . RINSE FM - LONDON U.K.]

After teaching hugely successful workshops in London 2012 and 2013, I am thrilled to announce that Sadie is coming back to teach again on 6th – 8th June 2014! This time there will be 5 fantastic workshops with certification  and a chance to get on one if you missed any of the others.

This lady needs no introduction but suffice to say Sadie is one of the most sought after performers and teachers of Oriental Dance (Bellydance) worldwide and is one of today’s most exciting and admired belly dance artists.

Workshop topics this year are:

Friday 6th June 7pm – 9pm “Rak the Drum Solo”
Saturday 7th June 1.15pm – 3.15pm “Drum Solo Choreography”
Saturday 7th June 4.15pm – 6.15pm “Raq ‘N Rolls, Flutters & Undulations”
Sunday 8th June 11am – 1pm ”Pops, Locks & Layers”
Sunday 8th June 2pm – 4pm “Creating your signature style”
Package price for all 5 workshops £180.00
Individual workshop prices £38.00 (paypal fees will apply) Full details can be found at www.bellyglitz.com

If you missed the workshops last time or were unable to get on any of them, now is your chance to book with her. Her workshops always sell out months in advance so don’t delay if you want to join! .  

Sadie will be performing at our fabulous showcase on Sunday 8th June 2014, and will be joined by our other great dancers on the night. Not to be missed!!

************************************************************
Presenting: "GRACE EVORA" LIVE SATURDAY.....

Grace Evora was born on February 2, 1969, on the island of São Vicente in Cape Verde. 

Grace has a total of four albums released : Total Love I (1994), Total Love II (1997), Romance (1999), Aventura (2003) and with this brand new best of album(2012) makes this his fifth album.

In 2010 he released his first Live dvd "live @ Rotterdam", in that show he invited some of the artist's which he was working trough the years to perform with him.
For Grace a dream come true when he won an music award for the best dvd of the year 
At the Cabo Verde Music Awards_ ! that was his ultimate recognition for his work

There are not many artists from Cabo Verde which are so successful as Grace Evora. 
In the 25 years of making music he rise and rise to the top of his dreams.
Like he always says "The only limit is our God"
Grace Evora is an ambitious musician who wants to share his love and talent with the world !

"Real music still alive"
God bless

- APRESENTAÇÃO IV ANIVERSÁRIO 10PRODUCTIONS

TRIKK é mais um motivo de orgulho dentro da cena electrónica portuguesa, ainda que tivesse que vingar lá fora antes de ser falado cá dentro.

Da Invicta para a capital Britânica desbrava terreno dentro da música house, criando um pequeno tumulto online à sua volta que suscitou o interesse de pessoas como George Fitzgerald que prontamente o "agarrou" para a sua editora Man Make Music.

Dotado de um excelente controlo da fluidez da pista através das suas produções, que já saíram por editoras como Get Physical, Hypercolour, Pets Recordings, Container ou Terrain Ahead, demonstra também uma capacidade extraordinária de tornar uma simples faixa 4x4 em algo viral que vai infectando quem o ouve. É "grave" e ao mesmo tempo suave e contido à medida certa, compondo aquele tipo de música electrónica que nos faz viajar durante horas sem cansar.

PASIÓN @ GRACE - The New 5 Star Bachata & Latin Night in the Heart of London Every Wednesday Night with 2 Rooms of Music and Dance!

Ola Latina & The Latin Passion are delighted to invite all Bachateros and Latin music lovers to this new weekly special night in Piccadilly Circus at the most elegant and trendiest of venues, GRACE. This is a weekly Bachata & Latin Night in the Heart of London, where all lovers of Bachata and Latin music and dance will be able to share their passion and dance the night away to their hearts' content. 

In order to make this a memorable night every week, we have set up a special program of lessons with The Latin Passion team, plus special guests AND have carefully hand-picked a number of top and well established Bachata & Latin DJs from London, to give that special flavour and quality that a great night needs.

GRACE boasts 2 gorgeous and stylish music rooms, 2 bars with a large selection of drinks and cocktails and VIP areas for those special occasions, or moments of extravagance. Special prices on selected drinks: Caipirihnas £3.50 / Brahma Beer £2.50

KABADDI MOVIE SCREENING
CORONET THEATRE
SE1 6TJ

DATE: 16-05-2014

(TICKET PRICE = £12)

TIME : 6PM - 9PM

DIRECTOR - RAM BABU GURUNG

PRODUCED BY - NISCHAL BASNET & SUNIL RUNIYAR

Duration: 123 minutes

Cast: 
Dayahang Rai, Nischal Basnet, Rishma Gurung, Rajan Khatiwada, Bijaya Baral, Buddi Tamang, Aruna Karki Pokharel, Sishir Bangdel, Pashupati Rai, Gobinda Rai, Kamal Mani Nepal, Puskar Gurung, Kabita Ale, Upendra Subba, Pradeep Chaudhary, Junu Bista, Hikmat Thapaliya, Suraj Yadav

Synopsis: 
Kazi, a third standard failed young man from Mustang dreams of marrying Maiya, daughter of his maternal uncle by any means. Maiya, on the other hand, student of high school is peeved by his idiotic behaviors, which always disappoints Kazi but never disheartens him. 

Supported by his two childhood friends Beekay and Chantyal, finally he decides to marry Maiya through capture marriage, which is illegal but still practiced by some ethnic communities in Nepal. 

To find her long gone father and to continue her studies in Kathmandu, Maiya elopes with a visitor named Bibek. Inflamed by her disappearance Kazi heads to Kathmandu in search of Maiya and finds himself trapped in a city conspiracy.

This will be our second movie screening, working with the same directors of LOOT who is also a producer and actor in this upcoming movie.

Hope to see you soon and lets get ready for some pop corn time.

FOR MORE INFO /  TICKETS CONTACT:

483130325128612.description:
HB004 Release party with : 

Perc (House Set - FIRST TIME IN UK ) [PercTrax / Submit Rec]
Enrico Mantini [Half Baked Records / UMM / Traxx Underground]
Greg Brockmann [Half Baked Records] 
Eyesmoon AKA Thomas Gimenez [Softporn]

-------------------------------------------------------

The previews are up and the response has been incredible, now it is time for the HB004 launch party!

First up is a man who was the last artist to take part in our Half Baked Workshop series. Perc, label boss of the brilliant Perc Trax will be playing a special house set for the first time ever to help us celebrate the launch of HB004. An internationally renowned DJ, Perc regularly plays at some of the biggest and best clubs right across the world, alongside some of the best DJ’s. Whilst he is known primarily for his techno, you should certainly not discount his knowledge of house music, with an ear for some incredible tracks we’re so excited to hear what he brings to play.

Next up is the man behind the EP, Enrico Mantini. A true pioneer of the deep house sound and a man who absolutely kills it every single time he plays for us. His releases on UMM in the nineties are still being played by DJ’s all over the world and the reception we’ve had of HB004 so far is no different! His signature, punchy, house sound can get the hands of any crowd up in the air - you can guarantee Enrico is going to get you dancing.

Half Baked resident Greg Brockmann is back! With us since the very beginning, Greg can always be relied on to entertain our beautiful London crowd. Now living in Berlin and providing music in some of the city’s most renowned clubs such as Tresor, Hoppetosse and Arena Club he is fully deserved of where he is today and it is a great pleasure to have such a good DJ as one of our residents.

Finally we have Eyesmoon or Thomas Gimenez as some of you may know him. A very close friend of the Half Baked Family, Thomas is originally from France but now living in London. As those of you who have seen him play before will know, he is an awesome DJ and he is definitely going to get you all warmed up perfectly for the rest of the night’s festivities. 

-------------------------------------------------------

This is a guestlist only party so if you want to be part of it then please send your full names to: 
guestlist@halfbaked.org.uk

Please remember that being on the guestlist does not mean you will definitely get in to the party. We reserve the right to refuse entry to people with the wrong attitude. This does not mean that only regulars can get in... Even if you have never been to Half Baked before but you possess the right attitude, and are respectful of yourself and those around you, then you have nothing to worry about! 


Half Baked Releases (Vinyl Only):

- HB 004 - Enrico Mantini with "Overflowing" 
https://soundcloud.com/half-baked-records/sets/hb004-enrico-mantini - RELEASED IN MARCH

- HB 003 - BirdsMakingMachine ( Fumiya Tanaka Remix) 
https://soundcloud.com/half-baked-records/sets/hb003-birdsmakingmachine 

- HB 002 - Mike Shannon with Slip it ( Thomas Melchior Remix) 
https://soundcloud.com/half-baked-records/sets/hb002-mike-shannon-east-side 

- HB 001- Various Artist with Seuil, Le Loup , Yakine & Robin Ordell
https://soundcloud.com/half-baked-records/sets/preview-hb001-v-a-le-loup 


Half Baked Records <3
483130325128612.name: Half Baked with HB004 Release party ( LONDON ) w/ Enrico Mantini & Perc (SPECIAL HOUSE SET )

Kviečiame visus, neabejingus “lietuviškuoju Brayanu Adamsu” tituluojamam atlikėjui, kovo 23 d. vakarą praleisti „Scala“ koncertų salėje (275 Pentonville Rd, London N1 9NL, United Kingdom), kurioje galėsite pasimėgauti išskirtiniu Gyčio Paškevičiaus tembru, nuoširdžiu, paprastu bendravimu, virpinančiomis širdį dainomis, apvainikuotomis neužmirštamais šlageriais „Šiam pasauly“, „Dalužė“, „Tu vėjo paklausk“, „Draugams“ ir kitais Jums pažįstamais autoriaus kūriniais.
Koncertų salė „Scala“ - išskirtinio grožio vieta pačiame Londono centre, netoli „King's Cross“ traukinių stoties. Gytis Paškevičius & "Crazy Crow" papildys įspūdingą „Scala“ pasirodžiusių muzikos kūrėjų sąrašą. „Coldplay“, Mobis, „Chemical Brothers“, Dido, Robbie Williams – tai tik keli iš žinomų vardų, kūrusių šio muzikinio klubo istoriją.

Bilietus galite įsigyti www.ticketweb.co.uk, Lituanica shops.

Renginio remėjas Lituanica.
Renginio pradžia 19:00
Bilieto kaina 35 £
N-18

493113284127173.description:
RAINBOW 

Spring addicted

Sabato 05.04.2014
dalle 23.00
SHABBA - Cantù - CO

Sorpresa!

Siamo tornati con un nuovo evento senza avvisarvi e senza fare nessun post sulla nostra pagina facebook ....
Abbiamo deciso di farvi una sorpesa e riportare il RAINBOW @ SHABBA ( la nostra piccola warehouse ) con un nuovo artista che sta facendo molto bene con uno dei gruppi più forti nella scena Londinese ....

Dal FUSE di Londra ROSSKO https://www.facebook.com/RosskoDJ

bio:
Nato nel 1984, Rossko vive nella periferia di Londra, in Essex, ed inizia ad innamorarsi della musica elettronica già all'eta di 14 anni.

Nella sua giovinezza, cresce con diversi generi e stili musicali, come l'Hip Hop, Jungle e Garage, che contribuiscono a maturare le sue sonorità, fino ad arrivare ad una forma più profonda di House & Techno.

All'età di 21 anni, Rossko si ritira dal calcio professionistico, a causa di un infortunio. Questa delusione, lo ha portato a focalizzare tutte le sue forze sulla musica e sul djing, in modo da poter esprimere tutto se stesso.

Dopo aver vissuto per 6 mesi a Madrid nel 2003, e dopo aver esplorato la scena underground londinese, la scelta di fare il dj fu naturale. 

Nel 2005-2008 Rossko diventa dj resident per Lost Souls, a Londra, party famoso per le feste diurne di sabato, presso il famigerato Public Life di Shoreditch. Qui perfeziona le sue qualità di dj, e le sue sonorità.

Dedica tutto il suo tempo e la sua fatica cercando sonorità originali, ed arriva così ad esibirsi in diversi clubs di Londra, quali:
The Key, The Cross, Egg, Turnmills, Ministry of Sound, Cafe1001, East Village and Home bar.
Arrivano poi performance in: Birmingham, Manchester, Southampton, Liverpool e più recentemente a Barcellona, Ibiza and Manheim, suonando al fianco di djs come: Loco Dice, Luciano, Nick Curly, Federico Molinari, H.O.S.H, Ray Okpara, Nima Gorji, Daniel Sanchez, Chris Liebing, Josh Wink, Tobi Neumann, Laidback Luke, Guy called Gerald, Tolga Fidan, Afrilounge, Men In Trees, Geddes.

Rossko è ora dj resident al Cerca Trova, ed al Fuse a Londra. 

STAY TUNED WITH US!

https://soundcloud.com/rossko

http://www.residentadvisor.net/dj/rossko

495093080600658.description:
The London Pride Parade will take place on Saturday 28th June 2014 from 1pm in Central London.

Registration for groups to take part in the Parade is NOW OPEN at http://prideinlondon.org/festival/parade-registration/

What is the Parade?

The Parade is a procession of walking groups and floats which together march through streets in the heart of London to celebrate the LGBT+ community. It is one of the largest LGBT+ Parades in the UK and your chance to show lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people from all over the UK, Europe and further afield the very best that London has to offer. The aim of the Parade is to have fun, campaign and ultimately showcase the LGBT+ community in London, the UK and overseas.

When is the Parade and what time does it start?

The Parade takes place on Saturday 28 June 2014, commencing at 13:00.

What is the Parade’s route?

The Parade departs from Baker Street and the procession then follows this route:

1) Straight down Orchard Street

2) Turns left into Oxford Street and continues to Oxford Circus

3) Turns right into Regent Street and continues to Piccadilly Circus

4) Passing Eros, it then carries on down Lower Regent Street

5) Turns left into Pall Mall and continues round to Cockspur Street, passing the south side of Trafalgar Square

7) Round the roundabout into Whitehall.

The route is approximately just over two miles long. The route does not follow the normal traffic layout as the streets have been closed for Pride in London.

Where and when does the Parade finish?

The Parade finishes at Whitehall at approximately 16:30.

What is the theme for the Parade?

The theme for this year’s Parade is ’Freedom to…’. This can interpreted in any form that you like but we encourage you to to dress and decorate your float appropriately to represent your chosen subject.

Examples are ‘Freedom to marry’ or ‘Freedom to holiday’, there are countless options open to you and is the ideal opportunity to demonstrate how far we have travelled, the goals left to achieve and to celebrate the invaluable contribution that the LGBT+ community makes to London today.

- See more at: http://prideinlondon.org/parade-faqs/#sthash.oGRpcfca.dpuf
495093080600658.name: Pride in London 2014 - Parade

"Here stood the house of SIR ISAAC NEWTON in which he lived from 1710 to 1727 & was visited by his friends Addison, Burnet, Halley, Swift, Wren and other great men."

Please join Edward Scissortongue and friends at Westminster reference Library on Saturday May 03 to celebrate the release of his sophomore release on High Focus Records 'THE THEREMIN EP'.

Edward Scissortongue will be joined by a sensational roster of forward thinking music makers on the night, all equipped with the diverse musical verve that will do the setting for the festivities justice. Westminister Reference Library is an iconic public library that houses over 45,000 reference titles on the arts...

LINE-UP:

EDWARD SCISSORTONGUE: Performing 'THE THEREMIN EP' in its entirety

LAMPLIGHTER: Exclusive MPC seance

JAM BAXTER: Spoken word set feat. special guests

MR. KEY & GREENWOOD SHARPS: Unheard album showcase

LEE SCOTT: Hardcore rap with manners

MOWGLI: Audio visual future sailor

DJ SAMMY B-SIDE: Future funk daydreams

MORE:

EDWARD SCISSORTONGUE:

High Focus Records artist EDWARD SCISSORTONGUE is extremely excited to preset 'THE THEREMIN EP' uncut, from top-to-tail, in its entirety.

LAMPLIGHTER:

We are delighted to announce that Glaswegian super producer, Kilamanjaro Records instrumentalist and the man behind Edward Scissortongue's debut album Lamplighter will be in town showcasing a series of musical masterpieces in the only way he knows how; crunching 
buttons and twizzling data wheels on his MPC.

JAM BAXTER:

Famed for his rambunctious live shows and crowd surfing / bone breaking antics, Jam Baxter will be in attendance premiering his first spoken word set in nearly five years. Expect cravats, fine wine and exceptional wordplay.

KEY & GREENWOOD SHARPS:

Contact Play aficionado Mr Key and wobble hop mastermind Greenwood Sharps have been sat in the lab putting the finishing touches to their debut album over the last couple of years. It is INCREDIBLE. We are delighted to have the duo on board as they prepare to premiere a long 
list of exclusives on the night.

LEE SCOTT:

Blah Records CEO and all-round super emcee Lee Scott will be doing what he does best; unloading track-after-track of classic unrelenting hip hop in trademark fashion. Expect equal doses of Charisma, anger and flamboyance from Mr Lee Scott on the night.

MOWGLI:

Rap visionary Mowgli has been touring a groundbreaking audio visual rap showcase of late. Reports of eyeballs popping clean out of skulls have been commonplace. Expect nothing short of audio visual bloodshed amongst the books from Mowgli and his team of movie makers.

DJ SAMMY B-SIDE:

High Focus Records go-to turntablist DJ Sammy B-Side will be in attendance spinning vinyls from the future (and offering Amuse-Bouche).

'THE THEREMIN EP' OFFICIAL LAUNCH @ WESTMINSTER REFERENCE LIBRARY, 35 ST MARTIN'S

502178883234175.description:
Grupo Niche is Colombia’s most emblematic salsa orchestra who have conquered the world for more than thirty years with their Cali-style salsa. They recently released  the album Tocando el Cielo Con Las Manos, containing a bunch of potential hits and demonstrating that the band is still at the top of its game.

Grupo Niche was formed by Jairo Varela and a group of like-minded, talented musicians and made their debut with the release of Al Pasito in 1980. After becoming one of the major tropical acts in their native country, the group had the opportunity to participate in a salsa festival at New York’s Madison Square Garden in 1986.  The band brought their dynamic sound to Europe for the first time in 1989. During the ’90s, Grupo Niche turned to romantic lyrics, leaving behind their traditional songs based on social issues and had numerous hits such as “Ana Mil”, “La Canoa Rancha” ‘ Cali Aji”, ” Una Aventura” ‘ Cielo de Tambores”, ” Gotas de Lluvia” and ” Cali Pachanguero”. Richie Valdez is the new musical director and Grupo Niche is alive as ever. To close La LInea 2014 the band will present their new work (including their summer hit “Un día después” ) and all the old favourites from the golden age of Colombian salsa.

Supported by a top line-up of London’s finest Colombian salsa djs to keep you dancing to the madrugada.

Tickets £26 plus booking fee

BUY TICKETS ONLINE

Via venue: http://www.seetickets.com/event/la-linea-presents-grupo-niche-djs/electric-brixton/756380

Ticket Web: http://www.ticketweb.co.uk/event/97695

519746428142682.description:
Brazil’s hip hop revelation Karol Conka has bounced bang into the spotlight thanks to neon energy, hard graft and a sound all her own. Mashing up hip hop with baile funk, trap and Afro-Brazilian beats, Karol Conka’s sound is a uniquely Brazilian mix. Batuque just got freaked.

Winner of the 2013 Multishow Best New Artist award, with over 2 million views of her video singles (Boa Noite also features on the FIFA 2014 EA game) and a blazing collaboration with Buraka Som Sistema for Adidas, Karol Conka is now set to take on the world with the international release of her debut album on Mr Bongo Records.

Karoline dos Santos Oliveira, aka Karol Conka, first set foot on stage in her home-town Curitiba in southern Brazil aged just 17. Ten years later, the young MC has proved that she has what it takes to be one of the most distinctive voices from today’s high-grade Brazilian hip hop scene.

One of the very few female Brazilian hip hop artists to break out of the underground, Karol Conka’s wider success was kicked off by the 2011 single Boa Noite (nominated for an MTV Brazil award). With the Brazilian launch of the album via VICE magazine, downloads and shows across the country, the rapper, singer and songwriter – influenced by Brazilian Pop Music (MPB) and a big Azealia Banks fan – has gained national recognition and critical acclaim. Hugely respected by her peers, she has also shared the stage with rap pioneers Racionais MCs, hip-hop hero Criolo and label-mate Marcelo D2, as well as recording with major rap star Projota and samba veteran Luiz Melodia.

Tickets £11 plus booking fee

http://www.SHOGUNAUDIO.co.uk

Belgian born Alix Depauw is the face behind production stature Alix Perez, now regarded as one of the most ground breaking and innovative producer-DJ of his generation. Shortly after his debut release, Alix sees himself catapulted to the fore front of the drum and bass scene carrying an ever growing reputation and sought after catalogue of music.

With a history of critically acclaimed releases on legendary labels such as Metalheadz, V recordings and Soul:R, Alix goes on to sign exclusively to Friction's very own imprint Shogun Audio, the home of his remarkable debut album "1984". Straying from the traditional confines of Drum and Bass, 1984 goes onto be one of the most highly anticipated and rated electronica albums of 2009 and beyond, gaining extraordinary reviews and extensive support globally. 

With collaborations ranging from legendary soul vocalist Peven Everett to lyricists Foreign Beggars, 1984's prominence in the history of drum and bass is further cemented with chart topping positions and rare reviews in publications such as the Metro, Mixmag and more. This leads onto remixes for staple labels such as Ninja Tunes for household names such as DJ Food, Hadouken and more.

525789957537798.description:
On the 1st September, we call on all dolphin friends to reunite together, this will mark the start of the awful Dolphin slaughter all over again and we need YOU to help make our message loud and clear to the Japanese Embassy, you have the opportunity to make a real difference to the lives of innocent animals by protesting the capture and slaughter of dolphins that is an atrocious annual tradition in Japan’s Taiji Cove. 

The little cove’s dirty great secret was uncovered in 2003, when marine conservation society Sea Shepherd released images of the now infamous ‘bloody cove’ – revealing the epicentre of the annual murder of 20 000 dolphins, porpoises and small whales which occurs in Japan every year between September and March. Since 2010 Sea Shepherd has maintained an ongoing presence of volunteers standing watch on the Cove site, known as The Cove Guardians. 

Australian Cove Guardian Emillie describes the scene she witnessed at Taiji Cove…

“A pod of 250 bottlenose dolphins spent days netted in the cove while their family unit was torturously torn apart. Dolphins deemed worthy for a life of captivity were stolen away. The remainder waited - disoriented, frightened and hungry until the eventual slaughter. On an almost daily basis I continued to witness intelligent, wild and free dolphin pods systematically driven into the cove only to depart as a commodity, either as a petrified prisoner or lifeless meat for human consumption. Every day, six months of the year, this is the reality of Taiji. And it is a visibly decaying town, symbolic of its archaic practices.”

The Japanese government maintain that Taiji is part of a cultural tradition, and yet the evidence is clear that this is a commercially driven endeavour, with the animals ending up in captivity, on the food market, or simply left injured in the oceans to die. Unlike whales, dolphins do not have an international organisation to offer them protection, so it really is down to us - the people of the international community to care enough to take action for these animals which scientists are increasingly discovering to be highly intelligent, emotional and social beings. 

Momentum is building rapidly for the opposition of dolphin and whale slaughter and capture in the form of global protests, a viral storm of Internet activity and media coverage including high profile documentaries. In 2009 the Academy Award winning documentary The Cove was released, featuring Richard O’Barry, a former dolphin capturer and trainer for the TV Series Flipper, who later dedicated his life to preventing the very same practice. The impact of this film now looks set to be matched by the recent release of the documentary Blackfish, which chillingly reveals the immorality and tragic consequences of keeping orca whales in captivity. 

Continued pressure is crucial. This Equinox Protest will act as a follow up to the extremely successful protest event of February 20th, during which over 1000 people arrived outside the Japanese embassy to show their derision at the Japanese government’s continued support of the annual slaughter. 

The world is waking up to the horrific reality of Taiji cove, but nothing will change unless we turn our awareness into action. Please join us at the protest on March 20th, to show Japan and the world that we no longer accept this and bring about a change desperately overdue.
525789957537798.name: London Demo for Dolphins - Against the Taiji Annual Hunt & Captivity

527837847333945.description:
Camino de los 40 años sobre los escenarios y sigue con la misma manera de vivir y entender el Rock. En todo este tiempo, pocos escenarios se le han resistido a Loquillo, una de las figuras más emblemáticas de la música española. Si había uno, era el de Londres, lugar donde se forjaron algunas de sus máximas influencias. Una vez dijo que “en el mundo anglosajón no podría surgir un Loquillo, el mundo anglosajón es demasiado light”. Y para demostrarlo estará sobre el escenario de la sala O2 Academy Islington de Londres el próximo  26 de  abril, dentro de la campaña de Guijuelo: The Land Of Iberic Delicacies. Un concierto especial en una noche histórica, una de esas en las que uno puede decir “yo estuve allí”.

VIP TICKET: El VIP ticket te dará acceso a la sala 1 hora antes de la apertura de puertas para poder disfrutar de una cata exclusiva de jamón e ibéricos de GUIJUELO, dentro de su campaña en U.K Guijuelo: The Land Of Iberic Delicacies. Meet & Greet con la banda y llevarte a casa un póster exclusivo firmado conmemorativo de esta histórica noche. Hay un número limitado, corre que vuelan!

El O2 academy Islington está muy cerca del metro de Angel y a 15 minutos andando tanto a Kings´Cross como a Shoreditch.

Para más info:

530943417001955.description:
Songlines Magazine described Kishon Khan’s Lokkhi TeRra as “London’s best kept secret and probably the world’s best Afrobeat- Cuban-Bangladeshi group”. Here they team up with ex-Fela Kuti keyboardist Dele Sosimi, the UK’s multiple award winning Afrobeat ambassador, to bring you a new musical mash-up between heavyweights on the London scene. CubAfrobeat is a groovetrain, travelling between Lagos Nigeria and Havana Cuba, but with the waiting/dancing room in London.

Featuring members of both Lokkhi Terra and Dele Sosimi Afrobeat Orchestra, this is a world premiere and a pre-cursor to a much awaited album due out at the end of 2014. Everyone say “yeah, yeah, si, si”

'The London Cuckolds' presents three marriages. Dashwell is married to the 'devout' Eugenia, Doodle to 'witty' Arabella, Wiseacres to 'simple' Peggy. Each husband thinks he is safe from being 'cuckolded' or cheated - but are they? Three young gallants - Ramble, Townley and Loveday - set out to prove them wrong!

Three confident husbands, three lively wives and three determined young rakes - with bed-hopping, mistaken identities, disguises and lovers in cupboards or under bedcovers. It is straightforward bawdy comedy and great fun.

540920242690820.description:
Buy tickets today at:
http://www.sjss.org.uk/events/london-piano-trio-0

Only £15 or £12.50 for groups!


Sakamoto - 1919
Christopher Gunning - Piano Trio No. 1 (World Premiere)
Korngold - Piano Trio in D major, op. 1


Join us as we celebrate three composers who successfully wrote music for both the concert hall and the screen. We start with Sakamoto’s ground breaking 1919, which features music to the movie ‘Merry Christmas Mr Lawrence’. The middle work is an exciting new commission by us of a trio by Christopher Gunning. Christopher’s film and TV work is extensive indeed, but he is most famous for writing the music for the hit series ‘Poirot’. 

Our concert finishes with Korngold’s only piano trio. Along with such composers as Max Steiner and Alfred Newman, he is considered an early pioneer of film music. Korngold’s 1938 Academy Award for his score to ‘The Adventures of Robin Hood’ marked the first time an Oscar was awarded to the composer rather than the head of the studio music department. - Robert Atchison

Deset let nato už značka STORM vítala nové milénium nejen jako výrobce unikátních hodinek, ale i jako designér stejně ojedinělých a nápaditých šperků i slunečních brýlí. 542383465877543.description:
- The Venue -
Dimension Interiors have expertly created an edgy venue that draws inspiration from London's cultural and creative diversity. Neon signs mix with tattoo artwork alongside graffiti murals, rustic furniture and pornography plastered toilets. The venue was previously home to home Ink Ldn, a club project by UK music artist Stephen Manderson, A.K.A Professor Green. An East End Club in the heart of the West End, LEVEL 5 is open daily from from 10pm - 3am and offers the best in music, food and drink under one very unique roof.

- The Night -
The music policy is open format, peppered with tracks from many genres. London's best DJ's on rotation provide a soundtrack offering a real mix of rock and roll, house, urban and classic dance floor fillers. The music and decor set the backdrop for one unique nightclub experience. Champagne quaffing Sloaneys mingle with East end Shoreditch hipsters, while Soho's taboo breakers show London tourists how to party. Celebrity patrons have included Professor Green, Ricky Hall, Keith Lemon, Emma Bunton, McBusted, Arabella Drummond, Jimmy Q, Professor Green, Millie Mackintosh and more.

- The Alcohol -
An extensive cocktail list is available, with a wide selection of premium spirits on offer. The bottle menu offers al of the usual bottled spirits in various sizes. A wide range of Champagnes are on offer too, topped with a sparkler for the attention seekers!

- Guestlist & Table Bookings -
Advance bookings are strongly recommended, with a number of table booking options and birthday packages available. For Guestlist & Table reservations visit www.level5london.com

Artist Info:

When London drum’n'bass duo, Chase & Status aka Saul Milton (Chase) and Will Kennard (Status) first laid down the tracks that would make up their third studio album, they were faced with a weighty dilemma: how to follow the sizeable footprint left by 2011′s multi platinum selling No More Idols, not to mention their hefty rep as festival headliners?

The answer was found with Brand New Machine, an album that brims with surging, dancefloor anthems, dusty trip hop grooves as championed by the likes of Massive Attack and Portishead, and a collection of jungle and garage breakbeats that increase with substance over repeated plays. Meanwhile, brooding ragga harmonies and hip hop samples deliver an updated take on No More Idols’ anthemic, catch-all appeal. The overall vibe? An instantly memorable collection of swaggering cuts tuned to a club setting, hyped summer festivals and arenas alike.

“This album was more about getting down what we were feeling, what we were into and what sounded good. No More Idols greatly exceeded our expectations, which was an incredible feeling and something we hadn’t planned. It was a real buzz.”

“This time around I guess we found the inspiration for what we wanted the album to sound like in our own record collections and experiences. We were born in the ’80s, we grew up in the ’90s we went raving, we went to rock gigs. That scene, that vibe, that culture; the rude boy clothes, the end-of-the-weekend club scene going to see Jumpin’ Jack Frost it all seeped into the recording. The Prodigy, Massive Attack, the east coast and west coast rap sound…those things pushed us to get the tunes down. That was the inspiration for the record. We didn’t want to follow the crowd, we wanted to do what sounded good to us.”

Early sketches for what would later become Brand New Machine’s infectious rhythms were laid down at the end of 2012, following an exhaustive world tour that trailed the buzz set by No More Idols. Having moved from their studios on the South Bank in London (the building, owned by 1980s pop producer Pete Waterman, was sold to make way for the new London Dungeons museum) Chase & Status relocated to Tileyard, a clubby, hit-making factory in Kings Cross occupied by the likes of Mark Ronson, Zane Lowe and Basement Jaxx. Inspiration came in a rush.

“The tracks arrived out of nowhere,” says Kennard. “At first, after recording for a while, we didn’t know whether we had anything. Then we sifted through our beats and riffs and thought, ‘Oh that’s a really good idea. And that, and that…’ Then we started working on them in more detail. At the time we were listening to loads of hip hop, experimental drum’n'bass and dance music that wasn’t super electronic. We were loving stuff with more soul.” Their early recordings set an interesting tone. Rather than leaning upon the old school rave sound that had previously fuelled hit singles such as Blind Faith, Chase & Status looked to a different influence from the early ’90s: the crackling beats and soulful strings that first laid a foundation for trip hop’s founding fathers, Massive Attack and Portishead; Tricky and the Mo Wax label.

“I think the first time I heard that sound was when it came out of my sister’s stereo,” says Milton. “I remember listening to Portishead’s (debut album) Dummy and thinking, ‘What is this? It’s really cool.’ As I got more and more into the music, I loved it. It was so iconic with the videos and (lead singer, Beth Gibbons’) voice. They were out there doing their own thing. It was inspirational.”

As Brand New Machine began to take shape, its sound spun off into different directions, making distinctive nods towards house music (Deeper Devotion), the Jamaican dancehall scene (Pressure) and the heavy blues of US rock two‐ piece, The Black Keys (Gun Metal Grey). What Is Right’s emotive, piano-driven hip hop took its cues from the late ’80s beat collective, Soul II Soul; Blk & Blu reworked the two step garage sound that swamped clubs in the 1990s.

Meanwhile, their studio at Tileyard quickly became a revolving door for the dance scene’s emerging singing talent. A role call of sensations-in-waiting were invited to lay down vocals on a string of tracks, and appearances by studio debutants, Louis M^ttrs, rapper Knytro and the smokey tones of Brighton singer, Elli Ingram followed on from Chase & Status’s previous work with A-listers, Plan B, Tinie Tempah, indie doom-mongers White Lies and greats such as Cee‐Lo Green an Rihanna.

“We used so many great singers in the recording process,” says Milton. “As with all our records, we liked working with interesting people like Nile Rodgers, and Pusha T, plus some newer, rawer names like Moko. But it was more exciting for the newer guys, they had passion and desire; that feeling of want. We’ve worked with artists who have gone on to do huge things after working with us… but they change! They aren’t the same in the studio anymore (once they make it big). They don’t have that same explosive desire that they had before. I love the eager vibe.”

“One of the most exciting collaborations was called Gangsta Boogie,” says Kennard. ‘We recorded it with a young rapper called Knytro after finding him earlier in the year, almost by chance. He was a friend of a friend, someone who was working in the studio and we heard his stuff when we were hanging around. It was on in the background. We said, ‘Who’s this?’ because it sounded amazing. And he went, ‘Oh that’s my friend over there.’ We looked over and there was this kid minding his own business, eating a bag of crisps. We got him into the studio as soon as we could.”

An album’s worth of tracks were recorded. As the spring of 2013 became summer, Chase & Status made a series of appearances on the festival circuit, road-testing new material along the way. First up was Radio 1’s Big Weekend Festival. “We performed (first single) Lost And Not Found with Louis M^tters who’s just the loveliest kid in the world. We asked him to come on the road with us; we threw him in the deep end massively because it was his first gig. I remember saying to him before he stepped out in front of 30,000 people, ‘Have you ever sung in front of anyone before?’ And he said, ‘Nah, just my dad and my uncle…’ Then he walked out to a huge crowd. But he smashed it and took it in his stride.”

Next came their prestigious headline slot at Glastonbury, opposite The Rolling Stones, on the Other Stage, where Heaven Knows was premiered with Elli Ingram. “The way she moved onstage was so cool,” says Kennard. “Seeing her sing in front of that crowd was amazing, she has a cool sound already, and she has an incredible presence on stage. Elli’s a real talent.” Next followed a string of headline performances around the UK and Europe including T In The Park, Lowlands Festival and closing the mainstage at Roskilde after Metallica.

To round up another phenomenal Summer on the festival circuit the band performed their storming, riotous show at Reading and Leeds Festival, on the Main Stage before Eminem. It was such a wild show that they had to stop the music multiple times to get the crowd to take a step back, reducing the crush at the front. Melvin Benn, the owner of Reading and Leeds, went on to say they were definite one day headliners.

With the songwriting process completed, what followed was a period of soul searching as the duo took to polishing 14 tracks into an album that lived up to their high expectations. “We’re perfectionists,” says Milton. “It’s a gift and a curse at the same time. There’s a standard we won’t go below, which is great. But it also sends us around the bend because we go around the houses before we’re satisfied. We’ll write a track and then make 20 versions of it. All of them are very different.”

“It drives us mad. Then after making 20 versions we usually realize that the first version was the best. It’s just about being tough on ourselves; we have high expectations of what we do. That’s when it becomes a job and we tend to go right to the wire until somebody tears the album from us so they can release it. Hopefully the results of that process make it worthwhile.”

The hard work and perfectionism paid off when Brand New Machine stormed the UK charts at #2 and is currently quickly approaching Platinum status, not to Mention closing the year with their first UK arena tour seeing the live band perform to over 80,000 people, which culminated in a phenomenal sold out homecoming show at London’s 02 Arena.

It’s not as if Chase & Status are without history in the production process, however. For the best part of 10 years, Milton and Kennard have continually pushed drum’n'bass’s experimental spirit into increasingly brave, unchartered areas – rock, reggae, hip hop and soulful club grooves are just some of the genres that have been underpinned by their love for clattering breakbeats. Remixing for the likes of Jay Z and The Prodigy, Milton and Kennard have had six tracks feature on three of Rihanna’s smash hit albums as well as Snoop Dogg requesting to write on their early hit ‘Eastern Jam’ transforming it into ‘Snoop Dogg Millionaire’. Now, with Brand New Machine’s kaleidoscopic sound, they’ve rebooted their reputation as the one of most exciting production teams on the scene.

“I guess that’s happened because we have good foundations,” says Kennard. “When times are hard in this studio and we think, ‘This is all rubbish’, I always remember what we used to do when we first started. Like driving up the M1 to do a gig in Manchester and then driving back to Leeds for 6am – in a battered Peugeot 206 ‐ to do an early morning show for a couple of hundred quid. We remember what we loved about doing this in the first place ‐ the music.

551925468236204.description:
2 day Weekend seminar that will rejuvenate your salah.
For Brothers and Sisters 

The prayer of the believer is the single most important form of worship and means of connection with one’s Lord. It is the medium through which the believer literally speaks to Allah and the a fountain from which one drinks on a daily basis to reinvigorate the soul and re establish one’s purpose in life.

I don’t know about you, but the above description of the prayers sounds somewhat alien to most of us right? The question is why? What’s missing and how can we make a change to revive the ritual?

This course seeks to address this very question…

This course will:

- Share the secret of how to attain khushu (concentration & devotion) in the prayer
- Explain both the outward and inward meanings of all the utterances in the prayer
- Explain the significance of the physical motions in the prayer
- Describe the thoughts & emotions one should experience in an awakened prayer
- Provide practical advice on how to develop the prayer through the above



Teachers: 
Shaykh Shams Adduha Muhammad 
Shaykh Mujahid Ali 
Shaykh Abdur Rahman Anwar 
Shaykh Abu Aaliyah - Surkheel Sharif

Extensive coursenotes will be provided for free

Note: this is not a fiqh course. The focus is on the quality of prayer as opposed to the rules of prayer.

555895331174736.description:
.:~.: DIAMONDS on the floor :.~:.

Diamante, do grego 'adamas', significa invencível e 'diaphanes', que significa transparente. Era usado em batalhas como símbolo de coragem.
Os antigos o chamavam de pedra do sol, devido ao seu brilho faiscante e os gregos acreditavam que o fogo de um diamante refletia a chama do amor.
Diamante simboliza portanto, a força e a eternidade do amor.
Lapidados os diamantes mais preciosos da nossa cidade, reunimos as suas belezas e particularidades em uma única pista de dança, uma única vibe, em uma noite para se tornar inesquecível para os amantes da house music.

1º Quilate Lapidado:
Bianca Pio - https://soundcloud.com/dj-bianca-pio

Larissa Lahw - https://soundcloud.com/larissalahw


Somando o brilho e riqueza de 5 quilates de muita personalidade, carinho, musicalidade e acima de tudo carisma, apresentamos DIAMONDS ON THE FLOOR. Permita a house music, abra a mente, brilhe junto, entre na vibe.

Line Up: 

CUEBUR (SOUL CANDI/DEFECTED)
MARISSA GUZMAN (SOUL CANDI/DEFECTED)
LEON PAUL (NYUMBA DEEP)
ALUKU REBELS
DEANY O
VELLY
TWINZ
NEED4HOUSE RESIDENTS (GENERALL / DION T / MIXOLIS / SLYBEE)

NEED4HOUSE are proud to bring you the #NoDoubtTour ft CUEBUR and MARISSA GUZMAN live in London. After a vibrant party with Da Capo in October this will surely not be one to miss, partying till the Early Hours of the Morning. 

CUEBUR 

Cuebur started his career as a musical child prodigy whose music had begun to pulsate South Africa's clubs and dance floors by the age of 15. He took it upon himself to bring SA a different sound. Cuebur’s sound frequently graces the playlists of SA’s top radio stations. 

In the music circles he is known as a world renowned DJ and producer. He specializes in making house and hip hop creations which has contributed to him being regarded as a reputable and appreciated DJ/Producer. 

In early 2007 Cuebur made the hit song “Pepe” which was featured on DJ Zinhle’s debut Album “Feminine Touch”. The song made waves all around SA and was played by the likes of Black Coffee, DJ Christos, and DJ Clock just to mention a few.

Cuebur moved to Johannesburg with his close friend and fellow musician Andile “Andyboi” Hlanze in 2009, to pursue their careers in music. It is in this year that Cuebur met a friend, Ashley “DJ Shimza” Raphala, who would be the key link into the industry. 

To solidify his love of making music Cuebur studied Advanced Music Production, Sound Engineering and Music Business at Soulcandi Institute of Music in 2010. Another one of Cuebur’s highlights was getting featured on Soulcandi Sessions 5, one of Soulcandi biggest compilations. 

In 2011 Cuebur was then approached by Soulcandi with the idea of a new project called “Candi Roots”. That is where he met DJ Mphoza and DJ Hypnosis. CUEBUR currently has a hit song with MARISSA GUZMAN realised under UK label DEFECTED which has set the House Music scene alight and will definitely be one of many highlights of the night.

MARISSA GUZMAN 

Raised in Detroit with a father who was on the Motown label (Eddie Guzman of Rare Earth), Marissa had quite the artistic upbringing. Having her dad constantly on the road touring with the band was difficult, but the excitement that goes along with a father who is a well-known musician deeply inspired her. Especially as a little girl while at concerts with thousands of screaming fans, the members of Rare Earth would call their kids on stage to help them sing their biggest hit, “I Just Want To Celebrate,” and Marissa knew then that she wanted to pursue singing.

With a strong passion for writing, Marissa majored in Journalism and landed her first job in advertising, devoting her life to Ford Motor Company. With such a demanding career, she had little time for her true passion: music, but in her free time she still managed to develop a huge appreciation for Detroit’s infamous underground electronic music, and started writing vocal tracks over instrumental house tunes. She became friends with the legendary Detroit techno pioneer, Derrick May, who convinced her to start her own label to get her music out there, which she did in 2007. Marissa's mom, Barbara named it Juicy Lucy Records.

Around this time she decided to move to San Francisco, and after a spiritual retreat in 2009, Marissa had a revelation to quit her job in marketing to learn how to produce, and work on her first album. In spring of 2011, the first single, "Time To Go" was proof to the world that she made the right decision. Black Coffee's remix went straight to #1 on Traxsource after being available for less than a week, and gave Marissa instant exposure internationally, setting the stage for a bright future.

As she feels very strongly about the importance of using music as a platform to help those less fortunate, Marissa is graciously donating 50% of her album sales to NextAid, a Los Angeles based nonprofit organization that harnesses the power of music to support sustainable development projects that serve vulnerable children, youth and women in Africa.

March 2012 was a very exciting month for Marissa, since "Time To Go" was nominated for Remix of the Year at the SAMAs (SA version of the GRAMMYs), and also in SA DJ Mag! Also in March, the Joy Road Remix album was released with remixes from Kerri Chandler, Black Coffee, Mr. V, Liquideep, Demarkus Lewis, Paul Randolph, Corduroy Mavericks, Doc Link, Hallex.M, and many more, and after being available one week it went to #2 in the Top 100 Albums on Traxsource.

For more info you can call: 07932949212  07447906470  07960384365 twitter: @groove_elements FB:  Groove Elements

560800934017889.description:
So....these past few years ehhh....they have been testing to say the least, but i managed to pull it all off pretty well  Got the Girl of my Dreams, Played at some of the most Momentous Parties i have ever attended, let alone get the privilege to play at, i've met some Wonderful People, and i've also lost some......, but as they say, 'It's all part of God's eternal plan..', whether it's fair or not, we all have our destiny, and destiny is nature's law.

Meet my Godson, he's a bright, bubbly little man who never fails to make me grin, but through that beautiful smile, he's having to endure hour's of physiotherapy because he finds it hard to move around on his own, also he has to labour through countless test's and other investigations and he's not even fully developed yet, at this point although things weren't perfect for me future wise, at least i had my health and the hope that anything was possible.

At this very moment, he's a little too young for us to know the full extent of his condition, but, until then he has to go abroad (Because its going to be major cheaper than here!) to receive quality therapy, which hopefully will allow him the very best start in life that he can be given, but this can cost an astronomical amount of money, much more than any new family could possibly afford in the modern day UK, and i gotta say i salute his parents who are very good friends of mine.

I have over the past few months, been kinda feeling sorry for myself with regards to a fair few things, but tonight, i had what you might call an epiphany, and that is this, if you live your life in the past, your past will destroy you, make no mistake about that, the key is to not live either in the past, or to hope for the future, but is simply to be happy for what you have now, the present, as that is all you have ever had in the first place.

I have been changing my life around, living healthier and removing the poisons in my life (Well most of em!lol), aspiring to the more meaningful and precious aspects of my world, and i am from here on in going to make every second count, trust me on this!! 

So, i would just like to say, every penny made by any of my tracks or remixes of the next year, i will be donating to my little corner of the fund to help him over the pond for his treatment and anything else i can possibly help with, plus i will be doing the 'Electric Run' in London in April to also raise a bit to try and help him along, and this is where you can help, please visit my justgiving page and if you feel you can help, sponsor me to help Luka's cause, any amount, no matter how small, can go a long way to helping him start to try and normal happy and healthy life.

Link to JustGiving page: https://www.justgiving.com/yimby/godfatherfund

Link to Electric Run Page:- http://electricrun.co.uk/


I am thinking, i might be going on a mission this year for the greater good and your support would be, as always, very welcome  .

God bless you :) 

Carl xx
560800934017889.name: Do just one good thing today that will make you feel wonderful for weeks, sponsor me at the London 'Electric Run' in aid of Breast Cancer Awareness & the Godfather Fund :)
