This is it! Cypher16's BIGGEST London headline show so far, and yes, it's a little way off yet, but we need ALL the support from our UK-based fans to make this the HUGE success it can be!

The show will come towards the end of a pretty busy schedule for Cypher16 in 2014, which will see the band playing shows across several different continents and 10+ countries, as well as tracking the long-awaited debut album! For more details as they are announced check www.cypher16.net

As a thank-you to those of you who buy your tickets in advance, we are offering the first 50 people who buy ONLINE from www.seetickets.com a FREE exclusive shirt at the show! Don't wait around! We estimate that by the end of January ALL the free shirts will be gone for this, despite it being a long way off, so get the date in your diary and pick up your ticket ASAP!

This will be a 14+ show - under 18's to be accompanied by an adult

£8 advance - tickets: www.seetickets.com/event/cypher16/underworld/759930 

Information from: www.cypher16.net 

Doors open 6pm

Special guests include:

TAGADA JONES (Officiel)

Celebrating their 20th anniversary this year, Tagada Jones will play their first show in London in over two years! This year will see the band play in multiple countries and at major festivals including Hellfest Open Air and Xtreme Fest! Catch them here this September!

Chasing Dragons [Official Band Page]

641764259211017.description:
DJs con una seleccion de indie/electro internacional y español*  •  WAYA DJs will play a mix of International & Spanish indie/electro*

--

La noche empezará a las 22.00 hasta las 06.00, pero vamos a probar con algo distinto… habrá dos ubicaciones, un poco como en España: empezar en un bar tomando algo y luego acabar en la discoteca o empezar en la discoteca y acabar en el after... o algo así!

Primera parte (22.00 - 02.00) se presentará conjuntamente con nuestros amigos 21st Century Noise al The Macbeth Hoxton en Old Street. Allí habrá tocando un grupo en directo a demás de nuestros DJs hasta las 2am. La entrada será £5, pero de esta manera también tendréis…

…entrada gratuita a la segunda parte (01.30-06.00) de We Are Your Amigos en una ubicación secreta que se encuentra a solo 5 minutos andando, más **2 CONSUMICIONES GRATUITAS!** Tendremos nuestros propios guías que acompañarán a grupos, desde la primera fiesta hasta la otra, así no os perdéis!

Esta vez, dispondremos de un lavabo más, un guardaropa y una zona nueva con más asientos y más luces para bailar!

Puedes comprar tus entradas anticipadas aquí:
https://21stcenturynoise.ticketabc.com/events/21cnwaya040414/

O podéis reservar las pulseras contestando este email (como la última vez), con vuestro nombre y los nombres de la gente que vendrá con vosotros: info@transmissionlondon.com

(Es necesario que se venga a la primera parte de la fiesta antes de la 1am para conseguir/recoger la pulsera que permitirá la entrada en la segunda parte).

--

BPITCH CONTROL RECORDS LONDON SHOWCASE - 
APRIL 11, 2014 ELECTRIC BRIXTON, TOWN HALL PARADE, LONDON

**** ELLEN ALLIEN, THOMAS MULLER, CAMEA, AEREA NEGROT & BABYG ****

We would like to suggest not to sleep on the tickets. This will sell out VERY VERY quickly. 

- SeeTickets: http://goo.gl/jiMcih
- Resident Advisor: http://goo.gl/1oFeqr

GoMad Events, in collaboration with DeepBrass Production, are proud to announce another massive London showcase, at Electric Brixton.
 
Taking place on Friday 11th April 2014, the famous Berlin-based, electronic record label, BPITCH CONTROL, who helped launch the careers of popular electronic artists such as #Modeselektor, #Apparat and #PaulKalkbrenner, will showcase 5 of their most prominent artists. 
This line-up will also include the label’s founder 
Ellen Allien, who will be doing a 3-hour DJ set.

The second room will be hosted by Hdnsm with their resident djs showcase

••• BPITCH CONTROL RECORDS •••
In 1999 Ellen Allien created an island of creativity in the centre of Berlin and its turbulent techno movement. In the years that followed, Berlin became a global magnet for art and club culture, and the result of this was two-fold; the label’s artists became known well be- yond the city’s limits, and the roster absorbed more international talent.
Since the mid 2000s BPitch Control has been regarded as one of the city’s most important emblems, maintaining global friendships and relationships, organising regular showcases on several continents.


------------------------------------------ 
 
Main Room: 
BPITCH CONTROL SHOWCASE

642993675772031.description:
We're very excited to have Mike Watt back with us after his sold out show with Il Sogno Del Marinaio last year.  Here's a quote from Wikipedia. Because it's pretty informative.
The Missingmen are a punk rock trio fronted by Minutemen/Firehose/Stooges bassist Mike Watt. The band features Watt, guitarist Tom Watson (Slovenly, The Pair Of Pliers, The Jom And Terry Show, Red Krayola), and drummer Raul Morales (FYP, Killer Dreamer, The Leeches, The Secondmen).

The band's name is a humorous reference to the fact that during a 2005 European tour behind Watt's album The Secondman's Middle Stand, neither of the original Secondmen (Pete Mazich and Jerry Trebotic) were able to participate.
642993675772031.name: Mike Watt & the Missingmen + Manflu + Hysterical Injury at The Lexington, London

645023495569111.description:
;
:

-------------------SAVE THE LAST DANCE--------------------------


3 Jahre Tumult & Kult - Techno @   Club London Underground 

 & gleichzeitig DIE LETZTE Tumult & Kult...

außerdem feiert Freund & DJ Kollege "Wabun" der noch zur alten Schule gehört seinen Abschied und Rückzug aus dem Business um sich neuem zu widmen. 



Vor 3 Jahren ( Mitte 2011) fing alles an. Damals noch im "Club Reina" der sich auf der Rheinseite des Walzmühlcenters in Ludwigshafen befindet. Das Gebäude ist absolut Kult. Die Legendären Hallen der alten Walzmühle waren damals gefüllt mit Topp Bookings der Techno-Szene. Selbst die "Time Warp " wurde in den 90ern dort gegründet!  

http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walzm%C3%BChle 

20 Gäste hatten wir bei der 1. Veranstaltung auf dem 2.  Floor der Location :D.  "minimal" & "techhouse" bestimmten die Line Up´s sämtlicher Clubs. Mit "Tumult & Kult" sollte sich dies ändern. Die Reihe fing schnell an Anhänger zu finden.  

Im April 2012 sind wir dann wegen Schließung des "Reina" in den damals gerade wieder neu-eröffneten "Club London" gezogen.

Im Juni 2012 stieg dann bei "Tumult & Kult" mit "NIEREICH TECHNO LIVE" im London die erste richtig fette Technoparty mit Headlinerbooking... Der Laden ist eskaliert und die Region wurde mit der Leidenschaft für Techno entfacht die selbst drei Jahre später nicht ein kleines bißchen nachgelassen hat. Was ne Hammer geile Zeit <3

Mitlerweile 38 Headliner aus 9 verschiedenen Ländern <3

DANKE DAFÜR !

Am 04.04 feiern wir Bday & Abschied zugleich. Ich hoffe ihr gebt euch trotz "Time warp" Wochenende ein letztes mal die Ehre und zeigt was diesen Event ausgemacht hat. 







LINE UP

BUNKERBOYS // Tumult & Kult / Reactor Beatz

With 2 Main stages dedicated solely to House and Jungle Music, hand selected headline acts, authentic retro lighting and decor & optional fancy dress, this event is set to bring all you real shape cutters the perfect platform to experience something different and let you hair down in a free environment

Fancy Dress is not compulsory, but the effort is more than appreciated as a contribution to the atmosphere in the dance!

✪✪✪✪ SECURITY NOTICE ✪✪✪✪

This event will feature a full security team provided by TBC. You will be subject to a thorough search upon entry, please work with the security and listen to instructions as they are their for your safety as well as others. Queuing is inevitable however following instructions will get you through a LOT faster.

These items are STRICTLY forbidden at our events, please take note.

✘ NO GLASS BOTTLES 
✘ NO SPRAY CANS
✘ NO SHARP OBJECTS

We will not tolerate thieving or aggressive behaviour of any kind! If you are acting aggressively towards any of the ravers or crew you will be swiftly ejected from the event. If you are found to be stealing or mugging people you will be taken to a room by security thoroughly searched, photographed and banned from all our future events. If deemed necessary, the police will be called and you will be arrested!

We only want good decent people at our events. This event is about the music, vibes and PLUR and we expect EVERY raver to look out for one another. Not just for trouble makers or thieves, but for falls, trips, slips and safe traveling to and from the event.

★ DRUGS NOTICE ★

While we do not condone the use of drugs we are aware that drug use takes place at most events. We simply ask you are responsible and don't overdo it. If you see someone having an adverse side affect which you believe to be caused from drug abuse please notify a member of staff immediately who will let the onsite paramedic know!

RIGS/PROMOTERS/DJ'S/ARTISTS/DECOR TEAMS GET IN TOUCH WITH THE HOSTS TO FIND OUT HOW YOU CAN GET INVOLVED

DONT FOTGET TO ADD THE BBM PIN TO STAY CONNECTED: 2A6E74A2

As One, London’s legendary club night concept that brings together the different tribes of gay London into the biggest parties ever in the capital, took the step into Victoria Park last year and As One – The Festival, was born. 2013′s event featured over 100 artists, brands and DJs over 9 arenas. Due to popular demand As One In The Park Festival, London’s biggest gay gathering, will be back in all it’s glory for 2014 – register your interest  at goo.gl/eiJWpO to be first in line for our pre-public release discount  tickets, available only to 2013 ticket holders and those who register.

Flying the flag for the Dutch electronic music scene on a global scale, it’s hard to put into words just how influential Chuckie has been in his ascent. Consistently thinking outside of the box when on the decks and obsessively putting in the work when in the studio, he is firmly established as one of the biggest players. He’ll be flying over the sounds of Dirty Dutch for a very special showcase showcase at Fire-London this spring.

Crossing the boundaries between various genres, Chuckie has put his distinctive stamp in clubs and is an innovator in building an eclectic sounding dance floor.  Refusing to be categorised to just one- his distinctive blend of house and hip hop has given him an edge that puts him on a pedestal above his piers. 

Dirty Dutch has built up a reputation in all of the world’s key electronic music hubs as a trendsetter that’s revolutionised clubs worldwide. Continuously pushing the limits with its’ music and events Chuckie has rustled up a selection of DJs that will get the Arches of Fire booming.

Needing no introduction Radio 1s Danny Howard will play alongside Audio Society and Skyhigh in support. If that wasn’t enough Chuckie has called on some of the finest in established and emerging talent for room 2!  

Advanced Tickets: 15 to £25 + bf
www.londonwarehouseevents.co.uk

t&cs : http://londonwarehouseevents.co.uk/terms-conditions/

In association with Mixcloud. 
www.mixcloud.com/lwe 

Any questions please email : info@londonwarehouseevents.co.uk

654017651301441.description:
Order tickets via Eventbrite:
http://www.eventbrite.com/e/central-london-muslim-history-walking-tour-tickets-11244467505?aff=efbevent

With the school holidays what will you be doing with your children? How about enjoying the discovery of Muslim history in Central London? See where Arabic was taught 400 years ago to a pioneer having his discovery stolen by an English chap or how about learning about the Muslim who was kidnapped, put into slavery and ended up in London in the 1700s, what Dawah did he do whilst here?

To find out these exciting answers and much more join us for the guided Central London Muslim history walking tour. Starting from Parliament Square we wiggle our way round through Whitehall, to probably Britain's number one tourist location of Trafalgar Square and finishing off at the National Portrait Gallery, a place founded in 1856!
654017651301441.name: Central London Muslim History Walking Tour

Nicole kicked off 2014 with gigs in Philadelphia, New York, and at Mexico’s BPM Festival, followed by a North and South America tour (keep an eye out for a mini-documentary!) The new year also brings her own globally syndicated radio show, produced by the team behind shows from Carl Cox, Adam Beyer, etc. “It’s a chance to play all the music I love,” she says, promising a set-list that ranges from live performances to deep house to driving techno. Music she loves will also appear on her MOOD Records imprint, ensuring fans a steady supply of the drum-fuelled electronic goodness they crave following previous standout efforts on labels like Drumcode.

Originally from Detroit, Berlin based Kris Wadsworth is a regular figure at some of the most famous nightclubs and discerning parties in the world. Names which include: Fabric, Rex, Arma 17, Panorama Bar, Tresor, Watergate, Sankeys to name a few. A prolific producer with a vast catalogue of inimitable EPs on labels like Hypercolour and Get Physical, as well as being one of the most sought-after remixers in the business. The most professional and respected journalists in the industry have dispensed phrases about him for many years now such as: “Disturbingly brilliant” (DJ Mag), “Freakishly good,” (MixMag), “Absolutely essential” (Resident Advisor), “We can buy practically anything from him blindfolded” (DE:Bug). 

Stephan Bodzin’s music is as polarizing as he is, both as DJ and live artist. But there’s one statement that holds true for all of his productions: they are certainly of the highest ‘authenticity’.Due to the quality of his impressive music he has reached the top of the international techno scene. Most recently he has remixed songs for well-known bands such as Depeche Mode, Booka Shade and The Knife. His releases can be found on labels such as Get Physical, Datapunk, Gigolo, Systematic and Giant Wheel.

Berlin’s talented Rampue of labels like Groove On, Audiolith and Dantze brings his incredible live show that fuses house and techno together in bold new ways.
654954344564350.name: Egg Presents: Nicole Moudaber, Kris Wadsworth, Stephan Bodzin, Rampue (live)

663605787018493.description:
Following the huge success of our first conference in 2013, The Song Collectors Collective presents this one-day event of talks, presentations and performances covering the practicalities, ethics, histories and art of contemporary song collecting. A unique opportunity to explore the origins of folk song, learn about the conservation of oral culture and celebrate the gems on your doorstep and beyond!

Featuring special guest speakers and singers Reg Hall, Angela Impey, John Howson, Tony Robertson, Nan Connors, Jerry O'Reilly, Michael Sheehy, Sam Lee, James McDonald. For more info visit our website: http://songcollectorscollective.co.uk/about/events/song-collectors-conference-2014

Tickets for the whole day are £15 from http://thenestcollective.co.uk/shows/events/26-apr-14-song-collectors-collective-conference--proud-archivist

This event is part of a collaboration between the Song Collectors Collective and The Endangered Languages Archive at SOAS and is supported by Creativeworks London.

---

PLUS.. Song Collectors TRANSCRIB-ATHON 2014!

Sunday 27th April @ The Proud Archivist, Dalston 11am - 3pm. FREE

There will be free training from 11am to 11.30 on how to index and transcribe the recordings of the Song Collectors archive. The rest of the session will be a fun and social atmosphere where we collaboratively transcribe as much of the published recordings on our website as we can. If you can't make it in person, but would like to be a remote transcriber on the day, email songcollectorscollective@gmail.com with 'Transcribathon 2014' in the subject and we'll get you involved!

---

Feedback from the 2013 conference:

'As genuine and exciting as it gets. Pure British song, rare and beautiful.'

'It’s lovely to hear songs, learn of alder-cockles and see so 
many enthusiastic people.'

'A very enjoyable and interesting day. Brilliant to learn about new things and meet people from such diverse backgrounds, who all share this passion for music and stories in all their forms.'
663605787018493.name: SCC Conference 2014 @ The Proud Archivist, London

665028293544719.description:
Wild Music est heureux de vous présenter son premier évènement en France, LONDON SESSION.

Celui-ci se déroulera le 30 MAI, au CO2 Club à Nantes et se verra recevoir en exclusivité l’un des plus grand DJ Londonien du moment, DJ Caspa 

Pas besoin de bouger, Londres vient à vous, l’occasion de retrouver l’esprit des soirées UK House à domicile. 

Pour agrémenter cet évènement, BDJ ( Chapeau Music, Italie) , Ian Tocor ( Cracki Records, Bordeaux), Lambert Herchenroder ( Wild Music ltd., Londres) et les deux briscards Ketraj & Anat nous feront le plaisir d’alimenter les débats de 23h00 à 07h00.

 §§§§§§§§§§§§§§§§§§§§§  Line Up §§§§§§§§§§§§§§§§§

Dj CASPA ( Percolate / Rinse Fm, UK) : 

Actif sur la scène UK depuis maintenant 23 ans, DJ CASPA est devenu incontournable à Londres avec sa propre nuit «A Night With Caspa » et affiche désormais complet tous les week-ends. Ses sets House/Garage énergétiques l’ont amené à s’exporter aux Pays-Bas et depuis peu en France. Il est actuellement résident en Angleterre dans 5 clubs : au Pacha, Percolate, Poetry in Motion, Funkatron, souled.

http://soundcloud.com/tundecas41

BDJ ( Chapeau Music, Italy) : 

Passionné par les Vynils, Biago est un jeune Dj expérimenté en plus d’être un talentueux producteur italien. Il est le co-fondateur de Chapeau Music et est désormais Dj résident chez Wild Music, qui l’a fièrement rajouté à sa liste d’artistes pour ses productions sorties chez Pura Music, Orion Music, Shinshy Records, Unity Records et bien d’autres. Grâce à son penchant pour le Jazz et le Blues, il a su mélanger ses influences folks pour créer un tout nouveau genre de Tech-house enivrante, tout comme ses sets Live. Toujours accompagné de son contrôleur MPC ,il  sera vous ravir par ses compositions incorporants des voix Soul et des samples surprenants dont il a le secret…

https://soundcloud.com/bdjchapeaumusic

IAN TOCOR (Cracki Records / Love What You Feel / OWT) : 

Ian Tocor, ex-nantais resté à l’Ouest est l'initiateur du mémorable open air Les Virées Electroniques à Bordeaux.
Activiste au sein de Minuit Blanche et My Love Supreme, souriant ambianceur à tendance house et techno, producteur d’avenir seul ou au sein d’Outlander Wax Theory avec son ami Axel Exal, proche des Minotor, ou Normal Music, ses dj set sont aussi rugueux et forts qu'ils sont entourés de tendresse.
Niveau actu, il vient tout juste de signer deux superbes tracks sur 'Love What you Feel Records', le sub label de 'Pittsburgh Track Autority' !
A surveiller de très prés...

https://soundcloud.com/iantocor
http://www.crackirecords.com/roast/ian-tocor

Lambert Herchenroder (Wild Music, Londres) :

Nourri de ses expériences à l’étranger, Lambert fait ses débuts aux côtés du label Beatgate à Istanbul. C’est à Londres qu’il trouve son bonheur, avec l’influence UK house typique de la capitale britannique. Il y a fait la connaissance de Marco Matera, qui deviendra le directeur du label Wild Music. Tous deux ont collaboré à la réussite de la première édition d’Into the Wild le 12 avril dernier à Londres. Ses sets « made in UK » allant de la Deep house jusqu’à la UK Garage tomberont toujours à point nommé quelque soit l’heure de la soirée.

https://soundcloud.com/lambert-herchenroder

Ketraj VS Anat :

https://soundcloud.com/attchoom

https://soundcloud.com/aanaat

 §§§§§§§§§§§§§§  Infos Pratiques §§§§§§§§§§

Sur place : 15 €

HERCULES AND LOVE AFFAIR [LIVE]
ANDY BUTLER [DJ SET]
SEVERINO
WARBOY

Very good things come to those who wait, and we’ve waited long enough for the new album of NYC house revivalists Hercules & Love Affair. XOYO Loves are proud to present H&LA’s return to the capital for the launch of their new album: ‘Feast of A Broken Heart’.
 
On Friday 23 May at East London’s The Laundry, head honcho Andy Butler and his crew of talented vocalists bring the new record alive… Never anything short of powerful, Andy said of their third album: “I wanted nasty basslines, stormy, bleary-eyed sounds, fiery, rough, tough and ragged old school house productions that sounded almost techno. I didn’t want polite, I wanted aggressive.”

666314490076461.description:
Perhaps best known for The Pleasure Garden (1953), a film shot at Crystal Palace and awarded a prize by Jean Cocteau in Cannes, James Broughton was a man of many parts: a poet, a filmmaker, a socialite, a traveller, a husband, father, teacher and in the last third of his life, an out and radical gay man. He spent most of his creative life in San Francisco and from the late 1940s helped nurture an artistic culture that eventually gave birth to the Beats. 

Broughton's bisexual life changed forever when he began a love affair in 1975 with a young man 35 years his junior. Beautifully illustrated with extracts from his poetry and his many films, and liberally sprinkled with interviews from key collaborators, friends and family, Big Joy reveals James Broughton as a brilliantly perceptive visionary, a bold and inspiring interpreter of art and life and the joy of creation.

‘Fascinating…a revealing portrait of a man who helped to broaden our ideas of what films could accomplish.’ -  The Hollywood Reporter

‘A great documentary’- Variety

Enjoy THREE Big Joy: the Adventures of James Broughton  screenings at FLARE:
Thursday, March 27 ~ 6:10 PM	
Saturday, March 29 ~  1:00 PM
Sunday, March 30 ~  2:10 PM

Tickets go on sale 03-03-2014 11:30 AM here:
http://bit.ly/1nWgemQ

Since opening our doors in 2003, we’ve played an integral part in re-establishing Kings Cross as a stomping ground for London’s discerning beat disciples. Our gnarly Flipside sound system, forward-looking lineups and industrial design aesthetics have proved popular earning us many loyal fans. During our 11 year reign we’ve become a staple of London club culture – a defining force within the scene, expanding year on year with bigger and better parties for the eyes and ears of you, the Egg London faithful.

To celebrate our birthday we’ve drafted in one of the most in demand House acts on the planet for his first London show of 2014. He's the boss of the highly regarded Diynamic Records imprint and we're stoked he will be right here for Egg London’s 11th annual celebration.  Step up SOLOMUN!  Joining the big man is Hamburg native and Diynamic label buddy DJ Phono.  Meanwhile, taking over the Familia hosted ground floor is firm Egg favourite and Techno front-runner Cristian Varela who’ll spin a 3 hour extended set.

Elsewhere, we have another present in store for you… Our birthday will also be the night we extend our highly regarded Flipside Sound System across the whole of the venue. Last year we installed the world’s first custom built Flipside rig on our Terrace floor and after Boddika called it, “literally one of the best sound systems I’ve ever played on!” and Dense & Pika said it’s “the best sound system in London, period”, we thought it perfect timing to roll it out across the rest of the club. We’re ever on a mission to make your clubbing experience the best it can possibly be and this move is testament to that.

So with all that on offer, underground clubbers of all musical persuasions should be satisfied so dust down your Oyster card and head North!

Social Developers London is back for 2014!

Tickets for our March event are now FREE! >>> http://www.eventbrite.com/e/social-developers-london-march-2014-tickets-2929711847

For those who missed our last event or have never been, come and join us and our usual high quality speakers. 

For those who do not know us, Social Developers London (formerly known as Facebook Garage London) is a non for profit organisation established in 2009 and the pioneer of bringing the latest social technology updates for the tech and marketing communities.

OUR SPEAKERS FOR THIS MONTH :

FACEBOOK
Todd Chaffee, CEO at Blue Crow and a social media expert and Jordan Smith, Software Engineer from Betapond will give us a quick update on general Facebook platform news.

TWITTER
Angus Fox, CEO at Multizone Ltd. and a technology expert will also be bringing us up to date on the Twitter platform.

GOOGLE
We are also pleased to have, as speakers, two developer advocates from Google+, Ade Oshineye and Michael Stillwell.   Details of their talk as follows:
Title : The Flukey Bird empire: achieving fame and fortune by building on the Google Platform
Abstract:
They will explain how the developer of a hypothetical Flukey Bird game could achieve fame and fortune by building on Google's platform. They will cover Google services and APIs that can be used to enhance a social application, such as leaderboards, social sharing, easy sign-in across devices, "push" app installs, and more.

UBUNTU
We have also got Richard Collins, an Ubuntu Mobile expert from Canonical talking about the Ubuntu Phone and its SDK which just launched at Mobile World Congress. 

The talks begin at 7.00pm. Networking starts at 6.30pm.
You must buy in advance to guarantee entry on the night

Get your FREE tickets here >>> http://www.eventbrite.com/e/social-developers-london-march-2014-tickets-2929711847

See you all soon!

Social Developers London

p.s. If your organisation is interested in sponsoring us, please e-mail us for more information. We are on constant look out for new speakers who is on top of their game when it comes to all thing social - so give us a shout if you know of anyone who may be interested!

675209602543988.description:
11/4/2014 Hotflush Recordings takeover

SOUTH LONDON ORDNANCE (UK)
LOCKED GROOVE (BE)
ahZ
Jock The Lock
Milan Kroutil
KINOCIRKUS videomapping

============================================

TERMINAL B je projekt, který přináší prostoru nákladového nádraží Žižkov zajímavou vizi hudebních nocí plných známých a přeci undergroundových Djů a producentů evropské a domácí elektronické hudební scény. Vznikl na podnět aktuálně bohužel častého jevu nechtěné invaze developerských projektů do pražských častí, kdy měl jeden takový vyrůst právě na místě Žižkovského nákladového nádraží. Našli se ale lidé, kterým tato informace nebyla jedno a pokusili se jednat s městskými zastupiteli a tento plán změnit. Přišli s ideou vytvořit v budově nádraží prostor, kterého účelem a náplní bude umění různých forem. Městská část Praha 3 schválila tento projekt na zkušební období a díky tomu bude toto místo oživeno divadlem, tancem a hudbou i prostřednictvím dramaturgie projektu Terminal B.

============================================

SOUTH LONDON ORDNANCE (UK)
 
Mladý, talentovaný producent z Londýna, který vstoupil na scénu současné elektronické hudby před dvěma lety. První věci vydává na Dub Records a postupně taky na 2nd Drop, Audio Culture anebo Hotflush Recordings. Přichází s inovativní house-tech-elektronikou a v Anglii je podporován uznávanými jmény jako je moderátorka Rádia 1 Mary Anne Hobbs anebo celosvětově známy producent Mosca. Popři produkování vlastních věcí je výborným DJem a venku je množství podcastů, například pro label Lucky Me, legendární XFM show, Rinse FM, FWD, anebo set pro Boiler Room.
 
http://soundcloud.com/south-london-ordnance
http://www.facebook.com/southlondonordnance
 
 
LOCKED GROOVE (BE)
 
je rovněž velice mladý producent tentokrát z Belgie a podobně jako SOL tvoří bass techno a hlubokou, místama až melancholickou house elektroniku se současným zvukem. Jeho produkce taky nachází domov pod labelem Hotflush Recordings, později pod Tigovým Turbo Recordings. Tyto společné jmenovatele nejsou náhodné, hosté druhého večírku pod hlavičkou Terminal B se znají a nebudou hrát na jednom pódiu poprvé. Navíc poskytnou formou workshopu své vědomosti z oblasti současné elektronické tvorby našim zájemcům.
 
http://soundcloud.com/lockedgrooves
http://www.facebook.com/lockedgroove
 
 
DJ ahZ

První ofiko hraní tohoto člena legendárního seskupení "Volnej průběh" proběhlo koncem léta 2001 v olomoucké Barumbě (RIP) a to z cdéček. Po dva roky tam pak pravidelně doplňoval pondělní večery pestrou směskou od ambientu a lounge music až po house a drumandbass. Po získání možnosti hmátnout si na vinyl definitivně odložil cdpack a přeorientoval se na desky. Od léta 2005 pak hraje pravidelně v olomouckém Metru, pro které tvořil i vizuály měsíčních programů. V současnosti žije v Praze a kromě pravidelného hraní po místních klubech spolupořádá party DrumiX, Shotgun Festival a zmiňovaný VPX. S kolegou KamCZou pravidelně již skoro čtyři roky připravuje Narovinu zlomenej podcast pro techno.cz. Seskupení "Volnej průběh", kterého je součástí a které sdružuje okrajovou hudbou zapálené blázny z Prahy (Touchwood, Stanzim, Nitrous, Rade) má také svůj pravidelný pořad na Radiu 1.
 
http://www.mixcloud.com/ahonznovak
http://www.techno.cz/nzp
 

Jock The Lock
 
Jock The Lock je sólový projekt Jaromíra Bednáře, pocházejícího z drsného kraje severní Moravy. V současné době žije již řadu let v Praze, kde nachází inspiraci a spřízněné duše. Jaromír byl odjakživa vášnivým posluchačem hudby, jako dítě a dorostenec chodil do hudební školy, kde hrál na klarinet a na kytaru. Získal tak základy rytmického a kompozičního cítění. Ve svých 20-ti letech propadl kouzlu - v té době - aktuálního drumandbassu a další elektronické hudby. Umělci jako např. Photek (Form And Function, Modus Operandi), Krust (Coded Language) a mnoho dalších, změnili jeho vnímání hudby. Ve své produkci má rád kontrasty strohosti s emočně silnou atmosférou. V současné době je inspirován aktuálním zvukem slučujícím prvky techna, garage, deep house.. a pracuje na debutové desce. Jaromír také spolupracuje s Garym Rostockem (Manchester, UK) v rámci projektu Atomise, s Josefem Sedloněm jakožto Universal Loosers a Philipem TBC pod jménem Slippery Jack
 
http://www.beatport.com/artist/jock-the-lock/107913/tracks
http://soundcloud.com/byzonek/slippery-jack-sitting-in
http://www.mixcloud.com/jaromir-bednar


Milan Kroutil
 
Pražský DJ a promotér, který miluje muziku různých žánrů a různého tempa, co je znatelné i v jeho vlastních setech, rád hraje pro publikum, které dokáže vnímat a dovolí mu být eklektickým. Jeho sety nejsou jenom náhodně vybrané věci, tracky si dopředu selektuje a má k nim vymyšlený příběh. Neustále sleduje nové věci, které rád hraje a zažívá přitom energii a překvapení společně s posluchači. Není vybíravý, ale nehraje často, protože se dle jeho slov chce na hraní těšit a ne 'jít do práce'. South London Ordnance je pro něj splněným snem, protože je v současnosti spolu s Bodikou jeden z jeho nejoblíbenějších producentů. Milan Kroutil vlastním jménem Marek Olchava je spoluzakladatelem Terminalu B stejně jako letního pražského večírku La Bella Vida.


KINOCIRKUS videomapping

KinocirKus je otevřený a nezávislý kolektiv sídlící v Praze. Spojuje nás vášeň k živým audiovizuálním vystoupením, interaktivním instalacím a experimentům s novými médiemi a technologiemi. Naším cílem je vytvářet inovativní prostory kde dochází k propojení lidí a jejich interakci s okolím. 
KinocirKus je eklektická mezinárodní směs VJů, vizuálních umělců, sochařů, animátorů, filmařů, programátorů a fotografů. Naše projekty kombinují architektonický mapping, video mapping, interaktivní instalace, VJing a živá audiovizuální vystoupení.

http://www.facebook.com/kino.cirkus.page


============================================


SOUTH LONDON ORDNANCE (UK)

Based in London, this young and talented guy has entered the local electronic music sceen two years ago. His first releases came out on Dub Records and afterwards his music is spread by 2nd Drop, Audio Culture and Hotflush Recordings. He comes with an inovative tech-house-electronica and in UK he has been supported by legendary names like Mary Anne Hobbs from Radio 1 or Mosca. In addition to his music, he is a brilliant DJ as well and there are lot of different podcast for example for Lucky Me, legendární XFM show, Rinse FM, FWD, or his set for Boiler Room.
 
http://soundcloud.com/south-london-ordnance
http://www.facebook.com/southlondonordnance

LOCKED GROOVE (BE)

He is also a very young producer from Belgium and he admires similar stuff as SOL - deep bass techno eventually melancholic house electronica with contemporary sound. His production finds its home at Hotflush Recordings and Tigo's Turbo Recordings. These connections between our guests are not random, they are friends and played together many times before. Moreover we are offering a workshop with both of them.
 
http://soundcloud.com/lockedgrooves
http://www.facebook.com/lockedgroove


Jock The Lock

Jock the Lock is a name of a solo project of Jaromír Bednář, who comes from rough part of the North Moravia. Nowadays he lives in Prague and he has found there an inspiration and soul mates. He has been loving music since ever and as he boy he went to music school where he played clarinet and guitar. As a teenager he was charmed by drum'n'bass and other electronic music. One of his big influences is Photek (Form And Function, Modus Operandi) or Krust (Coded Language). In his own production he uses contrast of curtness and strongly emotional atmosphere. Lately he has been influenced by contemporary sound that connects fragments of techno, garage, or deep house and he's preparing his album. Jaromir also cooperates with Gary Rostock (UK) on project called Atomise, with Josef Sedloň as Universal loosers and with Philip TBC under the name Slippery Jack.  
 
http://www.beatport.com/artist/jock-the-lock/107913/tracks
https://soundcloud.com/byzonek/slippery-jack-sitting-in
http://www.mixcloud.com/jaromir-bednar


Milan Kroutil (CZ)

is a DJ and promoter from Prague who loves music of many kinds and rates and you can feel it when you see him playing live. He appreciates an audience that is empathetic and makes him to be eclectic. His sets are not only random tracks but he selects them very carefully and creates a story out of them. He's checking out for a new stuff constantly, and than he shares the moment of an excitement right there with his audience. He doesn't play regularly because he really wants to enjoy it and not to feel like it's a job. South London Ordnance is his dream came true because he is one on his favorites together with Bodika. Marek Olchava aka Milan Kroutil is a cofounder of Terminal B project as well as summertime event La Bella Vida.

KINOCIRKUS 

Kinocirkus is an open and indipendent collective based in Prague, that grew in love for live A/V performances, interactive installations, and experimenting with new media and technologies. Members include an eclectic, international mix of VJs, video artists, sculptors, animators, filmmakers, programmers, and photographers. 
Our aim is to construct innovative spaces where people can connect and participate with their surroundings. Our projects combine architectural mapping, video mapping, interactive installation, VJing and live audio/visual performance.

http://www.facebook.com/kino.cirkus.page

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
http://www.viceaudio.com
http://www.facebook.com/viceaudio.rentalprague

677585755635463.description:
VIDEO LINK: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PwfI8T1IZ1w

LONDON — Teacher Robert Isquierdo Jr., a former London resident, makes no bones about the purpose of the proposed library for his north Tulare County hometown.

“We want a fully functional library,” he said. “I want this so bad.”

Isquierdo, who now teaches at Sierra Vista Junior High in Santa Clarita in north Los Angeles County, said the library would be a huge boost to the small community where he grew up.

Literacy rates will improve and students will have a place to study and do research for school assignments. Students will also have a location where they can read and explore literature.

“A place they can call their own,” he said. “To me, it’s important to have that accessibility.”

A community with an estimated population of 2,200, London is located southwest of Dinuba, south of Reedley and southeast of Kingsburg.

Access to public services there is limited.

“A library is a huge. It’s a component to education,” said Matt Naylor, who is also involved in the project. “It would be valuable to have a study place. I see the library as an incredible asset with incredible value.”

Isquierdo said his hometown didn’t have a library when he was growing up there. London residents had to go the neighboring towns to get access.

Isquierdo said that, if students at the Santa Clarita school where he teaches can have access to books and writers, then London residents deserve a library of their own.

Isquierdo has established a webpage and put together a video about the project. He has also organized meetings to bring awareness about the project.

“The response has been overwhelming and quick,” he said.

Among those who have shown support are Santa Clarita residents and Sierra Vista students. Isquierdo said he has received plenty of donations from them and the interest in the London library is evident in Santa Clarita.

Librarians have told Isquierdo they’re ready to drive to London and organize the donated items, Isquierdo said.

Former London residents have stepped up and pledged support, Isquierdo said. Locals have also shown interest and promised backing.

For Isquierdo, the project to bring a library to London is an extension of his chosen career.

“As an educator, I am walking the talk,” he said.

The early momentum has also meant plenty of book donations. Isquierdo said he’s running out space to temporarily store all the books and wants a permanent place to put them.

Naylor said London residents are on board with the library project and are already planning what activities could be held there.

London resident Karina Santoyo said she would love her 4-year-old daughter, Melanie, to grow up with a town library.

“Being able to go to library, being able to pick up books, to me it’s important to have that accessibility,” she said.

A new library in London would mark a significant improvement in town.

“I think it will be a huge difference,” Naylor said. “It would mean students will have resources for their school projects, instead of feeling lost.”

Naylor said the next step will be to identify a finance revenue source and locating a building for the library.

“Our goal would be to establish a library with a model of sustainability,” he said. “The initial energy can get us off the ground. But you have to have a long term plan.”

Isquierdo said he’s ready to show the endurance and commitment to make the library a reality. He said the project is about five percent complete.

“I have a big responsibility not to destroy the hope of residents,” he said. “I have to follow through on what I started.”

Contact/Message Robert Isquierdo at this link to donate books! https://www.facebook.com/robisquierdo


Will you send an e-mail for help? The Library For London Project needs your help to get the attention of Congressman Devin Nunes who represents the London, Ca area so we can get some assistance from him. 679129415484274.description:
Last year saw us team up with one of Londons hottest brands and one of the most sought after labels around at the moment, Fuse, on more than one occasion. As you'll remember we brought Seb Zito, Ittetsu, Chris Lattner and East End Dubs to Leeds for the first time, sharing the decks with them over the course of several events. 

This time around we're welcoming one of the most popular within their ranks; ROSSKO

Affiliated with his UK roots Rossko has always kept his sound original & forward thinking with love of blending the past with forgotten vintage gems. Connecting the dots and blurring the lines is what he does foremost.
A long standing resident of Cerca Trova & Fuse in London, whether he's on the bill of the clandestine quarterly basement party sessions or spinning one of those infamous fuzzy Sunday afternoons, his minimal-tinged shades of House and Techno are loved universally. Operating more so as a DJ, than a producer, a rarity in the current climate, the last 12 months saw him hold a regular slots at the now infamous Sankeys Ibiza, where him and his posse did the damage all Summer long and we can't wait to welcome him to our yard. 

Support, as ever, comes from a selection of BeatStreet residents;

Kezla | Will Crawshaw | Thomas Olivier | Hopkinson | Niko Maxen| Will Matiu

682654038432128.description:
ONLY UK SHOW -  the show will be hosted by Steve Tefis (IBP) & Seven Churches, with us helping promote the show. support from GRAVE MIASMA and CATTLE DECAPITATION

Few bands have done more to push the boundaries of extreme metal than the legendary Possessed. Even fewer can create a unique style which continues to set them apart from all others in a genre they laid the foundation for. 

Mike Torrao (guitar), Mike Sus (drums) and Barry Fisk (vocals) got their start playing covers of bands like Judas Priest and Iron Maiden. After Fisk’s unfortunate suicide, Torrao and Sus recruited singer/bassist Jeff Becerra from local metal band Blizzard to form a new band - Possessed - whose name would eventually be known by heavy music fanatics worldwide. 

Possessed took San Francisco’s metal scene by storm, playing with fellow Bay Area thrashers and friends Exodus, and other bands- many now long gone. In 1982-1983, they recorded a four song demo. One of the demo tracks, “Swing of the Axe” ended up on the Metal Massacre 6 compilation and later on “The Best of Metal Massacre.” 

While starting to make waves in the metal community, Possessed replaced guitarist Brian Montana, whose dedication to the band had waned. To fill the void left by Montana, Jeff Becerra recruited friend and Blizzard band mate Larry LaLonde. LaLonde’s passion for guitar and home-grown style fit Possessed perfectly; roughly six months after LaLonde joined Possessed, they signed to Combat Records. 

Released in October 1985 on Combat Records, Seven Churches set a new standard for extreme music. Combining Torraro and LaLonde’s lighting fast riffs, Becerra’s raspy trademark growl and speedy bass playing, Sus’s pummeling drums and Randy Burns’ production, Seven Churches created a whole new genre of music- death metal. Written by primarily by Torrao and Becerra, Seven Churches went on to be one of Combat Records’ best-selling albums. Not bad for a quartet of high school kids! 

Torrao and Becerra teamed up with LaLonde to write Beyond the Gates. Released on Halloween in 1986, this album was especially well-received in Europe where they toured at the end of the year. The album that changed the landscape of heavy metal, Seven Churches is the bar by which death metal albums are still measured. 

After that tour, Possessed recorded and released Eyes of Horror, a five song EP produced by Joe Satriani. Musically and lyrically advanced, the album touched on dark themes such as sin, drugs and violence. Not long after the release of the EP, LaLonde joined up with Les Claypool and Primus. Soon after, Sus left to continue his studies at SFSU and Torrao decided he no longer wanted to play in a band. Becerra continued to play and joined some side projects, but mostly took time to pursue his goals in life. At one point, Torrao attempted to re-create Possessed, but this attempt was short lived. 

In 2004, Becerra joined with Sadistic Intent to record “The Exorcist” for a Possessed tribute album. Becerra and Sadistic Intent decided to do a few live shows to satisfy fans who had been clamoring for shows for decades. With such a positive response, Becerra and Sadistic Intent continued to play a number of successful shows, including Wacken 2007, Maryland Deathfest 2009, and 2010’s Blackest of the Black Tour. This lineup breathed life into Sadistic Intent and Becerra, and the two parties split amicably to play their own styles of metal, with drummer Emilio Marquez staying with Becerra and Possessed. 

In 2011, Becerra and Marquez (Asesino, Coffin Texts, ex-Brujeria) found new blood in bassist Robert Cardenas (Masters Of Metal (formally know as Agent Steel), Malice, Coffin Texts, Engrave), along with guitarists Kelly McLauchlin (Pessimist, Diabolic, Unholy Ghost) and Daniel Gonzalez (Nailshitter). 

After making several live appearances, including Graspop 2012 & The Fallen Angel 2012 European Tour, this lineup has established Possessed for a new era. The Possessed legacy has been highly influential in the realm of extreme metal, changing the genre forever. Ready to take it further, Possessed is planning several tour dates and writing new material that will change the face of death metal once more.

Tickets £20 Adv.

https://www.stargreen.com/a-z/possessed.html

690691730961158.description:
The Polecats formed in 1977. The original line-up was Tim Worman (a.k.a Tim Polecat, vocalist), Martin "Boz" Boorer, (guitarist and vocalist), Phil Bloomberg (bassist), and Chris Hawkes (drummer), who originally played under the name "Cult Heroes." Finding difficulty persuading promoters to book them on the rockabilly circuit with a name sounding "too punk", they adopted Hawkes' suggested band name The Polecats.

Hawkes was later replaced by Neil Rooney.The band were first signed by the fledgling British rockabilly record label Nervous Records, and recorded their first single "Rockabilly Guy" at Guitarist Alan Warner's "Lane Studios" in 1979. Formerley with the hugely successful "Foundations" band Warner toured and recorded with the Polecats for about a year.In 1980 the band signed to Mercury Records, and released their most successful LP, Polecats Are Go! They had UK chart success with a David Bowie cover "John, I'm Only Dancing", a reworking of "Rockabilly Guy", and another cover version of the T-Rex (Marc Bolan) song "Jeepster".

In 1983, they hit the charts in the United States with their song "Make a Circuit With Me." Shortly after this, John Buck replaced Neil Rooney on drums.Boz Boorer left the group to work as a guitarist, musical director, and co-songwriter with Morrissey, but led a Polecats reunion in 1989, which produced a live album and a new studio set. Raucous Records released a compilation album of Boz Boorer's work entitled Between The Polecats in early 2001.Tim Polecat moved to Los Angeles, California and formed the band 13 Cats with drummer Slim Jim of the Stray Cats, stand-up bassist Smutty Smith of The Rockats, and guitarist Danny B. Harvey of The Swing Cats. Their album 13 Cats is available on Cleopatra Records.

Tim Polecat also works as a successful art director and production designer for film, commercials, and music videos. Musically, Tim Polecat also continues to work as a film composer and solo singer-songwriter and is currently touring the US with Slim Jim Phantom as "The Whammy!!"Phil Polecat continues to play with The Polecats, Katy Prado & The Mamboleros, Trio Farouche and as a session musician.

In November 2006 frontman Jarvis Cocker of the British band Pulp, along with bassist Steve Mackey, released a 2-CD compilation album, The Trip, which features a wide selection of tracks by artists as varied as The Fall, Gene Pitney, The Beach Boys, The Everly Brothers, Dion, Sonny Bono plus The Polecats with their hit "John, I'm Only Dancing".In June 2008 Disney Pixar film, WALL E, used The Polecats 1983 hit song, "Make a Circuit With Me" in their television trailers for the film.
690691730961158.name: THE POLECATS & GUITAR SLINGERS | THE ISLINGTON | LONDON

692884097410456.description:
As in life, music has a way to move you, shake you, bring you up and make you dance. This is London Calling, the all new Monthly event to be hosted at the amazing UNION. We will not only have America's best but Artist's from around the world. Our goal is simple: to provide a VIBE to dance and enjoy all night long. Our mission is to expand the ever growing sound of Garage, UK House and 2 Step Genre's.  What we as a collective of artist's have decided is to put focus on the music and the Vibe. Just for fun we will be doing Live Broadcast's at each and every London Calling from 12-2 AM with one of our partners so those that can not make the show can dance at home or work. 


      GRAND OPENING FEATURING: The one and Only: 

************ DJ KEMIT - ATLANTA *****************
           www.facebook.com/DJKemit

DJ Kemit. CEO of Kemit Muzik, Inc. Kemit divides his time between DJing, music production and being a family man. 

Pulling together a who’s who of soul, funk and R&B talent for his debut album, EVERLASTING, would have been a feat for any other producer. But not for KEMIT. 

He nabbed the heavy-hitters: Grammy-nominated vocalist ERRO, aka Eric Roberson; hip-hop super crew Hieroglyphics producer Kev Choice; co-vocalist from U.K. soul sensation Loose Ends, Carl McIntosh; Jean Baylor of Zhane; Craig Love, producer for Usher; soul powerhouse N’Dambi; along with Frank McComb, who has a debut of sorts himself on EVERLASTING behind the keys. 

While EVERLASTING recently has taken center stage, DJ KEMIT has long been a sought-after producer for remixes such as “Still” by ERRO, “On the Beach” by Leon Ware, the Billboard hit song “4Evermore” and the remix of "4evermore" for David’s EP “Location, Location, Location.”

DJ KEMIT is also internationally known for his production work as one-half of KemeticJust. The duo’s two dozen releases -- on labels such as King Street, Nite Grooves, Yoruba Records, Giant Step, Diaspora Recordings, Wave Music, Bombay Records and Play Records -- are still praised within the underground house music scene.

KEMIT left hip hop group, Arrested Development in 1996, but not without recognition for his production work on the group’s Grammy-nominated second album, Zingalamaduni.

Tastemakers and household names such as Prince, Janet Jackson, Steve Harvey, Jane Fonda, Jermaine Dupree and Bryan Michael Cox have put KEMIT on the short list of the world’s best DJs for nearly 20 years.

And you’ve likely attended or heard of the legendary FunkJazz Kafe, the National Black Arts Festival, the Soul Train Awards, House in the Park, Roy Ayers, Robert Glasper, Musiq Soulchild and Blackstreet – all projects, parties or artists that KEMIT has graced. 

KEMIT is instrumental in guiding the house, soul and hip-hop scenes in Atlanta – and beyond. It’s an important task given the city’s influence on American music everywhere. When people look to Atlanta, they have to look to KEMIT – and based on his superlative body of work, past and future, things are looking good.

Read a bit more about Garage Music: 

     UK garage is a genre of electronic music originating from England in the early 1990s. UK garage descends primarily from US Garage House, but also takes influence from Deep House, Jungle, and Oldschool RnB, among other genres. The trademark sound of Garage is its distinctive syncopated 4/4 percussive rhythm with 'shuffling' hi-hats and beat-skipping kick drums. Garage also often uses 'chopped up' and pitch-shifted vocals.
   Its originator is widely recognised to be Todd Edwards, the American house and garage producer, also known as Todd "The God" Edwards. In the early nineties he began to start remixing more soulful house records and incorporating more time-shifts and vocal samples than normal house records, whilst still living in the US. It was Edwards who began to apply these techniques on his own Garage House productions. Garage House being a heavily disco influenced sub-genre of House Music that took its name from the New York City nightclub Paradise Garage where it was created in the mid 1980s. However it was not until DJ EZ, the North London DJ, acquired one of Todd's tracks and played it at a faster tempo in a night club in Greenwich, that the music genre really took off.

     In the late 90s, Garage was growing strong in the underground scene: particularly in clubs and on pirate radio and in urban, inner city (primarily black) communities. Around the turn of the millennium, Garage became increasingly popular and new sub-genres such as 4x4, 2-Step, Speed Garage, and Dark Garage (precursor to Dubstep) were being developed. When it began to penetrate the mainstream with the help of artists like M.J. Cole, Artful Dodger, Jaimeson, So Solid Crew, Zed Bias,The Streets, Shanks & Bigfoot, DJ Luck and MC Neat, Ed Case, Sunship, Oxide and Neutrino, and El-B, elements of soul, hip-hop, reggae, jazz, drum and bass, contemporary R& B, and pop music were also incorporated into Garage.

     UK garage led to various offshoots in from the late 1990s to the mid 2000s, most notably dubstep, bassline and grime. UK garage left the mainstream in the mid-2000s and returned underground. This was partially caused by the Top 40 being bombarded with derivative, copycat Garage-esque pop songs by producers trying to cash in on the trend (think of how producers are trying to incorporate "Dubstep" into various pop songs nowadays and multiply that by 100x more). Secondly, the rapid increase in popularity for the genre meant bigger crowds at gigs and in clubs. And statistically, bigger crowds meant bigger chance of unsavory characters around. And given that a lot of the fans of Garage were predominately minorities from high crime, lower class neighborhoods, violence became increasingly rampant at the these garage events. Shootings, stabbings, fights, and general rowdy behavior, while not commonplace, were always heavily covered by the media when they occurred. Even the mega stars of the genre fell victim to it: Dizzee Rascal was stabbed after a gig promoting his Mercury Prize winning debut "Boy In Da Corner" and a few members of Number 1 hit scoring So Solid Crew are still serving time for their involvement in a gang related drive by shooting. All this negative attention to the UK Garage scene led to "Garage" becoming a dirty word associated with bland pop tunes and gang violence. As Garage retreated back to its underground beginnings of pirate radio, small clubs, limited vinyl pressing, and bedroom producers, many artists jumped ship onto the emerging Garage offshoots like Dubstep and Grime that were growing in popularity everyday.

   However in recent years, artists like Burial have brought Garage to new audiences and there has been a gradual resurgence in interest in the genre thanks in part to more widespread use of the internet and the popularity of Garage offshoot Dubstep. In the latter half of the decade there was a brief revival of 2-Step Garage in UK clubs with Oldschool producers returning to the scene with new tracks as well as tracks by various new-school producers. Around this time a new genre dubbed "Future Garage" emerged, although it was very tenuously linked to UK Garage despite its name. However, its popularity gave more prominence to Oldschool Garage. In the 2010s, interest in Garage has increased even more as the heavily- commercialized and aggressive "Brostep" has worn it's welcome on many: leading some fans and to go back to the heavily garage influenced stylings of old-school Dubstep while "Brostep" is currently falling out of fashion in the mainstream and in clubs.


     This departure has left a huge hole which is looking more and more like it will be filled with the resurgence of Garage. Garage hits by fresh-faced producers like Disclosure, Mosca, Naughty Boy, Jessie Ware as well as vocals done by popular singers like Sam Smith, AlunaGeorge, Eliza Doolittle, and Emile Sande on these tracks, the continued success of Garage enthusiasts Jamie XX, Burial and Four Tet, increased attention for the genre on the internet and outlets like Radio 1, the constant year to year touring of Garage innovator DJ EZ, as well as the return of older producers who made the genre what it is today like Zed Bias, Wookie, El-B, and Artful (one half of Artful Dodger) are helping bring the genre back big time and are paving the way for the next generation of Garage producers.
    
     As "Sincere" hitmaker MJ Cole once said, "London is a multicultural city... it's like a melting pot of young people, and that's reflected in the music of UK garage".

696458410405224.description:
The 2014 Conference will have some of the world’s leading investors speaking at it, including such well-known names as Mason Hawkins, Donald Yacktman, Mason Morfit and Jon Moulton. It is also a showcase for less well known and smaller firms.

The speakers will provide valuable insights into the methods and approaches that have made them successful, comment on the current investment climate and offer specific investment ideas. A key feature of the conference is the 10-15 minutes dedicated to audience Q&A for each speaker, led by David Shapiro.

Value Investing

Value Investing was developed in the early Twentieth Century by Benjamin Graham and has been popularised in recent decades by the success of many investors who follow the approach, most notably Warren Buffett. It is now a well respected investment style in the US but is still a nascent sector of the investment universe elsewhere.

Numerous academic studies have shown that a disciplined value-based approach to investing in securities outperforms the market over the long term. It is under-pinned by research into behavioural investing which demonstrates both why it is so psychologically difficult to do (because it involves taking positions that are contrary to the received wisdom of the crowd) and why it is so financially rewarding when done well.

What you can expect:

- Insight into successful techniques and approaches used by top value investors
- Investment ideas presented in detail
- Research on the long-term success of value investing
- Networking with like-minded investors

For more details with information about offered conference participation packages, please contact us by email: bank-of-investmentprojects@mail.com

Focused on the writing and recording of their third album, this short run tour will be a welcome breakaway from the studio and will quite possibly save the band from going ever more insane!

Fiercely proud to be British yet disillusioned with much the Nation offers has meant anger, frustration and pure bloody fury has shaped Beholder into the gnarly flag bearers of the UK Underground scene.

With undeniable hook lines, complexity and brutal delivery in the live shows they’ll leave you kicking and screaming as they sonically point scorn and derision at a world marked by massive inequalities of wealth and power. 

www.beholder.bigcartel.com 
www.facebook.com/BeholderUK 


CAMBION

CAMBION have been making a name for themselves in the metal world since forming in 2009.
They have played up and down the Uk and a couple of times in Europe, sharing stages with the likes of Scar Symmetry, Circle of Contempt, Evile, Sacred Mother Tongue, Breed 77, and toured with Chris Jericho’s band, Fozzy, and many more!

Having had two tracks featured on Metal Hammer’s cover mount cd, the last being a track off their current ep, “virus”, they likened their sound to” MESHUGGAH AND FEAR FACTORY AT WAR IN SPACE!,” which is awesome as that’s two of their influences.

705615299490156.description:
SATURDAY 12th April 2014, EDDIE COCHRAN Tribute Night, live on stage the legendary
SANDY FORD & THE FLYING SAUCERS at the ACE CAFE, Ace Corner
N Circular Road
London NW10 7UD
Hangar Lane
Phone number 020 8961 1000
Business website ace-cafe-london.com 12th April 2014, EDDIE COCHRAN Tribute Night, live on stage the legendary
SANDY FORD & THE FLYING SAUCERS
DJ DAVE FLATTOP { a well known Eddie Cochran fan}
9pm - 2am
Entry £10
Sorry No Under 18s

Ace Cafe London, hosting the annual Eddie Cochran Tribute Night at the cafe on Saturday 12th April, celebrates the 50th anniversary of the 1964 release on Liberty Records of Eddie's posthumous compilation album "My Way", LBY1205, and features this year the highly polished, well-oiled rock n' roll sounds of Sandy Ford & The Flying Saucers and DJ Flat Top Dave!

In a bid to get 1950's rock n' roll played on the BBC's national Radio One Show, in 1976 the band played on the back of an open truck that was part of the famous Teddy boy March in London that year - this brought about a one hour shown on BBC radio, on Saturday afternoon's with DJ's Stuart Colman and Geoff Barker, The Flying Saucers were one of the guest bands playing live on the show!

The evening includes opportunity to win prizes including two pairs of tickets to attend the "Joe Meek Special" at The Borderline Sunday 27th April, an evening bringing together for the first time many of the artists who recorded at Joe's legendary studio, his flat at 304 Holloway Road! 
Also up for grabs are 3 copies of Issue 9 of Vintage Rock Magazine with its Eddie Cochran feature, 3 copies of Record Collector Magazine, a pair of tickets to attend the Jukebox & Retro Fair and Ace goody items. THE EDDIE COCHRAN LEGEND continues on with THE BEST IN THE WORLD COCHRAN TRIBUTE THERE IS, the venue is legendary, the artist is a legend, the bands are living legends. GOD BLESS EDDIE COCHRAN.
705615299490156.name: THE EDDIE COCHRAN TRIBUTE NIGHT, with SANDY FORD and the FLYING SAUCERS, ACE CAFE, LONDON, APRIL 12th 2014

RAISON D'ETRE COLLECTIVE LONDON:

In 2000, Dj Healer Selecta pioneered  a new type of  platform/club night in the triangle of Shoreditch & Bricklane:  The Raison D'Etre-Reason2b phenomenon was born,   treasuring eclectic vintage music via very popular DJ session and sharing stage experience by giving exposure to talented up and coming UK musicians and artists in  the main  venues of the capital  Glastonbury Festival, Stoke Newington Fest  etc..
To name a few, Noisettes, Charlie Winston, Portico Quartet, Josienne Clarke,  Gaby Young, Sam Beer, Mudibu, Jezebel Sextet, Jamie Woon , Phidel, Congo Faith Healers, Natty, and many many more.
 
With a lot dedication, hard work and support from legendary pioneers such as,  Bo Diddley,  Wanda Jackson, Spanky Wilson, Raison d'être became an institution for London's international music lovers and was dubbed by London's press as one of the very best things in the big smoke. 
Amy Winehouse used to come and dance at Healer Selecta's Dj sessions  and Raison d'être Show at Jazz Cafe and tonight we are very happy to present to you a new great female vocalist, Hayley Red from the Dustaphonics, special appearance from Charlie Winston, The Future Of Sound and their unique Swingin Rhythm & HipHop Soul,  King Size Slim: Heavyweight Acoustic Roots & Blues Guitar: Check him out, he is really amazing  ( on stage at 7h30.) 708426732540969.description:
No pop, no commercial dance. Just cutting-edge house music.

*Please note that WRONG! is a mixed gay/straight party. Be nice or you won't get in. We're being strict on this*

Following the huge success of our Trade pre-party last week, WRONG! is back with our residents in charge!

WRONG! has built its reputation as Vauxhall's biggest, busiest, best Saturday morning afterhours party on the firm foundations of our friendly welcoming crowd and cutting-edge tech house. Always the friendliest welcome in Vauxhall (it's more like a family!), our established team of hosts are always on hand to welcome you on arrival: Robbie, Andy and Luis!

We open 2:30am Saturday morning and close around 1pm - often later!

£7 with a flyer, MOTD, ROAR. Get there early to avoid the queue.

The WRONG! residents this week:

Steven Sharp
Jamie de Rooy
Eduardo Herrera
Enrico Chirchiello

About our DJs:

STEVEN SHARP
With literally hundreds of productions and remixes under his belt as part of the Sharp Boys, and a good couple of decades tearing up the dancefloors, Steven Sharp has been at the forefront of the house music scene for a long time. He's promoted some of London's biggest parties, and played some of the world's biggest. Steven joined us as our new resident in January 2013 to play a great underground tech house set.
http://www.mixcloud.com/WRONG_Club/steven-sharp-at-wrong-17-august-2013/


JAMIE DE ROOY
Jamie de Rooy has for the past few years been bringing the London sound to Spain through his twice-weekly peak-hour mix show through Barcelona's premier dance music radio station, Styl FM. Jamie's supercharged tech house sets rock WRONG's parties, and will bring you up and then keep you on a peak til you can't dance anymore.
http://www.mixcloud.com/jamiederooy/

EDUARDO HERRERA
Eduardo fell in love with dance music way back in 1979 and since then he's never looked back. Originating from southern Brazil's capital Porto Alegre, Eduardo is a genius behind the decks. If you caught his set last time he played at WRONG! then you know you're in for a great experience - tough but alwyas uplifting, deep but never boring, he'll keep your feet firmly on the dancefloor!
https://soundcloud.com/theboxcollective/the-box-radio-show-ep-11-with

ENRICO CHIRCHIELLO
Enrico was born in Montreal, Canada in 1992 and moved to Italy at the age of 7. As a young boy he was already passionate about music and by the age of 13 he started DJing with turntables in small local clubs. Enrico has always been influeced and inspired by South American sounds. The style of music he DJs is predominantly Techno House. In 2011 he, with close friend Luca Donofrio, created a dual-owned record label called Mad System Brothers. That same year the two decided to move to London, for better opportunities, to meet new people and play in big clubs. In his endeavour to promote his DJing style and music, he has been resident at, and played in, a number of clubs in London. As his latest venture, Enrico has created and run his own events organisation called Last Drop, where he involves guest DJs and invites friends for a night of good music with a great ambiance. He has released tracks on labels like: Mr Ambrose Recordings, Finish Team Record, Housebeat Record, Black Eye Records, Jintonik Records, WOD Limited, Code2 Records, Beach Music Records, Celestial Recordings.
https://soundcloud.com/enrico-chirchiello
708426732540969.name: WRONG! London's biggest, busiest and best Saturday morning afterhours!

On Sunday 4th May 2014 the only way to shop retro returns to York Hall in Bethnal Green delivering up the chance to shop from the UK's largest Vintage wholesaler and buy your vintage by weight!!

We'll be bringing 5 TONNES of retro fashion to York Hall, menswear and womenswear will be laid out on rails and in rummage boxes. You simply select whatever you like, take it to the weigh station and pay at £15 per kilo - that's around 4 - 5 items!!

Ooh and we accept cash and credit / debit cards on all our stock.

Early Bird Entry £3.00 10:15am
General Entry: £1.00 11:00am

So, what on earth are we banging on about? Well, here are a few very good reasons to cancel your other plans...

1) IT'S EXCLUSIVE! Ran by us boffins at Judy's Affordable Vintage Fair, we partner up with Europe's BIGGEST vintage wholesaler to bring you 5 TONNES of stock! Laid out before you and waiting to be shopped, we're talking everything from retro tees to denim, jackets to jumpers to shorts and skirts. Featuring ladies and gents fashion and accessories from the 1970s and on, we don't disappoint.

2) It's SO FRIKKIN' CHEAP! After trying on, parading and hoarding your items, take them to our weighing desk where you will be charged a meagre £15 A KILO! But what does that mean? Well, it depends on the item's weight but that's an average of 4 - 5 ITEMS FOR £15! No better place to shop affordable vintage in a BIG way, throw away your clothes, come get a new wardrobe and still have money left over.

3) WE GOT ACCESSORIES! Calling all magpies, your dream date has arrived! Britain's BIGGEST vintage jewellery buff VICTORIA VINTAGE will be on hand, selling rings and chains, brooches and sunnies and all KINDS of accessories from a crazy 50p! Ring on each finger?? WHY NOT! 

4) WE REPLENISH! Early bird got the worm? I don't think so! Although it's ALWAYS good to come for kick-off, we'll be replenishing stock ALL DAY to make sure there are plenty of treasures about. 

One final thing to get you going? Because everyone likes an offer, we're thrilled to say that IF YOU BUY 10 KILOS OR MORE, THE PRICE DROPS FROM £15 A KILO TO £10 A KILO! If that's not madness, we don't know what is!

And there we have it folks - ample reasons to practically CAMP outside and wait for the goodies [not really. Well, you can if you want!]

For any TRADERS wanting to come and shop for your business, email judy@judysvintagefair.co.uk and request your trade forms.

That's all folks - remember, we aren't small fry. This is going to be BIG!

Retro Regards,
Team Kilo x

5 Old Ford Road, Bethnal Green
London
E2 9PJ
